text: Can. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and heavy hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate.

Dose 0,33l: Golden, leichte Trübung, sehr kräftiger stabiler mittelporiger Schaum; sehr fruchtige und frische Nase, Zitrusaromen, helle Früchte, Maracuja, Grapefruit, Malz, kräftige frische Hopfenaromen; frischer Körper, kräftige Hopfenaromen, Malz, Getreide, kräftige fruchtige Bitterkeit, dunkle/getrocknete Früchte, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, recht trocken, würzig, leichte Röstaromen; angenehmer würzig-trockener Nachgang mit kräftiger Hopfennoten

This is the first IPA I believe I've ever tasted and it hasnt changed since in the god knows how many years since the first time. It's just delicious plain and simple, the standard I set for all IPAs I drink 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can. 6.9%. Best before 31.12.17. Brewed in Berlin. Pours a slightly hazy straw yellow/golden, with a diminishing off-white head. Spotty lacing. Somewhat unbalanced aroma; hops, a bit cheesy; fruit, both overripe and regular; and slightly citrusy. Has a sort of cooked vegetables note to it as well. Flavour is fruity, citrusy. Light cheesy hops note. Spicy and cough drop hints as it warms. Bitter finish, lingering, along with a hop note, a mild alcohol burn and fledgling hints of rubber. Overall so-so; not bad, but the aroma does leave something to be desired, while the flavour is okay, if nothing special. 20.06.17.

Dose bei Rewe in der Ackerstrasse gekauft, gebraut in Berlin.
Blasses aber klares Bernstein, voller und großporiger Schaum
Aroma: sehr schönes Mango, Aprikose, Hopfen, Grapefruit, Zitrone
Geschmack: bitter, Heu, etwas Grapefruit, blumig
Eher saftartig, wenig Kohlensäure

Complex nose, piney, resiny with some bready notes. Rich bitter flavor, backed up by a malty sweetness. Slick, slightly oily body. Finish bitter, slightly harsh, but by no means overbittered. Excellent IPA

33 cl. can @ Home. Brewed in Berlin.
Aroma: not very intense aromas of grapefruit, grapes, passion fruit, citrus, tropical fruits. Subtle hints of pine, resin. Some malt background appeared as the beer was warming.
Appearance: light amber to golden color, light hazyness, high head thickness. Super creamy slightly off-white head made of mid sized to big sized bubbles. High retention. Very low Brussels lacing, almost non-existent.
Taste: low sweetness, medium to high bitterness, no sourness. Flavors of grapefruit, citrus, passion fruit. Tastes slightly sweet at first, but increasingly bitter towards the end.
Palate: light to medium body, oily texture, low to medium carbonation, very long and very dry bitter finish of grapefruit, resin, pine, citrus, tropical fruits, passion fruit.
Overall: very good appearance. Not very intense but good aromas and flavors of grapefruit, resin, pine, citrus. Quite refreshing and thirst quenching. Good IPA but not as good as id heard, maybe this one brewed in Berlin is not as good as the American one.

Can at home from Fakta. Clear yellow with a white head, nice lacings. Aroma medium malty (caramel), medium+ hoppy (piney, citrusy). Flavor medium sweet, medium+ bitter, spicy, long lasting bitterness. Medium body.

330 ml can from Marks & Spencers, brewed in Berlin, Germany. Aromas of tropical fruits, malts, subtle pine. Big white head and more or less clear golden body. Taste is sharp malts with hoppy bitterness. Floral, fruity notes and citrus finish. Very nice beer.
Amber. Powerful spicy hop aroma and flavour, and light caramel sweetness. Very bitter finish. Medium body, and a smooth mouthfeel Overall, a great IPA. Very tasty.

Off white, tight bubbly head stayed well on a hazy dark lemon coloured, finely carbonated body.
Bitter pith, grapefruit, candy & sweet citrus aroma.
Medium bodied. Soft on the palate, airy & a sharp back. Crisp.
Bitter/Sweet citrus, grapefruit, spices, hints of orange & a long hoppy bitter finish.
330ml can @ 6.9 % . Pine aromas, grapefruits and floral, taste is similar. Didnt massively enjoy this one, remember the bottle tasting much nicer. Possibly a bad batch.
33cl can. Light amber colour with average whitehead. aroma of hops lemons, oranges and grapefruit. well-balanced and full bodied, exemplary IPA

Nos super, świeże chmiele, owoce egzotyczne, ale za to trochę masła żeby nie było tak różowo. Dość ciekawe, ale kurde z drugiej strony trochę pustki... To nie zasługuje na takie oceny. Mogliby dosypać nieco więcej na goryczkę....

W aromacie chmiel z paczki, ale nie takie najlepszy. Barwa zlota, piana ladna, utrzymujaca sie. W smaku pelne owocowe. Goryczka intensywna, cytrusowa, zalegajaca. Wytrawne, fajne. Brakuje aromatu, ale to chyba kwestia swiezosci.

Golden amber pour with minimal head. Strong aromas of fresh pine, citrus fruits lemon, grapefruit and earthy herbs. Taste is clean; pale malt body dominated by big hop flavors; bold but balanced bitterness. Slick mouthfeel medium body, with moderate carbonation. Very good west coast IPA.

Good floral smell, just like an ipa should smell. 
Big white foam the disappear quickly, dark yellow color. 
Taste ok, but a little thin
Classic IPA. Full bodied, full of citrus, lemons, oranges and grapefruit. Plenty of piney hops. One to compare others to. A good IPA benchmark
Can. Pours pale amber with a perfect white foam residing. Scent is medium notes of middle hopped sweetness. Taste is consistent with notes of citrus. Some properties of dark fruit. Lovely.

Can (Berlin) and draft (US). Golden orange with an off-white head. Aroma has lots of hops, sweet caramelt malt, hay. Moderate sweet with hops, caramel, hay, pine. Grapefruit bitter aftertaste that is moderate bitter. I think I prefer the draft version.
Puszka z Berlina. Niegdyś rewelacja, dziś mocno przykurzony klasyk. Klarowne, poważnie goryczkowe, co się niefajnie odkłada w posmaku.
Wow. Ny farvoritøl. Fantastisk god smag. Dejlig med humle. Super frisk smag. Købt på tilbud i Fakta

Extremely good IPA. This is another benchmark for IPAs. The amount of citrus flavor packed into this IPA is incredible and the hop finish leaves enough like an IPA to be thoroughly enjoyable. This is going to be a go-to IPA.
Pours clear golden witth a one finger high white head. Aroma; Citrus, pine, tropical fruits and floral. Taste; Hoppy, grapefruit, citrus, mango, tangarine and pine.

Classic for being what it is: a solid IPA that has all the earmarks and no detractors: big citrus and pine aroma from a beautiful pour; full body with chunks of pine bark resin swimming around your tongue; and a bitter and sweet taste that eventually allows the hops to win out to a dry, but not too dry, finish. Excellent.

Can, 33cL. Gift from the staff of La Cervoiserie, Les Herbiers. Thank you !! Home. A golden orange-yellow beer with a small white head ; average retention. Fruits (red berries, tropical fruits, citrus), resin, light herb. Medium bitter refreshing, very dry, light sweet, light warming background, light spicy. Medium body, light to medium oily texture, average carbonation, dry fruity spicy refreshing finish. Overall, delicious !

Delicious world class IPA.
Beautiful clear honey colored with a medium frothy head.
Fruity hops flavor smooth and good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: sewage, onion, maybe a bit pine notes. Meh.
Taste: bitter, little pine and some unpleasant (sewage?) notes. Bitterness in aftertaste.
Head is just OK.
Overall: bad beer imo. Yuck.
amber, clear, white foam, citrus, herbs, floral, resin, medium body, thick feel, sticky, average carbonation, bitter,
UPDATED: JUN 1, 2017 Can. A sharp taste of hops but it quickly fades. Aroma is a little faint. An ok IPA but I have had better.

Pours clear amber with a good head. Pine, malt and citrus on the nose. Lots of hop character with biscuit and citrus flavours. Finishes long and bitter. A classic.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is an excellent IPA it's not too hoppy and doesn't leave an harsh aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
LCI. Uit blik geschonken. Mooie IPA, lekker bitter, hoppig, fruitig en een prettige bitter-grassige nasmaak. Prima!
Clear golden appeareance with a decent white head. Pine, malt, citrus, grass and grape aroma. Taste og pine, grapefruit, hoppy freshness and citrus.

Pours clear amber with a good head. 
Pine, malt and citrus on the nose. 
Lots of hop character with biscuit and citrus flavours. 
Finishes long and bitter. 
A classic.

Can, brewed in Berlin, Germany. Pours clodu yellow with average white head. Aroma is lemon, lemongrass, malt, a hint of pine and candy malt. Taste is bitter with pine, lemon, candy malt. Very well balanced.
From the tap at FOB, Rimini, Italy. Pours crisp golden with white foam. Aroma is resinous and piney. Body is medium-dense. Taste is bitter. Finish is long and bitter.
Puszka 330ml. Zloty kolor. Piana biala ,srednia o duzych pecherzach. W zapachu cytrusy i szyszki. W smaku dosc cierpkie o cytrusowym zacieciu, dojrzale owoce w tle z chmielowym akcentem. Urodzinowo
Can from Tesco Extra, Longton. Pours golden. Good chewy slightly resinous well hopped ipa. A bargain too!

Pivo v plechovce: Deep golden with an orangey sheen, hazy to cloudy, lacy white foam; moderate to solid sweet-bitter flowery to piney nose, sweet pale mal and some cookies detectable in the background; solid - but not too dry - bitter-sweet flavour, medium to full bodied, very soft; lingering dry bitter piney finish with - as expected - hops stickin to the palate and still a good dash of sweet malt. Even though Im already fed up with all the "craft-beer hop bombs", Ive to admit that this is a well made , well balanced example of astonishing drinkability...

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2017 Poors amber, light white head. A bit of caramel. Heavy hopy, strong grapefruit, pinewood, a little of apricot. Light sweet, strong bitterness. Good balance between hope taste and bitterness.

Just an all-around very good IPA. This is one I would give to someone who has never tried an IPA before. The pine and citrus and bitter are just not that strong for someone who is not ready for it. Readily available too.
Trübes dunkles gelb schöner schaum, fruchtig citrusgrasig herber Duft, im Geschmack kräftig hopfig trockenfrüchte citrus pinie kräftig harzig herb, ein klassisches ipa das einfach schmeckt

The aroma has a nice balance between dank resin and juicy citrus. Also lots of orange peel. Two finger white head, maybe a very light off-white. Lovely colour, slightly cloudy. Initial taste is very juicy, then orange peel bitterness comes through, lingering for a very long time. It takes a good length of time for all the flavours present to make themselves apparent. The initial juicy burst makes it very drinkable, to boot. This beer has a stellar reputation; well-deserved in my book.

Aroma: lightly sweet and floral; Appearance: hazy orange pour with thin white head that lingers; Taste: clean, hoppy, pleasant; Palate: medium body with medium finish; Overall: nice IPA example; would definitely get again.
12 oz. bottle. Clear pale gold, creamy white head. Aroma of citrus and tropical fruit. Taste is citrus, tropical fruit, grapefruit notes, pine. Nice.

Drank this beer quite a lot seven years ago, I've just started again it's a classic for sure. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Hellgelb, leicht trüb mit guter Krone. Erfrischend hopfiger Antrunk, Zitrusnoten, leicht malzig, trockener Abgang!
Berlin version, just a pale replica of the original. Very bitter, not as "tasteful" as the other beers from Stone in the U.S.A.

Can, Tesco online. Just splendid hoppiness, solid malt background, not too sweet or caramelly but definitely there, long pine, grapefruit bitterness, some resin. Dry. Long finish. Great, a classic for a reason.
UPDATED: MAY 9, 2017 Aroma: fruchtig, Beeren. Bereits im Antrunk ist der gute körper zu erkennen, der durchgängig alles im griff hat. Tolö hopfiger abgang, das gefällt. Gute Säure im Nachgeschmack.

(330 ml can) Clear amber-golden beer, with a thick, fluffy white head. Gently carbonated, and can-conditioned, with a few speckles of yeast floating in the glass.

A hoppy aroma, with grapefruit, pineapple, and cantaloupe at the forefront, and a slight singe of alcohol. Spicy on the palate, but surprisingly sweet and floral, and well-balanced with a strong caramel malt. The finish is slightly more bitter, with hints of pine and mineral water.

The mouthfeel of this beer is tremendously smooth and silky - a classic West Coast IPA.

Piwo zakupione w markecie w PL , w puszce. Canned on 07MAR2017 Enjoy by 02DEC2017
Aromat: Nuty od chmielu raczej ziemiste, ziołowe, trochę przyprawowe i leciutko cytrusowe, owocowe, rozczarowujące jakością jak i intensywnością, poza tym chyba niestety lekki DMS oraz Diacetyl.
Wygląd: klarowne złote, piana średniopęcherzykowa, ale redukuje się do cienkiej warstwy.
Smak: Wytrawne, goryczka wysoka, ale nieprzyjemna ziołowo - łodygowa, zalegająca.
Odczucie w ustach: Raczej lekkie, wysycenie średnie do wysokiego.
Ogólnie: Wielkie rozczarowanie, bardzo słaba IPA.

Stone Berlin, Germany. Pours hazy golden, lots of yeasts in the can, big head. What surprised me a lot, that there was no smell at all. Aroma was really watery, and there was only a hint of iron. Checked with my girlfriend, she didnt notice any aroma also, from the can and from the glass. Taste is bitter, grapefruit, a little artificial like (like some hops aroma, not like whole hops cones or granulate), also there is strong metallic flavor. Unfortunately I think that opening German brewery was not a good idea, now its harder to spot a real Stone beer in Europe, and this Berlin imitation of Stone IPA is just like mass production and tasteless.
The beer has got a clear deep golden-amber colour with a steady head and mediu body. Aroma of hops and pine. taste of hops, pine, citrus fruits, spruce, herbs and biscuits. Hoppy finish.
Typical West coast ipa big pine resin some peach and melon to balance. An original trailblazer.

33cl can,berlin version.Classic west coast ipa.
Aroma: pale malts, and shy hops with notes of zest and pine. Taste: moderate malty sweetness, just a touch of citrus and a big piney bitterness. Very good.

Pours a clear amber color with a medium sized, stable head.

The nose is defined by fruity hops, oranges, lemon peel and cakey malts to highlight the hops. Classical nose for an ipa, a very enjoyable though. 

Perfectly balanced, well carbonated bright and thirst quenching with a nice taste evolution regarding the evolving hop profile.

Bitter from the first glance, without pushing too far, due to balancing, sweeter malts. The hops are pretty fruity but foremost dry, bitter and in your face. Finishes soft, still dry but with a caramel malt sweetness cutting through.

Pretty wow, one the most well build west coast ipas I ve ever had. It is uncompromisingly bitter, while still caring for remaining drinkable, which is acoomplished by the noteable malts.

Clear golden with one finger white head. Dank hoppy aroma with citrus, grapefruit and tropical fruit. Taste is also dominated by dank hops accompanied by citrus, grapefruit, light pine, some tropical fruitiness and only a light and crisp malt base. Medium mouthfeel, medium carbonation and dank hoppy aftertaste.
A very good beer and Im surprised this is the first time Ive rated it. Well balanced, golden with an aggressive bitterness and a nice citrus flavor.
Fresh fruity aroma. Really dry with masive biterness. Very good west coast ipa!
Hazy golden. Moderate white head. Aroma: passion fruit, mango, tangerine. Medium body. Heavy bitter taste. Very fruity. Good.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

3 finger white head.
Semi-hazy, deep golden coloured beer.
Aroma is orange marmalade, honey, apricots and pungent mango. 
Taste is grapefruit and pine with a sweet and slightly dishcloth-y marmalade ending. Its that Centennial going to work. 
Medium oily mouthfeel but very crisp and refreshing. with a good bitterness bite but it couldve used more for a full 5/5. 
Overall: Still as good as the first time I drank it and a true classic IPA. Grab a few of these, grab a few friends and barbeque the shit out of a day.

Can from Stone Brewing GmbH, Berlin. Pours hazy golden with white head. Aroma of sulphur, citrus, grass, tropical fruits, lemonade, pine needles. Taste sweet with a lot of bitterness and very bitter finish.

Nice light amber pour with a thick white head that lasts. Aroma of citrus and pine. Taste is all bitterness...Unfortunately too much so, though. I get hints that theres some nice flavor in there, but the bitterness covers it all up. Its too bad, I had high hopes.
Tirador al BBF17. Cervesa daurada amb escuma blanca. Aromes herbacis amb una mica de cereal. Una mica plana però bona.
Poured a medium amber color with smooth thick head. Very nice aroma of orange/lemon zest with hints of pine. Well balance of hops and malt.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2017 330ml can, Tesco. Pours clear amber colour. Nose is pinewood and citrus. Definite pine & grapefruit taste with the bitterness you?d expect, although not huge amounts. Some orange zest as well.
Stone Brewing knows their IPAS. A good and juicey beer with plenty of citrus flavor and hops. Would recommend.
Kompletne india pale ale. Godne polecenia ;) Wpis w celu uzupełnienia profilu

With my local Tesco recently expanding their beer range with a bunch of american craft cans including this and the Go To IPA, I thought Id make this classic the first entry a "why have I never reviewed this before?" series of sorts. Can - 330 ml. Pours clear amber/gold with a finger of dense white head with good retention and thick lacing. Occasional small carbonation bubble visible. Bright and fresh on the nose with Intense sweet citrus and pine resin, underneath which is a bit of cut grass, light straw and acacia honey malt. Classic west coast hop profile as expected. Taste is both subtly sweet and strongly bitter (though obviously less so than Ruination) with a lot of solid honey malt joining the grassy, resinous hop profile. Grapefruit, gooseberry, hint of mango, long, slightly dry, chalky bitter finish. Medium body, thick, silky texture, light carb; lovely mouthfeel. Exceptionally well balanced and definitely lives up to its reputation, really glad Ive now got a ready supply of this!

Can. Poors amber, light white head. A bit of caramel. Heavy hopy, strong grapefruit, pinewood, a little of apricot. Light sweet, strong bitterness. Good balance between hope taste and bitterness. There is many IPA on market but this one is one of the best I drank during last weeks

Can 330ml (BB 12.06.2017). Clear, golden colour. White-grey, large, long lasting with good lacing head. Aroma is fresh with intense resin notes. I can say there is only a lot of pine in the aroma and thats great. Medium to high, resin biterness but short lasting with a bit astringent finish. Light body, full hoppy, refreshing, really drinkable. Im hoppy drinking this IPA.

1100th beer. 330ml can from Gateshead Tesco, served cold in a 1/2 pint chalice. Slightly hazy amber with a white head. I deliberately chose a "verging on iconic" beer. I dont know if Im right, but this feels like the original poster boy (or girl) for modern American IPA. Ripped the can lid, and smelled the Citrus, resin and tomato vine: and thats what you taste, along with a kick of alcohol and some cereal. Also a nice toffee malt undertone. So, my favourite style scores a solid 4, it does exactly what it says on the tin and sums up the 1-1100 quite nicely. By the way, did I say I bought it at Tesco?
Ipa bastante herbal(pino), con final amargo muy seco y de durabilidad media, no esta entre mis preferencias, de complejidad media.

Can from Beer52. Golden amber with an off-white head. Tropical fruit and pine aroma. Taste of lemon, grapefruit and pine. Its fresh and crisp and its a pretty decent IPA. But theres no wow factor, and for me it doesnt live up to its formidable reputation.
Can from Tesco. Rich golden colour with a thin white head. Aroma citrus orange and light grapefruit. Taste light fruity.

330 ml can from Tesco, London (UK). Colour is clear golden,with medium white head. Aroma is tropical fruit, citrus, pine. Taste is piney hop, orange zest, citrus, mango, other tropical fruit. Hoppy! At finishing light bitterness.

Nice can, typical Stone. A lot of information is on the webpage.
Clear golden beer with short white head, smell is very tropical fruitful and also citrus, taste is citrus, heavy bitter, medium body, short finish with bitterness, 
(I have 0.33l can with best-before 02 Oct 2017 and batch 170105060103)
Clear golden pour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour is mainly grapefruit and pine, light body, lingering bitterness. Solid.

From meny; pours bright golden with a giant white head; aroma is fruity hoppy, slightly hoppy spicy, berries, orange zest; taste is fruity hoppy, citric with some pine, fading into a solid smooth grapefruit and pine bitterness; light texture with high carbonation

33cl can at home. Appearance: slightly hazy pale straw with medium white head. Aroma: grapefruit, orange zest, hop resin, mango, pine, citrus. Taste: medium sweetness and high bitterness. Notes of hops, grapefruit, lemon, orange and tropical fruits. Finish is bitter-dry with notes of citrus. Palate: medium bodied, watery to oily texture and lively carbonation.
Klares Orangegold mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, sehr fruchtig, Zitrusfrüchte, Orangen, Grapefruit, leicht bitter, sehr süffig.
UPDATED: MAR 18, 2017 Puszka. W aromacie kiszonka. Na drugim planie tropiki.w smaku lepiej. Fajna goryczka.

Can 0,33 l / Amstein - St-Légier (CH). Golden with an average white head for a short time, low sparkling but laces on the glass. Fruity aromas of apricot, mango, passion, lemon, citrus, malt and caramel, the whole in symbiosis. The taste is like, fruity but bitter, crispy on a nice malted backbone and caramel. The fruity nuances are complex and the bitterness of citrus, pèine and grass. Very nice, except the can.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2017 Tasting @ fillepolo 20170310. Can from Systembolaget. Fruity, hoppy and caramely, pine needles and grapefruits, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, fruity and hoppy.
Beer tasting @ 10/3-17. Can from Systembolaget. Fruity and hoppy with grapefruit, caramel and pine needles. Body is medium, the finish is dry, hoppy and caramely with pine needles.
Overhopped and over-resinous with an unpleasant aftertaste. Really not one for me though Im clearly in the minority!

0.33l can. Hazy yellow to golden with medium creamy white head. Aroma: caramel, mango, tangerine, yeast, malt. Taste: tangerine, juicy, resins, malty background. Medium body, moderate carbonation. High bitterness with long fruity aftertaste. Oily texture. Clean and fruity brew.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2017 Barwa jasnego złota, piana średnia. Aromat cytrusowy, tropikalny trochę żywiczny. W smaku słodkie białe owoce, żywiczność a potem genialna grapefruitowa goryczka. Goryczka która fajnie zalega. Brak alko w smaku i fajnie grzeje w przełyk. Świetne pifko.

Can. Aroma- pleasant, but quite weak combination of resin and sweet tropical fruits. Great colour- pale and sunny. Clear, with a nice-looking, white head, which quickly falls down. Some tiny lacing. Taste- quite similar to the aroma. Again, therere tropical fruits and forest notes, but not so clear. Medium-dry, with a subtle maltyness in the aftertaste. The bitterness is medium-high, but quite harsh and stalk-like. Medium-low-bodied, with a medium-low carbonation, which makes it very drinkable. All in all, its a good IPA, but for me too weak to be in the Top 50.

Aroma: Citrus and light piney aroma. But not very lasting due to the smell of alcohol cover the aroma of hops.
Appearance: clean orange with whitehead.
Taste:medium malty, sweet and bitterness, quite balanced. 

A balance of freshing and relatively high alcohol IPA.
Złocista barwa, piana niezbyt obfita. W aromacie mocno cytrusowo z owocami tropikalnymi. W smaku trochę zawód, bo w zasadzie czuć wręcz ordynarną łodygę i nic prócz tego choć da się to wypić.

This one is a hop monster. Big on the grapefruit, pine and citrus on the nose. Taste is similar, but introduces some peach, lemon, lime and mango. A good quality beer, but nothing to separate it from the crowded market of IPAs. Tried as Stone Berlin.
Duft frisk citrus lime humle smag frisk citrus lodt gran lidt bitter kant maltet
33cl can from local Alko, Viikki. Excellent IPA which sets the standard to IPA in my books. Nice hops and length with delicious tropical fruits. Brilliant!

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2017 330 ml can served in tulip. Medium pale orange colour, slight mango smell. White head not long lasting. Blue cheese (Roquefort, Gorgonzola) and grapefruit aroma. Very bitter and salty, full-flavoured and spicy. Flat carbonated, medium body. Very bitter finish and long lasting aftertaste. Sophisticated IPA and quite interesting.

Can. Light yellow, almost clear, with big white and very solid head, good lacing. Strong citrus hoppy aroma with some grassy and herbal notes, very pleasant. Light body, dry but not watery, little bit sweet start with strong herbal bitterness. Excellent and very drinkable ipa.
citrus and light piney hop aromas. hop forward, strong citrus and piney flavors, underlying light caramel malt notes

Klasyczne IPA ze Stonea wygląda bardzo ładnie. Jest jasne, barwa to takie bardzo jasne złoto. Klarowne. Piana jest biała, bardzo obfita, nawet dość puszysta zbudowana z małych i średnich oczek, które po kilku chwilach pękają, piana opada i pozostaje po niej gruby pierścień przy brzegach, jest też trochę śladów na ściankach. Aromat typowe dla AIPA cytrusy i trochę owoców tropikalnych. Byloby bardzo przyjemnie, gdyby nie to, że jest też wyraźny DMS, który mocno przeszkadza i psuje wrażenie. W smaku przede wszystkim wyraźna, bardzo fajna, charakterna, wysoka grejpfrutowa goryczka, nie zalegająca. Owoce cytrusowe, grejpfrut, pomarańcza, mandarynka - początek owocowy i słodki, ale natychmiast skontrowany wspomnianą goryczką, przez co generalnie piwo jest wytrawne. Ciała jest sporo, nie jest gęste, ale jest treściwe, wysycenie jest niskie. Bardzo dobry przedstawiciel stylu West Coast IPA. Wierzę, że wada w aromacie to mój niefart, że trafiłem może na gorszą warkę. Bez tego, byłoby bardzo dobrze.

Bardzo dobra klasyczna amerykańska IPA, jeśli chcecie pokazać znajomemu styl to zdecydowanie można pokazać jako pierwsze piwo. 
Aromat to głównie intensywne cytrusy co w połączeniu z przyjemną lekką goryczką daje bardzo przyjemne doznania.

This is a very good beer. A lovely orange hazy color, with an aroma of hops and citrus. Flavorful and light and complex (some light bitterness and tang), yet refreshing at the same time. A modern classic.
Pours clear orange with a white head. Aroma is pine and citrus fruits. Taste is medium sweet medium bitter.
33cl can from Geers. Pours perfect golden. Low to almost flat carbonation. Nose of pine hops / spruce. Clean bitterness, mellow palate. No malt or yeast character noticeable. Good.

Aroma - true American IPA: a lot of herbal bitter hop, flowers, yellow fruits, grapefruit, some yeasts. Taste - medium bitter, predominantly herbal bitter hop, bitter green herbs, wild flowers, bitter grapefruit, citrus, yellow fruits. Very good!
Can from beer52 beer club. Bold yet not overpowering. The hops are strong and you can taste a gentle citrus undertone. Very enjoyable, dangerously so considering the Abv!

Piwo barwy złotej, opalizujące. Piana średnio obfita, sycząca, szybko redukuje się do cienkiego krążka. W aromacie karmel, cytrusy i lekka alkoholowa nuta. W smaku przyjemnie, dosyć wytrawnie, kwiatowo od chmielu. Wysycenie wysokie, goryczka średnia. Niestety piwo jest już pół roku po puszkowaniu i mimo, że ma jeszcze 3 miesiące ważności czuć, że ten chmiel nie gra już tak świetnie jak powinien.

Can from brewery in Berlin. Aroma not as intensive as I would expected. Its citrusy with piny hints. Noticeable malt profile . Taste is a liitle bit too heavy with too much of malty character. Nice, fruity, bitterness. In overall its a good beer but too heavy bodied and with too much maltiness.
Can version. Nice citrus aroma (grapefruit). A little bit bitter. Perfect carbonation. Nice !

0.33l can. Hopy aroma, light malty notes, pine, light resin, light citruses. Almost clear golden color, white head. Hopy taste, pine, light floral notes, medium bitter. Medium to full body, oily texture, soft carbonation and dry bitter finish. Easy drinking, alcohol is hidden, well balanced. Very good.

330ml can. Pours a deep amber with a small white head. Nose is caramel, bread and pine resin, bit of citrus too. Medium mouth feel and lightly carbonated. Sweet malts of the taste, leading into a very bitter pine resin, lemon peel, grapefruit peel finish. I get a touch of an alcohol kick with this one, but its a pleasant one. Really good stuff, still refreshing enough despite the 6.9 %.

Cloudy golden pour with thick white foam. Very strong, fruity nose. Taste is resiney, almost metallic. Very strong hoppy profile. The finish is bitter with some faint touches of malt. Its a very good example of a strong IPA but challenging too.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2017 Poured from a 0.33l can @ home. Medium to medium-heavy haze. Pale yellow-amber. White frothy head. Good lacing. Hops to malt aroma ratio is definitely in favour of hops, but not to any extremity. Caramel-Honey malt. Strong pure hops aroma with only a subtle bouquet of (resin?), grapefruit, pine. Sweetness is nice and subtle but balances the bitterness slightly. Bitterness is medium, perhaps a little lacking, but at a level that makes the beer very easy to drink. Body slightly watery to oily. Carbonation a slightly towards the low end. (Original rating: 8-3-7-5-17)

When I want to drink ipa, it should be like this beer. Color is clear golden with stable white head. Clear aroma of hops and tropical fruits, citrus. Taste is sweetish at first turning into a bitter finish. Well balanced ipa. Very nice.

330 ml can. Pours a clear golden with a large white head. Mild aroma, lightly breadish/caramel malty with some herbal hoppy notes. Medium body with a light carbonation and a medium bitterness. The taste is again malty with very light notes of stone fruits, hints of citric fruits and a hoppy bitterness, some alcohol, solvent, honey.
Can from Surething_ii. Soft white head, clear golden colour, soft citrusy aroma. String bitter and hoppy taste, with long bitter finish. Very good IPA.

Can from Pivný raj. 
Nice hoppy IPA. Very drinkable, nevertheless I miss bit of citruses.
Typical hopped up IPA, quite harsh, high medium bitterness, grapefruit pith, some malt to balance it (not enough).

Pours hazy gold from the can and leaves a thick, porous head that slowly subsides. A sticky film of lacing clings to the bottle. A fruity aroma greets the nose, with apricot being dominant. Taste is bittersweet with a perfect mix of hops bitterness and an underlying malty sweetness with a distinct mango note. Finishes lightly bitter. The palate is equally impressing: smooth and refreshing on a medium body. The rich feel in the mouth combined with the aromatic bittersweetness make this almost difficult to swallow. I just want to keep swishing it around in my mouth, enjoying the flavors. Great stuff.
Biscuit aroma with a slight hint of citrus. Pours a mid orange with a fluffy small head. Citrus and grapefruit taste with a slight butterscotchy finish, it lingers for a while. Decent.

Stone Berlin, puszka 0,33, data do 16.04.2017 r. Barwa złocista, lekko opalizujące, ładna piana, zostawia niezły lacing. Aromat nie powala, jest trochę cytrusów, ale mogłoby być lepiej. Raczej wytrawne, goryczka wysoka, odrobinę przydługa. Dupy nie urywa.

Bought as a single 12 oz. bottle. Drained into a tall, handled beer glass seeing a nice golden yellow body with active bubble action. The foam is thick, stays for awhile and laces well. The nose is cut grass and citrus. I taste a moderately hoppy opening, follows with biscuit, resin, a small sweetness. It has a good lingering bitterness. I sort of like Imperial IPAs but this is a strong everyday IPA. Does Stone ever get it wrong?
Can. High, stable, white head. The aroma is sweet with quiet week citrus notes. The taste is a little bit malty, hoppy, with nice, short medium-high bitterness. Very drinkable.

Ámbar dorado alucinante y su espuma, de gran burbuja, embelesa. El lúpulo lo inunda todo. Aromas a resina de pino y hierba.

En boca es rotunda y hecha para la gente que adora este estilo. Pomelo y dulzor parecido al melocotón. El amargo del lúpulo te sigue a todos lados, pero no es un final excesivo ni demasiado difícil. Riquísima.

Ideal para los amantes de las grandes IPAs americanas, o como los mismos chicos de Stone dicen: para los fanáticos del lúpulo.

Can, golden to orange clear color, medium white frothy head. Aroma is citrusy, resiny, zesty and piney, grapefruits. Taste with solid malty backbone and full body, grapefruits and zest, pines and resins, long hoppy and dry finish
Puszka. 4 miesiace od zapuszkowania. W aromacie mokry karton, ktory przyslania baze slodowo-owocowa. W smaku nijakie. Slodowe jak owocowe. Goryczka zalegajaca, grejpfrutowa. Dramat. Az mi przykro.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2017 Can, Berlin Brewing Co. Pours amber with white head. Taste is your typical West Coast IPA - grapefruit citrus, pine, but i also get a tropical lychee taste that I associate with Citra hops that. Interesting but I prefer Stones Ruination Double IPA
Can from the brewery in Germany. Not like i remember at all, almost has a sour off flavor to it. Maybe just a bad run?

I poured it from the bottle into a pint glass. It pours cloudy golden with a fluffy, white head and lacing. The aroma is piny hops, grass, and citrus. The taste is hops, grapefruit, and butterscotch. Theres a lot of bitterness with some sweetness to offset it. Its nicely carbonated and hides the alcohol nicely. This is an excellent IPA.

Pale orange with a fine head that holds up well, from bottle. Resinous, piney, grassy and biscuit aromas. A somewhat bitter finish and presence typical of west coast IPA that seems to work. A little butterscotch and yeasty flavors are noted. Nice.

Amarillo oro con abundante cabeza de espuma blanca consistente y de aspecto jabonoso, aromas a fruta tropical, resina, herbales y florales; en boca entrada potente, compensada carga de malta y lúpulos, empieza con amargor medio haciéndose más fuerte en el retrogusto, notas a hojas de pino y menta, cuerpo y carbónico medios, excelente cerveza, compleja y fácil de beber.
Somewhat hazy golden color with small white head. Nice strong hop aroma of pine and fruit. Taste is resin, grapefruit, stonefruit. Medium carbonation and medium body, with good bitterness. Solid IPA.

ASPETTO: biondo oro, lieviti in sospensione. Schiuma bianca, fine, abbastanza abbondante e decisamente persistente. AROMA: soprattutto frutta tropicale ed erbaceo, intenso e gradevole. GUSTO: leggera scorza di pane, ma soprattutto molto fruttata (frutta tropicale, come mango e papaya) e molto luppolata, di un amaro intenso e quasi pungente, ma senza mai esagerare. IPA davvero ben fatta!

Stone Berlin. Puszka 330ml. Piwo 6-miesieczne. Barwa zlota, jasna, opalizujaca. Typowa west coast ipa. Piana bujna, sredniopecherzykowa. Aromat chmielowy bardzo subtelny aczkolwiek przyjemny. W smaku wytrawne. Wyczuwalna baza slodowa w postaci biszkoptow. Chmielowosc, goryczka srednia, grejpfrutowa, bardzo przyjemna i krotka. Z kolejnymi łykami się uwypukla. Bardzo pijalne.

Draft Pint in USA in Oct 2015 - Pale Gold in colour. Big hoppy aroma. Mega-Fruity; bitter citrus-grapefruit & lemon. Mega-hoppy; piney, oily, resinous hops. Malt base; caramel. Hoppy citrus fruity beer, but NOT extreme. Very refreshing. Very nice beer! (2015-10)
Pourd clear blonde , small white head. Smell is bit citrussy, hopped , mild. Taste is intense bitter, pine, citrussy. Nice in taste, but a weak scent.

Sehr gutes IPA nahezu alles ist stilecht.goldenes Bier, zwei Finger Schaumkrone, die auch gut im Glas steht. Fruchtige Nase, das Mundgefühl ist etwas hart, so wie auch der Bittereindruck etwas kratzig ist. Aber das ist meckern auf sehr hohen Niveau.
Hazy amber color, off-white head. Fruity nose, orange, resin, citrus with grapefruit, caramel, grass. Grapefruit taste, caramel, malty, grass, moderate bitterness. Medium body, soft carbonation.

Once Ive let a full carton of 24 cans in the fridge of my parents house. 15 days after, Ive just found 4 cans. My father said - It is really good beer that one... Until that day he only used to drink industrial beer, from then I have to keep his fridge well assorted.

Canned from Biernavigatie.nl. Hazy golden colored, tiny particles floating around, medium lasting head. Powerful hoppy nose, fruity, resin. Flavor is dominated by hop bitterness, grapefruit, some malts. Pretty aggressive, but pretty solid.

Bottle. Hazy golden amber with big frothy white head. Medium malty and heavy hoppy. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruit and pine and caramel. Starts medium sweet and finish light heavy bitter. Light and juicy. Smooth. A nice one...
Can form the importer. malty and big body, more than expected. maybe I prefer more light ones. great ipa of course.
Bottle and home. Nice colour and aroma. Fruity feelings. Great bottle. Thanks for you.
Bottle @ home. Aroma of resin, sweet hops, and herbal hops. Clear with white lasting head. Taste is moderate+ bitter and light+ sweet. Medium+ body, oily feel and bitter finish.
12oz bottle pours golden with medium white head smell of citrus zest and hops, taste the same with a strong pine taste, very good beer.

Przeklejka ze starych ocen.

Strasznie proste i przyjemne piwo. Kwiatowa, przyjemna goryczka i iglasto-kwiatowo-żywiczny finisz. Wytrawne, lekkie jak na ekstrakt i przyjemne piwo, ale choćby polski rynek produkuje dużo lepsze i ciekawsze IPA. Wersja z Berlina.
Can. German version. Clear, golden, frothy head. Pine herbs resin in aroma. Very dry, light bodied, no balance for strong herbal andcresin bitterness.

Can. Semi hazy orange golden beer with a large white head. Aroma is fruity with notes of caramel, citrus, peaches, oranges and pine needles. Flavor is fruity with notes of citrus, grapefruit, peaches, pine needles and mangos. Well balanced.

330 ml can from Stone Berlin. Pours hazy orange with an off-white head. Aroma is tropical fruit, citrus, malt sweetness and pine resin, but the fruity bits dont seem as fresh and juicy as in better (A)IPAs. Taste is quite dry despite the malty sweetness. Mainly reliant on pine resin and high astringent bitterness. Long bitter finish. Flavors of tropical fruit and citrus seem a bit suppressed. Really pleasant mouthfeel though, but mouthfeel alone cant save a mediocre beer. Medium to high body, thick texture, medium carbonation/
Faint aroma of tropical fruit (pineapple). Taste is faint citrus, pine and grapefruit with subtle caramel undertones and some grass. It is a lovely beer.

[Can from Stone Berlin] A lot of citrus in the aroma with hints of mango and pineapple freshness. Earthy, malty punch in the background. Cloudy orange in the glass, frothy snow-white head. Taste is dominated by fruity dryness with some earthiness and malty core. Harsh hopiness is also noticeable. Full body and fizzy carbonation. Too aggressive in my book.

Can from Stone Berlin. Slightly cloudy orange/gold. Huge foamy head. Nice lacing. Aroma is pine, orange, lemons and grapefruit. Beautiful. Taste is oranges, grapefruit and some malts in the background. Grassy, herbal and a little bit spicy. Good balance between malts and hops (although this is of course a very hop-driven beer by design). Highly carbonated. Dry and very bitter finish. A lovely and delicious IPA.
Can 330 ml. Clear golden with medium head. Aroma of citrus and resin. Totally dry, medium and quite short bitterness, carbonation bit too high for me.

Clear golden, medium white head. Strong aroma of pine, orange, grapefruits, mango, caramel. Flavours of pine, caramel, orange and grapefruits. Medium bitter backbone. Long strongly bitter piney dry finish.

Clear, pale amber body with large, creamy, eggnog head that reduces to an everlasting layer, excellent lacing. Sweet, surprisingly malty and strong aroma of caramel and a bit too overripe tropical fruits. Strong flavour of caramel, slightly overripe tropical fruits, grapefruit and bitter orange marmalade, with a floral and spicy background. Light sweet initial taste followed by a rather heavy bitter and long-lasting finish. Mid-bodied, dry, soft carbonation. A very nice one, but didnt feel as fresh as I had expected. 
[35.5 cl can, enjoyed 5 months after bottling, from Vinmonopolet Aker Brygge, Oslo]

Can. Berlin. Nose is citrus, malt, slight dankness, lime, grapefruit. Taste follows, good malt body with grapefruit, dank, lime rind, tangerine, lemon, with a dry lemon grass finish. Looks beautiful in the glass with a pillowy head. A classic deeply drinkable modern IPA.

Kolor: Złoty, klarowne. 
Piana: Średnio obfita, oblepia szkło, redukuje się do warstewki na powierzchni.
Zapach: Owoce tropikalne, żywica, kwiaty, mokre zboże. Pachnie przyjemnie, wyraźnie ale zapach trochę mdławy, mało agresywny. 
Smak: Słodkie, rześkie. Mango, brzoskwinie, zboże. Goryczka pojawia się po dłuższej chwili ale z dużą intęsywnością, mimo to jest krótka i przyjemna.
Wysycenie: Średnie w stronę wysokiego, OK. 
Opakowanie: Zgrabna, stylowa puszka, niedokładny skład. 
Uwagi: Warka 16.04.17 Mocno chmielowe, klasyczne, przyjemne. Dobry przykład stylu.

33cl can (by Stone Brewing Berlin). Hazy golden orange with big white head. Citrus, caramel and grapefruit in the aroma. Taste is lightly bitter with fruity notes. Overall, a bit of a deception. Nice but not remarkable.

Can from beerlovers, Vienna. Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma is hops, pine, resiny, a bit garlicy, bisquity maltiness. Taste is hops, mostly pine, also some citrus and tropická fruits, also bisquity malty Taste. Very high bitterness. Nice carbonation. Very drinkable. Good.

Bottle kindly shared by rusos, many thanks. Golden color with medium white head. Aroma of citrus hops. Taste, solid malty base followed by nice citrus hoppy bitterness. Medium long hoppy bitter finish. Very good.
Bottle shared by rusos. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma of citrusy hops, grapefruit. Taste is bitter, grapefruit, citrusy hops, malty backbone.
Clear golden with a small white head. Medium body. Very hoppy, with pineapple, grapefruit, orange and peach. Good malt base, then huge bitterness. As youd expect...
UPDATED: FEB 3, 2017 Lata 33cl. No está mal pero un 100 me parece un poco exagerado. Un poco más de cuerpo y aroma no le vendrían mal...

Piwo barwy słomkowej, klarowne. Piana biała, obfita, bąbelki spore, lacing też jakiś obecny. Mocny aromat chmieli, sporo cytrusów, trochę sosny i jakby brzoskwini. W smaku, jak dla IPY, dominują ponownie chmiele i cytrusy, w tym wyraźny grejpfrut. Bardzo pijalne piwo. Goryczka oczywiście spora, niezalegająca, posmak chmielowo-cytrusowy.

13/20 it's ok but a bit too bitter for me. Good alcohol % though and quite smooth

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can (Stone Berlin). Pours orange with a rapidly fading big white head. Big aromas of peach and pine with some citrus. Theres a bit of caramel sweetness to the taste yet even then the bitterness is happening. Resin, grapefruit and still a hint of peach. Had this beer many a time but particularly enjoying it tonight; fresher than normal?

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2017 Amber clear body with a small white head lasting.
Light aroma of tropical fruits quick
Light body very crisp
Clean taste with a barely noticeable bitter finish

Good when fresh

I bought this bottle at amstein. I decide to drink this
beer after a awful day of work with delay from Paris and alone, instead of two. I arrived at home tired and I decided to drink this beer and I came back healthy. In my opinion, this beer is just great, first when you smell it, there is a powerful aroma of hops, delicious. When you drink it, the bitterness is just a piece of art, citrus, aromatic, grapefruit. The taste is well balanced and the bitterness follows you at all the steps until the belly, malt but the hop is the queen of this beer and the taste of this flower makes that you reach the paradise, perfect.
UPDATED: DEC 23, 2016 (Berlin) Golden w/ big whie head. Resin/pine/Citrus aroma. Citrus/pine same on the mouth. Nice bitterness with malt character.

0.33 can.   Clear, gold color and a small, white head. Aroma of pines, dough, and grapefruity - not particularly complex but straight to the point. Taste is obviously hoppy, somewhat bitter, piney, dough is featured again. A medium body, an oily texture, and a soft carbonation. Finish is bitter but not astringent. Overall the beer is fine, nothing exceptional but definitely pleasant.

Brewed and canned in germany. From the Can poured into Spiegelau IPA Glass. Pours clear with some Sediment. Herbal grassy nose and some citric fruits. Taste is piny, herbal, creamy sensation there too. Grassy herbal finish... Good  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2017 330ml can. Clear golden beer, solid white foam head. Rich, intense hoppy aroma: pineapple, grapefruit, grass, some resin. Taste is light light sweet and heavy bitter, grapefruit, grass, citrus. Very dry, medium body, quite slick texture, average carbonation. Long bitter finish. Great IPA and a real hop bomb, just a little too agressive.

33 cl, can conditioned. Bursting out of the can, thats never a good sign... :-( Golden amber, low carbonation, thin head, sediments galore. Aroma is butterscotch, suggesting that this can is way too old, just like my recent cans of Torpedo and Modus Hoperandi... The taste of this canned beer is aweful, I shouldnt be rating this at all. Big shame...

Orange beer with nice head on top which leaves some lacing. Aroma has pines, grapefruit and slight tropical sweet fruits too. Taste is bitter with grapefruit and pines then some caramel malts and citrus. Medium body and medium carbonation.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

nice grapefruit aroma. yellow clear beer with good white head. taste is medium bitterness, no real sweetness. palate is medium body, thin feel, average carbonation, very bitter, long finish. One dimensional, but still a well made ipa.

Color is amber to golden yellow. Average white foam head. Aroma is heavy floral hops, citrics. Taste is really bitter, somewhat sweet... flavour isnt too balanced. Medium body, sticky texture, low carbonation and a long bitter finish.

Pouts clear gold, minimal head. Great big aromas of pine, pineapples, socks, yeast, pine. A little thin for the abv. The huge aroma didnt really fully carry through to the taste, but theres still a nice day, bitter edge followed up with a musty sweetness. Suspect its the full shilling stateside and doesnt travel too well.

(can, 33cl) Hazy, orange-golden coloured hue with floaties and a loose medium-sized and slightly off-white foamy head. Rich fruity hoppy and delicately piney aroma with notes of grapefruit, mango and lychee, accompanied by slightly biscuity malty notes. Bitter and delicately sweet flavour, medium bodied with a moderate carbonation. Hearty hops character with mainly fruity and lighter piney/resiny notes, backed by mildly biscuit malt; lasting bitter hoppy and delicately sweet finish with a warming kick of alcohol. Very pleasant. 15.X.16
Tap at Crafthouse Prague. Hazy golden colour. Aroma of pine, hops.Taste is bitter, pine,grapefruits, lemons, moderate carbonation. Huge bitter finish. Nice balanced IPA

Can made in Berlin. Clear light golden with strong nature white head. Tropical fruit, citrus, sweetness and some floral aroma. Bitter, not to sweet with a slightly sticky palate and light body. Herbs, pine, grass, floral aroma. Some metallic side taste, possibly from the can. A nice typical IPA.

Can. Pours golden with a tall and frothy white head. Lovely aroma with smells of peach and mango, sugar, citrus and grapefruit. Fabulous palate, medium body, slick. Average carbonation, bitter finish. Mostly bitter flavour with wonderful sweet tones, packed with flavour. Excellent beer.
From can. Pours orange, cloudy, with medium white head. Pineapple, strawberry, grapes, tea, floral, grapefruit, caramel, resin. High carbonation, bitter, reminds me of a hammer. Good.

Draught at Bootleggers Craft Beer Bar. Hazy, golden colour with an amber tint. Fruity aroma with citrus fruits, resins, pines and a slightly toasted note. Taste is bitter. Medium body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Good for the abv. Finishes dry and bitter with citrus fruits and resin. Nice westcoast IPA.
Draught at WFPD 2016, American version. crisp, fresh, lots of citrus, not overhoppd, just the right amount of bitterness. Balanced beer, simple yet effective.

Can, brewed in Berlin. Aroma is slightly medicinal, some tropical fruits, hints of citrus, spruce, mango and apricot. Golden orange, hazy, small white head. Light to medium sweetness, medium+ bitterness, taste is apricot, peach, some light malty tones. Medium body, average carbonation, long finish with some fruity tones and almost harsh bitterness. Classic ipa, with some disturbing elements.

Rich golden color with some light malt at the beginning with slight grapefruit. Finishes tart and a bit bitter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ive had this from can. In the begining yellowish colour with nice white head but disappering really fast after few minutes, then some bitternes, some pine and grapefruit in taste but nothing else... Im a litle bit dissapointed.

Very nice clear gold colour with a large, foamy and lasting head. Pine, resin, citrus and full malty aromas. Medium malty sweetness and high bitterness. Very well balanced. Long, tart grapefruit finish. This is a great IPA but quite tame and lacking definition by todays standards. The competition has increased plenty since 1997.

Can from bierlinie in Berlin. Pours clear orange with soft white head. Nose is floral, citrus, ginger. Palate is bitter, bread, hay, but with soft fruity undertones. Finish is long and bitter. This is a really bitter IPA, but its still very drinkable. Good!
33cl can. Clear blonde. Zesty grapefruit and orange hop aroma. Rather big mouthfeel, spicey and herbal hops, bitterness lingers on for quite a while. Nice.

Clear golden color with white head. Strong aroma of pines, grapefruits, little caramel and tropical fruits. Loads of hops in taste, combined with pine and grapefruits. Soft carbonation. West coast IPA done right, well recommended!
Puszka 0,33l. Aromat intensywnie chmielowy, rześki i przyjemny. W smaku wytrawnie, chmielowo, delikatnie alkoholowo. Goryczka umiarkowana.
Tap. Deep honey pour with foamy white head. Really solid hop taste throughout - adds some hair on the chest! Quite drinkable too. A very standard IPA, and I mean that as a compliment.
Completely decent IPA like so many others, but does not do anything spectacular to warrant the insane ratings.

Muy fresca y lupulada. En nariz pino y limón. Cuerpo medio.En boca equilibrada: cítricos con presencia de la malta. Tremenda. Amargor resinoso final. Coincido con la nota de ratebeer.
Canned 2016/09/15 BB2017/06/12

CAN 33 CL by Stone Berlin. Almost clear orange, white head. Aroma: pale malts, and shy hops with notes of zest and pine. Taste: moderate malty sweetness, just a touch of citrus and a big piney bitterness. A bit old-school, but still good.
Set the bar that others follow. Still an all time great, big nose, pallet and finish make this perfect!

Its that easy and that delicious. All you have to do it to find the right balance. The hops, the bitterness, the alcohol and malts are all just at the edge. Loads of citrusy hops in taste. Solid malty backbone and the strong beer feel to it all. Very good.

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2016 couleur jaune dorée, légère mousse. Nez sur le fruit exotique, litchi, houblonné resineux, amande. Gout bien amer houblonné, résine, zest orange, amande et bien doux avec raisin, note caramel et fruitée. Bon corp. Fin bien amere avec houblon, reglisse, résine, et fruit exotique. Nickel et puissante
Can at home from Marks and Spencer Ayr clear golden beer with hoppy grapefruit aroma pine flavour some tropical fruit notes big pithy grapefruit dominates dry hoppy quite bitter on the finish

Wygląd: Złociste, klarowne, ładna piana drobno pęcherzykowa utrzymująca się na powierzchni piwa.

Aromat: Granulat chmielowy, żwyica, trawa no i niestety siarka w postaci jajka na twardo

Smak: Przyjemne żywiczne, lekki cytrus oraz słodowość. Goryczka w miarę wysoka, lekko zalega, wysycenie średnie, wytrawne

Piwo pite z puszki z berlińskiego browaru. Myślę, że gdyby nie ta siarka to byłoby to bardzo fajne piwo.

Dark gold to light amber color. Ultra thick creamy white head. Massive perfume of american hops, very fresh. Aroma is heavy hops, grapefruit, hop resin all over the place, fruity tones of tropical fruits, floury malts and candy sugar in the background with a charcoal note. Big and bold. Taste is balanced, yet prominently bitter. Body is medium to full, quite thick, creamy texture, a bist sticky, very dry. Long hoppy finish, sensible alcohol. Big American IPA nonetheless, excellent.
Resiny pine and sweet citrus on the nose. Juicy citrus and pine on the tongue. Bright, bitter and balanced.

Kicsi, tartós hab, tiszta, borostyán szín. Illata gyümölcsös, barack, mangó, halvány citrus, semmi gyanta. Citrusos, déligyümölcsös, ananászos ízvilág, markáns, közepes keserűvel, hosszú lecsengéssel. Közepes test és szénsavasság, leheletnyi gyanta. Kiváló egyensúly az aromák között, finom sör. Keserűje minden korty lecsengésekor egyre erősebb.

From Guevara & lynch. In Teku glass. Ar lunch with Pedro & David. With Penne norcina. Not the hops bomb I was expecting. Lacks some taste but is pleasant anyway. Improves at end of can, becoming hops more noticeable in taste

Copenhagen 9/10 2016. 33 cl can from Meny. Beer drinking Devil (in the strictest sense of the word) on the can. Pours slightly hazy yellow with big white head. Settles as 1,5 cm thick layer of foam. Lacing on the side of the glass. Aroma is intense with exotic fruit supplemented with sharp citrus fruit. Peach, passion fruit and pinapple intermingling with grape fruit and citrus. Soft carbonation and slightly thick palate. Flavor is dominated by very distinct bitterness and only light sweetness. Bitterness lingers on in the aftertaste. Dry finish. This is a very nice IPA - Distinctly bitter with just the right sweet touch. Hopelessly small can.

330ml can from M&S.
Good sized white head lasts well, decent lacing. Clear golden amber body. Nose is dank, caramel, pine, resin. Flavour is caramel, resin, grass, wood. Lasting resinous bitterness. Light carbonation, good mouthfeel, good bit of chew, clean finish. Proper bitter west coast IPA.

Can from M&S Exeter,(from Stone Berlin canned 15/09/2016)pours almost clear pale gold with a 3 finger slightly off white head. Aroma resinous piney hop,bread ,candy sugar some citrus,tangerine & cut grass. Taste is slightly resinous piney hop up front ,bread,caramel, grapefruit & orange pith & nicely raspingly bitter. Light to medium bodied ,bone dry ,bitter & well carbonated the finish is dry ,bitter with a long hop fruit finish! Really well made!

UPDATED: APR 1, 2017 Puszka 0,33l. z Berlina.Kolor złoty. Super klarowne. Piana szybko opada ale fajnie zdobi. Aromat mocno słodowy o niskiej goryczce. Smak odwrotnie. Duża goryczka o charakterze leśnym.
One of the best beers Ive ever drank. Great all aspects. Will definetely drink more.

Canned, 0.33 l.
Opal orange golden colour, small off-white head.
Fruity nose.
Aroma brings flowers, caramel, herbs, some resin and mild citrusses, taste of mango, drops... nice slick and crisp mouthfeel.
Lingering, gently warming, bittersweet finish with herbs and citrus fruits.
Refined, balanced, enjoyable IPA.

Dose (Stone IPA, gebraut in Deutschland", 33 cl) aus einem Kaisers in Berlin-Steglitz. - Orangegold, schwach trüb. - In der Nase üppige IPA-Aromen in perfekter Balance: Mango, Orangenschale, Nadelwald, dazu Karamel. - Im Antrunk verbinden sich fülliges Karamelmalz und kräftige Pampelmusenschale zu komplexer, trockener Herbe, in der die süße Fruchtigkeit der Nase nicht mehr vorkommt. Mild rezent, öllig weich im Mund. Kräftig zitrusherber Abgang; sehr langer, wuchtig bitterer Nachtrunk. - Klassisches, strenges IPA.

Aroma; pine forest, leaves, earth, pale malts. Look; fawn head, near clear deep golden body. Taste; citric resin, juicy hops, fruity malts, all in all much citric bitter flavours - leading to a bitter-fruity solid finish. Feel; solid body, softish carbonation. Overall; nice.[33cl.can 6.9% BB.10.03.2017 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */]

Bottle at home. Pours a slightly hazy orange colour with a big creamy off-white head. Aroma of orange peel, grapefruit, pale malt, spicy hops, pine and grass. A little careful though. Flavour of grassy hops, pine and grapefruit. A little dry in the end. Has a slick mouth feel, medium to full-bodied and a medium bitternes. A well-balanced and solid IPA.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2017 Pours translucent gold, honey-like colour, small persistent head and nice lacing. Very bright in appearance and aroma - pine, citrus and malt nose is exactly what you want in an IPA. Taste is near-perfectly balanced - orange, grapefruit, resiny hops, noticeable malt profile with toast and caramel... lingering bitter finish of citrus pith. Hits that sweet spot between intensely bitter yet fruitily refreshing.
Edit: original rating of 9/4/9/5/19 was perhaps a smidge too high - I wouldnt go so far as to say this is "special treat" category - but this is still an excellent brew and among the best widely-available IPAs.

33cl can from Stone Berlin - nice aroma of tropical fruits (mango, melon, citrus). Nice balance between high bitterness and medium sweetness. Nice aftertaste that stays on the palate for a while and leaves some grapefruit notes. Bitterness feels also very pleasant with a mixture of herbs and grapefruit. Great, very drinkable beer.
Can. Pors yellow with high white head. Aroma and taste are fruity, malty, hoppy and sweet. Taste is also nicely bitter. Very good one!

Can, brewed in Germany. Pours slightly hazy yellow, with a big creamy head receding to finger thickness. Aroma is bitter hops, with pine and citrusy notes, as well as some malts with biscuits and honey. Medium body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is bitter, with resin, pine and citrusy notes of grapefruit and orange peel, grassy notes, stone fruits and light tropical notes, as well as lots of malts with cereals and honey balancing it all. Lingering bitter finish. Very easy drinking, and moreish.
Tap at Taphouse takeover. Clear yellow small white head. Nice flowery hoppy aroma with a solid malty Base. Not that dry though.flavor is flowery hoppy and malty. Hoppy and herbal bitter end.
Standardowa IPA. Bez wad, ale też nie mająca nic takiego co by człowieka skłaniało do rozwodzenia się na jej temat.
Clear, light golden. Frothy head. Aroma is grapefruits and mangoes. Dank. Bitter. Boring.

Medium frothy white head with good retention.
Hazy dark golden
Aroma is fruity, citrus, candy.
Taste is resin bitter and malty
Hoppy bitter finish

Dorée, limpide, carbo tres faible, gros collet persistant.
Aromes résineux, caramel
Saveurs citronnées couvertent rapidement par une amertume forte sur le resineux, le biscuit.
Relativement fluide

33 cl can (Stone Berlin), served in snifter glass. Poured clear golden with a frothy three finger off white head. Lively carbonation in glass. Aroma: Citrus, mango, pineapple, grass, floral, herbs, hay. Taste: A continuation of the aroma with additional notes of caramel, bread, pine, grapefruit, lemon. Nice bitter grassy & fruity hops with malty character. Medium body with a grassy, dry, bittersweet finish. Very good!

The quintessential west coast IPA that defines everything great about the style. The appearance is translucent orange tinted gold. The head is creamy white. Super dank aromatics of pine and citrus. Apricot, grapefruit, lemon and tangerine dance around with fresh cut pine tree. The tasting treats the pallette to slightly toasted malt, refreshing citrus with a long dry pine finish. Clean, balanced malt bill let Stones talent for hop aggressiveness shine through. A brew that keeps me coming back for more and more.
German can version. Golden colour with small head. Aroma of pine, citrus, some tropical fruits, slight caramel, hoppiness backed up by malts. Quite bitter taste, mediumish body.
Can 0,33. Pours orange with medium white head, nice lacing. Citrus, pine, flowers, hops, well balanced. Full body and average carbonation.

33 cl, canned. Pours clear orange-tinted yellow with a medium white head. Aroma: Citric fruits, zest. Malt, biscuits. Taste: Somewhat sweet, notable bitterness. Zesty tones, balanced malty flavours. Grains. Palate: Medium body, average carbonation. Dry finish. Solid IPA.

Original recipe rating : 4.1   Rating v1.1 now.  Delicious impeccible gold pour, admirable head. More tropical-heavy nose of papaya, grapefruit, and tangerine, hints of pastel candy and floral notes, much less emphasis on the pine compared to the last version.  Flavor, again, presents a profound tropical bottom end, papaya, soft mango, sweet flowers, lime rind, canned tangerine, highly floral and, admittedly, beautiful complex linger with lime rind.  This, ultimately, is a step up from the original recipe, yet the absence of piney-ness has been replaced with hoppy resin (which is similar yet sometimes interchangeable).  This new version presents more tropical fruit than the other. A much more "ripe" flavor, but still wields the bitterness well and dryness too.  Impermanence is the beauty of life. I was skeptical of this "new version", but its still well balanced. I just miss the pine!
Aroma of citrus fruits, some flowers. Taste is medium bitter, dry. Flavor of rasin, citrus seeds, herbs. Aftertaste is long, tanin like, bitter.
Klar mörkgult med vitt skum. Riktigt god epa som känns färsk. Tropisk frukt, citrus, krispig. Grymt god!

A bit rough on my stomach but a damn delicious IPA. not too extreme. Well balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can 33cl. Yellow/orange with a nice white head. Hoppy/malty aroma, pine tree. Flavor of mandarine, malt and plenty of bitter hops. Long bitter finish.
Aroma of caramalts, pine and some fruity notes. Taste id bitter with citrus, grapefruit, pine, grassy hops. Medium thin body with good carbonation.
Pours cloudy gold with a foamy white head that laces the glass. Aroma is grapefruit,  pineapple, malt and pine. Flavour is bitter citrus and fruit. Good balanced taste. An all around great IPA.
0,33ml can, brewed in Berlin. Pours clear orange with medium sized head. Pine, citrus, malts. Quite basic IPA in a good way, no real weaknesses. Nicely balanced and full bodied.
Can. Pours clear amber with high frothy head. Aroma is floral hops, citrus fruits, forest scent. Taste is soft, clean, bitter, malts, orange peel, fruity and dry.
Drank with Marijn, Timothy, Rik and Lennart at Waalstrandje 14-9-2016 (from can). Good IPA, very fresh.
Aroma of pine and grapefruit, taste is much the same. Clean taste, not to angular. Slightly fruity, which balances the hops. Finishes with a nice lingering bitterness.

- klares gold-gelb mit leichter, schnell zerfallender Schaumbildung
- leichte Aromen nach Citrusfrüchten und eine dezente Harznote
- passende Carbonisierung
- der Antrunk ist von einer starken Säuerlichkeit geprägt
- danach kommen noch die Citrusaromen, etwas Heu und Kräuter
- die säuerliche Hopfenbitternis und eine gegen Ende einsetzende Malzig-
 keit prägen den weiteren Verlauf bzw. den Abgang
Fazit: Biederes Durchschnitts-IPA

Can at home. Pours hazy golden orange with large white head. Aroma really hoppy with citrus. Taste has strong malts and fruity hops. Light/medium bodied with strong carbonation. Refreshing, hoppy and clean. This with barbeque <3.
12-09-16 // 330ml bottle, US-version. Light hazy golden orange. One finger white head. Hoppy nose. Medium sweet, moderate carbonation. Nice bitter finish. Grapefruit, citrus, pine and grass notes.
Pouring a canned craft beer is still a bit... uncanny, but its the future right? Very malty IPA with a strong bitter kick at the end.
