Pours almost clear orange golden with offwhite head. Aroma has light malt and hints of light bread but otherwise mostly hoppy with grass, citrus, grapefruit and pine. Taste is hoppy up front with grass, citrus, grapefruit and pine and has light malt in the undertone with notes of biscuit as is comes along. Finish is dry and bitter with bitterness that hangs on.

0,33 l can, brewed in Berlin. Clear golden in the glass, small two finger off white foamy head. Floral hop with resin on the nose, malt in the background. Taste starts with a strong hop bitterness, floral in the background, malty bedding, some resin. Long lasting bitterness in the aftertaste. Complex mouthfeel. Reference stuff for its style.
Clear golden with white head. Dank, citrus and herbal. Crisp, green and dry finish. Great! Super clean!

On tap at Who Cares for Beer 2016 Beer Festival, Bevog Brewery, Bad Radkersburg, Austria. Shared with His Highness Kaiser und König Igor and Rasta Teacher Mark. Clear golden, off-white head. Light malty and fruity, citrus, orange. Fruity sweetness, moderate hoppy. Medium body, moderate hoppy finish. Not impressed.
330 bottle. Deep orange appearence with white head. Aroma of citrus, orange peel, lemon. Grapefruit bitterness roses in the after taste. I also found a hint of coffee.

Version canette métallique brassée à Berlin. Blonde propre à la mousse pas très tenace, mais initialement généreuse. Nez porté sur le pin et le résineux, un peu sur lananas. Assez ronde en bouche pour une IPA, légèrement maltée avec des notes de caramel, et puis les houblons entrent en action de fort belle manière avec ce quil faut damertume, et ce quil faut darômes (toujours sur le résineux). Très chouette IPA, sa réputation nest pas usurpée, y compris pour sa version made in Germany !

UPDATED: SEP 24, 2016 Re-rate 9/24/16: Can brewed at Stone Berlin. Appearance see below. Aroma of passion fruit, sweet malts, lime, pine, more citrus fruits. Very full, round. Taste is slightly sweet, medium bitterness. Creamy medium body, medium carbonation. This time, its round, very pleasant and full of ripe fruits. Great balance, and the creaminess of the body just rounds it out into a really great beer.

Original Rating 9/5/16: Tap at Bevog Festival. Pours a nice amber with a medium white head. But something?s pretty far off. A smell of whey overpowers what could be citrus fruit and resin. Taste is sour and overpoweringly bitter. Medium body, medium carbonation.
Something was definitely wrong with this one, it was rather unpleasant. Not at all what I?ve hoped for and not at all what people told me it would be like. Skunky? Probably something wrong with the keg or with the tap.

33cl can shared with friends. Hazy orange with a medium white soapy head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Nice bitterness with subtle fruity sweetness. Pine, grapefruit, caramel, malts and citrus. Very nice.

Berlin-brewed version

L:
-pours a clear golden-orange with a big,foamy,white head
-medium carbonation visible
-hop particles visible
S:
-grapefruit,orange,honey,bready,mango the nose plus medicinal,pine and resin
-finishes dry
-medium,lingering bitterniss for the style
F:
-medium carbonation
-light to medium body
O:
An all-around very good IPA

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2016 Versione europea. Bionda limpida, schiuma bianca funky. Aroma intenso e floreale, con tanto erbaceo e lievito. Al palato bella amarezza spinta, luppolo e agrumi. Retrogusto lungo e amaro. Carbonazione media. Ottima Ipa anche beverina.

Tasted from the tap on the 31/08/2016. Clear and golden orange colour with a lacing white head. Aroma of hops, flowers and grapefruit. Taste is grapefruit and very hoppy. Sweet malty hoppy finish. Next one please!

Pours a clear golden colour, with a big lace that leaves a good lace. Aroma of tropical fruits, citrics, resines. Light body , good carbonation. Taste of tropical fruits, resines, citrics. Tasted on can, I can detect some "can" notes. Heres on who still likes bottle better.

655ml bottle with "enjoy by" date of 22/12/16. Great to finally see this beer legitimately imported to Australia (via cold storage at the insistence of brewery). Pours clear gold with a substantial dense white head that laces nicely. Packed full of musty dry piney resinous hops on the nose with notes of freshly cracked pepper and stone fruits. Malt profile is subdued on the tongue with those palate scraping hops dominating the flavour before a substantial dry lingering bitterness. Lighter bodied than the ABV would indicate with an average carbonation and oily texture. Has now rather been superceded by numerous imitations including various DIPAs which dial up the hops even more, but respect is due! The original US West Coast IPA and pretty much deserves its iconic status.
Von Stone (Berlin) frisch vom Hahn im Straßenbräu getrunken. Golden im Glas mit schöner Blume. Anklänge komplexer Fruchtigkeit (Zitrus, Pinie, tropische Früchte). Bittrer Abgang.
UPDATED: NOV 4, 2016 The aroma is citrus and pine with grapefruit, bitter orange, and pine flavors. Taste is moderately bitter. Very nice IPA.

Aroma: hops citrus, slightly resinous.
Appearance: golden clear with small head.
Taste: high hops bitterness, malt.

Can: Served in a taster:
White head. Clear yellow golden body.
Nose of exotice fruit, hops, citrus, fruit punch, floral, herbal, light manure, grapefruit...
Flavours of bitters, grapefruit, hops, floral, light fruity, light citrus, apricot, pine apple, light creamy, grassy, some herbal tints...
Bitter floral hoppy aftertaste.
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied.
Nice!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Clear, golden amber color. Aroma: citrus, fruit, a little grassy. Taste: crisp, juicy, sweet malt, candy, fruit, citrus, grapefruit, very clean.
UPDATED: JAN 28, 2017 I need to admit that this is one of the best IPAs ever drunk. Perfect balance between citrus flavors and bitterness. Very drinkable and refreshing. Highly recommended

Blik 33cl van Stone Berlin. 
Goud/koper geel, vrij helder, volle net niet witte schuimkraag met grote bellen.
Aroma: Citrus, grapefruit, grassig, aarde, pijnboom, tropisch en moutig.
Smaak: Bitter,  grassig en netelige hops, mouten, iets karamel, citrus, grapefruit , pijnboom/hars.
Body is medium tot dun, voldoende koolzuur en de afdronk is vrij lang bitter en iets droog. 
Echt een mooie IPA waar naast de hops ook ruimte voor de mouten is. LIKE!
Alla spina. Resinosa, agrumata, profumatissima, forte, fresca, intensa, amara, robusta, dissetante. IPA grandiosa.

(Stone IPA (India Pale Ale)) Can 330 ml at home, served into a shaker, ABV 6.9%
Orange coloured body, crystal clear, with a full finger of thick, slightly off-white head, with very good retention.
Aroma of dunk, light caramel malts, piney notes.
Bitter taste with citrus, grapefruit, pine, grassy hops.
Medium thin body with good carbonation, dry palate.
Really good.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2016 Taster at Erzbierschof (thanks to staff). Aroma is sweet and pine with a really dry almost dusty profile. Flavour is big hops, especially for a non imperial. Theres plenty of sweet resin and a nice bitter finish. Fairly standard for the style but really nice.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Fresh crowler only a few days old from the main brewery in San Diego. Many thanks to my good friend Paul. Overall a balanced and very very tasty. Aroma and taste not overhopped, but good balanced with malt and pine. Very refreshing. A classic!

Tap at Erzbierschof. This beer is bitter but not much more. There is some forest aroma hops in the nose, but really not much else. Carbonation works, the bitter aftertaste is really striking. Not sure what I should think of this.

Slightly hazy pale golden colour, big white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, caramel, pine, hops, honey, citrus. Sweet bitter taste with hoppy finish and aftertaste. Thin to medium body and average carbonation. Nice sweetish IPA.

Can 33cl, a clear golden beer with medium head. Nose is on exotic fruits, resin and almond. Taste is very bitter with sweetness, aroma is on grassy and orange hops, exotic fruits, luppuline, lemon, light biscuit notes, pine, coconut, bitter almond. Quite string beer, almost balanced, good aftertaste duration on luppuline, pine and coconut oil.

Can from Stone Berlin. 
Clear orange, off white head 
Aroma of honey, syrup
Taste strong, bitter, sweet. Slight alcoholic. 
Round nice feel.

Canned June 13th. Pours clear golden with a small white head. Sadly I find it a little malt forward already. Some piney hops for sure but also caramel malty sweetness.. Not much citrus or other fruits. Mouthfeel is fine cafbonation is good.

On tap, JBM. Pours in clear pale body with medium white head. Aroma has spicy profile, earthy, citrusy. Light soufury touch. Taste has high earthy bitterness, light caramel sweetness. Body is full, high carbonation.

Can at home from Van Alsem, to celebrate that at 3.15 o clock I finished my paintjob in the bathroom! Poors clear dark golden/pale amber with white head. Sweet malts, big resiny and fruity hops, lychee, pineapple and spruce, also fudge, canned peaches, biscuits and apricot. Big nettle bitterness, quite sharp. Medium sweet, powerful bitterness. Over medium body, slick oily feel, soft carbonation. Bitter and fruity in the finish. Lovely.
Dobre. Aromat spoko, ziołowy. Wygląd ok. Smak bardzo przyjemny. Fajna goryczka. Wyjątkowo pijalne.

Dal colore dorato carico, tendente al ramato, limpido, con cappello di schiuma bianco dalla buona persistenza, al naso offre note lievi e fievoli di terra, erbacee e resinose. Al palato invece vira verso unamaro deciso fin da subito, sempre di stampo terroso, per finire sul finale vero note resinose ed erbacee. Il corpo è medio leggero con carbonazione nella media. La scorrevolezza è ottima , come pure la secchezza.
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours clear orange with a small white head. Aromas of citrus, hops, fresh orange zest. Taste is hoppy, citrussy, orange zest, mandarin.

Color is hazy straw. Aroma is all hops. Spicy and pungent. Taste has hints of malt but mostly hops. Very pungent. Smooth but earthy. Mouthfeel lingers, all hops. 

*12 oz bottle into glass

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Blikje 33 cl gekocht bij Hopfen&Maltz in Berlijn. Helder goudkleurig, witte kraag. Ruikt grapefruitig met mout. Smaakt grapefruitig met een mooie moutachtergrond, als het bier wat opwarmt een beetje kool smaak. Niet erg bitter en behoorlijk wat body. Smaakt goed maar ik mis wat pit. Een solide, brave IPA.

Stone berlin. Can! Pours clear amber with a white head. Aroma of floral hops, resin, slight malt, pine, citrus and weak bread. The taste is crisp and bitter with notes of orange, pine, herbs, grains and slight malt. Pretty old school bitter IPA. suits me fine!
Ser ut som IPA. Luktar IPA. Smakar IPA. En bra IPA. Görtråkig, men nog bra om man skulle få för sig att vilja dricka en IPA...

02.08.2016, tap @ Royal GourmetBurger @ Gin:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet and fresh grassy, leafs, sap, lawn, citrus peel, caramel malts, hops, moss, dried fruits, minerals, weeds, hay, hints of pine needles. Taste is slightly fresh concentrated grassy, leafs, lawn, minerals, hay, moss, hops, light malts, flowers, dried fruits, bark, pine needles. Medium to longlasting bitterness, slightly dry grassy mouthfeel. Nice.
How : can Appearance : almost clear deep orange with a medium foamy white head. Aroma : grapefruit, pine, lemon peel, grass, herbs. Palate : medium body, average carbonation.

Aroma of American hops, grapefruit, citrus, plums, fresh fruit and little yeast. Pours clear golden liquid with an average soapy white head. Strong bitterness and medium sweetness, very hoppy and citrusy flavour, grapefruit, kind of soapy and a caramel malt undertone. Light to medium body with a smooth texture, average carbonation and a bitter finish. Very nice IPA, refreshing and with a good amount of bitterness to it.

(tap 0,3l @ JBM (Brno))
Aroma: Strong hoppy, resiny, piny, spicy, light alcohol, dried berries.
Appearance: Clear golden color. Medium, white head.
Taste: Medium sweet, light caramel, medium bitter, resiny, piny hops.
Palate: Full body. Sticky texture. Long bitter, light warm finish.
Overall: Very good. Heavier. Bitter strong ale.
Clear orange color. Aroma is some pine and grapefruit. Taste is very bitter but smooth with some tropical fruits. Long lasting aftertaste, really coats your mouth

Clear amber liquid with thick white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, caramel. Taste of grapefruit, tropical fruits, caramel, medium sweet, medium bitter, light sour. Medium body, average carb, long fin

Can from 5/11/16 best by 8/9/16. Pours a hazy orange color with a sturdy rocky head. Orange, malt, grapefruit, alcohol, resin. Long bitter finish. Light mouthfeel. Classic bitter west coast ipa. Maybe a little malty and past its prime despite being within the best by date but still enjoyable.
Can from Stone Brewing Berlin. Nice head and appearance. Pine tree, grapefruit peel and metal. Stiff.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2017 Color dorado claro, translúcido, con capa de espuma de un blanco puro de dos dedos de grosor (buena retención). Carbonatación a tope. Textura acuosa y semiefervescente. Aroma a resina de pino, cedro, hierba mojada, marihuana, húmedo. Sabor con reminiscencias tropicales, mucha resina, cereal presente a mitad de trago, toques herbales. Amargor no muy elevado. Seca. Resina en postgusto largo rato.
Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a golden colour beer with a small head. Fruity and hoppy with pineapple, grape and caramel. Dry finish  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Can 330ml from the German branch of Stone. Golden amber, light haze with a dense white head. Sweetish aroma with lots of fruit, passionfruit, mango. Taste is robust and intense with addition of resinous notes and some alcohol. Long bitter hoppy aftertaste. A genuine IPA.
Yellow clear with foam layer. Hoppy fresh forest nose. Creamy and bitter with a forest hop touch and a tart follow up. Bitter tart and a little dry aftertaste.
Tap Hazy golden colour with medium white head.Aroma is fruity of exotic fruits pine and Greapfruits,good hoppy with medium body nice fresh crispy mouthfeels and hoppy finish.

1-2 oz pour on draft at B Side courtesy of the bartender Jane, thanks! Clear golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of floral notes, light citrus. Tastes of floral notes, toasty notes, citrus. Medium body with a dry finish.
Draft. Gold in color with an off-white head. The aroma is citrus and pine with grapefruit, bitter orange, and pine flavors. Taste is moderately bitter. Very nice IPA.
0,33l Dose. Orangenes trübes Bier, intensiver Geruch nach exotischen Früchten wie Mango. Im Geschmack wird diese fruchtige Komponente der Hopfung bestätigt. Im Abgang etwas zu herb!

Pours clear golden with nice white firm head. Aroma: hoppy, hay, fruity, mango, citrus, weak caramel. Taste: medium + bitter, pine, wood, freshly cutted grass, grapefruit. Bitter finish. Good IPA.
via Beer Buddy for iPhone
355 ml can from Systembolaget. First beer from the Berlin brewery for me. Hazy golden with white head. Grapefruit, old fruit dank hoppy. Dry with medium bitterness and medium carbonation.
33 cl bottle from systembolaget. Pours golden with little head. Sweet fruity aroma with hoppy citrus and some sweet caramel taste. Very nice!
Can. And this is the Berlin version. Fresh aroma of hops, sweet grapefruit, citrus, light touch of caramel in the background. Taste is super smooth, fresh and hoppy.. Bitterness could be higher.

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2016 Canned 16th of June. 
Aroma of pine, resin, caramel, orange, tangerine. 
Pours clear golden with a one finger off white head.
Taste is medium bitter and medium to lightly sweet. Resiny and grapefruity bitterness, bready and caramel sweetness. 
Nice medium body, sticky on the lips, average to soft carbonation, resinous and grapefruity finish. Iconic and very solid IPA.

Tap @ Keller, Tartu. Pours orange with medium head. Aroma is hay, silage, grass, some bitterness, some slurry, citrus. Taste is bitter, a lot of it,citrus, fruits, hay, grass, some spices, silage, lime. After taste is spicy, very long, bitter, silage. Good, very good!

12oz can dated 06/05/16 left behind by my buddy Mark. Thanks! Pours copper gold with a big off white head. Aroma is big grapefruit, a bit of grass. Flavor is slight caramel, grapefruit peel, a touch of grass. Grapefruit pith bitterness in the finish.

355ml bottle at the Head of Steam, Durham. Slightly cloudy yellow pour with a fine white head. Very strongly hoppy aroma, with slight floral notes. Strong flavour of hops, with a strange nicotine bitterness on the aftertaste.

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2016 0.33l can from kaisers in charlottenburg, brewed in berlin, 1.89.
 pours a hazy pale orange with a steady white head. aroma of sprucy and herbal hops, weed, passionfruit. flavour of grapefruit, mango, bread. oily mouthfeel. bittersweet finish.
a really nice us style ipa, would love to see more of it in europe.
Clear orange with off white head. Aroma of fruity citrusy hops, some malts. Taste beautiful bitter grapefruit and some nice bready malt notes. Really tasty IPA

Burk systembolaget. Berlinbryggd. Orangegul vätska. Fet humledoft. Barr, citrus och lite russin. Krafull bas i smaken med mycket beska. Citrus, barr, spannmål och hö. En ipa åt det tyngre och maltigare hållet snarare än frisk och fruktig.

Clear dark gold color with a medium white head. Medium aroma of hoppy citrus, pine grass and grapefruit, followed by light caramel and bread. Taste reflects the aroma. Medium body, with a dry texture. Medium carbonation. Medium bitterness.

330ml can poured into a Tulip glass. Appearance is slightly hazy Amber with a medium sized frothy beige head. Aroma and flavours of orange peels, grapefruit, pine, resin, caramel and a mango. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Palate is full-medium bodied, slightly sticky texture and average carbonation. No surprises here just a great style typical IPA.
UPDATED: SEP 22, 2016 Can at a pub. Dark yellow colour like honey, small white head. Very nice flowery hop forward ipa. Smooh mouthfeel wih very good balance. Outstanding ipa.
Burk från SB. Bärnstensfärgad med smutsvitt skum. Knäckig doft med lätt fruktighet. Bra humletryck med söt fruktighet.
Golden color, large white head. Caramel, bread, citrus and pine aromas. Bread, citrus, pine and grass aromas. Well balanced. Light bitter, hoppy finish.

Hevelka 2016. W aromacie chyba owoce tropikalne, chyba cytrusy i z całą pewnością coś popsutego (najbliższym odpowiednikiem są gotowane warzywa pozostawione w zamkniętym termosie na kilkanaście godzin). W smaku, o dziwo, całkiem przyjemne, półgorzkie z goryczką średnią do wysokiej. Ogólnie - rozczarowanie bo albo trafiłem na nieudaną warkę albo ktoś pokpił sprawę na linii producent - Hevelka.
Can from SB. Cloudy orange with a medium white head. Fruity and piney tones. Fruit, malt, resin and hops. Medium body with a nice bitter/ fruity finish.
Tap at Davo. Lovely bitter ipa, citrus, resin, very crisp, pretty bitter, yet an easy drinker.

Pours clear pale gold. Aroma: Dank hops that open into floral grapefruit, citrus and orange. Taste: Grassy hops, citrus fruit, solid malt backbone and a big bitter finish. Overall: Great example of a classic west coast IPA, but there are better on the market now at the same price point.

Can. Shaker. Clear, golden with medium t big, white, semi-sensed head. Medicore head retention and lacing. Medium citrus aroma - mainly grapefruit and orange, grassy balanced with some nice malty, toasty profile. Taste is medium bitter, mainly in the beginning of degustation. Medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation, finish is dry and bitter. In general dry, bitter and pretty well balanced beer. But nothing outstanding.

0,33l can from Stone Berlin. Canned 14/06/2016. BB 11/03/2017. dark yellow clear color, medium big white head. smells of pines, exotic fruits, light grapefruit, mango, lychee, passion fruit, some lemon grass. lovely smell. full body, soft carbonation, nice slick mouthfeel. tastes of pines, lightly grassy & herbal, exotic fruits again, lychee, lemon grass, light grapefruit, mango, a bit malt heavy towards the finish, but overall great balance. finishes lightly bitter with citric, lemon grass and some resiny notes. overall very nice one, could be just a tad more crisp.

33cl blik, uit de nieuwe Duitse brouwerij in Berlijn. schenkt gouden met licht geel/witte kraag. aroma is fris, citrus, gras. grapefruit, den. smaken zijn redelijk tot zwaar bitter, sinaasappel, citrus, mout, graan, zo dit is een beste bak bitterheid zeg. ook lang in de afdronk, matige body, droge afdronk, had er wel wat meer van verwacht.

Burk från SB. Tjusigt klar bärnstensfärgad vätska med högt fluffigt vitt skum som ger lite rester längs kanterna. I doften fräsch citrus; mandarin, apelsin, grape, lime, citrusskal, lite brödiga toner, lite tropiska inslag, granskott och en gnutta kåda. Fina, färska humletoner. Mellanstor kropp, åt det något större hållet. Fin, len munkänsla. Något klibbig. En något maltig bas bär upp humlet fint. Nära doften i smaken. Beskan är där från början och är påtaglig, men håller sig ändå väl på sin plats. Väldigt drickbar och lätt att få ner ett par stycken av. Stilren, enkel IPA som håller ihop väldigt snyggt. Mycket gott! Prisvärd dessutom.

Pours a clean golden color with medium white head. Aroma was a little let down at the beginning, not much going on but after a while, citrus, pine and bread stanted out. Taste was more inense, citrusy, piney, biscuity, grapefruity and slightly tropical, with a strong bitterness on the aftertaste.
Couleur dorée; mousse blanche; arômes fruités; goût fruité (citron, pamplemousse), malté et de résine; finale bien amère et longue; excellente bière

Wersja z Berlina. Piana ładnie zdobi szkło. Aromat chmielowy, owocowy, aczkolwiek niezbyt rześki. Jest w nim coś takiego średnio fajnego, nie potrafię określić co. W smaku wytrawne, owocowe z mocną, nie do końca przyjemną goryczką. Nawet lekko herbaciane się robi po ogrzaniu. Jest poprawnie, no ale kurwa, od Stone wymaga się chyba trochę więcej.

Fresh can from Stone Germany. Pours a clear, dark gold with white head. Something didnt feel quite right about this from the start, it was very musty and mostly lacked the fruitiness and freshness one normally associates with a west coast IPA. Luckily, the initial aromas soon gave way to more tropical fruit scents of apricots and mango, I slight toffee hint, some wet wool, resiny hops and a hint of sweet red licorice. The palate is medium bodied with balanced sweetness and a very long, growing bitterness that coates the tongue nicely.

Golden, perfectly clear, quickly disappearing white head. Aroma: tropical fruits, citrous, caramel, bit malty. Medium to high sweetness, full body. Lots of hoppy fruits, some malts and sweetness, but everything is just background for heavy to medium bitterness.
UPDATED: JUL 8, 2016 Burk från SB. Bärnstensfärgad med vit skumkrona. Söt frukt doft. Mediumsöt och besk kropp. Smak av knäck, ananas, tall, bränt socker och grapefrukt. Bra efterbeska.
4 finger beige head, amber body. Nose: Grassy notes, starfruit, pine and spruce. Aroma. Oranges, resin, grassy notes, kiwi, mango, starfruit, pine and spruce. Long, dry, bitter ending.

Berlin can. Golden color with a tin of amber, clear liquid, white head. Smell of vegetable. Aroma of lager, earth, zest. Harsh bitter. Long bitter finish. Alcohol is hidden. Nice touch of the beer history, but todays brews are somewhere else. Still great though.
Great IPA. Great IPA. Great IPA. Citrusy, piney, balanced bitterness, easy drinking.

On tap at Pudel. Golden yellow colour. Medium white head. Lots of tropical fruits, juiciness in the aroma. Delicous, refreshing smell in my nose. Lots of fruits at first. Juicy, hoppy in the middle. Citrussy, slightly salty, juicy finish. Citrusses in the aftertaste. Nicely balanced, very drinkable IPA.

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, tropical fruit, pine, hops and citrus.

Appearance:

Clear/hazy golden/amber beer with a slight/medium off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, tropical fruit and pine; ends slightly bitter and slightly/medium dry with hops and citrus.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. The appearance is way too clear for my liking however. A great and refreshing IPA.
Fantastic beer. Fresh aroma of hops, sweet grapefruit, citrus, light touch of caramel in the background. Taste is super smooth, fresh and hoppy.. Bitterness could be higher. World class IPA
Tap at Craft Bier Fest Wien. High bitterness, well attenuated, easy drinking. Slightly lacking in intensity though. Citrusy resiny hops is present, but leaves you longing for more.

Puszka z Berlina. Zapach intensywny, cytrusy, owoce tropikalne, trochę trawy. Kolor złoty, klarowne. Piana obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, trwała, ładny lacing. W smaku lekka słodycz, średnia pełnia, cytrusy, grejpfrut, mango, igliwia, żywica, toffi, karmel. Goryczka średnia, wysycenie niskie.

Berlin version from a can. Clear, golden color with white head. Aroma has grassy and dank hops and citrus fruits. Taste follows with the same hoppy notes but the malts seem a bit off, somehow too grainy for an IPA. Finish is quite bitter with intense grapefruit flavor. Medium to light body with medium carbonation. It has some really nice hoppy notes but theres something wrong with the malt backbone. 8/3/7/3/15 - 3.6/5.
Escondido version from a bottle. Clear, golden color with white head. Not as aromatic as the Berlin version. More generic, floral hops. Taste is also somehow more bland. There is a generic bitterness with some earthy hops but not really fruity or floral. Medium to light body with medium carbonation. This one is quite boring, I am disappointed. 6/3/7/3/13 - 3.2/5.
Average for both versions: 3.4/5.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2017 Aromat średnio intensywny, głównie żywica, nieco tropików i cytrusów, ale ogólnie nie powala. W wyglądzie stosunkowo klarowne, wysycone, z konkretną i zdobiącą szkło białą pianą. W smaku żywica i cytrusy, głównie grejpfrut, w posmaku pojawia się jeszcze ziołowość, goryczka grejpfrutowa średnia ku wysokiej. Pijalne, ciałko dość solidne. Solidna, wytrawna ipa

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2017 Pours golden color, clear, with foamy, stable white head. Aroma: rich hop aroma, which takes on pine, citruses...flavor is similar, with intense hop flavors, supported and very well balanced with malt flavors, which takes on bread, toffee.. Finish is bitter dry and lingers long in aftertaste. Body is medium, texture soft, carbonation is medium. OVERALL RATE 4 IS FOR USA VERSION, GERMANY RELEASE: 3,6.

Can shared at home. Clear golden with white head that doesnt last too long but leaves a nice ring. Quite grassy, lime peel, light dust, bitter leafy notes, grapefruit. Under medium sweet and over medium bitter. Medium bodied. Decent beer but I expected a bit more tbh.

Can from Lawendowa 8 in Gdansk. The first Berlin batch; canned Jun 14, i.e. 2 weeks ago. Pours almost clear golden amber with excellent, slightly creamy white head. Aroma of pungent resiny hops, bitter and unripe tropical fruits. Juicy. Tastes as resiny, bittersweet, with long lingering dryish bitter finish. Soft mouthfeel, lightish medium body, very thin and rather mellow carbonation. So easy-drinking, so fresh. Delicious. A true benchmark.

Can from their german brewery. Stamped "Enjoy by 05/03/17. 160608DE0101.
App: Clear golden with a big off white head.
Aroma: Bright honey caramel and grapefruit, lychee and peach, bitter pine needles and some stoney minerals. Classic flavours.
Taste: Taste has the same bright caramel sweetness with honey and floral nectar, grapefruit and lychee, topped off with a robust piney bitterness.
Palate: Medium bodied, soft carbonation, oily texture.
Overall: Classic and tasty stuff! Had the american version just a couple of days ago and it feels like they are getting close the original.
First batch of Stone Berlin cans - clear golden color, creamy head. A very round, perfectly balanced IPA. Medium fruity notes on the citrus side, malty body and a bitter dry finish. Easy to drink.

Can from Berlin brewery. Citrus, some tropical fruits in nose. Pours golden with white lacy foam. Taste is medium dry, fruity with grapefruit, pomelo, pineapple, some peach. Finish is medium bitter, Overall well made IPA, refreshing and drinkable.
Tap at Cafe Sara. Stone Berlin. Pours clear golden. Hoppy floral and fruity aroma. Medium body. Very smooth and well balanced.
Flaske. Sidste aften på hotel i Seoul, ikke så god som nogle af de andre amerikanere jeg har fået her, men stadig en solid old School IPA. Smækfyldt med citrus og bitterhumle. God øl.

Stone Berlin can. Pours a clear golden orange with a thin off white lacy head. Aroma is of pine, orange, caramel, exotic fruits, grapefruit, grassy. Taste is of grapefruit, citrus, orange, pine. Oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2016 Pression. Très bonne.Nez assez éthylique mais frais, très herbal, de jolies agrumes (dominante orange amère), un peu de tropical (notes mangues, nuances ananas).Bouche moins éthylique que le bouquet, fraîche, pas mal d?agrumes, de fruité, jolie longueur.Jolie.

Pours slightly cloudy orange with medium white head. Aroma of sweet malt and hints of citrus zest. Decent carbonation and mouth feel. Taste is citrus and zest, more lime and grapefruit than lemon. Sharp bitterness nicely balanced with the sweet malt

Aromat: intensywny i przyjemny, cytrusy, owoce tropikalne, winogrona.
Wygląd: barwa złota. klarowne, piana dość obfita, ładnie zdobi szkło.
Smak: pomimo wyczuwalnej sporej podbudowy słodowej i kryjącej się z nią słodyczy, piwo ma sporą goryczkę, a głównie występują cytrusy, grejpfrut, mango, ananas.
Tekstura: pełne, wysycenie średnie.
Ogólne wrażenie: bardzo smaczne i owoce piwo, potężna goryczka nie pozwala przebić się słodyczy, dość pijalne, a przez to zdradziecko, bo piwo ma prawie 7%.
Bottle. Pours light amber. Aroma of citrus, pine, and grapefruit. Mild bitter taste. Pretty standard ipa.
Pours cloudy golden. Aroma is of pine and grass, nice balance. Taste is hoppy, pine, finish is very bitter.
4oz taster @ VCBW 2016, Day 2. Grassy green, citrus round. Sweet, soft-bitter, grapefruity hops. lvl-5 sweet citrusy malts. Clean, grassy biting, medium bright. Decent.

12oz bottle. Clear golden color with a white head. Hops grain grapefruit aroma. Malt tropical fruit hops flavor. Medium body. Well balanced.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Glass at de 24 uurs van Maastricht, Golden beer, medium headm. Aroma is hops, citrus. Taste is citrus, bitter with a dry aftertaste. nice.

In der Nase viel viel Zitrone und ne Menge florale Aromen. Frisch!!! und irgendwie "GRÜN" :). Der Trunk dann heftig, garstig und fast Hopfenscharf, wenn man das so nennen darf. Klasse, aber auch extrem. Der Nachhall macht dann ebenfalls keine Gefangenen. Lang und hart herb. Heiss. Aus der 0,33l Dose von Stone Berlin. 2 Euro. Vom CRAFT MARKET 2016 HH.

From tap at Craft & Draft, Amsterdam. Aroma is fruity hops, grapefruit, tropical, some biscuit malt, pine resin. Flavour is lightly sweetish with a potent bitter finish. Body is medium. Very hoppy with some malty notes. A very fine IPA.

560ml bottle, shared in two snifters. Overall a very good beer, and I can only imagine the wow factor back in 1997 nearly 20 years ago. However the world has caught up and Im going to say that their "go to IPA" even at only a sessionable alcohol is better (as I expect their skills are too after nearly 20 years of practice). Nice beer, was huge in its time and still very good.
Mooie oranje kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt fruitig citrus orange. Smaakt fruitig citrus, orange. Bittere afdronk.

640ML bottle from Dan Murphys

Slightly hazy orange color. Bright white head that falls to a thick collar. Good lacing left in the glass. 
Nose is a good bread and toffee background with pine, grapefruit and orange. 
taste is well balanced. Lots of pine and grapefruit. Subtle caramel and toast background to soften the hops just enough. 
Long lasting bitterness. Very dry finish. Trademark SD style of beer. Easy to drink and always want more of this.

Pite z kega na WFDP. Cudowne IPA. Cechuje się bardzo wysoką pianą, pięknym lacingiem, a także pomarańczową barwą. W aromacie czuć bardzo intensywne cytrusy i owoce. W smaku tak samo - do tego dochodzi lekko zarysowana słodowość. Końcówka jest umiarkowanie długa, bardzo przyjemna. Piwo jest niesamowicie orzeźwiające, bardzo lekkie i ogólnie bliskie perfekcji.
From a bottle. Damn this is a nice beer, love the hop profile and the pine resin finish.

Pours a slightly hazy amber with a thick white head and medium carbonation, plus good lacing.

Aroma is very promising. Malt backbone and then the hops come through with marmelade, pine, mango and mint. Flavour is nicely balanced medium sweet and bitter long if slightly watery finish.

Came with a big reputation and slipped down a treat.

A definite classic. Such a great balance from start to finish. Sometimes I find myself taking out for granted until I have another. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Taster Glass from the Escondido	4.25	Color/Look: light amber	4.75	Smell: Hoppy	4.75	Taste: nice bitter bite usual in IPA, well balance	4.50	"
Feel: really creamy"	4.50	Overall: Excellent beer, something to look forward to

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2016 2016-11-28: 33cl can (Stone Berlin). Pretty much the same as the US brewed bottle version in my opinion. Only difference is there is a slight dank aroma to this but not enough to change my rating.
2016-06-02: 355ml bottle. Clear golden colour with a one finger white head, good retention. Strong hoppy aroma, citrus and pine, malt. Taste is really hoppy, slightly sweet citrus, grapefruit, very bitter. Soft carbonation, oily to watery texture. Great IPA though it didnt blow me away.

Serving: from tap at Stink.

Aroma: moderate pine hop.

Appearance: small, creamy, off-white, initial head with fair lacing and fully diminishing longevity. Clear, dark-yellow body.

Taste: lightly bitter initial flavor and finish with average duration.

Palate: light body, watery texture and lively carbonation.

Overall: good, everyday beer that would be great for hot weather.
Pours golden clear color with an off white one finger head. Aroma is citrus,caramel, hoppy. Taste is caramel, bitter, citrus, medium sweet. Medium body with a very long bitter aftertaste.
Beställde från systembolaget. En riktigt bra ipa som fungerar till alla tillfällen.

Bottle in LA. Wonderful grassy, citrus aroma. A similar taste with heavy bitterness up front. All in all a classic Weat Coast IPA. Super solid, but dont get the extraordinary adulation. There are better IPAs.

Bottle at home from Brewdog online. A clear bright golden light orange coloured pour with a a big sticky off white head. Aroma is juicy orange, base grains, grassy piney hop, biscuity. Flavour is composed of base grains with a hint of caramel, pine and citrus hops are nicely layered, tangerine. Palate is semi sweet , medium bodied, light hop resin. Semi dry finish. Solid IPA.

From draft, deep yellow golden colour pour with a white head. Nose of weak Bread malts, caramel sweetness, citrus, bitter lemon Peel, light grapefruit. Taste is sweet caramel malts, citrus, Bread, not of fruity as you would expect. Dry aftertaste

Third of a litre at the Celle Bierfest, served in a Stone snifter. Brewed in Berlin.

A: Golden amber colour, slight haze, one finger sized head, moderate retention, decent amount of lacing.

S: Citrus and grapefruit, Cascade bomb.

T: Wheat, pine and grapefruit. High on bitterness but kept it subtle and balanced.

M: Low carbonation, medium body, went down well.

O: I cant really add too much to what has already been said, but the quality of Stone beers brewed in Berlin has held up. This is a classy American IPA.

Bottle. Pours light honey with white head and lacing. Caramel and bread crust with citrus hops. Well-rounded IPA.     

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Cloudy golden-orange body, medium white head, decent amount of lacing, good retention. Aroma of acacia honey, grapefruit, peaches, orange jam. Taste of grapefruit zest, pine, oranges and peaches. Nice one.

Pours a cloudy orange, with a nice creamy head. Aroma is subtle with notes of pine and citrus. Tasting notes include pine resin, citrus, malts, and has a bitter finish. This is a classic, well crafted IPA!

Great hoppy, citrusy aroma. Nice head. Really bitter piney resins. Really good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: OCT 20, 2016 Very hoppy taste and aroma, citrus dank oranges. Flowery. Just not my thing

Aromas herbales y terrosos 
Aspecto cristalina y rubia dorada 
Buena espuma todo el trago
En boca muy balanceada muy maltosa al principioy un final seco y muy amargo 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

opalescent golden colour medium sized creamy off-white head; aroma of (tropical) fruity, citrusy, floral, biscuity and resiny notes; bittersweet resiny taste with the same notes as the aroma and some overripe fruitiness; starts with sweetness which is followed by intensive and long lasting bitterness; a masterpiece!
0.355l bottle. Hazy dark golden body, white head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, peach and citruses. Taste of caramel, reisins, hop resins, roasted malts, citruses and pine. Very smooth and nice.

Bottle Thanks Lorebacsi!! Surprisingly sweet malty aroma. Nice bitterness under the malts and the finish is where its at. Even dry bitterness with a quality finish. Tasted different from the tap but its still good.

APARIENCIA: de color dorado con destellos naranjas, se observa cristalina y moderada actividad de carbonatación; corona de espuma blanca, de burbuja compacta y buena retención.

AROMA: de inicio el lúpulo con notas cítricas y algo herbales, notas de pino y resinosas sin embargo no son tan intensas.

SABOR: amargor intenso de entrada seguido de notas herbales de entrada, notas de pino, mucho dankness, atrás de eso muy discretas notas cítricas. Al retrogusto, buena permanencia de ese amargor intenso, que queda pegado al paladar.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo ligero, se siente oleoso, carbonatación media.

RESUMEN: una excelente cerveza, muy apegada al estilo que representa.

Tap, TCBW 16. Bright orange body, tall head. Aroma has fresh American hops and caramelly malt. Some floral elements too. Taste has lots of hops and sweet citric fruits. Feels like a pretty standard IPA.
Tap (BGM4). Mocna, intensywna IPA. Może klasyczna, a może trochę za "toporna", brakuje trochę finezji, ale to ciągle bardzo dobre piwo.

Pours hazy yellow-orange with a sticky head. Aromas of candy, grapefruit, pine, deep dank earthiness. Taste is bitter pine, loads of resin, oily mouthfeel, nice citrus to cut it. Coulda sworn it was brewed with Columbus hops, but I guess it must be the Centennial/Chinook combo. It tastes to me much more like an APA than an IPA. Very good.

Slightly cloudy orange gold with moderate and persistent head. Malts sweet with tropical fruit edge soon overwhelmed by piny persistent hops. Not a subtle IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ar- hops dominate here, lots of citrus and tropical fruit, hints of malt sweetness and alcohol. There's an orange soda thing somewhere in there too. 

Ap- clear Amber with a string white head. 

Fl- again hops are the star, soft caramel malt sweetness and citrus and tropical fruit are well balanced by hop bitterness 

Mf- medium-full bodied, well carbonated, slight alcohol

Ov- the beer is very well done. Not a huge hop head but this beer is delicious and very well balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap in shaker pint glass at JImmys Culpeppers. Aroma is strong floral and resinous hops. Taste is as aroma. Appearance is light brown with finger-width frothy white head with nice sparkle and huge sudsy lacing. Palate is medium bodied with fairly thick texture and very dry, crisp finish. Overall, a perfectly good IPA without much fault but it didnt blow me away like I expected it to.
Light amber with medium head. Pineapple and malt aroma. Also some pine in the taste. Bitter finish.

Flaska från SB beställningssortiment. Smak och doft av humle, mango, persika, honung med toner av nektar. Ren och klar, mjuk och len, fin sötma, krämig, fruktig och frisk trots något trött humle, mycket välbalanserad och god IPA.
Bottle; pours orange gold with a white head; aroma of tropical fruits and pine with a hint of caramel; taste is bitter with caramel, tropical fruits, and a touch of pine; bitter finish; excellent
12 oz. bottle. Poured golden, foamy white head. Aroma was citrus, pine and grapefruit. Taste was bitter, that lasted.

Flaska från SB beställningssortiment. Bortled 151109, alltså mer än fyra månader gammal. Äppeljuicefärgad, klar, lågt men krämigt skum, små livliga bubblor. Inte jättestor humledoft men en söt fruktig honung- och nektardoft som är riktigt fin. Ren, mjuk smak, söt välmogen mango, nektar, medelstor kådig beska. Riktigt snygg smakbild även om humlen inte riktigt är där. Fin kropp med sötma som harmonierar fint. Riktgt gott trots allt.

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2016 330ml bottle served in a pint glass. Enjoyed at The Globe (www.theglobe.com.hk) - Hong Kong. 
A: Pours a clear gold yellow color forming a medium and creamy white head with good retention and lots of soaping style lacings formed and left in the glass. 
S: Nose is great. Very malty, fruity and flowery. Strong notes of mango, grapefruit, pine and herbs. Citrus zest notes.
T: Slightly sweet upfront followed by a dry and grassy hops bitterness. Strong notes of sweet pale malts, grapefruit, mango, resin and pine. Great but not very persistent hops bitterness.
M: Medium body. Good carbonation. Grapefruit and grassy hops in the aftertaste. 
O: Great drinkability. Masterpiece IPA from Stone!
definitely one of the best IPAs around. crisp citrus flavor, big hops. an all around good drinkable every day IPA.

Aroma- West coast hops bunch first, followed by a solid malt backbone. Resinous, dank hops. 
Appearance- Brilliantly golden and clear. Beautiful lacing and a bone white head. Textbook stuff from stone.
Taste- Citrus, dank, resinous hops. Malt balances but the hops are the main attraction. Each sips beckons you back for more. This is a tasty beverage. 
Palate- Lively carbonation and a medium body. Dank hops linger and make you want more. 
Overall- One of the quintessential west coast ipas and it still stands as strong today. Will always be a go to for my hops fix.

Aroma: herbs and malty.
Appearance: hazy golden color and thin white head.
Taste: medium herbal bitterness, malty backbone, like a pils.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation.
Overall: It is a joke, not IPA.

Pours amber with a smooth head. Peppery hops. A lot of flavor but its dryness blocks out any complexity. Would like something a bit more zesty and fruity and maybe have the mice malt tastes shine a little bit brighter. Still a very decent beer. One for the hop heads!

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2016 Bottle at The Queens Head pub-- Pours clear golden with medium and persistent white head. Nose is flowery. Aromas are pine resin, biscuit, herbal hops and grapefruit. Average carbonation, medium carbonation. Long bitter and piney finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft at Jabeerwocky, Warschau. Bitter, citrusy, piney, not special but very decent.

Very solid and enjoyable, but nothing surprising or fancy. Decent maltiness in background, some caramel, rich citrus, mostly grapefruit, grapefruit peel, some pine kick, floral and earthy aspect. Light sweetness with moderate bitterness, pleasantly oily smooth. Very nice and refreshing IPA.
Ipa de tous les jours. Juste correct. Maltée et légèrement houblonnée. Bonne amertume sèche.
I think my experience was tainted. After i finished I noticed it expired three months ago. Not anything special. But the bar sucked too.
One of my go-tos, and ALWAYS in my fridge. I love this beer for the intense bitter hops and long finish.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2016 One of the best IPA around. Sweet citrus smell, taste citrus and hoppy finish.

Another good American IPA 3.9!
LIght amber.orange with small off-white head. Hoppy aroma. Strong bitterness rich of fruity notes. Strong bitter aftertaste.

Poured from a bottle. Pours a medium amber with a thin white head. Light pine resin aroma. Slightly oily texture. Nice full mouth feel. Taste of pine and citrus rind. Medium bitterness but not harsh. Lingering flavors and a fairly smooth finish. Solid and refreshing.
Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma of malts, light grape, stale American hops, malty sweet, with a touch if citrus. Taste is stale sweet, malty too old. Caramel bomb
From bottle. Pours hazy orange with an off white head. Aroma of old socks, stale hops, caramel, sweet honey. All hops are gone, it tastes sweet, honey-like, lots of caramel. This is so old.

Pours clear golden with a large white head which hangs around. Aroma is citrus grapefruit, earthy, sprucey and a slight mango. Taste is medium bitter, tropical fruits sweet, mango sweet, caramel, slight grass on the finish. Good all-round IPA - bitterness and sweetness delivered in quaffable quantities.

Aroma is very dank hops, slightly earthy, followed by a burst of tropical fruit and pine. Appearance is a lovely golden amber, white head, nice and clear. Taste is dank, earthy, slight tropical fruit and pine, nice bitterness rounds out a pretty complex flavor. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, decently crisp carbonation, aftertaste offers a lot of pine and more tropical than dank profile. Overall, Stone does a very good job with their IPAs. And just about anything else Ive ever had by them.

Sampled on draught at nFuse at the Marriott in Anaheim. Golden colour with a foaming white head. Aroma of orange marmalade. Taste is very dry, with a taste dominated by grapefruit skin, grass and pine. Hints of green apple. A little too astringent for my English tastebuds, but refreshing and characterful.

Kolor: Złoty. 100% klarowności. Dawno nie widziałem już tak czystego piwa. Przykładając palec z tylnej części szkła, można dokładnie zobaczyć linie papilarne przez szkło.
Piana: Biała, drobnoziarnista, średnio trwała.
Dobre krążkowanie na szkle.
Piana szeroko oplata ścianki pokala.
Duża jej częsć pływa po powierzchni.
Po zamieszniu znowu idzie do góry.
Zapach: Bardzo przyjemny, ale nie rzuca na kolana. Owoce tropikalne i cytrusowe: mango, marakuja, grejpfrut i mandarynki.
W oddali trochę ziołowych nut i konkretna porcja świeżej sosnowej żywicy, takiej ściekającej prosto z drzewa.
Smak: Tutaj to dopiero się dzieje. Każdy kto miał zastrzeżenia co do intensywności aromatu, będzie w 100% usatysfakcjonowany.
Piwo miażdży dosłownie smakiem!
Jakbym mógł to połknąłbym je od razu razem z pokalem.
Mamy tutaj plejadę owocową z grejpfrutem, pomarańczą, pomelo, mandarynką. Na drugiej półkuli słodkie, tropikalne owoce: mango i marakuja.
Żywiczno-sosnowe akordy dopełniają euforię smaku.
Delikatna słodowa baza świetnie współgra z chmielowym profilem piwa.
Ziołowe składowe amerykańskich chmieli doskonale współpracują z krótką, arcyprzyjemną goryczką.
Pijalność jest niebywała.
Mógłbym to pić dzień i noc. 
Wysycenie: Wysokie.
Podsumowanie:

To moje kolejne piwo z browaru Stone Brewing Co.
Dzięki uprzejmości koleżanki z pracy, która przywiozła mi je z Nowego Jorku miałem tą wjątkową przyjemność rozkoszowania się smakiem tego szczególnego IPA.
Przeniosłem się do świata wytrawnego West Coast IPA.
Nie będę skupiał się ani na pianie, ani na zapachu - smak tutaj jest spełnieniem największych marzeń o perfekcyjnym IPA.
Jest wyraźny, głęboki, trwały i niezapomniany.
Jakbym mógł to nie zmieniłbym tutaj nic.
Piwo jest warte każdej ceny. W Polsce ceny Stonea są bardzo wygórowane. W USA to piwo kosztuje ok. $3 i(w 12-pakach cena spada nawet do $1,7) można je kupić w wielu supermarketach.
Bardzo żałuje, że w Polsce tak ciężko je dostać:/

Great daily go to ipa, easy drinking with great taste. Definitely only drink fresh. A classic. Hops are citrus, floral, and earthy. Nice bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pale golden, crystal clear, low pillowy head. Aroma grapefruit, lemon zest and light herbal notes. Palate watery, carbonation medium. Taste tropical fruit, green apples, grapes. Balanced bitter finish. No long lasting or characteristic bitterness. Balanced. Pretty mild, pretty decent. Like 5 am, aroma is richer than taste.
12oz bottle 1/12/16 (Old Notes)-Pours golden with a nice head and an aroma of hops and citrus. Taste of the same. This medium bodied brew is well balanced and is a great IPA.
Bottle split with friends, thanks Lukas! Copper pour with a frothy head. Notes of heavy oily resin, some caramel, pine and stone fruits. A bit tired...
Bottle. Aroma of citrus, malts. Taste of malts, spruce, citrus, sweet fruits.

Couleur Doré et clair. Arome de banane, poire, et ananas. Lamertume du houblon en bouche et coriace, mais tendre à la fois. Ensemble fruité, dont on ressent les agrumes, le pin et les épices. la finale sèche ressort une bonne amertume. Awesome IPA

Bottle thanks to LukasMH. Pours a clear orange with a creamy, small, white head. Aroma is super grassy, lots of malts, caramel malts, earthy hops, spice, lots of citrus peel. Taste is sweet and malty up front, spicy and then lots of grassy, bitter hops. Average high carbonation and an oily body.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2016 Bottle. Deep amber, small off-white head. Aroma hops, wild cherries, pineapple. Taste first a bitter attack, turning into a mellow sweet mango. Finish again very bitter, nearly quinine-like. An excellent IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Good and basic ipa, not the best but one of my personal top 5 ipas. Hoppy, citrusy and flavours of grapes.
Amazing aroma, beautiful golden color. Very fruity and hopy. They bitterness stay in the back of the mouth. It refresh the mouth and fulfills you with the hopy bitterness!

Golden color, white head with good duration. Aroma has notes of citrus, herbal hints and resins hops. Flavor is bittery, very fruity with notes of grapefruit and pineapple. Good bitterness in the final with some dry mouthfeel on palate.
bottle. Golden orange with frothy white head. Grapefruit aroma, tons of hops. Sweet caramel flavour with long hoppy bitterness

Brewed from Stone Brewery Berlin. Enjoyed from tap at Läuterwerk in Münster on 8th december 2015. Pours clear yellow with a large white head. Aroma very grassy and fruity. Medium bitter initial taste, hoppy, citrus. Medium body, good carbonation. Light dry, long bitter finish. Very good one.

Had this on tap at Craft & Draft in Amsterdam.
A great beer, light bodied and heavy on the tropical fruit - pineapple and mango - plus a bit of grapefruit, on top of a bitter and refreshing body. The alcohol is quite well hidden.
Draft @ Moeder Lambic Sint Gillis. Hazy yellow, white foam. Medium carbonation. Sweet and bitter. Hoppy, tropical fruit. Well balanced. Easy drinkable. Great!

7.11.15-draft [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */(1st Berlin brew) Goldgelb, fast klar, große weisse feste Krone. Aroma: Grapefruit, tropische Früchte. Im Antrunk ein heftiger Punch von leicht kratziger Bitterkeit, Malz, Pinie, Zitrus. Gut, nur die kratzige Bitterkeit stört etwas.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 kran w jabeer, tygodzien wczesniej warzona w berlinie... a tu aromaty wcale nie takie intensywne, choc jak najbardziej fajne, cytrusy swieze, troszke tropikow, troszke slodowego podkladu, w smaku dosc wytrawna, lekka rzeska... ale kurde nic nie urywajaca... jednak rozczarownie, tzn bardzo fajne piwo, ale spodziewal sie czlowiek wiecejOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Pours deep amber with a decent white head that settles nicely. Aroma is earthy and sharp. Flavours of citrus, earth, pine, sweet malt, very slight sour. Medium bodied, moderate carbonation. Really lovely.

On tap at the Well and Bucket in London. First batch from the new Berlin brewery. Pours a rich golden Amber with a creamy, tan head. The smell is candi sugar, citrus, toasted malt. The taste is lots of grapefruit, toasted malt with some sweetness that is counterbalanced by a decent bitterness. Light/medium on body with fairly active carbonation. A touch sweet and malty for my taste but it's nice to have some European made US IPAs available.

Robe cuivrée, peu de mousse. Arômes de fruits exotiques, agrumes et biscuit. Beaucoup d esters. Goût de céréales, agrumes, fruits confits. Arrière goût de fruits exotiques. Longue en bouche. Une très bonne IPA.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2015 Stone USA, 25/11/2015: 12fl oz bottle at home from craft and draft, Amsterdam. Body is opalescent yellow golden, head is small, white, medium bubbles, average lasting, excellent lacing. Nose is grass, citrus, flavor is grapefruit, pumpkin, tons of hops, quinine, honey, tropical fruits, spices. Medium sweet, heavy hoppy bitter. Finish is long lasting quinine medium bitter, developing hoppy heavy bitterness with long duration. Medium body, dry texture, average carbonation. Easy, refreshing, very hoppy tasty beer, interesting, one of the best IPA I?ve drunk so far, fantastic.

Stone Berlin, 07/12/2015: 1.5dl on tap at Craft & Draft, Amsterdam. Body is clear golden orange, head is big, cream white, creamy, mostly lasting, excellent lacing. Nose is citric, flavor is grapefruit, honey, spices, light caramel, black tea. Medium sweet, medium to heavy hoppy bitter. Finish is long lasting hoppy and slightly roasty heavy bitter. Medium body, dry texture, soft carbonation. Easy, refreshing, very tasty, excellent IPA.

Caña en Cimmeria 13..11..2015. 1er. día de pinchado barril. (r3674)Color rubio velado con espuma blanca persistente. Aromas intensos a Maltas y algo de cereales con predominio de herbaceos frescos, lupulos verdes y ligeros tonos cítricos. Sabores también intensos maltosos y bastantes herbaceos verdes y frescos de lupulos. Toques cítricos. Cuerpo medio a intenso, por su sabor, refinado, algo espumoso y denso y bastante bien combinado y conjuntado. Toques oleosos y grasos al calentar. Amargo final seco, herbaceo y tirando a resinoso acentuado y duradero 6.9 vol que parecen más. Increíble Ipa fresca y con sabores intensos, para repetir sin duda.

Rating #1301 - 21.10.2014 Stone launch @craftbeeryeg. Pours a rich golden, small white head, minimal lacing. Aroma is grapefruit On the palate, similar tropical flavours, mild resin, mild pastry dough malt. Medium bodied and extraordinarily balanced. Nice.

Tap / Tirador.
@ XXXII, Sevilla, España.
A: Amber / Ambar.
T/S: Hops, citrusy, fruity / Lupulo, citrico, afrutado.

Una molt bona Ipa, tastada en pinta de barril, em va semblar molt potent amb aromes de llupols amargs, afruitats I contundents. Facil de veure, diria que no gaire graduacio bueno 6 o 7 graus, em va agradat molt la veritat. Molt freca I facil de veure..com no...
Bottle, not fresh. Clear amber colour. Citrus hop aroma, malty citrus hop flavour, slightly bitter finish
