Bronze color with small/medium, staying white head and slightly hazy liquid. Medium/strong sweet taste with peach and some malts, a hint of citrus. Balanced with medium taste spectrum and medium/long aftertaste with hops and sweet malts. Medium/strong body with low/medium carbonation. Overall a reference class IPA with those American sweet notes.

Originally sampled on 4/1/08- Drinking my second as i type this, Appearance is tinged with orange hues. Minimal head, thin lacing, The aroma is fantastic! strong citrus with slight hint of peach? I think the aroma is my favorite aspect of this stuff. 6.9% alc. is well hidden but present, good bitter bite but it doesnt linger. refreshing and lively, definetley worth a try.
12oz Flasche. Dunkle goldene Farbe mit weissem Schaum. Extremer Duft. Citrus, Kräuter, Harz. Geschmack bitter und fruchtig. Spitzen IPA!
Dank and resinous hop aromas. Taste is bitter pine sap, grapefruit citrus, garlic, and straw.
Tap @ Bishops Arms Hornsgatan. Hazy amber, long lastning white head, good lacing. Caramel nose, bread, biscuits and citrus zest. Big body, smooth mouthfeel. Pine taste, caramel and grapefruit.

En bouteille. Couleur dorée, orangée. Apparence limpide avec fine mousse sans dentelle. Des arômes dominants de fruits tropicaux. En bouche cest surtout des notes de pins, gazons avec une finale maltée, sucrée. Amertume moyenne-elevé très resineuse. Très West Coast.

Excellent hop aroma from a orange pour and big white fluffy head. Stone fruit mango and pine needles in aroma. Very bitter taste but not too aggressively bitter well balanced with the mild malts finishes real clean and crisp and hoppy.
Najlepsza ipa Ever! Mocna ale nie alkoholowa, owoce cytrusowe, miła goryczka, pełne ciało. Mocno Chmielowe

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2016 Tap @ de klomp. Amber color and a white head with large bubbled and almost no lacing. Lemon, lime, bread and and some background mango and pine apple. Bitter dry taste with lasting assertive bitterness. Flavors or lemon, lime, oranges and some pine and bread. Caramel in the aftertaste. Classic ipa.
Can @ home from the berlin brewery. 160806.
Pours golden with persistent white head. Strong citric aroma, lime orange and some pine. Taste is bitter with light sweetness. A bit dry palate. Bitter finish and light-medium body. Really nice IPA.

Grumlig och halvljus. Trevligt fruktig och drickvänlig. Lite matt tyvärr lyfter inte till 100%

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Boisson jaune orangée, avec une belle petite mousse en surface ; un nez qui allie des notes de fruits tropicaux et de lépinette. La bouche est brillante, ensoleillée et complexe : notes fruitées en introduction, puis un peu de sucre dorge provenant des malts, et enfin une vague amère et pointue pour conclure le tout. On comprend sa réputation, elle est un exemple probant de ce quune west coast devrait être. Superbe, complexe, désaltérante.

A 12 fl oz bottle with a bottled date of 21th July 2015 and an enjoy by date of 19th October 2015. Poured into a Spiegelau IPA glass. It poured a clear golden copper colour with a one finger white head that had good retention and leaves nice spotty lacing. Aromas were fainter than I expected but starts with tropical mango and pineapple before turning to pine, grass and citrus lemon zest. Tastewise, there was none of the tropicalness from the smell, but strong lemon zest, hop bitterness, floral and grassiness. Medium bodied with medium to high carbonation. Overall, this was only just ok for me. It wasnt bad and I would drink it again but for example I prefer Stones Go To IPA.

Poured from a 12oz bottle into a 20oz mug.

A - Poured amber orange with a quickly-dissipating head.

S - Light fruit and hop aromatics, relatively weak on the nose.

T - Smooth, light malts, quickly dissipating into both fruity and floral hop flavors, smoothing and sweetening out into a boozy aftertaste.

M - A bit fizzy, but very creamy and smooth for an IPA. It settles in well to let the palate talk.

O - While many other west coast style IPAs blow this one out of the water, its still very smooth, balanced, and the hops sit in all the right ways.
Excelente ipa de san diego, pero no le doy el puntaje máximo porque he probado mejores.

- Nose: citrus-y (grapefruit + v light orange  satsuma?); caramel malts; a little peach; a little pine.
- Body: slightly creamy/oily (makes sense with high ABV); grapefruit + pine come to fore more, but meet their match in the (caramel?) malts.
- Finish: medium-long finish, crisp with a little hop-bitter fade.
- A golden delight and pretty good benchmark US IPA? Citrus, not too pine-y, a good weight + malt balance whilst still managing a crisp finish #StoneMe1 #1001Beers

Ámbar limpio y espuma marfil compacta. Aromas intensos de fruta naranja, citricos, pino y resinas. Cuerpo medio, con textura melosa y sabor dulce de fruta albaricoque, toque cítrico y final de amargor intenso de pino y resinas.
UPDATED: AUG 9, 2016 Clear orange coloured with a small off white head. Sweet aroma of malts, caramel and hops. Sweet flavour of malts, caramel grape fruit and hops

Bomber to myself. Golden orange pour, medium fairly dense off-white head. Lots of lacing. Big hop aroma, citrus orange, less so pine. Taste follows through with the hop flavors, nice resinous bitter finish Terrific example of an IPA.
Bottle. Pours a beautiful golden orange with a small white head. Aroma is pine, citrus, hops and some caramel. Taste is similar. Delicious.

I recently decided I was going to try and hunt down as many of these top 50 IPAs as possible. I was a lot more surprised that I hadnt rated this one, than I was that it made the list. The IPA is solid and Ive enjoyed it for years. Pours a clear oily golden color with a thick foam head and lace. 22 oz bottled on 7/26/15, so its closer to the best by date than it is the bottled date. Huge citrus hop aroma and flavor thoughout. Just a standard, solid, hoppy IPA here. Impressed with this one.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2016 Old rating: 0.355 l bottle from FIRMA BIER, no bb date. Clear, golden yellow with a medium large, frothy, stable, white head. Intense, sweetish-fruity aroma of orange blossom, mango, honey, resin and tangerine. Sweetish, fruity-resiny taste of orange blossom, tangerine, mango, honey, caramel and pine, followed by a medium long, medium bitter and slightly warming finish. Medium body, creamy to oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Nicely balanced, not intrusive, great palate, just round. Good! (7/4/7/4/14/3.6) New rating: Sampled from tap at Craft  & Draft (Stone Berlin). Clear, golden amber with a white to tan head. Sweetish, fruity-resiny aroma of mango, grapefruit, passion fruit and pine. Sweetish, fruity-resiny taste of mango, grapefruit, orange and pine, followed by a short, medum bitter, resiny finish. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, average carbonation. Very nice! (7/3/8/4/14/3.6)

Great to come back to an old favourite. Wow thats more bitter than I remembered. Refreshingly so. Not too subtle at all. Great blend of a lot of pine and some citrus from the hops. A little sweetness from the malt. Packs a serious punch.

Aroma: caramel, citrus, spruce
Appearance: clear gold, off-white head
Taste: light sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Excellent IPA, will definitely be getting more of this
Sweet orange, berries, mango. Sweet citrus, peach, pineapple, spiced herbs, dry hoppy finish. Classic solid ipa, Stone really has set the West Coast scenes standard very high.
Great beer orange color really clear and fizzy despite their anti fizzy notes. Really bitter hoppy and crisp. Always a guaruntee go to.

Bottle. Pours a slightly golden colour with a fizzy white head. Aroma of grapefruit, mango, melon, slight pineapple, orange peel, pine, some resin and some caramel. Big taste of pine and resin plus grapefruit, melon, some mango, slight orange peel, subtle grass and a caramel backbone. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A dry, resinous hop bitterness in the finish. Full of flavour, very resinous and citrusy. Its a nice west coast IPA but a bit too dry and resinous to be one of my favourites.
Decent stuff - bitter and refreshing. Some fruity, citric and enjoyable hoppy notes. A bit over rated - still pretty good though. After all Stone never fails.
nice orangey melon and grapefruit aroma, amber gold colour with some white lacing, nice well rounded fruity bitterness with a peppery finish

An opaque body with a decidedly orangey hue. Slightly thinner head than I was expecting.
On the nose, not really a hop bomb with a blend of citrus and floral hops. 
A medium bodied mouth feel. The tastes are in the realm of pine, citrus hops, some dankness, and definitely some caramel malts creeping into the blend.
Overall, not quite up to the level of some of my favourite IPAs like Great Lakes Karma Citra, RoboHop, and Thrust, but still a highly drinkable IPA that should be tried by any fan of the style.

I believe that I first tried this gem a decade ago, and yes, I went purely on the logo. If you havent tried Stone IPA yet, nows the time. The appearance, nose, taste, thirst quenching attribute, and after bite all point to excellence. I dont often indulge due to its price tag, but Bell Bev in South Philly had a great sale. Cheers!
(bottle) clear, bright amber colour with a small beige head; aroma of citrus, resin; balanced flavour with a long, light bitter finish; perfect
Dark golden ipa with a lovely fresh pine aroma. Citrous fruity flavour, with a very bitter aftertaste. For my taste a little too bitter, but a high quality beer with distinctive character

22oz bottle. Amber orange with a frothy off-white head. Slight haze. Flavors are biscuity malts, caramel, grapefruit, apricot, spruce gum and resinous hops with grassy notes. Sharp and generous bitterness. Medium body, moderate carbonation, oily texture.

Very balanced between malt and hop. Crystal clear. Gold. Pine and grapefruit. Mostly Pine, blended with citrus to a lighter degree, light caramel, biscuit. Bitterness blended perfectly with the sweetness. Big rocky off white head, nice lacing. Light creaminess, med body, dry finish.
Bottle at home. Pours golden. Nice head and lacing. Pine and sweet floral aroma. Delicious hoppy resin flavours. Big taste. Resin hop bitter attack. Full flavoured. Smooth finish. Great.
Yep, thisll do it! Hoppier than a hoppy thing on hop day and tasty to boot. Was my free beer from Ales by mail and I shallnt complain!

Was thrilled to finally get my hands on this stuff. Maybe its the high hopes I had ascribed to this stuff, but I wasnt really blown away. Theres some bitter, piney hops on the nose, but I get more earthy, spicy caramel malt than anything. Taste is a really nice chewy caramel malt, with a bitter resinous hop punch. Texture is wonderfully creamy. This stuff is really tasty but I was hoping for more "west coast hop" aroma.

12 fl oz bt @home. 13-08-2015.
Enjoy by 08/06/2015. Only 5 days ago...
In short: bitter fruity ipa.
Pours rather clean deep-gold to amber, with frothy white head. Moderate head retention, little lacing. Pine and earthy nose, some grassy. Medium body, high carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is quite bitter and dry, fruity, earthy. Long dry aftertaste. Really enjoyable.
Tap. Golden with white head. Fruity, hoppy aroma, grassy, pine. Taste of citric fruits, little caramel, malty. Medium body and carbonation. Great, balanced IPA.

Tap. Pours Clear golden with lasting white head. Aroma is pure hop juice. Piny resinous, grapfruit, peach, minty, juicy tropical fruits and slight malty. Taste is packed with oily hops. Sweet candy, fresy haops, peach, tropical fruits, minty, bitter pomelo and finishes out really dry and bitter. Long piney finish, yet so oily and full bodied for abv. Damn!
Bomber fresh from the LCBO (2 months old). Nose is pine, honey, resin, citrus. Taste is balanced, hoppy, earthy and citrus. Solid.
Botella, Bottled: 06/08/15 Color amarillo, aroma frutal, mango, sabor frutal, cuerpo medio, gran Ipa.

This beer is very spicy. This is little bit strong. Good smelling. I like this.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From bottle. Balanced tasty ipa, enjoyable and sessionable without being an absolute standout. A fine import beer Id recommend it.

Amarelo/laranja, espuma de média formação, boa retenção. Aroma bastante lupulado, mais cítrica que resinal, hortelã, florada, muito convidativa. Paladar de amargor leve/médio, baixo dulçor, mantendo a maior parte das características do aroma. Corpo leve, carbonatação média, não transparece os quase 7%. Aftertaste incrivelmente manteve a sensação de hortelã, e amargor no ponto exato ! Pena que não vem para o Brasil ...
Olor afrutado. Con buen cuerpo y espuma consistente. Color dorado. Sabor afrutado con final amargo.

Kolor: Złocisty, piwo jest idealnie klarowne.
Piana: Obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, trwała, pozostawia ładny lacing.
Aromat: Głównie owoców tropikalnych, po zabełtaniu wyłazi lekki aldehyd octowy, z tyłu pałętają się jakieś cytrusy. Aromat jest OK.
Smak: Goryczka średnia, ale niestety zalegająca. W smaku aldehydu octowego jest dużo więcej niż w aromacie - zdecydowanie za dużo. Przykrywa wszystkie te owoce. Alkohol wyczuwalny tylko jako grzanie w przełyk. Niestety słabo.
Wysycenie: Średnie, idealne.
Opakowanie: Ładna etykieta ale minus za brak informacji o składzie.
Uwagi: Co najwyżej średnie IPA. Goryczka zalegająca, a ilość aldehydu octowego nie do zaakceptowania. Nie ratuje tego przyzwoity aromat i ładny wygląd.

Bottle
Aroma-orange, ananas, pineapple, floral
Appearance-golden, clear, white foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, light sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, bitter finish
Overall-very good

Dobre IPA, ale nie powalajace jak te oceny na portalu. Srednia pianka malo trwala, kolor miedziany. Piwo pachnie owszem spora dawka chmielu, smak adekwatny do skladnikow czyli sporo chmielu. Brakowalo mi jakiejsc rownowagi, bo nic poza chmielem tu nie bylo. A jakas kontra by sie przydala. Ale napewno bylo to smaczne piwo wytrawne i to bardzo.

Golden color clear beer but with small stuff floating in (hops I quess) and half of finger of white head that last pretty long.
Aroma: 1st sweet orange and grapes, after warming up its more like mango, papaya. Its almost perfect but theres a little defect like garlic or something that doesnt fit in. 
taste: light malty sweet, big a little lingering bitterness. Flavours of fruits and something between resin and grass.
Palate: medium body, low carbonation. Long finish.
Overall: Really good IPA. Wonderfull beer.
Clear, golden colour; nice, white head with lacing. Sweet, malty backbone, lot of sweet and citrus fruits, herbs and some honey from oxidation. Quite sweet taste, herbs and fruits. Medium bitterness.

355 ml bottle bought at Q-Club in SoHo, Central.
Looks: Translucent orange honey colour; Three-quarter finger head and crumpety white foam which lasts for 2 minutes; Very good sticky lacing with quite fizzy small carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant Ale malt, with fresh lemon peel, orange, pineapples, grapefruits, floral, strong honey, pine, strong resin, yeast and sharp fresh grass.

Taste: Mid to light sweet Ale malt, with very strong lemon peels, grapefruits, honey, light molasses, strong pine, very strong resin ooze, dry biscuits, yeast, very strong bitter hops and fresh cut grass.

Body: Close to medium body; Slick, creamy and very oozy palate.

Mouth Feel: Very Ale-malty, even a moderate to light body cant hide its richness. Massive 2C attack with insanely strong fresh lemon peels and grapefruits, you cant get any fruiter and bitter than this! Resin ooze is just as intense but strangely quite without being overbearing as in most IIPAs. Biscuity yeast and strong grassy hops to round. Impressive!

Hoppiness: Excellent lemon, orange, pineapple, floral, honey and strong ooze in nose. Equally massive lemony resin fresh grass in taste. Bitterness is very strong yet tasty and match very well with the fruity resin for a lasting, very strong bitter fruity peel finish.

After Taste: Dry. Very oozy and nice strong bitter to mouth.

Comments: The Stone Cali Belgie I had previously gave me a hint of what to expect of this, but I am so surprised and satisfied by its intriguing hoppiness: the strong for strong sake idea on most craft IPAs and IIPAs does not apply here, as the strong 2Cs and magnum work together so well it bring refreshing fruitiness, just right resin and tasty strong bitterness. Such nice combination is very rare and this one nails it. This is my kind of strong IPA. Y-E-S!

WYGLĄD: Barwa złota, niemal idealnie klarowne. Piana wysoka, drobna, obfita, długa. Oblepia szkło.
AROMAT: Dosyć intensywny. Dominują zioła, wtórują im cytrusy.  W tle karmel, owoce tropikalne (kokos, ananas i papaja).
SMAK: Analogicznie do zapachu. Bardzo ziołowy i orzeźwiająco cytrusowy. Długi posmak ziołowy z domieszką karmelu. Goryczka cytrusowa - wysoka, zalegająca.
OGÓLNIE: Niezwykle ziołowe pod każdym względem. Goryczka utrzymuje się bardzo długo. Piana zostaje do samego końca. Bardzo smaczne piwo.

Piwo ciemnozlote, klarowne. Piana sredniopecherzykowa. Szybko opada, ladne lepi szklo. W aromacie owoce tropikalne. W smaku fahja goryczka. zaskakujaco delikatne. Dosc wytrawne. Niskowysycone. Pijalne.

Aromas of juicy citrus, lemon, thyme, tropical, pineapple, papaya. Clear orange with a fully lasting white head. Pretty dry, pretty bitter, but nicely balanced by light nutty malts. Light-medium bodied. A delicious representation of the hop-strong, West Coast style. This beer kills it!

Bottle. Pours golden, clear with white stable head. Aroma of pine, resin with some tropical fruits underneath. In taste dry, almost no sweetness is left, nice pine and resin in flavour. In the finish strong bitterness, short and nice. Great IPA.

My first beer from Stone brewery. Purchased because of recommendation from a friend. Very good brew, likely to purchase again. I've got a few more from Stone to try. Judging by this one, I'd say I'm in for a treat. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very nice fruity, citrusy and lemongrass aroma. It might be a bit more intensive though. Golden color, perfectly clear beer, with nice white head and awesome lacing. In taste its completely dry, has no sweetness at all. Typical west coast IPA. Its great, refreshing, very drinkable. Has strong hoppy flavours - fruits, a bit of grass, with big noticeable malty back. Very pleasant and high quality bitterness. Great classic, super beer.
Bottle. Golden colour with a dens White head. Richard aroma and taste of bitter hos. Lasting finish
Poured a golden color from the tap with aromas of grapefruit, lit citrus and pine. Flavors are the same decent hops, mild bitterness and pine. Solid and enjoyable.
On tap. Pours clear gold, white froth head. Aroma of citrus peel and fresh wet hops. Taste is malty sweet, candy-like. Good light citrus hop bitter finish.

Draught at Bubba Gumps in Anaheim. Pours a slightly hazy, golden orange with a small white head that laces. Hoppy grapefruit aroma with pine and caramel. Sweet hoppy flavour of grapefruit and caramel with a dry, bitter, pine finish. Medium body with an oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent IPA.
Nice deep gold. Floral citrus aroma. Hippy but not overly bitter. Nice nasal linger. Refreshing and delicious.

(On Tap) Clear golden amber with large dense white head. Beautiful aroma - stone fruit, oranges, hint of pine. Medium body with excellent mouth filling soft carbonation. Taste starts with tangy fruit over light biscuit malt. Fruit has orange and stone fruit notes. A nice bitterness appears in the mid palate and then builds for a great bitter finish. An excellent beer.
UPDATED: NOV 17, 2015 Bottled, nice golden blonde. Super crisp. Nice grassy hops with a malt taste. Overall second best IPA I have ever head.

Pours a hazy amber from a bottle. I guess this is a classic West coast IPA. Its okay, citrus and pine aromas, same flavor, less sweetness than you get from most IPAs nowadays, actually quite dry. Bitterness lasts long after you swallow. Meh.
I thought this was an okay IPA. The aroma has a little pine in it, but the taste is mostly bitter hops. There are lots of IPAs I enjoy more.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2016 Tap at the lab gastropub, LA. Hazy orange color with white head. Huge piney, resinous grapefruit marmalade aroma. Taste is bitter, good residual sweetness, nice body, bitter caramel. A great classic IPA! 8-4-9-3-16 = 4.0

EDIT: Can from Stone Berlin, <2 weeks old. More lychee and tropical fruits than I remember any of the Stone IPA Ive had in the US. Jammy, but also very bitter. Mouthfeel is a bit more oily, a bit booziness mixed into the bitter finish - could be a tiny little bit more clean, but I also like it this way. Legitimately extremely good, I have to admit that, and now readily available for a reasonable price in Germany. Upped to 8-4-9-4-16 = 4.1

Clear deep golden colour with a lasting fine poruing white head offering excellent lacings. Aromas of dank grass, green leaves, barnyard, spruce/pine and herbal hop resin with grapefruit and light citrus influences arise on the nose. Softly carbonated with a light slick texture and a medium body, this IPA offers a crisp malt center building up hop bitterness which lasts well on the palate without being abrasive. The finish is long and bone dry. Good stuff!
Soft carbonation. Beautiful flavour, strong grapefruit notes without the overpowering citrus. Well balanced hops. Bitter finish.

The classic. A nice dry American ipa. Great balance. Nice hops. Who can say anything bad

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Had after pale 2.0 and thank god for that. Wonderful floral and pine aroma. Crystal clear. Clean fresh hoppy taste very floral. Excellent, do not mess with something that works Stone! This is great beer.

This brew is strong yet refreshing, crisp and hoppy. The hops triggered a response from my parietal glands. As my salivary glands started to spam, my ears and sinuses reacted in kind. This brew is phenomenal. It is not for those that proclaim patronage to the non-bitter beer institute. As the good book says, dont cast pearls before swine. This beer is for the conesuer, for one who appreciates perfection. California ales are definitely leading the way for these hop righteous brews. Stone and a few others are defining the new era in IPA brewskies!

Solid IPA right here. Nice complex hoppy, but not too bitter taste. No lacing, ho head, nicel caramel coloring. Great lingering taste that makes you smack your lips and go "ahhhhhhhh". Super refreshing yet bold and defining. A favorite.
Pours a clear golden color. Aroma and taste are lots of pine with some grapefruit.

From QC, drank at home. Clear pale orange-tan pour. Fine creamy off-white head. Smells of crisp grapefruit and other citric fruits, resinous woody hop. A small bit of caramel/honey malt too. Taste is deeply resinous hop, very dry, some white pepper and malt/corn, bitter mineral finish with a dank hop bite. Body is medium, slick, gentle carbonation. A relatively straightforward IPA but one that's very well done - great resiny bitterness and balance.

12fl oz bottle pours a clear mid amber with a good off white head that lasts. Aroma is tropical fruit syrup, grapefruit, mango and pineapple. Mouthwatering nose! Taste is great with over ripe pineapple and big honeydew melon and some sticky caramel. Lovely, surprisingly thick mouth feel and a big hoppy, resinous, pine sappy, bitter finish. Excellent IPA.
Really good pour, great head, was frozen due to fridge temp being reduced. Bitter after taste. Fruity smell, floral bit of a caramel like taste. Will try one that hasnt been frozen.

Clear amber color with a two finger high, white head. 

Nose: Citrus, pine grass and grapefruit. 
Taste: Caramel malt, pine, grass, grapefruit and lemongrass. 
Body: Medium body and carbonation. Long, bitter finish. 

Great IPA!
Aroma- fruity, I guess tropical, and grassy. Taste similar, with pine coming through

TAP. pours a clear gold with minimal head, solid lacing. Toffee & malts on the nose, subtle hops. Sweet sticky toffee malts, to a warm boozy middle, finishing with a sticky slightly hoppy back end.. More malty then hoppy? Sourced Pourhouse Dunsborough

Poured from bottle, pale amber with medium head. Aroma with an explosion of fruit and pine mixed up with some caramel and bread. Taste is bitter but really well balanced, backed up with a light body and a long bitter finish. Taste notes of peach, grape fruit, resin and some bread. Loved it!

Keg @ Chez Sophie, Shrewsbury. Pours clear gold with good off-white head. Aroma is sweet caramel. Taste is sweet with citrus, pine and more caramel and a nice alcohol bite underpinning proceedings. A classic IPA.

Bottle to glass. Pours a light amber orangish color with an off white head. Aroma is big citrusy hops, with a nice balanced malt backbone. Flavor is a bit more on the bitter end, but has a good fruity citrusy hop presence. A nice flagship IPA.
Rated based on notes from 26 May 2012 -- This is a standby IPA. If a bar doesnt have a good IPA, it should at least have this beer.
Bottle. Citrus, caramel and malt in aroma. Taste is also malty with bitter long nice aftertaste. Flavors of malt, tropical fruits, grape, pine. Very nice aftertaste.

Looks the picture of health. Radiant, orange amber with a messy inch of foam atop. Daubs a devilish lace in its wake. Bold, resinous and piney, whole cone nose brimmed by hints of bitter grapefruit, roasted peanut husks, doughy white bread and lemon peel. Noticeably dulled hop notes on the palate. Mild burnt rubber amongst some tree-sap, nettles and sharp, bitter herbs. Quite tight and on the leaner side as far as body with light carbonation. Lengthy bitter hop swallow with a light hint of honey and bready malts. Seems to lack some tropical fruit and esters to lift it. Quaffable but not a stand-out! (12fl.Oz, BB 22/05/15, The Liquor Shed, Jandakot)
Bottle at tasting. Golden pour, white head. Aroma of passion fruit and citrus. Taste has grapefruit, citrus, passion fruit and a little biscuity caramel. Very balanced and tasty.

400ml draught 
6.9% ABV 
The Beerbistro (Toronto, Ontario, Canada)
February 17, 2015 
The beer pours a translucent golden orange colour with a bubbly white head. The aroma is lemony, grainy, with hints of caramel and yeast. The mouthfeel was medium bodied with average carbonation. The flavour was caramel, weak citrus hops, and a light fruitiness. Good, but not as goo as the arrogant bastard.
On tap at the BeerTemple. Golden amber with a white head. Aroma of fruity hops, floral, bit resiny. Taste is hoppy bitter, fruity, floral. Dry ending, bitter hoppy aftertaste. Not bad.

First smell welcomes flowers in your nose. Firs sip is a harmony of citrus, sweet caramel malt, some pine and freshness. Sip after sip it grows. Slowly the real bitterness becomes clear, but never hindering the complete palate with is carbonization and complex taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy (iOs)

Looks.. Gold-ish amber, sml head.
Smells.. Lemon and mandarin citrus,ripe tropical stonefruits, caramel malty.
Tastes..tropical fruits and citrus hoppiness and grapefruit bitterness, solid caramel malts..and pretty good.
One a few goto beers on a mass production I feel is perfect. Big hoppy aroma of mango stone fruit and pine. Very hoppy bitterness on the palate and perfect hoppy crisp finish.
Bottle. Golden, clear, white foam.Aroma very hoppy and very bitter taste. Good

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2015 650 ml bottle from the LCBO.
Appearance: Pours a
slightly hazy amber colour with lots of white head.  Average retention and lots of lacing.
Aroma:
Malt, hops.
Flavours:
Malt, citrus, slightly bitter hop finish.
Mouthfeel:
 Average viscosity with higher  carbonation.
Overall:  Nice IPA but I was surprised to find more malt than I expected.  This wasnt a bad thing as there was a good balance between the malt and citrus.
Pours golden orange with a white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruit, floral notes. The flavour is dominated by pine with some sweet malts coming through before a long bitter aftertaste.

Attractive golden amber with a haziness about it. Fruity and juicy tropical fruit aroma - passionfruit, tangerine, pineapple, mango, pine, honey, lightly toasted bread. Lots of pine and grassy hops in the taste, with grapefruit, honey and biscuit. A little metallic in the aftertaste. Light to medium bodied. Pretty solid IPA.
(Tap) Tropicla, citrus, grassy. Hops are too overpowering, and aftertaste is astringent. I dont like it.

Pours golden orange with a small but pillowy off-white head, leaving sporadic lacing. Aroma is citrus and stone fruit hop bitterness and malt sweetness. Flavor is consistent with the smell but in reverse - starts with good malt balancing but ends with a good hop bitterness that lingers until the next sip. A little sticky on the palate.
Lekkere IPA, maar de tweede was wat veel. Bitter en citrus. Weinig schuim. Verder niet zo veel te melden
Bottle from utobeer borough market. Pours clear with small frothy head which soon dissipates.hoppy, citrusy, not overpowering. Quality undemanding ipa

It pours golden yellow, thin white head medium bubbles. The aroma is pine, grass, zest, dont get much else. As expectee strong hops flavour, everlasting bitter finish. Its one dimensional but nails it.
Pours a clear amber with a small foamy white head. Awesome aroma of fresh floral hops. Delicious flavour of fresh citrus hops with enough malt to make the taste very well balanced.

Tap @Brewdog Shepherds Bush. Clear amber, small creamy white head. Citrus, piney aroma, hinta of peach. Fruity citrus flavour, peach and pineapple well balanced by light caramel malt. Long, fruity and bitter finish.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2016 Bottle 12 oz at Cika Boban Tasting in Vranovo Serbia.01.04.2015.Taste with cika Boban himself and my bro ippopotamo36!Thank you Alberto and Greek connection?s for this bottle.Pour it hazy orange color with medium white head.On the nose grassy hops.Taste and aroma of malt, orange peels, grass.Ok balanced.

Rerate
Draft 0.15l at Craft&Draft Amsterdam Netherlands. 03.05.2016. Taste with Zlotta.Orange peel,grassy catachter,sweet aftertaste yeah 3.5
Light orange colour, white head. Aroma of apricot, peach, pine, mandarins, grapefruit. Taste slightly sweet, medium bitter. Light to medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation. Very very good IPA.

Pure hops. Smells hop, tastes hop. A strong and bitter palate as expected of good hop ales. No malts adulteration. Overall a wonderful IPA. Fav++

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tried this at the Worthy Beer Festival in Springfield MA. Available year round at Smiths Billiards. Very good in a bottle

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is grapefruit, tanin, clove, an earthiness, lemongrass. Roasty malts with caramel and honey hints. Taste is a rich sweet malt body transitioning into a deep hop profile that is passionfruit fruit, pine needles, clove and hay. Appearance is a slightly hazy orange with a thin pearl head that retains fairly well.

At a great tasting in Vranovo-Serbia, with markoijelena and cika Boban. Bottle courtesy of Costantin from the Hoppy Imp, Greece. Thank you fratello! It comes clear immediately that the bottle is not that young. Pours golden cloudy and bright, medium white cap. Nose: orang, syrupy, a bit too thin (old-flat?). Mouth: malty with a citrusy hoppy accent.
Draught. Golden yellow with with small foamy white head, grassy hops aroma, low carbonation, balanced hoppy taste, long finish. Nearest thing to golden standard for an India Pale Ale.
Old rating. Great go to IPA. Amber. Citrus, medium malt body, well balanced with light bitterness. Great in a pinch.
Stone, re-do this one, not much to say, beginner level IPA, actually a perfect beginner level IPA..

On tap at Torontos most lame Louis Cifer is a great find. Not as hoppy as expected, but with a solid core of bitterness throughout. Didnt measure up to the Great Lakes Karma Citra I had after it, but still pretty solid.

Amber colored, unclear, medium white head. Strong aroma of grapefruit and pine, very hoppy. Taste is some caramel malts, not too sweet, and very bitter grapefruit and even more pine hoppiness. Dry. Aftertaste is long and quite bitter. Medium bodied.
Poured medium amber with a frothy off white head. Aroma of light fruit and caramel malt. Medium body, flavour is medium sweet, medium bitter, light toffee.
20.12.2014. Malty, citrus hops in aroma. Taste is balanced, fruits, exotic fruits, pineapple, hoppy bitter finish. Expected more.

Poured from 12oz bottle into St Bernardus glass. Pours golden with head and lace. Aroma of light grains, sweet malts, caramel. Medium carbonation and mouthfeel. Flavors of straw hops, grains, light malts. Overall rich, flavorful, somewhat bitter with significantly more hops than malts.
bottle from bottle dog a very very good beer nice fruity aroma with a massive hop kick in the taste lovely citrusy taste going on nice bitter finish a lovely beer

Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm.
Long lasting off white head. Clear golden beer. Firm american hop aroma with a tuch of bergamott. Big hop taste with a solid bitternes that is balanced with all other taste in the beer. The sweetness is low but balance the bitterness. Well fermented to give a dry finnish.
Love this stuff! Great citrus/bitter flavors but nicely balanced. Very good.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2016 Re-rate: Tap and bottle multiple times in 2016. Peach forward nose with resiny pine aromas. More peach on the palate with some honey and juicy citrus as it warms. Some light caramel notes as well. Big bitterness on the finish. Solid IPA. Pours a hazy orange with off-white head. Huge fruit bouquet aromas. Peach, citrus, papaya, passion fruit with a hint of caramel malt. Palate is all hop bomb bitterness with just enough malt in support. Oily mouthfeel. Medium body. Great carbonation. Long lingering bitter finish. What is a west coast ipa? Drink this.

An amber semi-transparent color with a creamy white (minimal) head. Fruity/hoppy aroma with a taste that doesn't have the fruit but plenty of hoppy bitterness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Not the freshest iteration of this IPA Ive had - some sediment was visible in the bottle, and the aroma was muted

Gift from Stone Brewing (Ian). Thank you !
Still THE benchmark IPA for me. 
golden, clear, frothy, white foam, spruce, citrus, herbs, cereal, light sweetness, very bitter, full body, oily feel, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish,

Aroma floral, citrus, 
Appearance golden, cloudy, white foam, 
Taste very bitter, 
Palate medium body, bitter, 
Overall I would suggest this beer to a friend
Poured from the tap. Aroma is hoppy. Flavor is floral, almost rose like. Has a slight IPA dankness to it...but very slight. Overall super easy drinking!

Bottled. Enjoy by date 06/04/15. Pours golden amber color, frothy white head. Aroma is orange peel, peach, bit of mango and tropical fruits. Flavor is hop forward, slight tropical fruits, citrus notes. Malty biscuit undertones. Bitter hop finish. Hoppy IPA.
En fût au Brothers. Blonde doré. Beau collet. Ronde. Malté. Bonne amertume. Léger caramel. Fruité. Pamplemousse. Épicé. Orange. Résineuse. Sèche et amère en finale. Minoume.
Hazy light orange with a big white head. Aroma is hops, pine and mango. Taste is caramel, pineapple and mango

Bottle 33 cl. Hazy orange with a white head. Hops, caramel, distinct strong bitterness, wormwood, citrus/lemon. Medium body, medium carbonation, strong bitter finish. Lacked hops aroma to balance the bitterness, but maybe its a bit old?
Great hop aroma and nice appearance. A little sweetness and a mildly bitter finish that is the perfect balance.
Poured from a bomber into a pint glass. Great color and aroma! Slightly floral, but with distinct citrus notes. Flavor is strong, but not overpowering. Left great lacing on the sides of the glass!
Klare dunkel goldgelbe Farbe, geringe weiße Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr hopfig, reife Früchte, Citrus, Aprikose. Geschmack kräftig malzig, hopfig fruchitig, leicht trocken, Aprikose und Mango, ok!
Tap. White medium head, intense lace. Hazy orange. Bity carbons, extra brut palate. Hops explosion. Fruity hoppy aroma.

Poured from a Bomber into a Pint Glass.
Aroma- A knockout of hops, floral essence, citrus and grass.
Appearance- Poured a copper to amber color with a large white head.
Taste- A fantastic flavor! Citrus and hops perfectly balanced.
Palate- A medium bodied beer with moderate carbonation, nice dry finish.
Overall-A world class IPA. This is the gold standard for IPAs.

A beautiful light bronze/light gold colour with a creamy white head. Some nice grassy and pine heavy hop scents. Im also getting hints of grapefruit. An incredibly smooth taste, the 6.9% is well hidden. The grass and the pine from the nose hold strong through to the taste, with the latter adding a lingering bitterness and slight punch to the brew. The mouthfeel is quite thick, with a nice velvety smoothness. Good levels of carbonation give a slight sense of dryness - this beer is uncomfortably sessionable.
It definitely had that nice subtle citrus taste and a nice bite. A great IPA.

Draft at Chandlers Burger Bistro, tasted on January 24, 2015. Cloudy gold hue, firm bittersweet nose with lots of citrus, tasty bittersweet flavor with lots of citrus/other fruit, long pleasant aftertaste. Fine brew.
Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal 09.02.15. Clear golden. White head. Dry American hops in aroma. Citrus and fresh tropical fruits. Similar taste. Well-balanced and very quaffable!

12oz into a flute, pours a very clear orange honey with sunshine qualities. Head is ample and frothy, phat lacing. Aroma of dull pine, orange, pine needles, malty aspirations, hoppy sidekick, no real hop punch in the aroma, seems too conjured with the malt profile. Taste a of dried orange, cedar, melon, faint hops, quite bitter up front and in aftertaste. Not really feeling this one, no hoppy after taste, just muted orange and malt prevalence. Drinks alright, except for the skunky flow of it all. I had my hopes up.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2015 330ml bottle at home. Clear golden orange color with nice white head. Aroma is hoppy, piney, resin, citrusy, grapefruit, caramel malty too. Light sweet and quite bitter taste, like aroma, light malty caramel notes, pine, fruits with mostly grapefruit. Medium oily body with soft carbonation, long bitter aftertaste.

Cask at CASK Pub & Kitchen, London. It pours a light amber golden colour with a decent white head that lasts. Aroma is tropical fruits, a rich citrus nose, piney hops and some earthy notes. Taste is fresh citrus, sweet fruit, piney and earthy taste and it finishes with a relatively strong bitterness that lingers in the aftertaste. It has a medium body, decent carbonation and a dry finish. This is a quintessential American IPA. This beer is classified among the best of its category. I would drink it again.
Pours golden with little to no head. Full aroma of tropical fruits and some hints of pine. Taste is citrusy, papaya, some bitterness and a dry finish.

This staple IPA hits the target with classic sweet aromas. Pouring a light amber with an oily head that glimmers and hangs to the glass when turned. Its mouth feel is smooth and astringent. The bittersweet is excellent. Good IPA
UPDATED: JUL 16, 2016 330ml can, Berlin version. Hazy amber body with a medium white head. Grapefruit zest, resin and pine pretty much, but overall really nicely packaged.

Bottle. Pours murky gold with creamy white head. Strong, fruity aromas: pine, citrus, peaches and passonfruit. Strong, enveloping and lasting bitterness with an oily mouthfeel. Easy to see how this is an IPA for all others to compare to.

A pint on tap [from notes]. . Arrived with a billowing head that was exceptionally thick and creamy. It left loads of sticky lacing.

Citrus hops with traces of alcohol and malts in the nose. 

The beer also has a strong citrus component on reaching the tongue, but this becomes more piney mid-taste. Strikingly sweet when it hits the tongue, with no immediate hop hit following ... this does appear in the surprisingly hoppy finish. Thus, this IPA creates a striking and unusual (well, exaggerated) flavor dynamic.

Bottle from cellarbrations super store in hami hill. Pours golden with a thick white head. On the nose it has plenty of citrus and pine, pine apple and a slight honey sweetness. Carbonation is moderate with a medium body. Taste is resinous, citrusy and grassy with a lingering bitter and dry finish.

Bottle at home, enjoy by 02/15/15. Clear golden colour, white creamy head. Strong piny, resinous character hops, grassy, and nicely fruity too with orange peel, grapefruit and citrus tones along with light some sweet tropical fruits. Long aftertaste, especially the bitterness lingers. Firm body (especially considering "only" 6.9% abv), medium carbonation, oily mouthfeel. Good IPA, crisp and bitter.

Nice amber/gold color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of rich floral hops, citrus, & some malt; Flavor of malt, pine hops, citrus (notably grapefruit), and some caramel; Finish is bitter & lingers a bit; Nicely balanced; Really nice IPA.

Enjoy by 10.15.14.
Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a tumbler on 08.22.14.

A: Tangerine, lemon, and orange.

A: 1 finger head. See through straw yellow body.

T: Tangerine, lemon, and orange dominate.

P: Creamy.

O: This was extremely good. It was very citrusy with a candied tropical fruit flavor and a tart aftertaste. This is the epitome of a West Coast IPA.

Poured from a 12oz bottle with a enjoy by date of 2/2/2015.

Ive had this beer before, but never reviewed it.

Aroma - tropical fruit - typical Stone beer.

Appearance - clear golden color. Super clear!

Taste - great tasting, smooth...delicous.

Palate - perfect bite at the end of the tongue - love it.

Overall - Stone rarely makes a bad beer, and this is another great beer by them.
Excellente IPA pour ceux qui aime le style très tranchant et belle amertume. Très bien équilibrée. Belle arôme. On sent plus que bien les 90 IBUs. Jai adoré cette IPA, un classique.
Pours hazy golden orange with thick white head. Smell is malt, citrus and hops. Taste is citrus, hops and pine. Medium body medium carb.

Not a bad ipa but not my favorite. Very biting and grassy in taste. Okay. Not super impressed. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Sake Taniguchi (World Beer Market). Somehow hadnt gotten around to this one. Sharp tangy grapefruit nose, some thick caramel behind, a bit of stinky fruit, too. Light copper/orange color, thin head, some lace. Tasty hopping right away, begins to balance in mid, but hops re-emerge, with a bit of burn in finish. Medium body, a bit of hop texture. Well, nothing is really outstanding, but somehow it all adds up. Pretty damn good (and Im not a huge fan of the brewery, overall).

12 oz bottle. Appearance is clear, pale amber color with light, creamy off-white head. Aroma is grapefruit, orange peel, with floral and alcohol notes. Taste is hop bitterness up front with flavors of grapefruit giving way to a subdued sweetness. Palate is light on the tongue, somewhat viscous texture, with a bitter finish.

Not much aroma. Lighter yellowish color with medium cloudiness. Bitter start and malty finish

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Brilliant golden color, clear body, with ample fluffy white head. Sticky lacing as I progressed through the glass. Very fresh and aromatic...strong floral and citrus scents on the onset. Slightly peppery finish. Huge pine flavors with grapefruit and other citrus notes. Some bready biscuit flavors as well. Well-balanced with plenty of zip from the hoppy goodness.
Golden color, clear with a thin white head. Aromas of pine and grass. Taste is pine, grass, lemon. Medium body with low carbonation.
Very good ipa. Stone knows how to do it. Citrus hop and caramel flavor. Great lacing on the glass. Nice bitter finish. Will get again.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2014 
A glowing, clear amber body supports a fading tight white head creating dense, intricate lace all around

Aromas and flavors display a lean, balanced glow of grass and pine, grapefruit and orange, pineapple, and honey on a silky smooth, lightly creamy, light plus body finishing and resonating with restrained malts, citrus and tropic heavy, pine and grass playing a supporting role, one of the best lean IPAs there is, which makes it one of my favorites

12oz bottle code ENJOY BY 03/04/15, 90 days from bottling puts this in early December, served at 45° into 14.7oz Zwiesel Cognac snifter followed by Spiegelau IPA glass
Boozy aroma with citrus notes. Clear amber colour. Tropical fruit notes, with caramel flavour; sustained bitter finish. Medium body and lively carbonation. Quite a tasty beer.

12 FL. OZ. bottle. Unclear orange yellow, off-white foam settles and mostly fades. Fresh pungent aroma of floral citrus pine grapefruity hops. Juicy bold coniferous grapefruity hop taste, lightly sweet toasted caramel malt, fuck these guys make great beer, so glad they are finally trickling up to my part of the world. Average carbonation, medium bodied, aggresively hopped. Finishes dry. DNFL (Definitely Not For Lagerboys)
09222011: nice hoppy aroma,golden, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, long finish nice hoppy finish.

Nose is floral and soapy. Clear medium amber with a small white head. Light sweet start moves quickly to a quite bitter pine middle and a long dry finish. Medium oily mouth with average carbonation. The archetypical west coast IPA

12 oz bottle into pint glass. Cloudy dark yellow-gold in the glass with a decent foamy head. Smells like the best kind bud imaginable with fruity notes, I say strawberry. Plenty sour, plenty bitter, nice and dry on the palate. Tastes strongly of high quality hops and grain. 
Extremely bitter but I want to emphasize that it goes down very smooth in the finish. 

Very pleasant! It's everything I look for in an IPA. If that's your thing, and you like bitterness, I don't think you can go wrong with this. I will consistently come back to this. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma and taste is citrus fruity and malty, caramel, some nice tropical hoppy notes as well, great sweet initial hit and bitter balance to the finish. Lovely.
Good basic IPA. Nothing really stands out but it tastes like an IPA should.
Very, very hoppy both in bitterness and flavor, but its actually overmatched by a malty sweetness. Caramely, toasty flavor complimented by a smooth hop flavor. Extra dry-hopping really shows.
12 oz bottle poured into pint glass. Aroma was average, no head at all. Taste was hop foward with a strong finish.

Appearance is a hazy golden, one finger pure white head, a few bubbles rising. Aroma- you can smell this from a long way away. The usual hoppy fruitiness, grapefruit, orange, tropical fruit juice, quite a lot of bready malt detectable too, hints of caramel. Taste- loads of hop bitterness, quite smooth in the mouth, malty, oily hop resins coat the mouth, not that much carbonation, citrus fruits and pineapple juice, zesty orange, a big bitter finish. The malt presence makes this one stand out.

caramel, grass, spruce, citrus, golden, clear, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, light body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter, long finish
Blast of citrus pine hops upon pouring. White foam that dissipates fairy soon with light lacing. Bread/caramel malt initially, then medium bitterness takes over. Medium carbonation with a light oily mouthfeel. Spruce like bitterness is the finish that lasts. Pretty dry at the end. Quite good.
I love stone IPAs but this is not one of my favorites. Still better than 90 percent off all other IPAs though.

Not how I remembered it when I first tried it. The aroma is more piney than citrus, yeasty but less so than a Belgian hybrid Bold, both semi- sweetness and bitterness are way up there and consistent sip after sip. Surprisingly, pleasant butterscotch lingers briefly at the back of the throat then dissipates quickly. Viscosity is about of a 75% DPI. Unique, superb and I have overlooked and missed out on a beast of a beer searching for the latest and the greatest.. It wont happen again

Very smooth IPA. Bitterness lingers, after a dry finish. Warmth in the back of the throat. Orange-copper colour with little or no head. Mild hoppy aroma, but not overpowering. Medium lacing on a beer mug with handle. Would buy again, but would like to taste on draft, rather than the bottle I just drank.

From a bottle... Aroma is consumed by hops; taste is the same, albeit with a sticky taste that lingers. I wasnt around when the Brits were invading India but I suspect this beer is what they had in mind...

Now available in Alberta, Canada. Definitely enjoyed this a bit more than their Go To even though I usually prefer the tropical citrus to bitter and malty IPAs. This one was more enjoyable to me because it has a lot more character and isnt so one noted - has pine, resin, some citrus notes and a nice malt backbone.
UPDATED: SEP 18, 2016 Just an awesome beer. Hoppy and refreshing with some citrus then that bitterness on the back end. Enjoy every sip, one of my favorite ipas
I like a good IPA but this one is a little too hoppy and bitter for me. I like my beer a little less bitter than this.

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2014 This is a bitter, yet aromatic and smooth IPA. It?s 6.9 ABV gives it a little more kick. I really want to stress how smooth this beer tastes on your tongue and goes down. It does have the bitterness, but as IPA?s go it is one of the better ones I have had. On draft and in a bottle. Better on draft.

355ml bottle from Brewdog Online Shop. Pours clear gold with a thick white, long-lasting head. Very fruity hop aromas, ripe peachy, lots of resin too, light banana note. Taste is helluva bitter, crystal malt is there, but mostly bitter hops all the way. Long bitter finish. Classic stuff.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear golden with a white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are peach, flowers, pine, and caramel - with a bitter finish.

Nice and fruity aroma, pine needles, citrus and caramel join forces and rush up you nostrils. The flavor is extremely well balanced and sweet caramel malts slow dances with the fruity hops over your taste buds before leaving the dance hall, and the characteristic bitterness that you look for, stays the night. A very good, balanced, worthy IPA.
Bottle, 355 ml at Blackfriars, Glasgow. Pours orange with medium white head. Malty and hoppy aroma. Fruity, piney and hoppy flavor with dry bitter finish.

355ml. Bottle. EnjoyBy 2014-12-08
Pours clear orange with white head. 
Aroma citrus, pine, tropical fruits, honey, grapefruit, orange. 
Taste big citrus pine bitter, little honey sweet. 
Mouthfeel thin, dry. 
Awesome IPA.
UPDATED: NOV 30, 2014 33 cl. bottle. Clear orange colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, fruit, hops and caramel.

Big IPA pris en Virginie.bonne intensité,très bien balancé , très florale , des agrumes francs, avec ce coté un peut surette avec une petite touche poivré qui balance le tout et qui suit lamertume bien présente.Pas cher au States , très belle IPA

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2015 The floral citrus bouquet in the aroma of this beer is laced with a touch of honey maltiness then the flavor takes over with pine and mango hoppiness balancing a biscuit maltiness. Well balanced finish.

(On tap at Akkurat, Oct 14 2014) Pours a hazy orange-gold with a big frothy white head and lace. Aroma is really quite dank, with lots of citrus rind, a bit of tropical fruit, resin, bready malts and light sweetness, but really all about the hop cocktail. On the palate, more grapefruit and orange zest, orange flesh, green dank hops, a little pine and floral character. Some nice moderately sweet malt in the middle does just enough to hold all those hops. Light early and more citrus pith with supporting pine in the dry, astringent, bitter finish. Medium but very chewy body, light to moderate carb. All about the hops for sure, but its not at all unbalanced and is extremely quenching. Perhaps my ultimate preference runs to more tropical fruit but this is a top notch IPA.

12oz brown bottle. Gold pour, thick and creamy white foam, great lacing. Nose has pine, grapefruit, orange. Light biscuit malt, grapefruit and piney hops. Lingering hoppiness and aftertaste of grapefruit orange and pine. Very drinkable, simple but pleasing.
UPDATED: JUL 20, 2016 Klar, gul-orange, lätt orange skum. Doft: Humle, bränt socker, kola, billig torkad papaya, jäst. Smak: Jäst, torkad mango, barr, humle, mandarin skal.
Flaska via privatimport. Dimmig ljus bärnstensfärgad vätska med vitt skum. Doftar kådigt. Fyllig humlesmak med bra beska. Riktigt bra IPA

"as far as the regular (ie-not imperial) IPAs go, this is right up there as one of the best. Hoppier (slightly) than Marins, with a slightly thinner but slicker mouthfeel. Aroma is near perfect, and its cheaper than Marin, which only comes in 22s."
Translucent orange with a quickly dissipating white head. Heavy citrus aroma, grapefruit and orange, grass and flowers. Alcohol and bitterness are very present. Dry hops, sweet and sour citrus.

tap @ Konttori
Orange clear beer with white dense head leaving lots of lacing. Aroma has sweet tropical ftuits, resin, grapefruit and caramelly sweetness. Flavor is very hoppy bitter, resinous and grapefruity. Palate is quite full and fluffy with feel of bitterness. Finish has very strong bitterness. Aftertaste is dry, grapefruity, piney and soapy. One of the strongest hop loads Ive ever tasted, most DIPAs get mellowed out by the thicker malt backbone. The bitterness is almost violently strong. Theres a bit of the annoying bitter caramelliness I dislike about American IPAs, which drops a few points. Still, a very enjoyable IPA.
Mild smell of hops. Yellow colour, yellow head. Aroma of earth, basement aromas. Bitter. Flat and rich carbon.
Heavy hop bitterness dominates from start to finish but manages to keep a perfect balance between pine and citrus. This one is to write home about.

Enjoying pint from tap @60sPalaver, Joensuu, Finland. Crispy taste with long aftertaste filling mouth with nice hop flavors. Enjoying despite the robbery price 11,50 pint...hey its long way from California!

Bottle at Bar Liberte in Philly. Drank from the bottle. Pungent, dank aroma. Lots of citrus rind. Mouthfeel is very carbonated and slightly sticky. Taste is grapefruit rind all the way. Very bitter. Nothing subtle about this. Hops are the only thing going on with this beer. No pretext of balance, but thats OK sometimes. Pretty decent and Id drink again. But I wouldnt drink often.

Appearance: translucent yellow color, really nice dense white head when poured, head does not dissolve quickly
Aroma: hoppy!!!! Grassy earthy can smell the bitterness
Taste: bitter and hoppy throughout the entire sip citrus grass earth
Palette: bitter !!! Medium body
Overall:this is the ultimate ipa!

Privatimporterad flaska genom Great Brands. 
Strålande vacker i sin tungt dimmiga bärnsten, ingen jästfällning här inte. Lite klent skum kanske, men va fan gör det?
Mäktig humledoft av kåda men mycket citrusfrukt framförallt. 
Är dock lite besviken på smaken, fin sötma av grape och mango, beskan välbalanserad men den känns tunn! Här hade de kunnat fläska på lite mer. 
Överlag en jättefin IPA dock. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great beer from stone. I love everything they make! A must try for sure!!!!!!!

Pours a hazy orange yellow color with a great lively white head. Aroma is pretty strong, hop, grapefruit, sweet orange, tang, slight bread, lemon zest, a very sweet floral, pine resin. Taste is awesome, notes of sweet oranges, grapefruit, lemons, resin, pine, and a very strong malty backbone to carry the bitter. Overall a fantastic IPA, great yet still sessionable. Texture is perfectly smooth, full bodied, all around awesome.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle with a Best By date of 11/20/2014. 
Aroma is rather hop forward with quite a bit of pine resin and grapefruit. A bit of wood and hop resins. Some light cracker and bread notes. Hints of stone and tropical fruit esters. 
Pours a slightly hazy, golden orange with a small, moderately thick, white head with average retention as it recedes to the edges. Moderate lacing and medium length legs. 
Flavor has a light sweetness with a bit of bread and cracker notes. A moderately strong bitterness with a hint of alcohol in the finish. Moderately strong grapefruit hop notes with hints of orange and other citrus. Medium light pine resin and a hint of wood. Some faint stone fruit notes. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a pretty nice IPA, but nothing special either. Some nice hop character, but it lacks the super fruitiness of the newer hop varietals.

Átlátszó színe aszúhoz hasonlatos, habja hüvelykujjnyi vastag, krémes. Fenséges aromái kecsesen szállingóznak a levegőben, művész hajlammal rendelkezőknek egy napra elég is lenne ennyi. Fenyőfa kiválasztása előtti hangulatok jönnek, a prímet nyilvánvalóan a "tűlevelű komló" illata viszi. Az olyan jelzőket, mint a kifinomult, elegáns és megnyerő, természetes és harmonikus lelkiismeret furdalás nélkül pufogtathatjuk, azonban talán egyik sem jellemzi hűen az egyszerűségben rejlő tökéletességét. Frissítő kortyai kellően teltek, a bizsergető szénsavasság remekül élénkíti meg a jól érezhetően gabonás testet. Ezzel párhuzamosan természetesen érkezik a komló gyantás karcossága, a homogén keserűség másodperceken belül szinte vághatóvá válik. Nagyszerű IPA-alapvetés, semmi cifrázás, mérnökien precíz munka.
Just Bad. The worst after taste of any IPA, it made me gag. Disgusting. Poured 4 bottles down the drain and hoped it would ruin the houses plumbing system.
Dégustée à Los Angeles lors dune soirée bien chaude... Très bonne IPA, du corps, des arômes dagrume, de la longueur en bouche... On dirait presque une double.
UPDATED: NOV 2, 2015 Bottles and tap many times. Big fresh hop aroma, massive bitterness. Great IPA but the huge bitterness wears me down after one or two.

An excellent example of a massed produced, but very high quality IPA. Definitely one of my favorite IPAs out there. The aroma after the initial pour is excellent, though I did not have proper glassware(might be even better with a good glass), it pours a beautiful golden honey color. Lots of hoppy aroma before your first sip. Taste is very complex, lots citrus fruity notes, an initial sweetness which turns slightly bitter and then all biter after taste (but in a very good way). I paired this with a spicy Chinese dish. But then kept drinking it long after I finished the dinner. Ill definitely choose this IPA again!
This pours a semi-clear golden yellow color with a slight head. The aroma is bold with hops. The taste is bitter, dry, and perhaps one of the best IPA brews on the market. Outstanding and a must try!

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2014 Bottle. Only a faint aroma even poured into a glass. Light and citrusy up front, which fads to a nice bitter finish. Definitely a more citrusy IPA, lacking in malt balance. A good beer, but I really dont understand the hype. At $45 a case its seriously over-priced too.

Reviewed from notes. Bottle poured into a Hair of the Dog tulip glass.


A - Pours hazy orange with a nice frothy pillow of one and a half finger tall white head leaving light rings of lacing down the glass.


S - Smells of pungent hops; most notably citric and pine; sweet caramel malt, and some fruity esters. Good overall balance of sweet and bitter.


T - Starts off with a nice punch of pungent citric hops slowly giving way to a mix of sweet caramel malt, pine, and some fruity esters. I like how no one flavors dominates the others, it makes it very easy to drink. The finish has some light hop bitterness, lingering for a short period of time. This is one easy drinking, enjoyable, IPA.


M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Very smooth, crisp, feel with some lingering bitterness in the finish.


O - Pretty good. I could drink this regularly but when you compare it to some of the other offerings available locally it really comes up short. Still a good beer tho.
Very nice bitter yellow to orange beer with huge white head. Aroma of hops by resin. Clean yeast character. Good IPA.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2014 On tap, pint at Smith Street Taps, Singapore. Citrus nose, light fragrance of citrus and pine. Pale amber when poured with a medium sized head which lasts and leaves some nice lacing. Lovely taste of grapefruit, malt. Hoppy and bitter - good balance. A nice West Coast IPA.
Une très belle bière avec plein dagrumes dans larôme. Plein de corps, un peu comme une IPA impériale mais moins onctueux. Très bonne.

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2015 Bottle from Stone on Tap at the BeerTemple in Amsterdam.  Classic Californian IPA with thinnish, off-white, lacing head and bright golden blonde colour, warm and vividly sparkling.  Complex spicy aroma of grapefruit peel, strawberry, cedar, acacia honey, curry spices, ginger, drying hay and biscuit.  Crisp, sharpish, activatingly fresh onset of redcurrant, some unripe peach and starfruit, delicate mouthfeel with the right body thickness and the right amount of carbonation for the style, lean and supple; juicy malt sweetness with an ever so bready touch is adorned with a complex, herbal and resiny hop bitterness, piney and floral, providing drought and deep bitterness as well as wonderful retronasal aromas; malt sweetness does creep through in the end, but very limitedly so.  Like all Stone beers I had, this is very delicate, refined and noble, a great beer and a shining example of the West Coast IPA style which is now sweeping the world, in my opinion.
Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. Golden coloured with warming rich pine and orange marmalade flavours followed by a bitter pine and grapefruit finish. Excellent!

nose: grainy, grapefriuty. lemon and pine a bit like cleaning product. also something far more complex, almost like berry chewing gum but u have to dig for it.

palate: very dry and grainy at first, turning focused and lemony. bitter pine kick in the finish that just wont go away.

theres sweetness but its so out of the way u dont notice. overall impression of dryness and chalkiness. balance. nice!

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2017 12oz bottle from Wegmans, West Seneca, NY. Pale amber with a ring of cream head; an immediate mango and pineapple aroma; a good depth of hooopy flavours, with tropical fruit, pine resin, and some herbal spice; before a long clean and pleasantly bitter finish. A classic West Coast IPA. (8/27/2014 - 8/3/7/4/16=3.8)</br></br>33cl can from Beer52.com, brewed in Berlin. Straw coloured with a billowing cream coloured head; fresh, lightly fruity aroma; big tropical fruit taste, with a slightly chalky mouth-feel, and a rounded grapefruit bitterness; then a long lasting finish with grapefruit and lemon sherbert. Seems muted compared to the US version, or perhaps my palate has changed. (2/24/2017 - 6/4/7/4/14=3.5)

Bottle. Clear, pale yellow colour. Pine, grapefruit peel, cheesy and citrusses on nose. Dry in taste, hoppy, medium body and just perectly ballanced bitter aftertaste. West coast style. Brilliant one.

on tap. Golden Amber hue with a ton of clarity. Smells sweet and fresh, little bit of booziness. Goes down clean and bitter.... classic American iPA. But you can tell that IPAs Have come a long way since this came out
UPDATED: OCT 10, 2014 Hell und klar im Glas, leichter schaum, hopfig alkoholisch in der Nase, süß im Antrunk, gefolgt von massiver, Langanhaltender bittere, schön trockenes IPA!

On tap. Pours clear gold with a thin white head. Good lacing and head retention. Big dank resinous aroma. Grapefruit, pine, berry, orange, and grass notes. Light to medium body with high carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel. The finish is dry. Very good IPA.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2016 First rating, from 2014. Bottle at a tasting. Pour is gold with a minimal head, aroma is strong fruity and sweet. Taste is fruity with plenty of bitterness backing it up and a bitter aftertaste. Good (7/3/8/3/16=3.7)

Second rating, 2016. Can from stone Berlin, two weeks old. Pour is gold, aroma is sweet, fruity, grapefruit. Taste is sweet, lychee, bitter. Good, but not outstanding
Im surprised by the 100 rating on this beer. It is definitely lacking on the hop front. Smooth but as their signature IPA it should have plenty of hops.
Great, well balanced IPA. Excellent hop character balanced with a nice hoppiness.

Bottle. Hazy gold. Strong citrus and pine on the aroma. Very floral. Huge white thick head. Bitter at first but then the malt kicks in on the finish. Lingering hop resins. High carb. Excellent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
33cl bottle from bottledog, london. Clear gold color. Thin white head. High bitterness, low sweetness. Medium to high dryness. Aroma is malt, hop, resin, wood.

From a bottle. Pours copper with a white head. Great aroma of fresh hops and malt. Flavors are nutty, bitter grapefruit, toasty and roasty notes, with bready tones. Medium mouthfeel with a dry finish. Wow! This is a beautiful, nutty, roasty IPA.

This is one of the best West Coast style IPAs out there. Not so strong that you cant enjoy a few, along with that strong hop bitterness and citrus flavor that sometimes is only found in a double IPA. Just a classic.

12 oz bottle poured into a sensory glass. Pours a light copper color with a medium sized white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a lot of lacing behind. 

Smell is floral hops. Some pine, some grapefruit.

Taste is nice, fresh hops with a dry biscuity character. Good amount of bitterness at 70+ IBUs, but so well balanced that it doesnt overpower the beer. Mouthfeel is smooth and crisp.

Overall, a classic West Coast IPA that everyone should try.

12 oz bottle poured a golden orange with a little head. Aroma is super citrusy and amazing. Taste is a hop blast of flavor. Lots of citrus and pine, kinda sticky mouth feel. Long bitter aftertaste. What an awesome IPA!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Aroma is grassy, hops and grapefruit. Taste is big juicy grapefruit, hop bitterness and some floral backend. Very good ipa. So well balanced, can drink everyday. One of the best
Bottle. Pour a slightly hazy gold with a thin off-white head. Aroma and taste of citrus, pine and floral hop. Nicely bitter but not the hop bomb I was expecting but still a nice IPA.
Bottle (12 Oz): cloudy golden color. Lots of bitterness throughout. Almost a metallic taste in the end. Good but not a favorite
Bottle from father and sons. Poured into pint glass. Poured hazy golden with a slight white head. Piney grapefruit aroma. Very floral taste. Very drinkable IPA.

Bottle to shaker glass. Pours cloudy gold, two finger head, light lacing. Aroma of pine, grapefruit, apricot and grass. Taste is very balanced but bitterness is the showcase. Medium body, lots of small bubble carbonation, soapy, resin mouth feel. Finishes bitter with notes of stone fruits, pine and earthy grass like textures. This is one of the best IPAs in the country in my opinion.

Look: pours a golden straw. White head that fades quickly.
Smell: pine. Tropical fruit. Orange. Pineapple.
Taste: pine. Pineapple. Orange.
Feel: not mouth of a film but there is a slight one. Medium carbonation.
Overall: good session beer. Easy to drink. Heavy pine.
First drank: Robbie's grill 7/18/14

Call me crazy, but this is not the best IPA Ive had. That said, its awesome. A good hoppy aroma. With a clean palate, my first taste was the overwhelming bitterness. That probably lowered my overall rating. About halfway through my first beer, though, the malt character caught up, and the bitterness was less pronounced. Its a beautiful beer in a pilsner glass (my favorite), crystal clear with a nice soapy head. A little pricey here in the Midwest, but Ill probably buy it again.
Bottle at home. Pours amber, nose is toffee, sweet fruit, taste is dry, bitter, juicy fruit.
The holy grail of the class. There is a challenger noted earlier this evening but yet, this one remains my highest rated pure IPA. Wonderful concoction.

Bottle. Pours dark golden with a white head, Aroma is orange zest, grapefruit, pine, grass and biscuit. Taste is medium bitter and medium sweet, hard bread and orange marmalade. Finish is dry grassy lasting bitterness. Smooth medium body, average carbonation.
Pours golden with white head. Really nice hop aroma and flavor. Not as bitter as I was expecting.
Bottle at Urbn pizza in SD. Grapefruit, pine, resiny hops. Malty but not too malty. Really good.

From a 355ml bottle on 12/7/2014. I was absolutely stoked to find world renowned brew in a new bottle-o just up the road. Pours a slightly cloudy golden with a small to medium fine white head. Has a lovely aroma featuring caramel, grapefruit, lemon and a hint of passionfruit. The one screams quality from the first sip. Theres a substantial caramel malt background off which loads of citrus and stone fruit hang (orange, mandarin, grapefruit, lemon, peach), with a dash of pear as well. The hops are satisfyingly assertive, with oodles of lingering resin and grapefruit kicking around. Has a fullish body and medium carbonation. This is a supremely balanced IPA and totally deserves its big rep imo. A truly superb hop monster.

Pours a slightly hazy, but mainly clear copper with a medium white head. Aroma is hops, grapefruit, pine, some lemon and maybe a little tropical. Mildy dank. Taste is bitter with grapefruit and pine coming out. Medium body, dry on the finish, overall solid IPA.
Golden color with white head. Floral hop and citrus aroma. Nice dry citrus flavor with some grassy notes and fruitiness. Finish is grapefruit and pine. Lingering bitterness.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2014 Pours slightly hazey with white head. Aroma is citrus hop. Tast ia strong malt up front, followed quickly with lots of pine & citrus hops and bitterness. Plenty of bitterness all the way through the finish. Great great IPA. Thank goodness this bear came out when it did, and thank goodness it is still available after all these years.
Bottle 355 ml. Golden colour, medium head. Fresh bitternes, medium dryness. Spicy notes.
On draft. Hazy gold/orange color with good thick head. Tropical fruit aroma. Biscuit and flower flavor. Doesn?t end so bitter. Enjoyable.

Pours hazy orange peach. Aroma of hops, peaches and citrus but not as strong as expected. Taste is hops and bitterness. A great IPA but doesn't blow me away. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Day 3 of my IPA Advent calendar.

Bottle rating. Much better on tap. I love Stone but in a month of IPA drinking this didn't hold up in uniqueness and felt tamer than I recall on tap. 

I plan to re-do this as it seems odd.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great IPA - a standard and for a good reason. Hints of grass, citrus, and extremely hoppy and delicious on the tongue that lingers after the finish. Extremely drinkable too.

Straight from the fridge to a large Sam Adams glass. Pours a nice golden color with a very nice hop scent and great hop taste. They say it's dry hopped for a couple weeks and it gives a great taste. Nice beer, nice aftertaste, a great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A: nice clear yellow beer with white head and minimal lacing

A: grassy nose and piney hops

T: a very good IPA. A little sweetness and good bitterness 

M: appropriate carbonation for the style. I would like a little more to cut through the maltiness

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. 

A: Clear copper color with a thin fizzy white head. Bubbles throughout. No lacing.

N: Tasty hop smell: grapefruit, pine, earth, and pineapple. Leaves and some Mary Jane. Cracker and biscuit backbone. 

T: Sharply bitter with a touch of malt sweetness. 

M: Resinous and razor dryness. Medium body.

O: A much better beer than Ruination. The Stone yeast characteristics accentuate this one, and the hop profile is more pronounced. Im actually surprised.

Bottle from saveur-biere.com. Deep amber, clear body, with a medium, creamy, white head. Aroma of citrus, peach, pineapple, red berries, pine, some candy. Tastes of grapefruit, pine, peach, red berries, grass, caramel, very hoppy and smooth at the same time. Mouthfeel is medium, oily, with a lively carbonation and it finishes bitter, slightly dry, with lemon zest, pine and peach notes. Wow, this is a tasty IPA, that offers almost everything at the same time: slightly sharp hop bite and a lot of fruitiness, complexity and high drinkability and most of all a perfect balance! This really is an accomplished example of this style!
Tap. 10 oz pour at new bohemia. Light gold with white head and good lacing. Grapefruit aroma. Very hoppy and super dry throughout. This one doesnt pull any punches.
Cerveza que tomé ayer traída desde Chicago y que conserva su frescor. Es una cerveza ligera muy equilibrada con un amargor final bastante interesante. El color también es apropiado.

Transfer from BA review on 5-27-12- 
Poured from growler into pint glass

Appearance  The brew pours a nice golden color, with a thin white head. The head fades rather fast and gives way to a very light amount of lacing.

Smell  The aroma is a nice mix of caramel, bread and a blend of citrus (mainly grapefruit in nature) and pine hop.

Taste  The taste starts out of sweeter caramel and a nice smooth bread flavor. There is a nice citrus hop present up front, that begins losing ground to some of the sweeter tastes more toward the middle of the tongue. While it temporarily loses ground in the middle, more toward the end it intensifies again and mixes with a pine flavor, which in the end, leaves a slightly sweet hop flavor on the tongue. It is quite pleasing.

Mouthfeel  The body of the brew is above average in creaminess and the carbonation is right about average. The carbonation is good for the exciting hop flavors, but the creaminess is good for the malty and sweet. Together it is a pleasant feel. 

Overall  A nice easy drinking IPA. Its not over the top in hop, or lacking either. It is a good session IPA.

Bona cervesa molt equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza muy equilibrada y sabrosa.

Taste: nice hoppy blast really sweet, grassy and floral note, pineapple and peach. Aftertaste: nice wet sweet bitterness. Easy drinkable and good !

On tap @ Stone Brewery, Escondido - CA. Color: clear golden beer with small carbonation and white foam. Smell : hoppy and grassy notes. Floral finish and fruity as pineapple, peach and mango. Very nice. Taste: very well balance between malt and hops. A total mastering of the IPA! Very easy drinkable! Good beer on the style ! Hoppy and floral finish. Aftertaste: dry bitterness!
Excellent...big hoppy nose grassy resin spruce. awesome light gold color crystal clear good body. great beer had by my house in Oceanside

Poured from tap to glass. Slightly hazy orange hue with white head. Aroma is orange, pine, citrus peel, spicy, straw. Mouthfeel is nice with medium light body and zesty carbonation. Taste is dry sweetness initially followed by a big hop bitterness that extends through the finish. Overall this is a great shelf IPA.

22 Fl OZ ($4.99) pretty good IPA, I like that its very drinkable at 6.9% and not really bitter. I like it and if youd like to get into an IPA without the real bitter situation this one is pretty easy going but packs a punch.
Pours hazy yellow with a low white head. Aromas of grapefruit, peach, apricot, resin. Taste is peach, apricot, grapefruit, caramel, resin. Mourhfeel is crisp with medium carbonation.

Bottle. Light hazy yellow with a medium sized creamy white head. Pine, light cheese, citrus, white bread, dough. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation, medium sweet and bitter. Dry finish. Refreshing.
355 mil bottle from purvis cellers big hoppy aroma amber in colour with white head taste is resin hops

Oh you like Pine trees?? This IPA is the gold standard. Its just perfect. Theres nothing here that an IPA lover would dislike. It has everything. Theres nothing else you can say about it. Resinous Pine, enamel melting, tones of tropical fruits just go apeshit as it warms up. Its bitter as hell and you love it. This is a perfect IPA. Its simple and delicious and I can and will drink this until Im on the floor. Great stuff.
On tap in NY. Wonderfully hoppy yet some malty balance. Aroma is american hops with some nice balance of maltiness.

Drank from bottle.
Hoppy nose, with notes of citrus. 
Taste is very hoppy, with floral and citrus notes.

Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle pour. Hazy golden with small to medium white head. Hoppy is the only way to describe this beer.

Pours a clear golden with a thick lingering head. Immediate taste of thick crisp hops. Just the right amount of pine, with a long finish. Then the hops stay on your tongue when you breathe in.

It is a great beer. No doubt about it, but lack of body is a bit annoying. Color bit too light. Plane bitternes. And aroma is nothing memorable!

Pours a hazy gold with a med white head. Aroma is floral hops, peach, grapefruit, pine. Dry for an IPA which is actually quite nice, big big bitter hop throughout.. malt character keeps it light and slightly sweet. A classic.

Stone IPA is no doubt a classic craft. Just slight fresh hop aroma coming from this amber pour with a nice head. Taste is big malt character followed by the hops -- mostly pine notes -- and a bitterness that complements the flavor.  Not much complexity, just a solid hop character. Finish is nice without a lot of lingering bitterness. Stone IPA definitely blazed a trail, but now have lots of competition. Still it is a nice quaff with dinner.

On tap at Dan's. The pour is a beautiful gold with a nice sticky thick white head and gorgeous lacing. The aroma is very fruity and hoppy with a nice floral undertone. The flavor is great. There is a solid bitterness right off of first contact and a great citrusy hop dominance. This is just crisp and right to the point for an IPA. I love the resin that moves in toward the back. The mouth feel is a touch light, but has great carbonation to go with it. The aftertaste is pretty great. Lingeringly bitter and delicious.
