Moeder Lambic, Brussel, pilskleur, geel en helder, witte schuimkraag, ruikt en smaakt hoppig, bomen, dennelucht, zoet, bitter

What else can you say? Simply the standard. Been blessed to drink this regularly for several years now. Piney, resiny nose and taste reminds me of the Ponderosa pines growing right outside my door and never fails to deliver. I occasionally wander off looking for something for something new like we all do, but this is really the gold standard by which all the others are measured. Perfect? Well, for now at least. Maybe a little too malty for some occasions, but thats really an extremely minor nitpick. This beer should not be allowed to be rated by mere mortals, its that good!
user_location: Los Alamos NM, New Mexico, USA

text: @ Mogwai. Humle, söt aroma, från honung? Bärnstensfärgad. Kraftig beska med långt häng..
Aroma has pine and citrus on the head. Pours golden clear with good lacing and head. Finishes with light bitterness, but not terribly complex. Some sweetness in finish as well. On tap at Blue Monk.

Can't believe I never rated this and also can't believe I've overlooked how great this standard bearer is. Delicious biscuity malts are nearly overwhelmed by piney resiny hops and grapefruit citrus notes. Similar flavors on the palate and super well balanced. This is one of those beers that you always look past for something more interesting or to get a new tick. That's a mistake. This is good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Copper beer with a big foamy head. Nice fruity and sweet hoppy aroma. Medium body. Soapy, mildly grape fruity, balanced bitterness and sweetness. Id like to have a chance to enjoy a more fresh batch than this one. This is a very good IPA.

Presentation: 22 oz. brown bottle with an "enjoy by" date printed on the neck. Served in a Samuel Adams pint glass. 

Appearance: One finger head goes down eventually and stays there until the end. It has a clear, bright gold color, and leaves some very nice lacing.

Smell: The smell is fantastic, with a dominating herbal hop scent and some pine, fruit and spice notes present too. 

Taste: This beer has a big hop character, overwhelmingly so. Its very herbal, spicy and bitter. Youve gotta love hops to really appreciate the details and character in this. If you dont itll be just another (albeit good) strong, bitter brew. 

Moutfeel: It feels creamy, full bodied and smooth. It leaves a tingling sensation on the palate thats quite curious.

Overall: An amazing brew in every single aspect. If you love hops, IPAs or just something crisp, bitter and challenging, youll love this beer. If you dont, youll probably be put off by the intensity of it all.
Stone IPA is very hoppy but not overally bitter thanks to the malt backbone. Nice mouthfeel and a smooth finish.

This was the beer that opened my mind to a whole new world and I've never turned back. It's a favorite that I always fall back to and will compare all other IPAs to.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
My favorite all purpose ipa, and I use it as a measuring stick for everything else.  Pine, grapefruit, sublte floral notes, plus a creamy mouthfeel that finishes with a crisp bite.  Hellz to the yea
Pours a clear amber with a small white head. Smells of citrus, pine, pineapple.   Taste is sweet and bitter - citrusy hops, pine, bready malt.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy orange with a finger and a half of white head that settles in minutes, thin lacing. Aroma is hoppy, resinous, bitter, and oily. Flavor is hoppy, resinous, moderately bitter, piney, with a very mild malt background. Bitter, very slightly soapy finish. Soft to moderate carbonation, medium body, crisp texture, and slightly oily mouthfeel. A very good IPA.
Simply the best "every day" IPA there is. Solid across the board.
35.5,cl bottle at oharas. pours clear golden medium head. Hoppy citrus aroma. balanced mouth feel. sweet malts and hoops

Beautiful mostly white head with tan tint. Smells hoppy as can be. Golden color maybe a little copper. Hop attack at first then kinda tin aftertaste. Im completely biased since Im from San Diego and have been drinking this beer for years. Cheers!
Bottle into a tulip. Pours a light gold with a slight white head and loose lacing. Tropical and citrus fruit aroma. Taste is fruity, lightly bitter, lemon and orange. Super drinkable.
UPDATED: SEP 13, 2013 Refreshing although a little too sweet.. This is the go to IPA for all occasions although not my favorite style.

Very good ipa. Has a nice light and hop mix. It says 70 ibis but didn't seem overpowering. Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap @ Cask Pub and Kitchen, London. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - fruity. Flavor is medium sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 260413

Bottle. Nice yellow color, foggy with a lot of foam that dissipates rather quickly. Aroma has a lot of orange peel and pine. 

Taste is very strong and good from the getgo. Very well balanced with bitter crispy hops and a dry finish, even for an IPA. Nice mouthfeel, low carbonation. Alcohol level is just right for this brew.

Overall a very good IPA I would welcome any day, any time.
Copper colored beer with nice head. Aroma is hoppy, grapefruit. Flavor is malt, hops, bitter. Nice balanced IPA.
Bouteille 12 oz. Acheté au Half Time (Poughkeepsie). Une IPA comme on les aime, amertume robuste, houblon terreux, effluves fruitées et résineuses. Du gros stock!

Have had this beer many times before, but never taken the time to rate.  Had this at Roux in Roswell while taking my annual birthday thrift shopping trip with my mom and brother.  Poured a hazy burnt orange just a shade darker than color favored by Longhorns.    Just a tad shy on citrus for this to rate as highly as my favorite IPAs.  Perfect level of bitterness.  Excellent fizzy palate.  Good beer.  Looking forward to grabbing some "Enjoy By" tomorrow for comparative purposes.  Bottle - Roux - Roswell, GA

22 ounce bottle.  Pours a dark gold with a tow inch beige head that lasts.  Taste is of hops, pine, citrus, resin, malt and caramel.  Has a cleaner, hoppy aroma.  The body is creamy and a bit thick.  Has a  nice, dry and bitter finish that lingers.  Overall, a pretty good IPA.
This has been my go to for years, you cant go wrong with it but i am finding myself drawn to others lately......
Bottle; Golden honey color with an off white creamy head.  Aroma: herbal, citrus with breat/wheat notes, spice.  Flavor: Creamy, dry biting spicy tart flavor with a grapefruit finish.
Pours golden with grapefruity aroma. Taste up front is awesome however the end leaves me wanting more. This is a great IPA but, not the best i have had. Another Stone Brewery hit.
UPDATED: APR 25, 2015 Hops, slight ginger.  Yellow color.  Nice white head.  Very crisp and smooth, alcohol is present but not offensive.  Excellent beer.  Finally, an ipa I can get into.

Pours with a nice creamy head white. A bit cloudy with a golden amber orange-ish hue. Grapefruit and apricot in the nose not overwhelming. Nicely balanced a bit of a harsh aftertaste though. Nice to drink. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fra flaske på Cardinaltreff april-13: o salige stund, denne gikk rett i fletta, rett og slett kveldens 3-stjerners. En amerikansk klassiker jeg bare må få prøvd igjen, og da med fullt skjerpede sanser. Stort bedre tror jeg ikke en APA kan bli. IPA er dette ikke, her er det flat pedal.

Very balanced IPA, I felt that the aroma was lacking a little bit but still there. It was also very well balanced and didnt get too bitter or have too much of one element. The lacing was a little inconsistent and left something to be desired. Overall, this beer deserves its place amongst the top IPAs on the market.
One of my favorite IPAs. Nice golden color with a nice thick head. Very hippy in flavor but not over powering. One of the better IPAs.
Good fragrance with a wonderful flavor. The aftertaste is never ending. A really good beer this.
This is one of the best IPAs out there.  Has plenty of hops to satisfy and hop head without completly overpowering and ruining the beer.

330ml bottle (shared by FatPhil, thanks). Clear golden color. Nice head. Hops, fruity, exotic fruits in aroma. Omg its juicy! Nice mellow sweetness and fruity bitterness in flavor. Well balanced and asks you to take another sip. Another one please!

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2015 A top notch IPA but extremely hoppy with a lot of citrus and pine and a very bitter finish. Toasty, roasty malt backbone, a bit weaker than other IPAs but not a detractor here. Average mouthfeel, not sticky or thick so more refreshing. Between gold and copper. Fresh hop flavor and somewhat dry.

Light cooper and hazy body. Excellent head but diminished to a ring around the glass and after each sip a big lace was left attached to the glass. Aroma is crisp, pine, citrus such as orange, and lemon-lime Taste is very bitter, piney, and slight citrus. Palate is crisp pine, hints of lemon-lime, very bitter with earthy tones. Possibly the best IPA I have tasted next to AleSmith. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle.. Poured into a snifter. Beautiful dark golden-orange that is fairly hazy. Great white head that lasted a long time. Lacing is also significant. Aroma is solid with grass, citrus, flowers and hay. The taste is similar with aggressive hops contributing to bitterness, citrus, flowers, hay and earth. The light malts balance the bitterness and the mouth feel is fairly dry to finish. I love this IPA.

1 Pt. 6 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured an nice cloudy amber with a nice off white head and tons of lacing. Aroma is quite nice lots of hops (citrusy) and  some malts. Nice well balanced flavor citrus flavors, some sweetness from malts, very crisp, a dry slightly bitter finish. Great beer...

A - Pours a cloudy copper orange with a moundy white head that lives long. Notch line lacing.

S - Pine needles, lime, grapefruit, mint, thyme, hints of sweet malt.

T - Grapefruit rind rushes over the palate taking over the back of the throat. It mellows out and lets the malt in for a split second and then takes back over towards the finish. Hints of herbal spearmint like hops show up as well. Finishes like you brushed your teeth with a grapefruit.

M - Medium bodied.

This beer is bursting with fruit flavor! You would expect a ton of bitterness out of such intense hops but the flavor is much more prominent than the bitterness. Very intense flavor without the crazy bitterness.
This is a corner"stone" IPA.

Serving type: bottle

10-30-2010

Very smooth yet hoppy IPA. Easily drinkable but still very noticeable hoppy flavor. At 6.9% this is definitely a keeper.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is a strong, hoppy IPA. Some swigs leave a more bitter, almost metallic aftertaste. I could definitely go through multiple, though. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 23, 2016 355ml bottle (Alko Arkadia, Helsinki)(7:3:6:4:13=3.3)
Lovely fruity hoppy aroma, refreshing, and uplifting. Orange, small frothy head. Nice full palate, smooth, but pleasant carbonation. Alas a slightly mashy crystalmalt-like taste, a little sticky. Citrussy hops dance around the back of the mouth, and finally the sticky resiny bitterness kicks in, to join the dots. That late finish is just pure resiny bitteness, a touch fruity, and very nice. A touch too acidic with some of the resins - I thought it was only English brewers who used fertilised female hops - as thats what this reminds me of. Wayhay - were out of the trough.
Rerate: 355ml bottle (Porgu, Tallinn) (8-:4:7:4:15=3.8-)
Stunningly refresing aroma, even more uplifting than before, very perfumey on top of the above. Hazy orange, small sticky persistent tight head, lots of lacing. Just as refreshing in the mouth, no sticky crystal malts, so much zesty hops, mixed peel, so fruity - juicy sweetness. Drinkability very high. Alcohol totally covered. Damn, the last one was not a patch on this. This is simply delicious.
Rerate: Tap (TCBW2016) (5:3:5-:3:9=2.5-)
Stanky and watery. Not good.
Bottle. Copper/yellow pour with a foamy tall head. Sweet citrus and resiny hops. Powerful hops with grain in the finish.

White foamy head over clear golden body. Aroma of tropical fruit, citrus, sweetness, orange peal. Taste of a ton of hop up front, but surprisingly balanced bitterness. Orange, grass, zest, spice. Palate hoppy but not overly bitter with a dry finish. Nice drinking beer

Pungent grassy lemony aroma that is signature Stone in the best way. Crystal clear deep golden hue with a creamy white head. Sweet upfront and slightly dry in the finish, the hop flavor is bright and vibrant. Classic west coast IPA, one of my personal favorites.

Orangish/ dark yellow pour with carby white head. Smell and taste are pine with wet grapefruit. Nice malt bitter balance. To be honest, as far as shelf ipas go, it sets the damn standard. Its comforting to know I can go anywhere and get an IPA of such excellent quality. Thank you Stone!

Golden clear, some head also. Aroma is citrusy, fruity and sweet.
Somehow thin mouthfeel at start but good bitter finish and balance overall

Well balanced IPA with great floral hops and a little bitterness. Hadn't had one in a while. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Color unclear amber with medium head. Aroma malt, caramel, hoppy, pine, grapefruit, orange. Flavor sweet, hoppy, caramel, bitter, yeast.
One of my favorites. Classic floral hoppy aroma; hop forward bite in the flavor. Nice dry finish.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2013 Golden pour. Mild fruitiness and hops on the aroma. Taste is bitterness. Smooth, then big hit of the bite. Mild sweetness on end. Palate is a lingering bite. Overall, great bitter and sessional IPA, but nothing on the ruination!
Pours a golden amber with a thin head. Nose is fresh floral hops. Bitter hops with a floral finish. Big on the hoppiness, but not a whole lot of complexity.

Poured from a 12oz bottle into a Samuel Adams perfect pint glass.

Appearance: Deep yellow with particles floating around. The highlight of the look is the head and lacing though, which is absolutely awesome.

Smell: Earthy and spicy hops ... its a hop bomb in the aroma department. Pleasant to say the least.

Taste/feel: At first sip, I got a hugely bitter taste, but the more I drank it, the more balanced and complete it seemed to get. Definitely huge on the hops (spicy, earthy, even fruity) which is always key for an IPA, and the malt cuts through the bitterness quite well. I do like this beer, but at the same time, Im somewhat disappointed. The reviews on this site has it ranked among the best in the world, but its just lacking something. Im not sure what that something is, but beers like Racer 5 and Two Hearted have it ... this one doesnt. Its still a very good IPA that Id no doubt have again, but I definitely feel that its a touch overrated.

March 2013 - cold bottle on my birthday.  My 501st beer since I started recording.  The best Stone beer Ive had so far.  Like an artificial sweet with some astringent bitterness.  Mild lemon?  Not much fruit, not particularly floral either - bit of parma violets.  Im finding it hard to place the flavour.  Grapefruit is too easy a comparison.  Drying.  Reminds me of a few of the Kernel beers.  Overall, its an above average IPA.

Poured from bottle to pint glass, dark golden amber with floating particulate. One finger white head, subsided after about a minute. Not that much aroma aside from hoppy floral notes. Tasting - initial caramel notes, followed by wonderful citursy hoppy carbonation notes. After swallowing, not much lingering aftertaste noiticible. Delicious.
UPDATED: OCT 12, 2016 Pours a pale golden color with a 1 inch white frothy head. Aroma is hoppy and citrusy. Strong hop taste with pine and citrus. Dry slightly bitter finish. A very good IPA.

355 ml bottle. Clear golden amber colour, thin whte head. Aroma of malt, peaches and citrusy hops. The flavour is malty, with caramel and fruity notes, and a citrus-pine hoppy finish. Tasty and well balanced.
Bottle. Slightly hazy light copper / pale yellow color with a minimal head. Fruity aroma of peach, apricot, ginger and coriander. Medium bitter, oddly quite sweet taste. Bitter finish.

15.03.2013. 0,33l Bottle. Melkebaren, Sandnes. Golden orange colour with white head. Aoma is very strong and dominated by aromatic hops. Much bitterness, almost raw with flowers. Rich with strong bitter aftertaste. Dry mouthfeel at the end. Almost oily. Very good floral bitter flavours with soft notes of pale green spruce shoots. Ver good!!

Vibrant gold color with humongous white head. A bready floral citrus hop smell. A pretty intense bitter taste with a fair amount of grapefruit, mid to late palate is a nice yeasty, cracker, bread with a tiny bit of caramel malt. A little too intense on the bitter and lacking in the sweet but enjoyable overall. Gorgeous sticky lacing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours golden, amberish, with a big head lasting a while. Aromas of fresh hops, floral, fruity, pineapple, pine. Awesome. Taste is similar, hoppy and fresh, fruity and refreshing. Long lasting bitterness follows. This really stands out of the IPAs Ive drank this far. Great.

Best before April 30, 2013.
Appearance: The body is crystal clear with an amber hue, carbonation is showing in the body. The head is a light tan, not short or tall, with good retention. The head settles to a creamy coating covering the top.
Aroma: At first I picked up a lot of piney and grapefruit bitterness on the aroma, on second thought I get some sweet orange with floral touches, a bit of spice. Lots of hops, this is complex with good strength.
Taste: The hops take the flavor here providing an assertive grapefruit and pine bitterness with a malt base there just to balance out the bitterness. This is a classic IPA, no frills but great to drink.
Palate: Creamy body with soft carbonation.
Overall: This is a great IPA. Theres no fault I can really find in this, Im just not in love with the hop choices since I prefer a more tropical flavor. This is good though, just a bit pricey.

Bottle at Øltorget, Mathallen
Golden hazy, big white head. Smells of pine, citrus. grapefruit and nice malts. Medium sweet, quite clean, quite woody and some fruity tones in the back. Heavy bitter, resins and citrus zests. This beer is amazingly well balanced, just top class IPA

Stone IPA really hits all the sweet spots that you want in an American Style IPA. Outstanding!  I grabbed the 22oz Bomber at a nice $5 but I would recommend grabbing the six at just under $11because youre going to want more. Pours a tinge under a blood orange color with a light haze and nice bright white head. The first nosing from a tulip  was eye opening. There is a lot going on here. Just a hop lovers dream. Fresh hop and sweet grass mix with grapefruit and pineapple and theres an earthiness that really puts this over the top for me. The carbonation is assertive and delivers all of the hops throughout the palate. Really nice bitterness on the tip of the tongue and the roof of the mouth, juicy and mouthwatering under the tongue and a dry clean finish. The hops bitterness lingers perfectly in the aftertaste. Do yourself a favor keep some of this in the fridge..Its a no brainer go to!
Great all around. Aroma is pleasant, taste is spectacular with just the right amount of whoopass, a bit of a much if you have three or more.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2014 Pours hazy bright gold into a pint glass, off white lumpy head dies into body in about a minute, spotty lacing with rings, smell has pale malts and hops, some floral notes come out as the beer warms, well balanced, taste is citrus, becomes balanced well between the hops and malts; palate is medium, crisp and clean, sessionable, nothing harsh on the tongue, no aftertaste, piney and malty finish, overall, this is a mostly easy drinking IPA. Im impressed how well balanced everything is in this beer. I would have this again.

Orange-gold with a slight haze and a frothy white head. Grapefruit and pineapple aroma. Malty flavor with undertones of pine resin and tropical fruit. Solid bitterness with long pleasing finish. Excellent IPA.

12oz Bottle poured golden copper with an orange tint. You know the drill, HOPS on the nose. Very citrusy. Taste is very citrusy as well almost fruity. Has a unique flavor that I cant detect. Overall another good beer from Stone. Have Another? yeah

As the saying goes...Stone Rocks!  What a great IPA. True to their standard, Stone delivers a well balanced IPA worthy of elite status. Get Stoned!

MKH---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours orange gorgeous foam head. Lots of grapefruit and grass on nose. Taste follows very biter and dry zest

Pours a crystal clear golden color with a moderate head. Aroma is floral and piney hop aroma with malt breadiness lurking in the background. Taste is big resiny hop flavor and bitterness. Malt flavor lends sweetness but still finishes dry. Still an excellent IPA. Highly recommended.

A great IPA from a brewery that is great with all their IPAs.  This is the one I go for if I'm undecided on which Stone beer to get(or which IPA to get).

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a light copper with a medium, yellowish-brown head. Aroma is stiffly green hops. Some gooseberry, lots of grapefruit, some pine, light caramel. Saliva-inducing. Taste is resiny, bitter, dry. Pine there, some caramel. Aftertaste is a lot of pine and pith. Palate is stingy and medium. Superb and deceivingly quaffable.
A great IPA, melon citrus hop bitterness balanced by a subtle malt sweetness
Light copper appearance with a medium head.  The taste is of grapefruit with medium bitterness for an IPA.  Also has a higher malty flavor.  One of the better IPA beers.

Bottle pour into a glass. Hazy golden pour with a white head with medium lacing. Smells pine, citrus, some honey overtones. Yeah, big on hops here. Bitter, pine, grapefruit, citrus. Balanced nicely and not overwhelming at all

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2016 8/13/16 With some of the hop monsters out there, Stones ipa has become a little precious in comparison. However, its still a very solid ipa and well balanced. Good stuff.
A punch of aroma! Citrus, piney, and slight notes of peach and stone fruit. Light amber pour with a white head. Taste is citrus and strong hop flavor with a malty balance. Complex and developing flavor with a piney finish. Finishes a little dry, bitter with a smooth  lingering pine characteristic. Excellent balance & aroma. Just excellent.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Great example of a West Coast IPA. Pours a hazy gold, with moderate head. Immediate taste of resin and pine followed quickly by grapefruit bitterness and a touch of sweetness to finish it up. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smells like a home brew. Tastes great. Lots of hops, perfect American IPA. Stone is a great brewer, keep it up. Only real complaint is that it was not very well carbonated, very small head.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2013 Was very excited to try this one, amazed I was able to grab some of this in Australia. Pours a light yellow colour with a generous white fluffy head, Looks very nice. Nice hope aroma, not overwhelming but indicates a exciting beer ahead. Taste is a little different from many IPAs I have had before, has the hoppy taste with some medium bittereness but also has a little sweetness as well. Very well balanced beer, this beer certainly did not dissapiont, Top notch beer.

Pours a mostly clear light orange color, off white head. Lots of citrus, mostly grapefruit and a touch of banana on the nose. Very fruity. Taste is full bodied, lots of citrus up front, some bitter piney notes in the middle, and a bit of malt on the finish to round it out. Very well balanced beer, great example of west coast IPA.

Pours clear golden dark brown with a solid head which leaves a lacing. Aroma of caramel malts, hops light citrus, piney, resin. Beautifully balanced ale with sweet malts and a crisp bitterness. Slick mouthfeel. Great IPA
Bottle at praha, tampere. Little hazy orange color, small white head. Fruity hoppy aroma, leafs, fruits. Dry hoppy taste, fruits, hint of sweetness. Very good ipa and hoppy aftertaste.

35,5cl bottle from a trade with Cunningham. Pours slightly hazy golden with a white head. Hoppy and malty aroma with citrus and pine and hints of caramel, fruits and flowers. Sweet, malt and hoppy with a citrusy and bitter finish. Well balanced. Quite full-bodied with a bit lively carbonation. Surprisingly smooth, but with a long and bitter aftertaste with lots of citrus. Definitely a rock solid IPA and quite easy to drink. A bit too much on the sweet side, but the finish almost evens it out. Nice to finally get a sip of this - thank you, Henrik!

Pours a crystal clear gold color with three fingers of fluffy white head that hangs around and leaves good lacing. Id say this looks more like Pilsner Urquell than any other IPA Ive ever seen. Aroma is dry, resiny pine and a bit thinner than I would expect. Taste is crisp with a good balance of sweet malts and pine/citrus hops. Its good in its own right, but I expected more of a hop punch from Stone. Palate is a little bubbly and straddles the line between light and refreshing and thick and satisfying. Overall, very good, but it is a little tame for Stone and feels like its trying to be an IPA and a pilsner at the same time.

A thin head on a hazy, straw colored body.
The aroma is a wonderful grain and honey with some citrus.
The taste is a solid pine bitterness. Straight up IPA.
The texture is crisp with moderate carbonation.
Well, its one of the best IPAs out there.

Bottle from 16 Tons, Eugene. Pours a dark amber, with a moderate amount of white head. Aroma is slightly resinous, maybe just a hint of grapefruit as well. Medium body, finish is sticky sweet at the very first, then yields to a strong bitterness, complex to say the least. Not my personal all-time favorite, but I get why its so highly regarded.

Clear golden with about finger of white fluffy head. Aroma is fantastic! Hops, grapefruit, piney, dank, and some good sweetness. Taste follows the aroma almost perfect. The sweetness with the malt profile blend so great with the hops used. Nice bitterness and the piney resin left on the tongue is really nice! Overall; always a go to IPA. Cheers!

On tap at Treno. Light gold pour, white head and nice lacing. Aroma is faint citrus and and not much else. taste is citrus and piney hops with some  lemon zest and fresh bread. Medium body with lively carbonation. Probably a great summer beer, but I prefer more depth.
Nice floral smell and amber color. Really good hops balanced with malts. My first hop love. Still a really excellent IPA.

12oz bottle poured into a pint glass.  Pours clear gold with big head.  Nose is pine, citrus; taste has good malt and citrus tones.  Both bitter and sweet.  I liked this more than most Stone offerings.

Oh man. Here we go. Its rumble time. Im pouring six IPAs tonight, into two identical tulip glasses so I can compare, with this one going head to head with Two Hearted Ale by Bells. The two american IPAs, both with 100/100 on ratebeer. Damn, this ought to be fun. Stone is No 2/6, Two hearted, no 3/6. 

 This one went head to head with Titan IPA earlier and this was the conclusion: Titan is livelier than stone, stone has more of a malty background while titan is a bit more hop forward, but really tough call. Both are epic. Stone wins on aroma, really nice floral and citrus hop, but titan wins on taste. Both cases barely. As much as it pains me to say so I call a tie. You cant go wrong with either of these.

But time for the rumble. Bottle pours on each into identical tulips. Aroma of stone is nice and floral, but Two hearted wins the category. Dont get me wrong, the citrus and glorious honey and hop aroma of stone is great but it has to go up against the two hearted, and two hearteds balanced hop aroma wins. In taste Stone IPA is more hoppy, citrus and floral, but Two hearted is more balanced. Two hearted though just is so unbelievably smooth with all the citrus hops coming through still that I have to give it the category. Two hearteds finish is better as well. Im calling it for Two hearted here. Both are epic, but in a battle of heavyweights the two hearted wins. On to the next!
Excellent IPA! Slight sweetness. Hoppiness is present, but not overbearing. Stone delivers yet again.

Pours a clear, gold color with lots of white head.  Aroma is very nice and dominated by pine and citrus.  Taste follows the head and is bitter with just a hint of sweetness mixed in.  Medium bodied with a dry finish.  A very well done IPA.
Bitter to the max... no, really! :D Medium head with lacing. Amber orange. Palate little dissapointing, but still decent.  Aromas of pine, citrus, fruity... Nice "on the glass" printed bottle.

From the bottle poured a honey golden brew with a HUGH white head. Deliciously complex aromas odf grapefruit, malt,  and a hint of evergreen resine. Medium full bodied with a wondrful mix of flavors including butter, hops, malt, and a hint of honey. I likey.

Another one I cant believe I hadnt rated yet. Orangey golden with a big foamy head and lots of lacing. Pithy and resiny. Very hoppy- both bitter and dry and a little tart. Lots of hang time- not much sweetness. How I like it.
Nice awesome hop aroma.  Head that never ends... how is this possible? Taste?  Earthy hoppy good balnce with key on citrus.  I mean this really is awesome.
Great beer. Had this in the avenue pub in new orleans the first time. Lovely beer & bottle.
Pours a nice amber. Smells of pine and citrus. Has a fruity hop flavor. A long lasting bitter aftertaste.

Pours a nice clear amber colour with a thin white head leaving some lace up the glass. Aromas of pine and citrus make up majority of this beer though once it warms a little some sweet malt comes through. Flavour consists of citrus, pine, and fruity hops, bitterness is high and quite dry, some toasty notes are present, the bitterness lingers into the aftertaste without being harsh. Very well balanced IPA.

Pours light amber with white head. Great balanced aroma of hops and spices. Great hop taste without being overpowered by bitterness. Great beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a clear orangish copper with a fluffy white hat that leaves lots of sticky lace. Aroma of citrus & piney hops with a hint of malt sweetness in the background. Taste is citrus and piney hops with a hint of fruit up front that transitions into a well balanced smooth hop bitterness. Has a clean finish and hops dont stick around all day, definitely a go to ipa.
This is a great ipa. Right there with dogfish head (imo) At first the citrus flavor is a little strong. But it evens out. Nice head with strong lacing. Great tasting ipa

12pz bottle poured medium orange with white head that disappeared quickly. Nice big hoppy aroma of citrus and mild pine. Minimal malt in the nose. The flavor is very good and solid. Nice citrus hop on the fore front. Followed by some pine hop on the back end of the tongue. Very well balanced.

Great smell of hops, citus and pine. Color is a hazy orange, with a white head. Tastes of earthy hops, pine, citrus and faint malt. Palate is amazing. It has a medium mouth feel that is sufficiently carbonated and goes down very easily. Stone once again delivers, a great IPA. One of my all-time favorites right alongside Racer 5 and Firestone Walker Union Jack.

Pours a slightly hazy light golden color with a decent sized white ehad that slowly dissipates to a cap on top. Aromas of grapefruit pith, lemon zest, pine and resin with a faint bready caramel to provide a hint of balance. The flavor is sweet with light bread and caramel with a pleasant hop flavor and bite. Citrus and pine mingle in a crescendo of flavor. Medium body with a moderate level of carbonation and a sweet resinous mouthfeel. Ive had this many times before and I cant believe I hadnt reviewed it yet. Great beer, and Id drink it all the time if Stone could get it to my store before its close to or expired.

12 oz bottle.  Pours golden and clear with a frothy white foam thats sticky and lasting.  Smells like hops, herbs, flowers, fruit.  Medium body with a smooth and creamy mouth feel.  Heavy hop flavor, herbs/spices, pine, citrus, grass.  Light grainy malt sweetness with a dry finish.  Hopped up all the way through.  Good, but a bit overrated in my opinion.
Pours a golden yellow slightly clouded. Nice from the head. Citrus floral smell. Hope bitterness is good with a girly nice dry finish. All together a solid IPA.
Stone Cali - Belgique IPA: not enough hops and a hint of some fruit. Clean / smooth finish. Its a belgium beer so im still getting use to it
One of my favorite IPAs. Nice balance between strength and drinkability. Pungent citrus, pine and hops, but isnt unpleasantly bitter.

Bottle many thx to Adrian cons 2013-02-02 Göteborg
AR: citrus, lime leafes, mandarin, lychee, mangoo, should have been fresher - have been waiting fot these one (s) since 4 months
AP: high frothy steady creamy appricot coloured head
F: citrus kiss, ripe mango, wee bit sharp bubbly carbonation, grape fruit bitterness

During multiple conversations in front of the beer cooler I have heard this beer referred to as a good standard IPA. Every time i have one i think, God Damn we are spoiled. The hops start as they infiltrates your nose as you raise the glass to you mouth. Is a nice amber with a light head, its clarity is misleading to the flavor it is hiding. The hops equal part floral to bitter bite. Overall I am going have to agree with the brewery over the consumer on this one this is not a standard IPA this a definitive IPA.
Pours a bright golden with tiny, quickly diminishing head. strong citrus aroma. The taste is grapefruit all the way. Not as balanced as id prefer, but a great ipa still.

Wow. I consider myself relatively new to craft beer and thought that dogfish head IPAs were the undisputed IPA champs. This beer is damn good. Pours a nice pale amber color. STINKS of citrus and hops. You can taste amazing citrusy lemon as soon as you take it into your mouth (giggity). One of the best upset it took me so long to try this

Pours hazy straw colored with a little fluffy head. Aroma is piney and resinous hops. Taste also adds a prominent citrus note. Completely textbook but delicious. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
What to say about this beer, had in California the first time, great IPA, like all Stone products, great looking bottle, and the liquid inside, a great tasting IPA, Hoppy, citrus, pine = nice!

Pours a clear light golden color with a finger of white head and nice lacing.  Aroma of citrus and pine predominately but you can detect some sweet molasses also.  Bitterness from the hops and carbonation hit the tongue and taste buds first followed by some orange flavor and some sweetness from the malt .  Finishes with a briny bitterness that builds as you drink and a slight pepperiness.  Prickly mouthfeel from the carbonation that finishes dry.  A bit too bitter for me to drink regularly but a good beer overall.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: FEB 3, 2013 A good solid IPA. Hoppy but without being overpowering. Tastes of pine and citrus. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap. Pours hazy amber with average, creamy white head; decent retention and spare lacing. Aroma is citrus ans floral hops, orange peel, bread and cookie malt, light dank, and light pine. Flavor is fresh pine, citrus and grassy hops forward (medium bitterness) with good supporting bready malts and light citrus esters; dry finish with some lingering bitterness. Medium body and low carbonation.

Bomber.  Pours a slightly cloudy golden orange with a large fluffy white head.  Aroma of citrus, pine, and florals.  Taste is grapefruit, lemons, pine, florals, and some malt.  Very nice, hard to beat.
Cask at the Pony Bar NYC sept 2012. Clear orange beer with a small offwhite head. Caramell, hoppy, sweetish aroma. Sweet hoppy flavour. Nice smooth beer :-)
Poured out of 12 oz bottle, great hoppy malty aroma. Has a golden clear appearance. Great big hop flavor with nice carbonation that brings out the flavor even more. This is a great IPA.

2013 bottle to pint glass. Pours hazy lemon yellow with orange highlights and decent white, foamy head.  Aroma is a combination of piney and grassy hops with a lemon citrus smell and some floral.  Taste is the same piney/grassy bitterness with some bread and a little citrus.  A slight soapy quality.   Mouthfeel is fuller than expected.  Overall, the bitterness is a little to intense for my taste but a decent IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 0.335l at St Michael, Oulu. Colour is clear orange with medium white head. Aromas and flavours are citrus, fruits, caramel and hops. Easy to drink, perfect casual ipa.
Pours yellow orange.  Fantastic citrus hop aroma.   Tropical fruit an citrus hops taste.  Good bitterness, long finish.  One of my favorite go to every day ipa

Pours dark orange with a lovely hop aroma.  Excellent balance of hops to create a great tasting beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle to tulip.  Pours a crystal clear golden amber with a white head.  Aroma is of grassy and citrus hops with an undertone of caramel malts.  Taste is very much the same, with the addition of some grapefruit. The malt undertone really comes through in the taste, and balances the hops nicely. The MF is smooth and clean, a very easy drinking beer. Overall this is a great readily available IPA.

Kaatuu lasiin oranssinruskeana, pohjalla oleva olut näyttää jopa valkoiselta (johtuisiko tuopista?), vaahdon ollessa tiivis ja niukka. Haju on vahvan hedelmäinen ja puumaisen humaloitu, havuinen ja hyvin raikas. Maku on pihkainen, havuinen, ruohoinen, kukkainen, yrttinen sekä lievän hedelmäinen ja karamellinen. Suutuntuma on keskitäyteläinen ja hieman katkera. jopa yllättävän kevyt jenkki-IPAksi. Kokonaisuutena helposti juotava ja poikkeava jenkki-IPA, mutta sopi kyllä meikäläiselle (vaikka humalapommiin olinkin varautunut).

Poured a lovely light copper with a one finger head that disappeared quickly.

I really wanted to see what notes this beer would release if I let it sit and warm up for a few minutes. This turned out to be a good idea.

Aroma: Immediate hops, grapefruit on the front; warmth reveals pineapple, passion fruit, papaya, light malty finish.

Taste: BITTER, right into tropical fruits, light maltiness, then into a lingering hoppy, crisp, bitter, astringent, maybe a little spicy or cereal finish.

I was finally able to sit down with this one for a review. Quite a tasty West Coast type IPA; I was pleasantly surprised with the tropical fruit aromas and flavors, but this batch, at least, tends to stay on the bitter side. Definitely something to keep around the house.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2013 My go to IPA. Nice golden color with a noticeable white head. Loads of hops on the nose and palate - the way only Stone knows how. Somewhat unbalanced but a fantastic brew none the less.
Great balance all the way through, my go-to IPA when I feel the need for some serious hoppiness in my day.

12 oz bottle
appearance: slightly translucent gold, thin white head
aroma: piney hops, slightly sweet, floral, grapefruit
taste: balanced hops, grapefruit with slight sweetness, gives a balanced experience, hops arent overbearing
palate: slightly oily
bottle pour. great value on this IPA since the nose and flavors are just what the doctor ordered for this style and it wont break the bank to buy these either.
Citrus aroma. Copper color. Perfect ballance of bitter hops and citrus. Great ipa.

Thick head. Crisp taste with no overly hoppy after taste. Great floral aroma.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very crisp dry ipa. Flavors of caramel, floral hops and pine. Clean aftertaste and great carbonation.

Aroma is very hoppy. Pours golden color with thick head. Starts smooth with a hoppy, dry finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at a local bar. Nice copper color. Citrus in the aroma and flavor, but doesnt beat you up with excessive hop bitterness. More balanced than many in the style, which is confusing coming from the brewery that brings Ruination and Arrogant Bastard to the table.

Golden colour with thin-medium head. Beautiful aroma of grapefruit, caramel and grassy notes. Thin oily body. Lovely balanced taste. A bitter finish complements the malt sweetness perfectly. Nothing in this beer is overdone, yet it still packs so much character.
Minimial aroma, light color, overall very smooth for a good ipa. Great tasting hoppiness without an overwheling bitterness

Excellent IPA with consistent hoppy flavor from taste through finish. Lots and lots of hops without losing it's drinkability. Alcohol can come through too strongly at times, particularly when beer is at lower temperatures, but never ruins what is otherwise a very enjoyable beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Really enjoyed this IPA. Had it on draft most recently which was superior to the times Ive had it in a bottle. Floral, almost hibiscus on the nose with a super bright bitter hop finish. A great IPA.

Spicy black peppet nose. Brief dead zone in the aroma department before the spiciness returns accomplanied by an orangy liquor nose. Foamy fluffy white headon top of yellow golden glow.
Very hop forward with long firm bitter development through the middle palate and to the end with a long and strong finish. Supportive body, not heavy, but balanced and porportional.
On tap at taphouse westmont.  Lots of bitter hops.  Slightly pine and dank.  Nothing else in the aroma.  Very bittter for a single ipa.  Lingering bitter ness.  Very close to the ruination.

The smell is a lot of citrus and pine, slightly yeasty. This pours light orange/yellow with a white head.  Tastes great, it starts and finishes with a consistently hoppy dryness. The flavors are typical; slightly hoppy, piney with citrus overtones (lemon). A solidly brewed IPA with an enjoyable consumption experience.

Pours an amber color with medium head and great lacing. Aromas of pine, citrus, grass cuttings, and a little musty. Taste is pine, lemon zest, and a little spice with a nice malty backbone. There is a density to the taste that is hard to describe. Finish is dry with citrus zest.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2014 Pours a clear gold with huge, lasting head that leaves awesome lacing.  Aroma is fresh with sweet honey malts and floral hops.  Taste is clean, crisp up front into a pleasantly bitter pine resin middle, with a small amount of malt to balance in the end.  Nothing mind-blowing, just a solid IPA.  This was 6 weeks prior to "drink by" date.  Ive had much older iterations of this, and it does not age well.   The fresher the better with this one.
Pours a dark yellow gold with off-white head with good retention and lacing.  Aroma is excellent - floral, citrus, honey, and just a slight bit of malt.  Taste is dominated by hops, pine, grapefruit, bitter.  Medium texture.  After being in your face briefly, it is very tolerable afterwards and leaves clean and crisp.  Shares many good attributes with Stones Ruination DIPA, but in a (relatively) more laid back format - more casual & sessionable.  Although I might prefer the Ruination head-to-head, this is a top-notch IPA and has its place in the world. 9+4+9+4+17=4.3

Bottle. Pours a clear gold with medium white head. Lots of hops in the aroma: citrus, pine, resin.  Flavor is also dominated by hops, creating a nice complexity.  Big dose of bitterness in the finish.  I see what all the fuss is about.

Hazy golden colour with a big frothy white head. Good lacing. Rich citric hoppy and mild fruity aroma. Full body. Balanced sweetness and a rich bitterness that did not kill everything else in the flavour. Rich citric hoppy and mild fruity flavour.[Bottle from Systembolaget in Strömstad, Sweden]

Had this many times but never rated. Top 5 iPas and top 5 beer I ever had.  Goes down smooth and no aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle Pours a dark yellow some off white head. Smells tastes of citrus grapefruit pine resin bitter. Good stuff damn good beer.

If you want a great IPA That proves to be very sessional.  This is definitely the one for you well-made!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2013 Pours semi-murky gold with large white head, which lingers but has pretty lacing.
Aroma is strong floral scent, with pine and citrus hops, very pungent. Pollen and honey scents. 
Tastes of grapefruit and orange, some subtle pine, with earthy tones like flower pedal and twig. Full bitterness that lingers on the tongue for seconds after. Some presence of malt with caramel and butter. 
As with all stone brews the palate is perfect, full and silky mouth feel, with carbonation, but not too much carbonation (other breweries brew india pales too carbonated).
Overall, the best brew Ive ever had.

Really fruity IPA, the hop taste is really pleasant, its an easy drinking IPA, I could drink a dozen of this during an evening, its a simple beer, really good, I really enjoyed this IPA. The smell of the hops is also really cool.

Keg. Opaque honey coloured beer with a decent finger of bubbles. Honey and marmalade nose. IBU POW! All kinds of fruit bitters in my mouth, tangerine, orange, mango, lemon, lime, more marmalade. Surprisingly balanced though and leaves a nice tasty bitter on the palate to enjoy well after the beer has gone.

12 oz bottle poured into a standard pint glass.  Pours a pale yellow, slightly cloudy but not much, with a tiny off white head.  Good lacing.  Smells of grapefruit, citrus, lemons and pine.  Tastes of grapefruit, pine, and lemons.  Not a lot of malt here.  Mouthfeel is medium to thin with a drying finish.  Good bitterness without being overpowering.  Tastes like 2 row with "c" hops.  Good beer but I would like more of malt background.

I cant believe I havent rated this yet.  Pours a slightly hazy golden with a head that is just a bit off white.  Aroma is strong, with grapefruit, pine, orange, and lemon.  It is pretty much what you are looking for in an IPA.  The taste continues in the traditional method for this style.  It has plenty of pine and grapefruit, lots of hops, and is bitter.  It is medium bodied with a thick texture.  Despite this, I find this actually to be very crisp and refreshing.  It is a wonderful contrast here.  It feels very "clean" when drinking.  Overall, this is a very, very good IPA.  They did everything well here and you cant go wrong.
UPDATED: DEC 9, 2012 Great beer for a dinner.  Not too heavy and has a really good after taste.
Bottle->SA glass. Golden with fluffy white head. Aroma of hops, citrus, conifer.  Taste is perfectly balanced hops, herbs, and citrus.  A go-to IPA.

Positively glows golden with a nice foamy head. Plenty of resiny hops on the nose. The hops make their presence known pretty quickly, the caramel malt quickly gives way to the hops that take you to the finish. Medium bodied.

Aroma: Sharp, extra hoppy, extra herbal, floral (somewhat like unripe olives), piny and citrusy. Fantastic.

Mouthfeel: A solid, smooth body and medium carbonation going on.

Taste: Very very bitter, citrusy (lime, grapefruit) and fruity (a combination of peach and pineapple, maybe?). Solid malt background to make this beer round and complete. 

Finish: Long lasting strong bitterness and zesty tang. I love it.

Overall: Top beer.

Small head I think. Sweet dry Well balanced. Slight bitterness. Great brew.

Enjoy by date January 2013 poured into pint glass at burger bar in Las Vegas. Pours a clear honey like color. Scent is pine and  citrus. Taste follows. Nice and crisp with a bitter finish. Could easily follow this up with a couple more. Solid IPA.
Hazy blond. Quite a floral and citrusy IPA with a strong bitter finish.

Pours yellow with a white head. Aromas of grapefruit, pine, peach, slight bread. Taste is juicy grapefruit, minty herbal, orange, hint of mango, with some caramel sweetness hiding at the end. A medium bodied, juicy IPA. Very good.

Bottle; A IPA with a great selection of hops which work in harmony.  It was light on the palate yet boasted an enjoyable hoppy flavor with a distinct sweetness and a great aftertaste.  One of the better IPAs that Ive had.
Bottle: Poured a orange amber with a white cream head. Aroma is fresh hops. Taste is a nice fresh hops up front with a soothing grain and malt.

Pours a nice cloudy golden with small head. Smell is pine and lemon citrus zest. Taste follows with piney hops and strong fresh lemon presence. Crisp IPA with slick medium mouthfeel. Good carbonation. Very nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pale gold pour, big white creamy head.  Nose of solid, rounded hops.  Bitter on the tongue.  Balanced sweet malt in the middle, accompanied by firm hop assertiveness.  Pleasantly bitter finish.  Nice work!
Bottle.  Pine and grapefruit peel aroma.  Hazy golden yellow with nice head.   Sweet orange and strong bitter grapefruit peel and pine flavor.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2016 Big, bold, hoppety-hoppy, resinous - I get it: it sets the standard for initiating old-world tastebuds to West-Coast IPA zesty-bitterness with the subtlety of a forced skydive. Expertly brewed, inspiring awe but not overzealous amounts of affection in my Belgian-for-balance-educated palate. // Rerate as Stone Berlin IPA, 33cl Dose canned JUN2016: not the most aroma-forward of IPAs, mainly foamy proteins, wet pine and even a whiff of alcohol, really. well-dosed layers of mainly pine and woodbark, pith and fruit rinds in taste against a condensed pale malt base. The bitterness outlasts the lustre...update recipe 2.0?
Tap at Pivni York, aroma is certainly hoppy but a bit disappointed with taste. IMHO not nearly hoppy enough. Saying that would still have again.
Tap. Clear orange with nice white head. Smells citrusy. Tastes caramelly with nice citrus. Nice long bitter finish. Solid IPA.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2015 Light yellow, hazy, loose white foam.
Medium body and  moderate in flavor, which however becomes intense but  coarse in the aftertaste, long on palate. Bitter, dry, unbalanced. 
Hoppy, resiny, lemony, with an abundant malt background. 
Very unbalanced, which wastes all the flavor that it otherwise has.
golden pour wit h  small white head. Aroma of resin, Subdued pine and loads of caramel. taste is full caramel with nice bitter hoppyness. Well balanced, with a slightly bitter finish.

Tap to tulip
Strong pine, flowers and a bit of grapefruit, kind of what was expected. Appearance is a clear sparkling amber with little head. Taste is all hop bitterness with a tinge of middling sweetness. A little alcohol burn at the end.

Bottle poured into snifter glass.  Hazy amber-ish yellow color with white head.  Aroma of grass/citrus hops with sweet malt behind.  Taste is citrus hops bitterness, more fruity then expected with hints of floral and grass, balanced by a light caramel malt background.  Palate is dry yet creamy.  Pretty good!

Bottle at Mandalay.
Lots of hops aroma, citrus, grass, very nice.
Hazy yellow white head.
Medium sweetness in taste lots bitternes and even though it is ibu 70+ it is not to much, thg for dry hopping ;).
real nice ipa.

Pours a slightly dark golden color with a nice foamy head. Aroma is sweet and strongly floral. Flavor is...whoah baby. Crisp and hoppy.  A sweet floral bouquet with a hint of spicy. Oh man. This is one of the best IPAs on the planet.

12oz bottle. Pour was a hazy orange with a finger of off-white head that took some time to disappear. The aroma is fantastic. Notes of apricot, grapefruit and tropical fruits. Mouth....where do I begin. Delicious! The fruitiness hits the palette right away with a mild hop bite. Grapefruit and apricot through to a somewhat dry finish. Good lacing. Very tasty.

Big tropical fruits w/citrus- a touch of sweet malt underneath.  Nice fruity flavor - grapefruit, guava and finishes with orange and citrus .  Nice hop bitterness but not overpowering - an often overlooked fantastic west coast IPA in SoCal -  great beer.

This is an awesome IPA!  Cant help but give it a perfect score as it embodies everything I like about an IPA.  Big bold hops in the aroma and flavor, great pour, great head.  Great start and great finish.  The middle is off the charts!
0,33l bottle @ Cardinal. Pours golden with a white head. Not as much citrus punch as I was hoping for, but still a great ale! Well balanced and great drinkability!

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2012 Bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger, Norway. Pours a hazy orange colour with a small white head. Fantastic aroma of pineapple, green apples, citrus and some raisins. Flavour is mostly oriented around pineapple and peach. Amazing balance and body. Smooth mouthfeel. The best IPA I?ve ever tasted!
UPDATED: MAR 1, 2013 Among my favorite common IPAs. Nuce balance of hops and taste. Skunky aroma up front but surprisingly smooth. Bit of a raw aftertaste after a couple though.

12 oz bottle. Pours an almost clear, golden straw with a short lasting white head. Taste is caramel, cereals, slightly fruity. Finish is all citrus, grapefruits, lemon. Some touch of herbal by the end. Grows on you, builds up as the bottle goes. Medium bodied. Very good IPA.
Great aroma and taste.  Initial bitterness is refreshing and the beer holds its flavor to the bottom of the glass.

Una de las razones por las cuales cruzar de México a Estados Unidos el mejor IPA que he probado sin contar el de fullers, mi primo dice que Ruination es muchas veces mejor, así que espero probarlo algún dia.

355ml bottle.
Pours a medium straw, with a white head.
Hoppy, herbal aroma, spruce, grass, apricot, resin, passion fruit, grapefruit, marmalade.
Dry, medium bodied, high bitterness, creamy CO2.
Hoppy, floral taste, spruce, grass, grapefruit peel, malt, apricot, light caramel.
Ridiculously drinkable. (2012-10-19)

From Tap: poured a clear amber/copper color with little head. Aroma was fruity hop followed by malt. Taste was sweet malt with a balance of hop bittering. Not overloaded with hops. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A good hoppy beer. After having many of these they lose the "aw appeal" and taste overproduced.
Keg at Port Street Beer House; Glorious west coast IPA had a pint of this bit over the top but worth it great citrus to hop balance some caramel resinous mouthfeel I want some.

Pours a clear golden amber from the bottle, aroma is a balance of hops with a whiff of maltiness, and the balance follows through on the flavor. Crisp, delicious IPA that for all its bitterness, is not overpowering in bitterness but instead the perfect offset to the malt.  This would be the beer to give someone who was turned off on IPAs due to an overhopped example,  Probably my favorite IPA of those that are widely available.
Bottled. Poured dark yellow in colour with a whitish frothy head. Pine, exotic fruits, bready malts and sweet toffee in aroma. Flavour is lemon, biscuits and grassy hops. Decent brew this one.

Pours a clear yellow with a creamy white head. Aroma is a nice, non-bitter hop. Flavor is excellent with citrusy hops and a solid malt profile. Overall a very.nice.IPA, especially considering the price

12 oz bottle. Pours cloudy golden orange with thin lacey head. Aroma is bright citrus and floral hops. Taste is sharp bitter piney hops initially, with the malts really taking a back seat. Clean, crisp flavor with the hop profile of a much bigger beer. Simple, outstanding IPA.
Perfect score? I enjoyed it but Im sure there is better out there.  It was crisp and bitter. On with the search for the perfect beer...

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2014 Ljus bärnstensfärgad vätska. Djup och intensiv doft av gran, tall och kåda. Underbart humlebett som möts av en avvägd sötma. Lång efterbeska. Bättre än så här blir inte en standard-IPA.
Quite possibly the perfect beer! Citrusy crisp hops and nice malty undertones. I try to pick up a six pack weekly. Not widely available in Ny unfortunately.
Pours a clear orange-gold with a moderate white head.  Aroma of pine.  Properly bitter, lively, good body.  A very good, classic, hoppy IPA.

The hops in the aroma, just mutes anything else. You can really tell that this beer has been dryhopped to the max. Clear golden amber color, big offwhite head, with good retention. The taste is also very citrusy and hoppy, beyond that, it really doesnt give me too much of an experience.

The gold standard of American IPA -- or of anything else.  Pours pale gold and translucent, with a rich aroma.  Taste is full of hop bitterness but not overwhelming, very clean and dry with noticeable citrus and pine throughout.  Finishes just as it started, with no bitter aftertaste.  Hard to get much better than this.
Draft. Pours hazy orange with white head. Nose and taste of grassy hops, caramel bread, resin and bitter orange peel. Medium body.

The color is a cloudy, dark yellow with an average head.  The smell is strong, grassy hops, orange zest, and a little bit of bread.  The flavor is strong and bitter.  Uncompromising.  Even Stones bottom rung IPA (I assume) is ballsier and more solid than the average IPA.  Stone just cannot fail.

22 oz. bottle. Pours a slightly hazy light orange with a medium, off-white head. The lacing is thick and clings solidly to the glass. The aroma is strong resin, caramel, bitter orange peel, and grass. The flavor is very bitter, from the beginning, well into the aftertaste. The palate is medium, sticky, astringent, but surprisingly crisp and clean in the finish. Overall, this is a very strong and hoppy IPA, but it is still approachable, with a good flavor and nice mouthfeel.

Clear golden with a l-o-o-o-n-g lasting white head and bands of lace.  This may be the only IPA Ive sampled that actually smelled delicious: caramel mixed 50/50 with hops.  The taste is strong hops, of course, but somehow, Stone never gives up the malt entirely.  A beautiful balance in a great tasting brew.  Highly recommended.

Pretty much the IPA to which I compare all others.  Light enough to be a very nice meal accompaniment and full enough to warm me up by itself.

Great aroma and taste, theres always one in my fridge.
Lovely example of the style.  Richly hopped yet not overly sweet.  Did lack a bit of vibrancy in the carbonation.

All around outstanding IPA.  Really incredible aroma: sweet grapefruit, slight pine, strong caramel/sweet butterscotch malt character.  Really bitter and dry
: grapefruit is much sharper, along with pine and resin.  Caramel moves more to the back ground - not necessarily great balance but I enjoy it a lot.  Crystal clear amber with a fantastic, long lingering foamy/creamy white 1 finger head.  This and arrogant bastard should be in my fridge forever - so consistently solid.
bottle. deep golden with small head. textbook example of west coast ipa. awesome hops with both pine and grapefruit/citrus.

Gold, lightly clouded with hop oils, very little yeast sediment, thin white head.  Aroma is leafy/floral hops with appetizing bread and sweet grain/hay.  It is in the flavor the the pine and evergreen come out along with moderate floral notes, and light sap/grapefruit.  Medium-light body, and rather dry for the style- crisp.  Delightful.  Up there with my favorites; the hops bitterness and the pine resin may be a bit much to be in my top 3 though.
100/100? Really? Its good, better than the usual mega caramel malt US ipas cause less caramel. The 2nd 100 has value, but the 1st Id argue against.
UPDATED: SEP 6, 2012 If you like IPA?s this one you will love. Just remember you get what you pay for, it?s well worth the price. A full bodied IPA, that?s hop heaven but well balanced.
Very good IPA and another homerun from Stone. A little on the expensive side but I never have a problem paying for quality. Like most other stone beers, I could easily drink this every day.

Nice golden color. Has a strong after hoppy taste that last awhile,but as a hop head I enjoy that. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Lockview. Pours a hazy orange color with a lacy white head. Aroma of caramel and citrus hops, possibly cascade. Tastes of pine, grapefruit, some malt biscuit and sweetness as it warms. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Stone makes good beers, this is one of many.

Double dry hopped IPA pours yellow with good head and lots of sticky lacing. Nose of citrus hops with a pine/earthy note. Taste is smooth cause its from a cask but it has loads of malt flavor with a gentle bitter mouth. Very good 6.9% in 16oz pint glass on cask at Smiths Billiards 8/29/12.

From a 33cl bottle purchased at total wine in McLean Virginia. Pours a nice light amber with creamy head. Aroma of grapefruit. Taste of citrus 
And new mown lawn. Quite a bitter aftertaste. An excellent ipa.

Aroma of pine, hops, and citrus spices.  Almost dark orange in color, nice thick, white head that lasts.  Tiny hint of malt up front...then flooded with a nice balance of hops, some notes of citrus, bitter finish that lasts.  If you like hops..youll like this.

Basunen: Ölet är enbart en dryg månad gammalt. Stor fruktig doft av apelsin och grapefrukt. Smaken är fruktig och väldigt humlig. Lång eftersmak. Mycket gott.

Aroma: gorgeous note of grain an hops, the closest thing you will you get to walking through fields of the stuff.

Appearance: Bright Amber whit head

Taste: Massive hops that slowly mellow out in to the very definition of an IPA, bitter and floral with a more sweet finish

Palate: Substantial in all regards, a nice long finish

Overall: Do you like beer? Yes? Have you found this one? Yes? Why are you not buying it?

Clear yellow with small white foam head. Aroma is hoppy like an IPA should be. Taste is nice bitter, with some sweet tones. Nice long bitter aftertaste. A good IPA, but not a oompf IPA. (Houston 201208)
A great IPA. Low AA hops (guessing) because nose has a little more umph to it (vs. hoppy body...mmmm...hoppy body). Caramel, typical ale yeast. Just an enjoyable beer. Would recommend!

nice color and aroma. color is a cloudy orange with minimal head and lacing. taste has a just over slightly bitter aftertaste which hinders the drinkability of the beer. the mouth feel is sharp. a good beer but i have had better.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2013 Bottle .Pours a golden orange yellow with off white head with medium lacing.  Aroma is moderate to heavy floral, grass, citrus, skunky, moderate caramel. A classic. Yellow, golden orange colour. Aroma of pine, guave and hoppy goodness. Taste is grapefruit, orange, pineapple and more pine and hops. Delicious.

Ah yes, an old favorite. Served in a Duvel tulip. Pours a hazy yellow orange with a finger of off white head and ok lacing. Aroma is pine, guava, orange, and caramel. Taste is grapefruit, tangerine, lemon, caramel, pineapple, and passion fruit. Mouthfeel is velvety and smooth. Awesome IPA.
I dont need to tell you this is a good beer. Smell the hops, taste the hops, enjoy the hops.

Overall a very nice beer.  Very good taste, nice body, and a presentation.  Would recommend trying.

clear golden with foamy white head - aroma of bread and grapefruit/pine - first taste is a rich brown sugary malt followed by peppery hops, grapefruit, orange and then followed by a lingering sweet malt.
A clear golden colored beer, with a white head. The aroma of fruits like citrus and orange, very hoppy. The taste of fruits with a pleasant hop bitter. The aftertaste is fruity with gentle bitter.

Ok, stone ipa needs no "description" if you havent had it yet your missing out. This is a "staple" beer in our fridge. For nights like tonight where new belgians super cru didnt satisfy me, I pull out a stone ipa and it totally redeems my night!!

Really the only thing I dont like about Stone IPA is that it isnt Stone Ruination IPA. Well balanced, bitter (far more so than a lot of IPAs you see out there), widely available, and generally delicious. This sets the standard for IPAs.

On tap sampler at Old Dominion Brewhouse in Hyattsville, MD.

From a bottle to an ordinary glass. A bit of a disapointment (Had very high expectations). Quite nice but not extraordinary. But a isxpack in us for 12 bucks (80 Skr). In the most famous chain of pubs in Sweden they charge You 128 SKr (18 USdollar) per bottle!! Thats robbery!
22oz. bottle. Golden yellow pour. Decent hoppy nose. Very good representation of the style.

22 oz bottle pours a slightly hazy golden color with moderate white head but not much lacing. Smell is full of citrus and piney hops.  Aroma is pretty much the same,  Taste is sweet at first when the malts kick in, but has a pleasant bitter dry finish.  Medium body with lively carbonation.  This is how an IPA should be made.

I had to drop the overall rating from 19 to 18 cause I couldnt put this one over Dogfish Head; though this one is as close as they come.  Great, smooth, hoppy beer, just not quite as complex as the previously mentioned.
Pours a bit hazy orange with low head. Aroma is hops and some fruits. Pine too. Dry flavor is hops and pine and grapefruit. Nice ipa.
gold blond coloured body with a white head a spicy fruity hoppy aroma a spicy hoppy fruity dry sweet bitter taste with a alcholic bitter finish

Bottle. Golden yellow without much head our lace. Classic sweet aromas odd grapefruit mango and pine. Sweat biscuit malt on those flavors with now resin and spiciness.  Clean sticky mouthfeel.  Justified classic.
Clear yellow with white head. Aroma is hoppy, fruity and piny. Flavour is piny, grassy, fruity, bitter and a bit sweet.
Well balanced IPA - floral, citrus, hops, bitter finish.  This is the definition of an IPA.  Id put this right along side Bells Two Hearted, Founders Cent. IPA.  All unique and very good.

The appearance is slightly hazy and light orange in color. The head is a half inch thick and leaves a formidable sheet of lacing throughout the glass. The aroma is bold, with hops soaked in alcohol being the dominant scent. The flavor is very enjoyable and hop forward, with subtle citrus notes. The finish is quite bitter (in a positive sense) and has a warming alcohol sensation to cap the whole thing off. Overall, a very good IPA.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-02-2011

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2013 Pours a clear gold nice white thick head. Aroma is citrucy hops and florals. Taste is grapefruit hops with a nice sweet malt backbone. Very nice balanced ipa with a perfect mouth feel and some lingering hop bitterness.
Pours clear golden with a low head. Aroma is malts and fruits. Flavor is malts, fruits and plenty of hops. Pretty nice.
This is great, but it is one dimensional in flavour, which is a knock on most beers. This is all bitter, no malt, no citrus, just bitter. Its great for what it is.
Nice head, good lacing, very hoppy aroma, bitter, enjoyed from tap.  Not an over powering IPA.
Pours a clear golden/peachy colour. Very hoppy and fresh smelling and tasting. Lots of pine needles and floral notes. A touch of sweetness..but mostly its bracingly bitter. Excellent!
UPDATED: AUG 3, 2012 Draft at Sugarmoms. Light gold pour with a slim fizzy head. Medium strong hop flavors. Clean taste but otherwise unexceptional. Smooth finish.

Pours from the tap a slightly hazy orange with a thick white head. Aroma of hops with some malt sweetness. Now for an IPA, the body was good and the sweet malt provides a good base. The piney and citrus hops were strong but not overwhelming. Finish is dry and the bitterness dwindled quickly. Overall, a better IPA.
Taken from old notes. Nice citrusy nose. Taste is very balanced with just enough malt sweetness. Bitter finish. Very drinkable beer.

On tap at Flying Saucer in KC.  Pours a clear golden orange with a thick white head and nice lacing.  Aroma is pine, citrus, and fruity.  Taste is bitter with pine and citrus with some sweetness in the middle.  Excellent IPA.

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2012 Gold with a light orange hue.  Nice white "creamy" head that has great sticky lacing.  Lemon grass, pine, and obviously a hoppy aroma.  Not very bitter, more balanced than expected given the IBUs.  Leaves a wet taste in the mouth, which is welcoming given that most IPA are on the dry side. This is a stalwart IPA.

0.355/angleterre. Orange, minimal haze. Quite a lovely citrus, floral aroma. Some currants or gooseberries. Bitter, dry, medium light body. Long finish. Caramel found on palate. Excellent product. UPDATED: SEP 3, 2015 BB 31/08/15. Poured a crystal clear golden amber colour with a one-finger white foamy head that retained very well and laced OK. Aroma of citrus/grapefruit, a hint of pine and a hint of grass. Taste of subtle sweet malt followed by grapefruits with a sharp tangy bitterness. Light to medium body. a lovely IPA this, served from the fridge @ brewdog glasgow. probably a bit over chilled as had a real orange haze about it. nice grassy hop nose and smooth drinking. nice balance. a fine IPA

Special cask pour at Lord Hobo bunged on 7/20/12 served in a shaker. Dark golden pour with a thick but airy white foam head. Strong citrus and floral hop aroma. Taste is lemon, lime, and mandarin orange. Flowers and a bright lavender  soap follow. A littlest mouthfeel than the standard recipe but still decent bodied. This is remarkably delicious. Earlier Rating: 4/6/2009 Total Score: 4.3Ever since I fist tried the Stone IPA years ago, this has been one of my favorite beers.  I dont drink it too often but every time I do I am always blown away by the complexity of the flavor.  The color is golden with tiny bubbles.  The head looks like a soft meringue that refuses to go away.  Aroma floral and citrus hops with a little bit of malt.  There are many layers of flavor in the glass, all perfectly balanced.  First comess floral hops then bread/malt which fades into a delicious bitterness.  This is far from the hop-water that most IPAs are characterized by.
One of the best IPAS I have had. Light aroma, cloudy appearance, not to hoppy . Very clean taste!!!

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2016 On tap at Cafe Sara, july 5th 2016. Clear goldne body with a medium white head. Aroma is grassy with resin and citrus, taste is grassy, caramel, bread, bitter. Dry hoppy finish with grass and pine.
UPDATED: AUG 25, 2012 Drank this beer for a second time at melting pot out of a bottle but poured into a glass. Very solid IPA
Bottle pours coppery with foamy white head. Citrus, pine, caramel. Moderately sweet. Long tail bitterness. Full-bodied. A good IPA if you dont want to taste anything for a couple of hours.

Pours a ripe copper color with a one finger head that laces and dissipates quickly. Juicy peach pineapple aromas lead into a bit of sweet malts and a touch of booze.  On the palate its fresh juicy but balanced out nicely with mid palate caramel malts and lingering bitterness that jumps on for the finish.  Quality in a bottle at a pretty good value.
Great color. Smoother initial HP flavor followed by crisp hop after notes. Smooth flavorful yet light body

Tasted: draft at Stokesay Castle , Reading , Pa. Orange, yellow color. Solid 2 finger head that lasts. Aroma of grassy hops and some citrus fruit. A very pleasant hoppy aroma. Taste is awesome. Starts with the citrus flavor ( apricot, pineapple) and moves to the light caramel of the body. Finishes with a grassy/ piney hop with a touch of lasting citrus. This beer is mega hopped but balanced nicely. Medium body and carbonation. The various hops work well together. A hoppy muddle masterpiece. Great beer.

I was excited for this one, as it was something I considered a classic IPA. Poured a beautiful golden color and gave that hopsy smell I love. Had a sip, wasnt disappointed, but not blow off my feet either. A good IPA, but nothing to go wild over. A smooth drink, that I would buy again, but not get too excited about.

Bottle @ Tre Små Rum, Gothenburg. At last: a classic top rankin American that Ive been trying to get my paws on for a while! Great joy! :-) Pours a hazy deep yellow-orange body with a medium white head. Aroma is quite simply marvellous: peaches, red berries, fresh grass, apricot, hints of lemon zest and pine. Fresh, balanced, fruity and lovely: few IPAs have this kind of natural aromatic beauty! Taste, fortunately, follows suit: delicious fruity tones of apricot, peaches, super-smooth light caramel malts in the back with some mild syrup and pine. A bit of fresh grass and melon in the finish, with just the right bitterness, leaving me wanting more more more. Smooth body with medium carbonation. Holy Madonna, this is damn near perfection! :-D

Pours a nice gold with medium head. Wonderful aroma with hints of citrus. Nice malt balance and hops are just right. Leaves nice taste afterwards. One of my favorite IPAs.

Cerveza con muy buen aroma, donde destacan principalmente aromas a citricos (Fuertemente cascara de naranja), maltas y hierbas a raíz del lupulo utilizado.

La apariencia es la de una verdadera IPA. Amarillo palido con destellos color oro, cuerpo y carbonatación media, corona de espuma ligera y adherente.

En boca es suave, carboanatada y con un toque seco y amargo.

Al paladar, y conforme el liquido recorre por la garganta, este se disfruta más.  Las notas principales son amargas, aun que de buen sabor, agradable y totalmente disfrutable, con un final citrico de intensidad media

En general una IPA muy agradable, en el cual, y como buena representante del estilo es amarga, pero los finales citricos le dan una estructura elegante y un sabor sumamente agradable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The logo for this San Diego brewery is a gargoyle, those eerie stone creatures one sees perched along the roofs of great cathedrals, where they serve as rain spouts. Why? This is unimportant; what is important is that Stone produces great craft brew; this IPA is one of the best.

It begins in a luxuriant froth, spongy and shimmering, and slowly subsides beneath the glass rim, forming a sudsy crown atop a cloudy pool of gold. The nose detects faint whiffs of apple supplemented by myriad notes of butter. 

However, the action occurs on the palate; there is an initial citrus explosion, containing various shards of lime and orange, which fades in a quick, but intense, bitterness provided by the generous dry hopping. Pleasant well-balanced mouthfeel brings to close a satisfying quaff and an important reminder of how great craft brew should taste. Still, you gotta love them gargoyles.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2013 Bottle that has to be fresh. 12 oz. Pours a slightly hazy orange, with a tall, frothy, rich snowy white head. Aroma of frash dry hops, lemon zest, grapefruit, oranges, and herbal/grassy notes. Intensely full body, especially for an IPA, with a tangy, moderately funky palate. Crisp, bitter, ever-so-slightly dry finish. Excellent IPA from Stone.

Poured cleared orangey with a foamy, irresistible, off-white head.  Smells of pine cones, sauerkraut, cardboard and fish oil. Tastes of hops, light candi sugar, paper, and fir tree bark. Not very much citrus detected in this one; a shame but still a pleasant experience nonetheless.
Fruity aroma with a hint of caramel. color is orange fairly see through.  Sweety flavor with minimal hoops finish.  Very drinkable but not smoothing too special.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2013 12oz bottle. Light hazy orange pour with frothy white head. Aroma of tropical fruits - mango and pineapple primarily - some pine resin, bitter citrus fruit, grapefruit, spruce, slightly sweet caramel. Poured a hazy orange color with a medium-sized white head.  Pine in the aroma with some spruce and lots of citrus.  Body is very flavorful with lots of orange and citrus. First sip begins with banana and bubble yum bubble gum followed by citrus and palatable hop bitterness on the smooth finish.  Perfect balance of subtle sweet and bitter notes linger in the mouth and throat.  Wondefully drinkable, balanced, flavorful IPA.

Keg @ The Euston Tap. Deep amber orange with a big white head. The nose is filled with mango, pinapple, seagrass and wood. Hoppy indeed. The taste is medium bitter, some sweet juicy hop notes. Plenty of tropical fruit with a sugary sweet finish. Nicely balanced, hop-forward indeed, but not overly so. Overall, a very nice IPA. I can only imagine how good it is when super fresh.
