Pleasant, mild hop bitterness and reasonable malt backbone. A little thin on the body but overall this is really nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Mild aroma compared to most ipas. Flavor is nothing to write home about. Hazy brown orange hue. Its an IPA and thats about it.
Bottle. Pours hazy golden medium white head. Floral, citrus, pine. Mild sweet citrus taste. Medium body, average carbonation, medium bitter finish. Very good IPA.
Pours a lovely golden brown with clean white head. Aroma is a citrus and pine, hops way out front. Taste is all of the hops, with a nice clean finish. Solid west coast IPA.
Classic American hops on the nose. A strong resinous bitterness coupled to a delicate and balanced citrus note. Quite oily but it retains a lovely balanced quality.

12oz bottle poured into tulip glass.  Enjoy by 05.07.12 date
Aroma:  Getting hardly anything here.  a tiny bit of lemongrass and citrus hops.  some malt and caramel.  floral hops as well 
Appearance: light yellowish orange color, very clear and a little bit of stark white head that faded quickly.  doesnt lace glass.  very few bubbles rising
Taste: medium sweet, mild sour, mild bitter.  maltiness comes out here.
Palate: mild sweet, medium sour, medium bitter aftertaste.  average carbonation.  medium body and oily/creamy texture.  
Overall: This just isnt doing anything for me.  Couldnt detect hardly any floral or citrus hops.  My bottle is a few days away from the best by date.  I may re-rate this in the future with a fresher bottle.  Not overly bitter.  Very drinkable for 6.9%.  It is a decent beer but i was expecting much more from the ratings and description from Stone.

Originally reviewed: 11/16/08. Pours a murky deep orange with only about an inchs worth of head. This dissipates to a thin sheet. Excellent rings along glass edge. 

Smells of very strong hops and floral and definitive citrus. Nice crisp scent.

Strong smack of grapefruit hits the palate. Nice crisp hop bittterness. This is a great IPA. This is the quinticential crisp bitter ale. 

Not too bad of a mouthfeel. Crisp, clean, tasty.

Well rounded IPA.  Good hops.  Floral finish. Nice color.  For the price a nice everyday go to IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2013 Definitely hoppy as advertised.  Didnt find it as citrusy as some have claimed, and would have liked a little more malt to balance the hops, but still very good.  Prefer their double IPA, Ruination, which is in my top 5 all-time beers.  May re-rate: bumping this up a little.  Citrus hits more now that its been in my fridge for about a week.  Super crisp finish.  Just let this one rest and get very cold for awhile - itll wow you more.  Ruination is still incomparable, but this is a great single IPA like most others seem to think.  Yet another re-rate: I have yet to be very impressed by their aroma, which still stays an above average 7 in my view - other testers have agreed with me.  Not even as citrusy as Bells.  Lighter bodied like Bells, but much more bitter, if that is what you are after.  I still desperately want more malt to go with this - taking down from 8 to 7.  I like bitter, but I like bitter WITH malts!  Lingers nicely, yes, but - malt!  Bring the malt!  I first rated this 3.5, then 3.7, now 3.6.  Their double IPA, Ruination, and their pale ale, are both better than this, IMO.
Bottles and draught @ PETCO Park, I think. Golden orange with white head. Pine and citrus hops, grassy notes. Simple. Bitter, of course, and decent body. One of my favorite IPAs, prime west coast.

Cloudy orange in color with a small white head. Good amount a lacing left on glass. Aroma of piney hops, grass, with a hint of citrus. The taste is heavy on the hops, very smooth, easy drinking, not much detection of alcohol. One of the better IPAs ive had.
Bomber from Binnys. Solid offering. Great head retention, nice orange-gold color. Light body, piney hops come quick and finish rather quickly, with a slight bitter fade out.

Hazy golden color.  Medium body head.  Fruity aroma with a strong finish. A mist try.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iSomething
Pours golden some lace. Crisp grapefruit hops aroma. Some citrus in the taste as well, but more dominant earthy flavors. Minimal aftertaste. Overall a clean, wonderful example of an American IPA

May 2010: One of the four taps at Pay and Take, Flagstaff.

Came in a pint glass, slightly cloudy and orange in colour, more orange than the amber body I was expecting, full white head at first, soon only a wisp and collar.

Very hoppy in aroma and taste, the citrus smells from the aroma hops disgiuised the bitterness that was to follow in the taste.

I quiet enjoyed the beer, the bitterness continued throughout the tasting, even the aftertaste was all hop and no hint of any malt content could i find anywhere within the brew.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy straw yellow with a medium white head.  Aroma of citrusy hops.  Flavor is somewhat one-dimensional - a lot of citrus hops, and a slightly bready aftertaste.  Refreshing and a solid example of the style, but not quite interesting enough to justify its high rating here.
UPDATED: JUN 8, 2012 Hop floral aroma. Pours misty golden color. Medium palate  with hop and malt taste. Has a delicious factor in it. Very good balance. Smooth finish.
Citrusy hop aromas.  Citrus fruity hop flavors with sweet malt backing.  Overall a very good IPA.

Pours gold with lacing pearl head. Overpowering aroma of sweet bread?? Some citrus and flowery hop, but mostly crescent-esque nose. Flowery citrus flavor with malt backbone. Just solid brew! Expected more...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 19, 2012 Super complex beer. Cloudy orange pour with quickly vanishing head. 1st taste - hops, roasted hops, yeast and creamy finish. 2nd taste - hops and spice with good bitterness. Aroma is yeast, hops, orange peel and flowers.

Aroma of malt and citrus. Pours a golden orange with a creamy white head with excellent lacing. Malt forward with a bitter citrus bite at the end. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Opaque, yellow- orange, slow fading, off-white head....sheets of lacing.
Scent is light fruit, pine with sweet after-notes.
Taste is strongly bitter at f irst sip, but levels out to a nice balance with the sweeter aspects coming through.
Really Good.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2013 Re-review from 3/16 ^_^ 12 oz bottle poured into a regular glass.

A: Pours a faintly hazy golden amber color. The head is a two finger offwhite shade that retains itself nicely.

S: Not really my bag here. Its mostly some earthy dankness, pine cone, mild grapefruit, with a bit of augmenting caramel malt. I prefer big tropical fruit bomb aromas, so its not the fault of the brew itself.

T: Better than I remembered. The initial flavor is pleasant grapefruit, before giving way to a bitter, dry piny finish. Malts are only vaguely evident throughout. Quite good, even great.

M: Dry and astringent - bitter, too. Theres nothing balanced or delicate about the mouthfeel, but it gives the beer impressive drinkability in conjunction with the lighter texture and moderate carbonation. Still, it would be even better if the bitter dryness didnt fatigue the palate so badly.

O: I keep writing off Stone, and there are many occasions when Im right in doing so. This one, though, Im thankful I revisited. I wouldnt quite make it a go-to - theres far too big of a risk of getting a stale bottle here on the right coast - but I would revisit this on tap, easily. A good "palate wrecker" IPA.
Bottle from beerboxer. Great westcoast style ipa. Has the pine an sweetness of grapefuit an pineapple. Aroma is hoppy an color is copper amber

Certainly a top notch ipa. Up front grassy earthy bitterness. Middle is muted, but finish is great pine-y hops. Medium in the mouth with lively. Arbonation. Pours light orange with head that sticks around.

--very good beer. ----/ little murky with a nice golden color. ---- the hops is def. there and has a nice bitter taste. Love the palate. ----   

---Rated via Beerology

Light orange color with a nice head that lingers a bit.  Great aroma.  Different kinds of hops come through.  I smell citrus, pine, grass, flowers, and I can pick out some malt too.  Great taste too.  Not a hop bomb like some IPAs.  I taste a lot of the flowery hops and some fruity citrus ones too.  Mild bitterness then a sweet malt finish that is not dry at all.  Flavorful and refreshing like an IPA should be.  One of the best non-imperial IPAs Ive had.

Pours a cloudy yellow with a nice orange hue, barely any head. Aroma is piney-tart citrus with some sweet (cascade) hints. Taste is initially a strong bitter bite but quickly tapers off and some of the sweet malts shine through and then finishes with still a bit of the bitterness left on the palate. A bit too bitter for me but this is a great choice if you like a nice and bitter IPA.

Maybe Ive been trying too many double and tripple IPAs but this seemed a bit insipid. Had this in a pint glass at a Alehouse, light amber in color, no head to speak of and light lacing, classic IPA taste with the hops and bitterness at the back end

From notes. Pours a nice transparent golden yellow, two fingers of white head tops it off leaving some wicked lacing.
Super hoppy aroma, smells like simcoe, hop resin, a bit of malt in the background but not much and the expected tropical fruit. Lots of hoppy flavors with a nice light body, very drinkable with a refreshing bright carbonation.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2015 Astringent nose featuring heavy hop doses at the beginning, starting out with pine, pepper, and other spices, then some grapefruit and green fruits, and culminating with a nice touch of brown sugar. Powerful and impressive. It pours a golden orange with an off-white head, of which only a thin layer remains after a few seconds. The mouthfeel is great, with a medium body and medium carbonation. The taste is powerful, with pungent, hoppy bitterness throughout. It starts with piney hops, follows up with fruity sweetness, and then leaves a really resiny, bitter aftertaste in your mouth

the beer pours a hazy yellow with a nice thick head. the beer leaves lots of lacing throughout. the aroma is of strong powerful hops, slight fruit as well and yeast. the taste is extremely hoppy up front with lots of bitterness but finished quite smoothly. there is almost a fruity aftertaste maybe grapefruit. there is also a slight amount of citrus and grass taste as well. I prefer this over the pale ale.
Great and hoppy like most IPAs, this pours in a cloudy but golden color. Little head, but very tasty.

Bronze color with a very small, white head that fades very quickly. The smell is of a nice hoppy citrus. The taste has a very nice fruity hoppy flavor, followed by a nice bitterness. The mouthfeel is creamy.
One of my favorite IPAs. Bottle, poured cloudy, light amber color. Mostly a hoppy aroma. Strong hoppy bitterness with a lingering aftertaste. Also notes of citrous and pine.

Keg at Craft Beer Co., London. Bouquet of floral fruitiness on the nose. Powerful bitter sensations on the tongue, noticably bracing but soft and buttery underneath. And I hear they do even more intense IPAs? Sign me up.

Keg at the Draft House Tower Bridge, cloudy dark gold with a clingy white head, aromas of hops with hints of bitter citrus, well balanced on the palate with fruit, spicy hops and a solid alcohol bite all playing off each other.
Excellent spicy aroma with slight citrus. Spicy hop flavor, medium, body with nice dry hop spice aftertaste. Gold standard for a good ipa.
Bottle - average sixe foamy head, medium copper color, nice big hoppy aroma and flavor - decent IPA, but was expecting a little more from Stone

Cloudy tan color with minimal head that left a perfect lace. Aroma is spicy and fruity.The malts really come through in the flavor. Sweet and grainy with hints of caramel and fruit. Followed of course by the hops. Well balanced IPA.

Orange body, creamy white head. Strong hoppy aroma with lots of grapefruit, pine. Smooth, easy drinking palate. Great strong bitter flavour with pine and grapefruit, and a subtle caramel note. A really good IPA.

Clear golden yellow topped off with a modest frothy white head. Aroma is largely of grapefruit, pine and sweet caramel malts. Thick, toasted, caramel malts upfront; heavy, aggressive bitterness in the finish; strong notes of a) grapefruit and b) pine; medium bodied with a creamy, crisp mouthfeel.

On bottle Bishops Arms Gothenburg
Golden color , intenst hoppy aromas.
High hoppy complexity
A bit more fuzz the Ruination, and I prefer this one

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 355 ml [2011]. Tasted a couple of month after the bb. Appeance: Pours honey whith a medium beige head. Aroma: Hoppy, citrus (grapefruit). Taste: Hoppy, grapefruit and a bitter finish. Overall: Nice IPA but is probably way better when fresh.

The bottle I am drinking right now has an expiration date of Feb. 9, 2012, and I didnt realize that until after I bought it on Feb. 29, 2012. Oh well. The aroma is still pretty awesome ... Hoppy and floral. White thick foamy head with great lacing but otherwise nothing too impressive about the appearance. Smooth on the palate, but with a bit of a unique bite to it (hopefully that doesnt have nothing to do with it being expired). The hops are rather subtle compared to other ipas, but great for a session iPA.

0.355l bottle from myBrewerytap. Hmm.. This is one of those "classics" isnt it? Anyhow, the pour is near-clear, and it has a golden pale orange-ish colored body. The head is medium sized and has a off-white color. The aroma reminds more of a hoppy apa then a IPA. Its nice and fruity with lots of different subtle tones; peach, melon, malts, strawberries and some thin caramel and hints of fruit pastilles. Its average to soft carbonated and it has a thick oily texture in the mouth. Really balanced in the flavor. My lord! Almost as smooth as a baby butt this. Clearly not a fresh bottle, but still really nice. With fresh pizza, perfect! 24.02.2012

Light amber with a big white head that fades to a light cover. Nice lacing. Aroma is pine and grapefruit, with some malt underneath. The flavor is good on the citrus and pine with a nice caramel malt backbone. Good balance and very easy drinking.

Golden brown, some nice sediment floating around with a one finger head. Looks like it will lace nicely. The smell has a strong floral scent, with some fruity and hoppy undertones. Bitter up front, which follows with sweet and malty flavors. Very light carbonation and goes down smooth. I can see why the reviews are so good, it's a great beer.

Poured from 12 oz, blind tasted with FW Union Jack..  Golden color,, a bit hazy, medium  off white head.  Nose was malty, with floral overtones, taste was bitter, with just a hint of sweetness.  Medium bodied with an oily texture. Nice overall. but UJ was a step up in my opinion.

The ole standby. Luscious floral and citrus hop aroma with a touch of pine.. This is from the tap, but the aroma is normally a little more present after a bottle pour. Standard appearance for an IPA with a tight head with good lacing. This is pretty bitter with mainly grapefruit flavor with a bit of grainy sweetness. This is baseline I measure IPAs against.

Its like grapefruit, except its beer.  I remember years ago, when I couldnt stand IPAs, and this was horribly bitter.  Interestingly, now I taste mostly grapefruit (and less of the grapefruit-pine blend I tend to like most in IPAs now).  This actually tastes more oaky than piney.  And, needless to say, I now like it.  Thank you for corrupting me, Holy and Jerry (not related to any Jerry who rates beer on here).
Flowery hops on the smell... nothing to write home about on the appearance, typical IPA.  Tastes great.  High quality IPA

Meh... this IPA aint all its cracked up to be.  Its average at best, and not deserving of its high place on the ratings.  Nugget Nectar blows this away completely.  All of you have already had it, so Im not even going to bother to tell you that this is an entry level IPA.  Try it once and move on.
22 oz bomber pours amber with a white head.  Aroma of malt and pine.  Taste is citrus, hops and a bit of malt.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2012 Bomber from Sicilianos in Grand Rapids, MI.  Pours hazy amber with some sediment.  Aroma is beautiful; fruity and floral hops, with a touch of sweetness.  Taste is also beautiful; sweet malt up front, followed by those same fruity and floral hops.  And the perfect level of bitterness: lots, but not so much that its distracting.  Great full body with perfect carbonation.  Perfect balance all around, while still being a big bold beer.  A perfect IPA; Im pretty sure they dont get better than this.  Wish I could give appearance a higher score, so the total score would be higher.
Bottle. Light amber with a white head. Malt and pine aroma. Flavour is citrus, pine and bitter with a solid malt backbone. Quite sticky mouthfeel. High end gear.

on tap poured into pint glass

a: amber hue, nice stickey head with awesome retention,

s: nice piney and earthy hop notes

t: piney hop followed nicely with a nice malt backbone. slight citrus finish this is a very nice IPA

m&d: medium bodied

Dark orange/ medium yellow witha head that ends up coating about half of the beer to the bottom of the glass. Aroma is malty, kind of like sticking your nose into a bag of dried malt extract, but it also has that sting of hops there in the background. Taste is malty, but immediately goes to the hops and just lingers there on your tongue, producing an aftertaste of sweet, sweet hop goodness.

Poured with a chill haze.....it also had some bits floating about, perhaps conditioning yeast which had become unattatched.  The smell was pure brewery, it had a true malty aroma with heavy hops presence.  A heavy mouthfeel which  sat on the tongue and a taste complementing the aroma with high malt and a thick but subdued hops taste which is in full balance.  Excellent, but for the chill haze.

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2012 Jaune brumeuse avec un super col crémeux, superbe.  Odeur de houblon et dagrume.  Le leger citron est au rendez-vous avec une amertume tranchante et rafraîchissante en bouche.  Descend bien, pas trop mince mais un peu acre en arrière goût.  Mais au total, cest vraiment excellent.
UPDATED: MAY 19, 2012 Great citrusy aroma with a pale golden appearance. Hoppy taste with citrus overtones. Crisp light mouth with a lingering bitter finish. Not bad, a good IPA.

You can get this anywhere. I think churches sell it around Southern California.  Great supermarket IPA. Still like the idea of Stone and what they are doing versus what their beers actually taste like. Great fresh, meh, after.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: 22 ounce bottle into pint glass, best by 2/28/2012.  Pours slightly cloudy golden straw color with a nice 2 finger off white head with fantastic retention that reduces to a thick cap that lingers.  Some nice lacing down the sides of the glass.  Aromas of big grapefruit, pine, herbal, floral, honey, and a bit of biscuit.  Nice and well balanced aromas with good strength.  Taste of big grapefruit, pine, herbal spiciness, floral, caramel, honey, and biscuit.  Good amount of bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, pine, herbal, floral, and honey notes on the finish for a while.  Very hoppy, but still has a nice malt balance to even things out.  Medium carbonation and body; with a slightly creamy and very crisp mouthfeel.  Very drinkable, with hardly any alcohol warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is an absolutely incredible IPA.  Very hoppy, yet still has great balance; and is very drinkable at 6.9%.

Pillows of foam poured from bomber into tumbler. Spicy, piney, and hoppy aromas follow through with the same type of taste. Plenty of bitter for the IPA fan. A smooth finish and lingering slickness result in a satisfying treat.

From notes.  First reviewed 5/5/2010.  Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into a pint glass.

A very hazy golden color, with a bubbly, rocky head. Decent retention, and nice lace stick.

The aroma is full of floral and herbal hops. Surprising spicy aroma. 

No real malt presence in the flavor, we go straight the a strong hop taste. I really enjoy the herbal spiciness that protrudes and stays through the whole sip. There is still a nice sweetness here. Strong hop bitterness during the sip, and the aftertaste is quite bitter as well. 

One thing I will never say about a Stone Brew is that it is not smooth, and this is no exception. Medium carbonation, but with a strong taste it drinks with a medium / full body.

West coast ultra hopped tastiness. Not for the faint of palette. It would be natural to think a beer this hoppy would not be drinkable. Stone is insulted by that way of thinking, dont let it happen again.

Copper-red color, a cream colored head, a lasting lace work on the glass, great humor on the bottle, massive grapefruit-rind hops, aromatic esters, a medium-light bodied ale, rich flavor, nicely malted, slightly sweet toasty flavors, followed by a dry knockout perfect bitter finish.
great everyday IPA, slightly off aftertaste. great price, would buy again but Im not exactly rushing to the store.

After being blown away by Stones Ruination, I was excited to try the IPA. Pours a beautiful hazy orange, a color I would paint my walls. Light head, light aroma, smooooooooth taste. Very nice. Not as nice as the Ruination but very respectable.

Touch of cloudiness and a thin head. The aroma is not quite as full as I anticipated but there is definitely a noted floral hoppiness as is to be expected. The body is creamy and medium. The taste really makes up for any flaws. Bitter hops with a fruity sweetness on the side.
Very well balanced India Pale Ale. Stone is a great brewery and this is excellent.
Great hoppy IPA, strong aroma, poured orange with a normal head.  Taste is sweet, bitter and hoppy.  Overall one of the better IPAs I have had.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2012 Poured a dark yellow into a pint glass.  Small white head, bout a half inch which lasted through the whole drink.

Smell was incredible.  Smell of citrus and pine, very strong, very mouthwattering.

Taste is very hoppy, very bitter.  Citrus taste which is classic with west coast IPAs.

Mouthfeel, pretty intense.  If youre a hophead, you will LOOOOOOVE this beer like I did.

12 oz. bottle...pours a very nice orange with a very thin white head...aroma was very floral, with nice hints of fruit as well as some pine...flavor was much of the same...one of the best IPAs I have had...was waiting to try and offering from Stone and I am glad I started with this one.
UPDATED: JUN 24, 2012 draft. this is close to the top of being the standard for all west coast ipas. nuff said.
Gyllene med dragning åt orange. Ett livligt men ganska snabbt försvinnande skum. Doftar färsk humle, blommighet och citrus. Fräsch humlighet och citron. Eftersmaken sitter kvar riktigt länge.

Draft pint at Market Cross Pub in Carlisle, PA. IPA as it ought to be. Solid hops throughout. I like the carbonation as well. Do over... And over... And over!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

one of my all time favorites I just have never rated. Dark gold with a great fresh hop aroma. Nice and smooth, lots of hops all the way, and bitterness for an aftertaste. As west coast IPAs go, its hard to top.
One of the best IPAs Ive ever tasted. Grapefruit and orange zest on the palate. Pure hoppy freshness leaves the palate clean and pairs well with most food.

341ml bottle. Pours a hazy orange/amber with a moderate off-white head. Floaties?! Aroma is nicely balanced between grapefruit and pine hops and caramel malt. Taste scews a bit more toward the citrus hops rather than the other elements but it doesnt get out of balance.Good body and palate has a nice bite. Overall, a top class IPA.

The definition of an IPA. If youre on ratebeer and havent tried it Im confused.  Enjoy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a blond hay color. The nose has pine, floral aroma, hints of juniper a little malt. The taste is a very piney flavor peaking to a bitter flavor and before it gets out of control you role down into floral round balance flavor. It is so balanced at the end just leaving your pallet wanting another sip. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Golden with small white head. Smells of loads of fresh hops and citrus, very floral and clean smelling. Taste like sweet lemony malts and hoppy freshness. Med carbonation, very smooth mouth feel.  After taste is very clean, dry, and not too bitter. This is a very well crafted IPA.
golden yellow color, citrus pineapple aroma, flavor is lots of citrus hops with a dry finish, light bodied and very drinkable

Bottle sample share at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Pours orange to yellow with a nice head, aroma of pine, pineapple, vanilla lemon skin, flavor is bitter with moderate sweetness, leafs, pine, grapefruit and lemon, medium bodied, nice

Ovanpå den orange ölen vilar ett livligt skum och dofterna från glaset är rent sköna av apelsin, rosenvatten och örter. De beska smakerna i munnen finns kvar länge, och där finns apelsinskal och knäckebröd. Riktigt god.
Great beer one of my favorites. Not to hoppy great after taste dosent linger to long.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Thanks zvikar. Pours  cloudy orange with light foam. Orange-citrus fun aroma, really bitter and equally fun taste, dry finish, light body, fair carbonation.

Pours a nice golden honey color with a decent head that kept a thin layer of dense foam afloat through the entire glass. Slight sediment and crisp, with a bitter citrus grapefruit aftertaste and floral alcohol aroma. This is a good IPA for the intermediate IPAer

355ml bottle. Cloudy dark orange with creamy frothy white head, superb lacing. Wonderful hop aroma, fresh and fruity, with citrus, grapefruit and orange. Taste is very hoppy, but not overpowered and good absorbed by the malt contingent. Would have expected a more grassy and peppery hop focusing, but this is so dangerously drinkable - I couldnt resist if I had more at my disposal.

Pours a hazy orange with a thin white head. Very aromatic with notes of citrus, earthy hops, and some malty sweetness. Tastes very much the  same with a medium amount of bitterness and a rather dry finish. One of my favorite IPAs, very tasty and one that I most certainly will look forward to enjoying again. SLAINTE!

Tasted at the 2012 St. Louis Centennial Beer Festival from bottle into sampler glass. Poured a clear, light amber color with average off-white foam. Aromas and flavors true-to-style for American craft India Pale Ale. Very grapefruity, American profile. Malty, hoppy, fruity. Medium body with long-lasting citrusy and bitter aftertaste.

Great friggin beer!  Tan and clear with a nice head and lace.  Hoppy to the max, without being over the top or oily in smell or taste.  Wonderfully hoppy while maintaining balance from the malts.  One of the most drinkable IPAs in existence.  At $3.80 a bomber its just plain fantastic in all aspects.  I could drink this one all the time and not get tired of it.

Awesome pinecone hop aroma. Really fresh like an alpine forest. Not as bitter as i expected but great all the same. Pine, Grapefruit and Sherbet, soft mouthfeel, and a soft carbonation. I like smelling it as much as drinking it. I gotta get more of this for the fridge!!!
Pours hazy orange, smells like citrus and orange pine , Perfect hopps and Excellent overall taste... I will be stocking up on this next time i see it

It pours a golden color with no hint of haze and a thick frothy head. The beers produces a nice lace. Aroma is of citrus hops with some peppery notes. Hops and grapefruit dominate the taste. Some lively carbonation with a long citruisy hop finish.

On draft at pizza plant.  Pours orangeish amber, a small finger of head.  good lacing.  Aroma of pineapple, orange, grapefruit and a bit of pine.  Citrus hops up front, darker citrus fruits, pineapple, caramel malt.  Medium body, average carbonation.
Pours golden with an orange haze. Nose is citrus with hints of honey, some pineapple.. Fresh mouthfeel, crisper palate than most IPAs (?) but bitter overtone from beginning to finish.

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2015 Gold, foamy white head with lots of sediment. Citrusy/piney hop aroma. Taste is really nice...hops are a bouquet of pine, grapefruit and floral earthiness. Balanced nicely with a strong caramel malt backbone. The finish seems a bit astringent, but thatâs really the only negative I can come up with. One of the best IPAâs Iâve had. Excellent.
Bottle. Orange colour with a small off-white head. Fruity aroma with citrus, peach and malt. Peach, citrus, pines and some malt in the flavour. Medium-bodied, bitter aftertaste.

May be the most balanced ipa.  Fruity, good after taste, not too strong or too long.  Bold but not overpowering. ............... 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Amber/Gold, then white head, a bunch of lacing. Gorgeous looking brew. Citrus - mandarin, candy-apple, slight cloves and some yeasty funk. Sweet with round zingy bitter finish.

Orange-yellow beer with a medium and blond head. Aroma is tropical fruity, peaches, papaiyas and fructose. Taste is medium bitter, pine needles, slighly less tropical fruits than were in aroma, quite dry, slightly harsh aftertaste. Medium bodied, nice carbonation, slippery to drink. Great aroma, taste is more piney. Tastefull, typical US-IPA.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2013 Aroma is a mix of citrus and piney hops.  The flavor is similar to the aroma along with grapefruit and a grainy malt background.  A very well made IPA, balanced nicely and a simple but great ale.
UPDATED: JAN 27, 2012 Fresh, clean tasting IPA with a light body. Very refreshing, overall a very great beer

Bottle. A light powered hoppy aroma with muted vegetable scent mixed in, kind of like a broccoli fart. Not too impressive in strength. The appearance was better than the aroma, a tangerine honey with a nice big head that melted into a ring, decent lacing as well. 

The palate was a medium body with a sticky texture. The taste wasnt as hoppy as Id expected for an IPA, and I picked up that strange broccoli fart aftertaste similar to the aroma.

Not sure if this was a bad bottle, but I expected more.

Bottled. Cloudy orange beer, loose white head. Powerful, tropical hoppy aroma with sweet wine gums, hints of floral honey and herbal pine. Slightly biscuity, pale maltiness, light in caramel. Bitter taste with caramelly backnote in the finish. Medium body, smooth and refreshing texture.  Clean, pure IPA.
Very hoppy, of course. Obviously thats what dominates it but theres a nice hint of sweetness to balance the hops and the finish is nicely bitter. Great beer.
Full of fresh citrus in the nose from the hops. Nice white head. One of the best American IPA i tasted.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2016 Bottle and can. Hazy golden body with a medium white head that holds well. Lively carbonation. Excellent lacing. Aroma of pine, peach, orange, flowers and a faint bubblegum note. Flavour of caramel, peach, mango, pine, grapefruit and rose flavoured Turkish delight. Medium body with an oily texture. Light fizz. Id forgotten just how good this is. When fresh, its one of the very best IPAs out there.

A - citrus and floral hops with caramel malt
A - hazy mid-gold to orange with thin white head
T - light sweet with full pleasant bitter
P - soft, mid and oily
O - a proper IPA... But a bit too much malt for me

This was an OK ipa definitely did not live up to the hype. I wish people would stop listening to everyone else. And make an opinion of their own. This supposed to be the ipa that all other ipa are judged by. I however, dont see it that way, too much piney and bitter flavor. This is not an accurate ipa for tue new westcoast style.

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2012 Bottle into goblet, color is golden tan with a white head that starts out high but drops away fast. Very bitter its a great ale. A nice smooth bitter after taste. Over all a very good ale.
355ml bottle @Maltainen Riekko. Poured clear golden with a nice looking, lacing white head. Grapefruity, slightly sweet aroma. Flavor is pine, grapefruit, somewhat sweet. Finish is brutally bitter.

12oz bottle into a pint glass.

Pours a slightly hazy orange with a thick white head. Awesome lacing.

The aroma smacks you in the face with piney citrusy hops. There is also some earthiness along with caramel.

The flavor is pine and grapefruit but giving way to some caramel. There is a certain earthy flavor present as well. Strong bitterness throughout leading to a drying finish. Mouthfeel is good for the style.

Overall this is one of my favorite IPAs. It is extremely smooth and each sip leaves you wanting more. It would be easy to down several of these in a sitting.

Bottle at home. Pours orangey-gold, not a huge amount of head but holds well. Nose is orangey, citrussy and grassy, with possibly a touch of caramel. Brilliant fruity hoppiness with an excellent bitterness which lingers well, and really well balanced as well. Carbonation is absolutely spot on. Just a really, really great beer.

Bottle from Dans. Pours a orange gold. Beautiful nose - resin, hops, caramel. Taste corresponds beautifully - really nice balance between hop flavour and caramel notes. Perfect carbonation too. My kinda IPA.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2012 Pour is golden yellow, with thin white head. Aroma is candy, hints of sour fruit, plenty of citrus hops. Flavour is sweet orange and pine, some savoury undertones, finishing with plenty of pine and bitterness. Palate is somewhat dry, yet leaving a sticky residue on the tongue.
On tap. Started out with aromas of hops and some background citrus and fruit. The finish was different, it left my mouth feeling dry. Overall I enjoyed it.

Bottle. Golden, hazy, average and mostly diminishing head. Moderate, malty and sweetish aroma, fruitiness, faint caramel, grapefruit and piney hoppyness. Body is medium, malty and lightly sweetish flavor, light fruitiness and faint caramel, piney hoppyness. Finish is average to long, malty and dry, lots of piney hoppyness. Really nice dry and well hopped IPA.
Poured a peach color with a foamy white head. Not a lot of lacing. Pine and grass hop aroma. Taste was some citrus, pine, some caramel,and grass. Nice dry bitter finish. Very good.

Keg at Brewdog Aberdeen. It pours cloudy amber, with a massive white head. The nose is orange, tangerine, nectarine, honey and grass. The taste is pine, resin, citrus pith, grapefruit, hay, grass, floral and spice, with a bitter-dry finish. Medium body, fine carbonation and foamy mouth-feel. Good stuff, but not quite as amazing as other ratings suggest.
UPDATED: FEB 12, 2012 Excelente, aroma muy agradable amargo muy agradable color dorado, sabor en la boca persistente. En SAT  the yardhouse

#1083 bottle; Nose is heavy dry hops, menthol, weak bile, grass, pine, little green apple acids, feel is very broad, carb Is mediumheavy, taste is very smooth heavy hops, sweet red grape, decent bile, leaves, later weak sweet menthol
UPDATED: JAN 10, 2012 Smells lemon and pine.  Pours hazy yellow gold with a thick white head.  Tastes fruity and hoppy...but not overly hopped.  Easily one of the best IPAs I?ve enjoyed.
Bottle. Pours light golden. Aroma high grass hops. Really bitter. Not for the weak hearted.vNot Bad.

Pours a semi cloudy golden hue with a fluffy white lasting head and a gianormous aroma of stonefruit/hopresin/grapefruit. Has a nice sweet caramel flavour upfront with a piney bitter finish a supurb IPA.

Pours a clear light golden colour with a frothy white head that dissipates fairly quickly. Aroma is of floral and cascade hops with nice citrus fruit (lemon, orange, grapefruit) undertone. Taste is mildly sweet but most prevalent is the steady bitterness in the sip. Light-medium body, smooth/thin mouthfeel, and somewhat softer carbonation. Great IPA.

Pours amber with low head
Aroma explodes full of hops. Fantastic aromas of fresh citrusy and sweet hops.
Taste is almost to the dipa way long sweet and fresh that ends in a nice bitterness. Is it a bit watery? All in all a grear ipa!
Pours a golden color with a thin white head and hoppy aroma. Taste is sweet and big on hop with pine and grapefruit and a nice, crisp bitter finish. Great hoppy IPA from Stone.

Pours rusty golden with a hoppy aroma. Wonderful lemony, citrusy
flavor with grapefruit notes. Delicious on the
palate, with a nice medium dry crisp long finish. Quite enjoyable !
" Hop " on if you havent tried this one yet. Cheers !

Pours a yellow beer with a medimu size white head with good retention, aroma is intensely hoppy with notes of pine, passion fruit, mango and citrus fruits. Its medium bodied, the flavor its dominated by the hop flavors wich get intensified at the finish but caramel malt notes are also noticeable. Great brew

Bottle from at home. Helsingborg, December 2011. 

Thanks Rafiki!

Pours clear orange, airy creamy head. Aromas of grass and pine with just the right amount of maltiness. Grapefruit is very prominent. Loads of American hops with a great balance. Smooth, medium bodied with a nice amount of carbonation. Taste is grassy and hoppy with a nice malt background. Super balanced. Slightly dry with a hint of warming alcohol and a coating bitterness towards the end. Perfect IPA.

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2014 Plusieurs bouteilles de 12oz. Bière légèrement cuivrée avec une mousse blanche et compacte. Le nez est tout en houblon, il sy dégage des arômes des plus intéressants dagrumes et de résine. La bouche ne sen laisse pas imposer, le malt supporte tout ce houblon. Cest facile à boire, simple mais les saveurs imposantes sont très agréables. Un classique à boire à tout les jours.

22oz bottle from Binnys Lincoln Park. Pours a crystal clear, yellowish amber color with a nice white head and some lacing. Aroma is hoppy, pine, citrus, mango. Medium on the palate with average carbonation. Flavor is a nice balance of malty sweetness and bitter hops, with a very nice bitter hop finish. An excellent IPA.

Very soft on the nose to start. Not overlly pushy of a beer. The first sip will introduce you to full flavor IPA without a harshness. Very smooth to the palate.
Enjoyable to have with a plate of nachos or just to sip alone.

Stong citrus and some pear aroma. Outstanding aroma. Pours a hazy golden orange color with yeast/trub particulates. Avg. white head. Up front taste is a light sweet grapefruit taste. Back end of taste becomes salty and is very bitter with a long finish. Medium body with average carbonation. One of my favorite IPAs.
UPDATED: FEB 16, 2014 Riche et parfumé principalement aux agrumes sucrés. Lamertume est très accessible, létape avant la ruination. Très croustillante.
UPDATED: SEP 3, 2013 Bitter, dry, hoppy. Citrus flavor and aromas. Fairly pale and light bodied. Good, but has fallen behind compared to some of the IPAs that have been coming out.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2011 12-oz bottle.. Such an excellent single IPA I dont know where to start: the the shiny medium-amber pour, the pure-hop aroma or the balanced,ultra-hoppy flavor that takes over the tongue. Not extremely bitter despite the aggressive hop profile. Almost the quintessential IPA.
Probably my favourite IPA.  Pours clear golden with slight head.  Strong pine aroma of hops.  Tasting translates to slight bitterness, good deal of sweetness, easy to drink hoppy IPA.
Pours pale orange. Citrus, grass, and pine.  Ive always been a bit underwhelmed by this beer.  I really want to like it more, but unfortunately it doesnt blow me away.

Aroma is full of orange/citrus hops with a light,sweet malty background. Appearance is a light gold with a thin foam top. The taste is a big slap in the throat of heavy hoppy bitterness. There is an intense leafy bitter hop bite on this beer. The finish contains a very light caramel malt with a nice bitterness. Overall, this is a very solid brew. Nice flavoring leaning towards the earthy, fully hopped flavor with a light hint of sweet malts. This is a great tasting IPA. Id give this an A rating.
Bottle from beersofeurope.com pours amber with a thin white head. Definite stone aroma, very subtle and complex on the hops. Light carbonation with an amazing vegetable aftertaste. Great ipa.
Bottle to glass. Amber/golden pour with large white head. Heavy citrus aroma. Medium bodied with great bitter finish. A fine American IPA. I really enjoy this
My favourite IPA. very bitter, and long finish. Imagine you just open a fresh Cascade Hope pocket and you smell it . This is exactelly the feeling I had when I smell that beer  for the first time.

My favorite regular ipa to date. Lovely floral hop aroma that hints at things to come. Scrumptious fresh hop flavor with enough malt to give balance and body. Medium finish that holds you over just long enough until the next sip. You cant go wrong with this classic. Try it!

Pours clear yellow color with avg. head.  Aroma of orange and exotic fruity hops and some mild malts. Flavor of fruits, especially orange, caramel, toffee and some malts. Palate is moderately sweet and bitter. Very balanced brew, a good example of an IPA.

33cl bottle. Hazy orange with a big white head. Nose : Orange zest, grapefruit ....a what a hell I take the sip right away : oily body, creamy with a little carbonation. Bitter start and bitter finish. Very aromatic with citrus and their zest. Some other fruit notes like apricot and little banana. Fresh. Yes, thats a good one.

Pours a hazy light amber with a 2 finger creamy white head.  Aroma is citrus, pine, grapefruit.  Taste is a great balance between malt and hops which allows the west coast hops to be the star, lots of citrus and herbal hop flavors, some bread on the finish with aggressive hop bitterness.  This is a great American IPA.

A nice clear orange coloured beer, a medium sized fluffy head, sticks and holds ok. Floral, grass and hops, a lot of citrus at the smelling. Nice bitter beer, with also slight but good sweet-kick in at the middle, and a good bitterness at the aftertaste. Decent bodied, a good IPA. At the smell the grass is more present, the taste misses something that gives it the boost to make it great. For me just a bit more carbination would be welcome also.

22/11/2011 12Fl. Oz. bottle @ home - no date stamp (2011-666) 
Cloudy orange beer, huge towering white creamy head, pretty stable, adhesive with nice lacing. Aroma: ripe sweet mango, papaya, some Turkish delight. MF: lots of carbon, medium body. Taste: some citrus, bitter grapefruit, pineapple, bit of liquor. Aftertaste: dry bitter, lemon zest, somewhat minty/menthol. Very complex yet more in aroma than flavour.

Got to try some of this at the Brews Best Beer Fest on my trip to Vegas, fall 2011. Poured a hazy golden colour with a little amber hue. Its head is creamy, off-white, has great retention and thick lacing. Cascade hop scent with light malt notes. The mouthfeel is dry with just a little wetness. Grainy malt taste that is well-balanced with the hop. A very well-brewed IPA.

12 oz bottle into pint glass.  Looks yellow clear and off white fluffy head.  Smells of light fruit thick flowery hops.  Definitely dry hopped.  Tastes like a hop extravaganza In a strong pale rough malt form.  Strong quality bitterness all over my palate.  Overall 9 of 10.

My go-to IPA. Fresh with the citrus notes, lite on the piney aspect,and smooth hops blend well with this beer. Sexy lacing. The only thing would do is bring more hops out in the aroma without messing with the taste. I love smelling the hops while taking a great swig!
Great looking beer! Citrus, pine and honey malts. Low alcohol. Medium to high bitterness. Quite drinkable for the 7% abv. Would have like more citrus hopsand less bitterness but still a great brew.

What an IPA should taste like, this beer is bitter yet still drinkable. Hops and bitterness throughout with a bitter/dry after-taste that coats the back of the tongue and throat. Great representation of an IPA, one of my favorites.
clear orange in colour with an aroma of citrus and orange peel and it tastes very good with the citrus notes and hoppy character this is a nice ipa.
Stone IPA has a nice floral-hoppy aroma and a bright honey-orange color. Flavors of orange, honey, hops, lemon, and more hops. Very bitter finish, but still very crisp and drinkable. I am a fan.
Clear orange colour with a good white head.Hoppy aroma citrus and floral.Taste hoppy as well with a nice malty ending.well balanced.Nice one!
Copper shine, large head that holds. Sweet hop aroma and a very nice dry bitterness.
Pours amber with a finely laced head.  Aroma of herbal and honeyed hops.  Medium body with significant hop bitterness.  More towards the bitter/herbal hops than some.

The quintessential American IPA. Poured with a nice, large, off white, foamy, frothy, head that lasts a long time and lots of lace. Color is a clear amber with some bubble trails. Aroma is hop, malt, citrus, pine, fresh baked bread, grass. Flavor is huge hop/malt bittersweet thing with perfect carbonic tang. Body and carbonation are perfect. Finish has just the right length and is like flavor. This is beer baby.
Bottle. Pours gold with a thick white head. Smells of hops and tastes a little lighter than expected for a nearly 7% brew. A solid IPA.
Amber/Gold, then white head, a bunch of lacing. Gorgeous looking brew. Citrus - mandarin,  candy-apple,  slight cloves and some yeasty funk. Sweet with round zingy bitter finish.

So Ive had this beer on tap and in the bottle several times before I got my Rate Beer account.  Then yesterday at the Surly Goat I saw Stone Double Dry Hopped IPA.  The double dry hopped IPA had a great fresh pine aroma and a nice balanced flavor of pine, citrus and a little malt.  After drinking this beer I thought it tasted fresher than regular Stone IPA.  Then I go to rate it and I find our that the Double Dry hopped IPA is the same beer as the IPA.   Could have fooled me.  Perhaps the beer I had last night was the freshest version of the IPA I have ever had.  Also, on a side note, I wish that beers would not have aliass.

This is one of my all-time favorite beers, and probably my favorite in the style. Finally time to rate the standard-setter from the hometown heroes. Giant pour into La Fin du Monde glass (just for kicks). Head 2-3" and nearly pure white. Retention is hard to beat. Beer is medium orange-bronze. Nice constant nucleation and the glass is perfectly beer clean. Aroma is just pure, beautiful, West Coast hop. So fresh and crisp. Citrus and pine in balance. Flavor is hugely hoppy and bitter, but stays balanced with a strong malt presence. Finish is pretty dry--how I like my IPAs--and mouthfeel pleasant. Alcohol notes creep in from time to time to remind you of the beers strength. Love West Coast IPAs, love Stone IPA, love Stone. First-rate.

Pour from a 22oz bottle. Orange amber brew with frothy white head, good lacing. Moderate aroma of pine, citrus hops. Great taste hop forward but good maltiness at the start yeilding to a growing hoppy bitter finish. And excellent IPA.

I just drink it in a shaker glass (usually my go-to Simpsons one), and it never lets me down.  My benchmark IPA, and one the only good beer they sell at the gas station down the street.  Aroma is a nice skunky IPA, more sour than the average pour.  Orange-y appearance with a circle of foamy dots that usually float to the top.  At first sip, youre hit with a strong, smoky taste with a sour (but refreshing) aftertaste.  Its not a sesh beer, but its got a body that I would put at medium-full with a very sticky texture.  I can drink a few at a time; not sure about everybody else.  A sixer at once and I imagine I would be either passed out at Jack in the Box or over a toilet.  My favorite beer due to its relative availability in SoCal, its reasonable price point and its consistent high quality.  The "one" I always point to when recommending IPAs to friends in the area.
Stone ipa is really good but nothing too distinctive. This should be the benchmark against which other ipas are measured.
Pour is a darker copper with decent white lacy head. Aroma is a wet grass and sweet orange smell. Taste is very balanced between hoppy green grass pepper and lemon with a slightly sweet middle.

650mL bomber poured a golden color with a nice big white head with some retention and a nice lacing left on side of glass.  Aroma is floral and citrus hops.  Taste is bold hop bitterness with some malt sweetness in the background.  This is one of the best IPAs that I have ever sampled.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2011 Poured from a draft into a pint glass at Playa Grill & Margarita Bar in San Diego, Calif. Color was orange blossom honey, kind of clear. Not much head when I got it, but probably originally an inch. Bubbly white lacing on the top. The film was scattered throughout. 

Smelled of citrus hops with light lemon leading the way. Some bitterness at the end.

Quick citrus up front, giving way to a sharp and strong alcohol bite. Crisp, clean and some bitterness at the end.

Medium body. Lively carbonation. Clean and refreshing.

A pretty good beer overall. Id definitely give it another go.

this is Sarah Browns ( my knowledgable brar tenders)  favorite I.P.A.  It was preety good, but the hops were all bitterness, as if they were all added at the begening of the wort boil, andIi did not get much floral hops nose from the beer.  I can see that this beer is well ballanced, but the hops bitterness is not counteracted with a fresh hops nose, soIi can not in good concience give it a 100 rating

Pours slightly hazy copper with a thick white head and lace.  Aroma is of lots of west coast hops, citrus and floral notes.  Nice smooth flavor, lots of hops, grapefruit, citrus and floral notes and a tiny bit of caramel.  All around well balanced IPA.

Thats one hearty hoppy punch right off the get-go partner!! Just enough sweet malts on the finish to meld for a find tasting IPA! Would definitely be my choice brew with some spicy grilled oysters on the half-shell! This brew is mouth-puckeringly delicious!! Very smooth and refreshing indeed! Hoppy is as hoppy does!!

Pours a golden color with a hint of orange.  Excellent head with even better lacing.  I cant think of a better looking IPA.  Aroma is citrusy, and the taste is powerful with plenty of hops and grapefruit.  Simply a great IPA.

It is just solid all the way through.  It is floral, but not overwhelming.  Malty and bitter just like it should be.  Not quite as floral as some others Ive had, which is why it only gets a 3.8.  I love Stone beers, but the IPA is not any better than some others Ive had.

on tap at three needs, VT. bright golden with a nice white head, good retention and lacing. malts, spices, medium to heavy flowery-strawberry hopping. average carbonation, medium body - sticky, medium long bitter grapefruit-strawberry.
damn good! one of my favorite beers. forget any beer without the letters IPA.

pours light yellow, fairly opaque with a small white head.  smells of flowers, with a dry tang at the back.  tastes slight wheat with classic ipa acid and bitter at the back. smooth mouth feel, slightly thin.  overall a really solid ipa, very delicious :)

Pours a pale yellow with frothy white head that hangs around. Nose is grapefruit. First sip is pleasant with slight pale malt but citrus flavors like kumquat. Finish is bitter but very smooth and clean.
Bomber. Great taste. Balanced with bitterness throughout. Fresh and crisp. Way above average India Pale Ale in my book.
36cl, as Stone IPA, American brew, from Geers Oostakker, complex bitter brew, fruity/malty and slightly sweet, very balanced, clear, good head, very good brew, yet expensive

Draught @ Moeder Lambic during the Stone vs Moeder Lambic event. Slightly hazy yellow with a big white head. Smells hoppy, toilet refreshner and flowers. Tastes flowers, pine, hops and bitter. Great carbo, medium body.
Date: September 24, 2011 Mode: Bottle Source: Minneapolis Beer Fest.  Full description not available as I sampled way too many beers in 4.5 hours!
Nice appearans,  have 12 beers left of an total of 48, so it is a nice beer to always have in the fridge. Saw it on yesterdays episode of weeds and it gave me the fever for drinking one!

This sucker is BIT-TER. Yikes. Just way too out of balance for my tastes. Plus, there isnt really anything subtle going on to intrigue me. Aroma is wonderful, pours a nice hazy golden orange. If you really love a very bitter IPA, this may be your beer. Not one Ill be buying again.
My first american ipa, guys you can make some great bitter beers! Tastibg this one after de la senne speciale belge, this one has more bitterness, not too much, great beer!

A bit hoppy for my tastes but refreshing enough. Good ipa.A bit hoppy for my tastes but refreshing enough. Good ipa.A bit hoppy for my tastes but refreshing enough. Good ipa.A bit hoppy for my tastes but refreshing enough. Good ipa.A bit hoppy for my tastes but refreshing enough. Good ipa.A bit hoppy for my tastes but refreshing enough. Good ipa.A bit hoppy for my tastes but refreshing enough. Good ipa.A bit hoppy for my tastes but refreshing enough. Good ipa.A bit hoppy for my tastes but refreshing enough. Good ipa.

Draught at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Light orange coloured and hazy. Has a white head, mostly lasting. Heavy hoppy aroma, notes of citrus and rubber. Lime. flavor starts sweet and moderate bitter, finish heavy bitter. Dry creamy texture and soft carbonation.

Draught at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas during the three day Stone Event, 16-18 september 2011. Hazy yellow color, big creamy white head. Smell fruits, grassy, hops, bitter and very citrussy. Tastes very fresh, very citrussy and bitter. Good carbo, medium body. Nice beer.
An above average IPA. Pours a golden orange with a white fizzy head that fades into a nice lace. At 70 IBUs his is a nicely hopped beer without being crazy. Very drinkable, and readily available.
Tasting at beer temple.  Clear golden pour with small white head.  Aroma is grassy hops and a little soap.  Flavour is also grassy hos with a lot of grapefruit.  Simply fantastic!

Pours a clear orange with a huge off-white head. Aroma of citrus and grassy hops with hints a fruit and some nice malts as well. Flavor of citrus and grassy hops with a very nice malty backbone. One of the most balanced IPA I have ever had. Very good.

Keg, Port Street Beer House, 14th September 2011.  Nice look and mouth feel, good aroma, smooth taste.  Taste was similar to Tempest Brave New World IPA, which I also tried that night.  One to have again for sure!
A light and refreshing IPA with a slight presence of hops, and a crisp finish! Overall, a nice beginners introduction to the world of IPAs.

355 ml bottle @ Euston Tap, London.
Rated on 20110721.
Pours clear yellow color with no head. Aroma of strong orange, exotic fruity hops, grass and some mild malts. Flavor of fruits, especially orange, caramel, toffee and some malts. Palate is moderately sweet and bitter. Very balanced brew, a good example of an IPA.
3515

35,5 cl bottle @ hotel room, Kyoto. BBE 05/2012 on sticker
Rather hoppy and fruity aroma with resin. Flavour is really hoppy and fresh  just like IPA should be. It has exotic fruits and some resin. Brilliant IPA, and not too sweet!

This is one of my favorite beers.  Not an overpowering IPA but enough bitter to let you know you are drionking an IPA.  Nice hoppy aroma with some citrus.  It is a nice beer to look at as well.  A nice light orangie amber with a bit of lace.  A very refreshing beer on a hot day.

Pours a light bronze color with a lively white head.  Aroma is of pine and citrusy hops.  The hops hit you up front right away and without compromise (this is Stone after all).  I can detect a very slight hint of malt as if it were added as an afterthought.  Extra points for being my first IPA back in the day.  Set the bar pretty high from the start.
A classic, Pours orange with a white head. Notes of citrus and pine. A beautiful drying hop finish. A real standard that I was surprised I never rated.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2012 rerated on May 3rd 2012 - 22oz bottle - pours clear caramel with rich white head and some lacing.  Nose is grapefruit and pine.  Flavors adds caramel and lots of resin with hints of orange peel.  Taste is definitely bitter with some sweetness.  medium to full body with sticky texture.  This is almost violently hoppy.  

Draft in a pint glass - pours hazy orange with lacing white head. Nose is citrus and grass. aroma is hops of a pine-y nature. Aftertaste is hoppy. OK this is way overrated. 6/3/8/3/11

Had on tap, its a glassful of pale gold ale with a small head. The mild aroma has some minor hoppy and citrusy notes. The laid-back taste surprised me because it did NOT come on strong. Medium mouthfeel somewhat watery with soft carbonation; not high on my list of crafty American IPAs.

I love this beer!  It has a little bitter bite to it, but to me it taste wonderful.  This is an outstanding IPA offering; I like it second only to two hearted ale.  If you like IPA"s this is a must try beer!
Big bottle.  Yellow to golden color, clear, decent head.  Mainly floral hop aroma.  Nice bitterness and finish.  Good ipa  all around... Enough but not too much.
22 oz from PCC in Redmond WA citrus taste up front, and aroma of flowers, and some fruity but reallyt a lot of citrus is the main taste..

Had this a thousand times not sure why I havent rated it yet. Nose is citrus peel grassy, grapefruit, flowers, Slight sweet malts, some fruity notes but citrus full on. Flavor is grass, fruits, loads of citrus and very dry flavor.  This is a really nice beer. I will only buy it if I know when it came in. Date your bottles please.

355ml bottle.  Pours a cloudy amber with a off-white head.  A good amount of pine in the nose with some caramel, grapefruit.  Taste has a nice golden syrup undertone, with some serious piney hops, tropical fruit and malt notes in a finish that is both somehow VERY bitter, and slightly watery.  Good stuff.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 A: Golden/straw color body with off-white creamy dense head with loads of lace...

S: Not as hoppy on the nose as id expect.. they certain are there... but no where near as aromatic as most other ipas coming out of the west coast these days...

T: Slightly more hops going on in the taste.. slightly piney and oily.. some malts and grains hold down the fort in the middle of the profile... slight bitter finish

M: Smooth. Crisp finish. Moderate body.

O: Pretty solid all around.. Wont be my first choice when I want an arromatic IPA, but there is no denying the all around quality of fresh Stone IPA

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2013 Pours translucent gold with orange highlights and features a two-finger foamy head. Aroma citrus and floral hops. Taste is really nice, with hop bitterness all over the place and a light sweetness. Palate is medium and slightly oily with a very soft carbonation and lingering bitter finish. I can see why this one rates out so well. I certainly have good local (Michigan) options when it comes to regular strength IPAs, but this is right there with them. Very well done and glad I can get some at my local bottle shop. <<update>> Havent had in a while, so I got a fresh bottle. Notes of toasted malt, mango, pine resin, savory spice, honey, a "brassy" quality. Clear pure gold with a tall off-white head leaving significant spotty lace. Somewhat sweet, quite bitter, lightly tart. Medium bodied, soapy, oily, drying, crisp, lengthy toasty finish. Drinkable yet complex, lots of good to this brew.

12 oz bottle.
Pours bright hazy gold with a small white head that settles to a lingering thin covering. Hop driven aroma, citrusy, floral and woody.
Very well done.

Bottle in San Louis Obispo, 2008. From notes. Pours orange, hazy. Big grapefruit citrous aroma, tropical fruit underneath, maybe bit of mango. Nice carmel malt backbone. Crisp bitter grapefruit finish. One of the best!

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2012 33 cl bottle. Hazy, deep golden liquid with medium off-white head. Hoppy aroma of grapefruit, c-hops, citrus, tropical fruit, fresh hops and light caramel malt. Taste is dry with medium to high bitterness and hoppy notes. Light to medium bodied with nice carbonation. Overall, good IPA, better than average. 7/4/8/3/17 

Re-rating 2012-05-28. Excellently clear, orange/amber liquid with medium, firm off-white head that lasts for a long time. Aroma is very hop forward with notes of citrus, grapefruit, resin, pine, caramel, mango/passionfruit and fresh hops. Really pleasant, up the score to 8. Taste is dry with high bitterness and has nice resinous notes and some biscuity malt as well. Medium bodied with a well tuned level of carbonation. Not too high, not too low. Really enjoyed this one this time. One of the better "regular" IPAs there is and quite easy on the wallet as well.
This beer is really pretty decent, but still nothing much to it.  I like some more complexity.
A great staple beer. Something you could enjoy every night. Very smooth and tasty flow across the palate. Hoppy but not over powering. Sort a light ipa in its easy to drink way.

Poured a orangish gold color.  Med head.  Big citrus hop aroma.  Med to heavy bitter, slight sweet.  Med body, slick and slightly oily.  Long bitter finish.  Crisp and fresh hopped, clean finish.  Some grapefruit and pine flavors.  This one the hoppier ipas that Ive had.  Well done.

Little to no head.Aroma is mild to nothing some fruit almost bublegum/yeast esters? Not a fresh beer maybe im assuming.Dry crisp bitter drinkable. Finishes with some malt sweetness- lingering bitterness.Reminds me of a few extra pale ales ive recently had.I guess this would be west coast ipa style so its a pretty classic good tasting ipa.  I generally fall for the more balanced malty ipas but enjoy these lighter dryer hop forward ipas too.Just not a memeralbly good ipa.
Bottle @ GBBF, 2011. Pours cloudy orange with a small white head and lacings. Fresh hops. Pine and grape. Flavor has lots of peach and buiscuit. Medium and smooth body. Ends dry.

Has all the characteristics of a great IPA but the finish, like a lot of stone beers is unpleasantly bitter and lasting.  I like a good bitter bite in IPAs but this one is just a bit lingering and makes for a rough drink imo.  The hop flavors are great with citrus and pine but the finish is bad.

Sweet. Jesus. 

This is a delicious beer. On tap at the Farmhouse in Burlington VT. Aroma is clean and citrusy; pours a lovely hazy light caramel amber with slow, lazy effervescence. Tight white head with impressive, sustained lacing that lingers all down the tulip. Hops aplenty dominate, medium mouth feel, finishes bitter and beautiful on the soft palate with a lingering piney creaminess on the roof of the mouth. Wow. Love.
Bottle at Great British Beer Festival 2011.  Cloudy orange, good head.  Lovely hoppy aroma.  Very pleasant light IPA with a dry aftertaste.  Good but not brilliant.

Impressive.  This beer holds together very well and makes one delicious beverage.  Its a little pricey at 5.99 for a 1pt 6fl bottle, but it fits better as a special occasion beer rather than a session beer.  Very hoppy, very good.
user_location: The United States of Texas, Texas, USA

text: Great IPA. Golden orange pour with big white head. Aroma is hoppy pine, grapefruit and also tropical fruits. Very nice, with a heavy floral presence. Taste is obviously hoppy bitterness, again with grapefruit, pine, but also a nicely balancing caramel touch. Funnily, I tasted more malt than I could smell, but that certainly wasnt a bad thing. Mouthfeel medium to rich with pleasant carbonation. A very, very solid everyday IPA.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2011 Tap @ CASK Pub and Kitchen. From memory, since I didnt take any notes. Nose is really fresh with aromatic hops. Both citrusy, pungent and crisp with a great play between the different hops. A bit of maltiness with a pronounced caramel feel. Taste is amazing for an IPA, really pungent, nicely tasting hop profile, pineapple and oranges come to mind. Great balance. A stellar IPA.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2012 AR : fresh citrus. some strawberry and lychee
AP : Lovely copper/orange. foamy head
T : slight sweetness giving over to full hops then a bitter finish
P : milky and a bit sticky
O : pretty much just how an IPA should be ( maybe slightly too much alcohol or a good zing on the tongue, depends on my mood!)

cracking beer.  a must sample

Bottle to a pint glass. Pours a rich golden color, with evident carbonation.  Rich, thick head that sustains through the glass.  Absolutely smooth, with a clean hoppy taste.  Rich even finish.  As good of an IPA as youll find.

In bottle. A golden colour with a thin white head. Big hoppy aroma. Sweet and fruity with passionfruit and grapefruit and a nice caramel backbone. Tastes quite heavy with some CO2 prickle, oily mouthfeel and again caramel and fruity hops. Nice bitter linger with a long alcohol hum. Very nice.
Bottle. This is a solid beer! Aroma of hops and caramel. Similar taste. Well balanced, not too happy or at least not overwhelming. Definitely recommend this one for hopheads. 6.9% alcohol.

A clear reddish orange beer with a moderate off-white head that leaves decent lacing.  The aroma is definitely hoppy, with pine, apricot, and grapefruit detectable.  The flavor has a nice dose of bitterness and some pine and grassy notes.  The body is quite nice, allowing the bitterness to remain on the tongue long after you swallow.  Still, I find it lacking a bit in actual flavor, and perhaps its just the bottle I got, but the aroma was very faint.  Ill have to re-rate at a later date.

Having sampled many of Stones offerings in the past, Im finally getting the chance to try their IPA.  

This is a 22 ounce bomber that Im pouring into a goblet.  The appearance is hazy, and it almost looks like there is some yeast sediment at the bottom of the bottle.  I didnt think that Stone bottle conditioned but maybe Im wrong.  Color is a deep golden yielding to copper.  Head is minimal but it has gorgeous lacing.  

Not surprisingly, hops dominate the nose.  This is an IPA, after all, and a West-coast style one, to boot.  Fruity citrus hops dominate, followed by floral and musty pine.  In the background theres this wonderful hint of malt caramel sweetness.  Often you get an IPA with muted hop character, and thats certainly not the case here.  The smell on this is just so crisp and fresh  a sure sign that this is a very fresh IPA and one thats been treated with care.  

The first taste showcases a nice level of carbonation, and moderate bitterness that isnt overpowering.  Having had Ruination in the past, its nice to get a beer from Stone that actually attempts to maintain some semblance of balance.  Taste has a nice residual sweetness to it, including in the finish.  Its easy to finish IPAs with bitterness, but this, surprisingly, seems to go more towards the sweet side.  That said the body of the beer is light, dry, and refreshing.  Lots of flavor for something that goes down so easily.  The label says 6.9% ABV but the alcohol is never apparent.  

Stone gets a lot of praise for the other beers that they produce, but this is an underrated example of the West-Coast IPA style.  Its a little bit light in body, but this lends to easy drinking.  The hop profile and underrated malt backbone make this beer a winner.
355ml bottle.  Pours bright gold with a medium frothy head.  Aroma is pineapple, mango and a little bread.  Taste is piney to start.  Creamy malt and a strong bitter finish.

Pours a rich amber/golden colour, with a minimal white head.  The aroma is of strong citrus and grapefruit, with something a little more earthy in the mix.  The taste is relatively light and malty, with abundant hops, but seems well balanced overall.  A very solid (and delicious) example of an IPA.

It poured a hazy orange color with a white head. The aroma had notes of big resinous pine, citrus, and some caramel. The taste was sweet citrus, bitter pine, some biscuit and caramel, with a nicely bitter finish. Very good IPA.

355ml bottle. Pours a hazy golden colour with a good head, The nose has pine and grapefruit pith and some pink grapefruit, almost blood oranges. The taste has a creamy malt profile to start with with then pink grapefruit to follow. The palate is big in body, medium texture and a very clean and refreshing finish. Overall, a great beer!

Bottle 650ml
Pours cloudy amber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, citrus and grape. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
hard to top this, easy to drink - close to perfect smell, taste, and appearance.  easy to find in chicago now on tap and bottle.
Good American ipa. Floral hop nose. Citrusy, fruity, tropical, good malt kick. Well carbonated, good head retention. Well balanced, not too bitter

Aroma is a perfect balance of pale malts and a tease of crystal with some nice earthy hops,very little citrus or grapefruit compared to say the Smutty IPA.Nice deep gold with a somewhat short head with some good lacing.This beer is all about balance and overall quality.

Pour hazy golden yellow great white head great lace. Aroma pine, citrus, grapefruit, caramel, orange. Taste pine, resiny hops, cirus, grapefruit, caramel malt, nice malt balance. MF medium sticky body mild carb. Solid brew very well done solid construction.

Draught at Beer Trappe. Orange color. Grapefruit and floral. Solid bitterness.Tasty.Earlier Rating: 8/12/2005 Total Score: 4.6Stone is king This is a solid IPA, nice hops, excellent taste. If you see a Stone, dont hestitate. DRINK IT!
Otherwise, you are not worthy.  I wish Stone was available in Michigan. I used to bring em back from Austin.

Excellent IPA that delivers everything you want in a good beer. Bitter but well balanced, this beer is worthy of being in the regular rotation for certain. If you havent tried this beauty yet do yourself a favor and grab some.
A great beer I picked up in a mix-and-match pack.  I am usually rather fond of IPAs.

5 oz draught at Flying Saucer KC for Stone release party in MO. (from notes) Pours a clear golden color.  Aroma of citrus, pine, grass.  Flavor of grapefruit, grass, pine.  Not to heavy.  Wonderful aromas and flavor.Earlier Rating: 7/12/2010 Total Score: 4.6Pours a cloudy honey copper color. Aroma of floral, pine and citrus. Flavor is citrus, pine and lavender. Balance is incredible. Surprisingly low pungency and bitterness for being so aromatic.  Ridiculously good!

Bottle pour enjoyed in a tulip, with a nice turkey sandwich. Aroma was intense grapefruit/orange with some honey and caramel in the background. The body was a nice copper/orange color with a nice creamy white head. The head looked like what is leftover from a milkshake with whipped cream on top that gets left at the bottom of the glass. Citrus and honey entice the taste buds up front but this one has a nice malty backbone that satisfies. Awesome.
one of the best ipa´s in the markey, excelente aroma with notes of malt and of course intesen citrusy hop aroma, the flavor is refreshing and comples at the same time, a really great treat
Whats to say - plenty have reviewed it - I prefer it to Ruination, which was my favourite. A great IPA!
Refrigerated bottle poured into a shaker.  Pours hazy golden with two finger head.  Some lacing, good carbonation, thick body, and sticky texture.  Taste is spicy citrus, sharp, and bitter hops.

Bottle at the Blue Monk in Buffalo. Pours a gold/ copper colour, with a ring of white head and some spidery lace left on the glass wall. Some yeast rings when the head settles as well. Smells of hop and a little bready. Tastes bitter (wow), theres some honey sweetness as well. Tongue numbing. Good stuff.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden copper color with a white fluffy head. Nice lace left on the glass. Orange, citrus, grassy, all in the nose. Clean and crisp. Light/medium mouthfeel. Buliding bitterness. Sweet upfront with the  bitterness flavors. I know this is highly rated and its decent but in all honestly Id almost rather have a Centennial IPA from Fournders.

Right up there with Avery Dugana, Stone IPA is the perfect IPA.  From the first sniff to the last sip, everything about this beer is flawless.  The first sip is rich and bitter and dances on the back of your tongue.  Its like tasting a magical plant.  The pour is immaculate and the aroma is intense and earthy.  It makes you want to eat Stone IPA instead of drink it.  6 packs for $7.99-$9.99 are always worth the price.

Wow, I cant believe I have not rated this beer yet.  
Easily found in most stores, not rarely found tap.  
Nice bright golden hue in the pour, a nice medium white head.  The Aroma is hop and it associated citrus and pine.  The flavor is sharp, crisp and perfect for a hot day.  This is just a great beer.

I recently reviewed this beer on my website.
Please find attached a URL to my page:


http://zythum.yolasite.com/stone-brewer

Found this in a grocery store in springtown texas This beer pours a cloudy light tan color, with a pure white head that leaves behind very good lacing. The aroma promises hops in abundance, and the flavor deliveres. Crisp strong hop flavor, and a beer I can drink all night long.
Extra golden in color, this is a very solid IPA.  Lots of hops up front with a nice bitter flavor and finish.  This is not the best tasting IPA Ive had, but is one of the most refreshing.

Appearance is clear amber with a medium white head. Aroma is pine hops with a little sweetness. Taste is a hint of sweet malts, but mostly earth hops and medium bitterness. Overall very well balanced and probably the best IPA I have tried.
Pours a cloudy golden with a thin white head.  Aroma is citrusy floral with light caramel notes.  Sweet malty taste.  Bitter palate with a sticky texture.

UPDATED: SEP 18, 2011 33cl bottle from a friend who went to NYC.
Decent white head.  golden colour.  Nice bitterIPA.  Citrus bitterness

Why does an IPA expire 2 months after it is first available in the state?IPAs were brewed to survive long ocean journeys due to high hop contents.The most bang for your buck out of Stones brews.I will be buying Sierra Nevada for the holiday weekend for half the price of this over- rated swill.

Pours a beautiful light gold, nice fluffy head. Aroma is  cat pee, pine, citrus, grapefruit. Flavor is clean hops. Nice citrus and pine hop flavors, juicy grapefruit hop finish. Just enough malt to know its there but its in the backseat. Clean yeast finish. Great IPA.

An excellent West Coast IPA.  It pours a golden light amber color, not as dark as many IPAs.  Aroma.excellent green hoppy pine.  Taste is also hoppy balance, it finishes on the bitter side, not so much a good strong hoppy finish.  Great brew!

This is one of my favorite brews in the world.  I drink more of this one than of anything else out there.  It is a fixture in my fridge.  Very citrus in taste and aroma.  Pours a golden-amber, nice and cloudy from the bottle.  Head is a beautiful froth, if slightly less than a finger.  Beautifully refined in bitterness and sweetness, dry and light in body.  This brew almost singlehandedly redefined west coast IPAs, and continues to excel.  It is rare that other IPAs can even come close, and even rarer for a brew to eclipse the high-quality flavor and all-around goodness delivered in a Stone IPA.

this is one of my favorite ipas. a) because i can get it anywhere and b) because it is damn good.  citrusy and grapefruit notes. great aroma and body well balanced plenty of bitterness and low on malty sweetness. enjoyed on draft at backcountry pizza in nederland, co after a trip to rocky mountain national park.

12 oz bottle
The aroma is of bready malts and mild hops.  This beer may be past its prime.
The taste is some citrus fruits, bready malts, and hop resin.
Not a bad beer. A solid IPA.

Bottle pour ---> Shaker. Scents... Citrus, hops and a touch of ginger/spice were what this one is all about. The flavor was bright and fruity, with a nice sweet malt start and a nice, dry hop finish. The aftertaste was bitter and dry, only making you want more. This particular IPA is fantastic and balanced - Stone strikes again!
12 oz bottle from 6 from corner store. really bitter, but has sweet aspects to the flavor with some good fruity flavors, peach? certainly a beer ill have again soon but not necessarily exceptional.
Bottle. Pours golden with nice white head. Grapefruit and pine hop aroma, taste is sweet, medium creamy mouthfeel, and lots of hops.

Very rich, creamy head. Lively carbonation which helps maintain the head. Bitter aroma with strong note of dank hops. Clean, pure medium amber color. Very refreshing IPA. Strength of hops is well-balanced with the alcohol content. The palate doesnt dull your senses by the end of the glass. One of the best in the IPA category. Exceptionally solid.

Like this one. Its got a nice combination of citrusy-grapefruit and pine-hop bite to it. Smells very fresh and floral. Pours a nice golden amber with good-sized frothy head. I think Ill have another.

Pours a clear, peach-amber with a frothy eggshell head. Aroma is sweet citrus, sweet malt, orange marmalade, pine, english yeast, and a touch of stone fruit. Flavor is pine, wet limestone, underripe stone fruit, citrus hops, english yeast, and a touch of toffee. Palate is light to medium bodied, neutral entry, dry from there on out, dry finish and a medium carbonation. Really nice IPA, but the English-y yeast notes are a little off for the American IPA malt and hop profiles..

bottled. pours light clear amber with ample foamy off white head. aromas of spruce caramel and mild citrus rind. it has a light sweetness with really well balanced hop structure. its very hoppy without being astringent. damn good.

Bottle.  Clear golden orange with a head that has good lacing.  Smells grapefuitty and very dank.  The hops are just bursting out of this one.  Tastes of uber floral and resiny hoops that almost has a spicy quality to it.  There is not very much balance here, but it sure is a hop lovers dream.  The finish is quite bitter and last for a bit.  A very good ipa.

Bottle.  Clear light orange pour, lasting head and a hoppy/dry and slightly orange aroma.  Flavor is creamy vanilla hops, light malt backbone orange and lemon citurs and finished dry.  Very good and a much better price point than Ruination.

Stone IPA is a true classic IPA, huge and hoppy and bitter and oh-so-West Coast.  The hops are spicy and piney with grapefruit and lemon zest mixed in, yet the malts provide apt sweetness to help battle the massive IBUs.  Theres the tiniest hint of alcohol in the finish, but this heat blends into the peppery hops, so its no real bother.  Plus, after three Stone IPAs, the hats women wear to the Kentucky Derby start to make sense.

Harmonischer, sehr starker Hopfengeruch, blumig, natürlich, deutlich nach Honig. Selbstverständlich ist der Antrunk sehr hopfig, leicht blumig und honigartig. Der Hopfen kommt hier in absolut reiner Form vor. Im Mittelteil wird das Bier etwas süß, der Hopfen wird durch eine leichte Malznote fülliger. Hier setzen außerdem die ersten Bitternoten ein, die sich im Abgang steigern, insgesamt aber auf angenehmem und erfrischenden Niveau bleiben.
