UPDATED: JAN 15, 2009 Bottle pours a clear golden copper color with a decent sized white head.  Full bodied citrus hops aroma.  Great flavor with the perfect amount of bitterness in the finish.  I really like this one!

Bottle. Clear amber body, light head and perfect carbonation. Wonderful floral citrusy hops and pine. Incredibly smooth and balanced. Sweet to malt to hoppy piney finish. Was so impressed that I shared it with my non-hop loving friends and it was praised all around. Magnificent brew.

Bottle pours clear light golden with 1cm white head with nice lacing. Aroma is pine and sweet malt. First taste is somewhat sweet but hops bitterness quickly appears and dominates the flavor. Finish is lingering pine hops burn. Nice IPA.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2009 A lot softer than I was expecting. Very much a sessionable IPA, although go easy witht the ABV. The obligatory pine hops were there, but this is a very smooth beer..."quaffable" for want of a better term
Bottle.  Poured a gold/orange color with a two finger white head.  Aroma of pine hops.  Flavor was well balanced with malt.  Medium body with good carbonation.

slightly hazy orange hued gold under a medium sized creamy white head.  good lacing.  a very sharp looking beer.  hoppy(peach, apricot, pear, pine) scented  with sweet pale malt.  flavor is perfectly malted to match the beers hop content.  pine, peach, white grape blend with a bready malt.  malty enough for balance but still letting the hops take the stage.  medium bodied.  a real quality ipa.
Nice orange color.  Medium head.  Great pine hop aroma.  Big hop taste.  Alcohol is well hidden.  Just a great example of an APA/IPA.  Great beer.  Would definitely buy again, and again....
Taste 9/8 Bottle. Looks: Copper, small head. Aroma: Blend of strong hops. Taste: Very big flavor blended very well. Almost a double IPA in taste. Nice, high quality brew.

I would agree with others who’ve called this beer balanced.  This is a really easy-drinking IPA that I could probably drink all night.  I love variety and beers that are extreme, but I’d buy a six-pack of this to drink at a party or wherever...there’s been a lot of talk about "session" beers on this site, and I’d nominate this one.

Pours an amber body with good head.  Aroma is distinctly hoppy, but not over the top.  There is some light sweetness and citrus notes.  Flavor is hoppy with a significant malt backbone.  Mouthfeel is crisp and clean.  Very drinkable, but not too unusual or exciting.  Still good though.

I’d buy this again and recommend it.  SurlySober left this at my house, and I have no idea where he got it.

At a tasting at Priscillas in Morehead City, NC.  Balanced.  That was the word for this fine IPA.  Poured a golden yellow with a good head.  The aroma is floral with the hops.  Smell is strong, but the taste is balanced, not over the top.  Bittering on the back end is excellent.

Pours a hazy, medium golden color with a decent head that builds from the bottom.  Has an aroma of crisp hops with hints of flowers and citrus.  This beer has a clean, hoppy flavor, but the hops aren’t overpowering.  It definitely leaves a bit of a bitter taste on the edges of the tongue, but not in a bad way.

Pours a lovely golden-orange color with a half inch white head.  Nice lacing on glass as head disappears.  Aroma is strong with piney hops, but it also has nice notes of citrus, perhaps grapefruit stands out the best.  The taste is about the same, a notes of grass comethrough in the bitter aftertaste.  Very balanced and very good.
pours a nice golden color, with a small white head, some lacing on glass. Strong hoppy, flowerey smell, taste is the same, bitterness is perfect, well balanced, very refreshing.

This hazy amber and orange brew may be the most balanced beer of this type I have tasted.  The sweet and the dry, the sour and the bright, hops and citrus, spice and pine, flowers and malt.  Nothing stands out, just an incredibly pleasing beer to drink.  "Note to self, I must be defective, I prefer a beer no so well balanced, something that grabs me one way or another."

Pours cloudy amber with a strong hops
aroma with a citrus note in the background.  Smooth palate with a
slight creaminess from the head.  Lots
of hops bitterness but not overpowering.  some spiciness in the
flavor too.  Another excellent brew from
this west coast brewery.
Clear golden with medium white head. Sweet and hoppy aroma with citric, piney and hoppy notes. Sweet and hoppy flavour that develops likewise with a solid bitter finish

Pours a nice dark gold with a touch of amber.  Small but lasting off white head.  Big nose, sweet candied citrus, a little pine and bananas.  OMG, beautiful.  Big hop flavor but great balance, nice bitterness but not to over the top.  I could drink a few of these.

On draft at Midtown bar in Harrisburg. Poured cloudy orangeish golden in color with a medium sized beige head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of floral, citrus and piney hops. Tastes of orange citrus, sweet malt, with a nice bittering hop taste which leads into the finish nicely. Great body and great hop flavor.

Pours a hazy orange, with an impressive white head leaving great lacing.  An intense, wonderful aroma of hops, floral notes and citrus.  Hop blast to start the taste balanced by a lingering mild sweetness.  Basically, what any IPA lover would look for.  An incredible beer by any measure, and one of my "goto’s" when I can’t decide on anything.

Pours a hazy orange, with a decent white head. Aroma is of bitter hops and floral notes. with hints of oranges. Taste of bitterness hits first, followed by a lingering sweetness that is damned delicious. Has the perfect amount of bite to make this enjoyable, but not overly bitter.  Very good beer.

22oz Bottle. Golden color with a fluffy, white head that leaves Belgian lace on the inside of the glass. You can smell and taste the citrus from the abundant use of Centennial hops. A refreshing burst hits your mouth with the first sip due to the carbonation level and bitterness. The high hopping rate covers the high alcohol content (6.9% abv), but a bit of residual malt sweetness makes it through at the finish. Nothing complex here - just a straight forward, highly hopped, American IPA.
Another great ipa had the pleasure of enjoying this one in new york with my buddies nice and refreshing on a hot july day

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2008 Bottle. Pours slightly hazy gold with a hint of orange and a small but creamy white head. Nose is big on citrus - pineapple, grapefruit, orange all come through, sweet but clean. Taste starts off with clean, lightly sweet caramel malt and lightly astringent hops, with a finish that allows the fresh citrus to really shine, and a lighter than expected bitterness lingering on the palate. The overall result is an utterly fantastic IPA - not overpowering, refreshing, flavorful, and one of the most drinkable IPA’s I’ve ever had. Emphasizes the flavor of the hops, rather than just the bitterness. Superb balance.

On draught at the Echo Tap in Madison: Pours a bright cloudy copper colour with a large creamy white head. Aroma is floral all the way through, massive hop flow, grapefruits, lemon and other citrus notes. Taste is firm, astringent, wicked hoppy and chewy just how i like it. for $2.50 taps of this during happy hour, i was pretty happy when i left! Awesome brew, it delivered the perfect amont of hops to my palate.

Reddish gold pour with a minimal white head. Aroma is citrus and floral hops, with a bit of honey. The hop component is a little understated for my tastes - the citrus in particular is a little flat. The flavor centers more on the floral hoppiness, but includes some very nice clean citrus. Nice refreshing finish. Pretty average mouthfeel. Good beer, but a little disappointing, hopefully I just got an old bottle.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a hazy yellow/orange gold with minimal white head.  Strong hoppy aroma (citrus and floral).  Hops in the taste, although I found that the citrus hops tended to dominate, particuarly in the bitter finish.  Definitely enjoyable, but can’t quite give it as much love as some other IPAs.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2008 (Sample from July 20, 2007 Beer Club Meeting; 12oz bottle from Yellow Store at home on September 2, 2008) Ultra-clear orange-yellow color with a small white head.  Looks clean!  Quick, sparse carbonation.  Light, but clean and true.  Hefty on the palate but thin at the same time.  Alcohol is noticeable only when you slam a mouthful.  Nice properties.  Citric.  Serious dry-hopped characteristics.  Well done for a standard-style IPA.  Two thumbs up!

650 mL bottle.  Orange-brown with a small white head.  Strong aroma of C-hops and not much else.  Not that that’s a bad thing.  The flavour is surprisingly well balanced, with loads of citrus & floral hops almost, but not quite, balanced by a solid nutty-caramel malt backbone.  Alcohol is well hidden.  Surprisingly drinkable.

NTH TRIAL: Pours a brilliant golden color with a slight white head; aroma is the perfect amount of citrus-y, floral hops (definitely there, but nothing overboard); flavor is smooth and delicious with citrus bitterness, biscuity malts, and a great finish that sits in the corners of your mouth.  This beer is fantastic, and although it’s ~7% ABV, it’s currently my session beer of choice.  It embodies what IPAs should be, and although I wasn’t that excited to hear that Stone had finally made it to Wisconsin, as I sit here in my favorite chair and sip away at a Stone IPA, I’m now completely delighted.
Really nice aroma.  Very strong citrus presence.  Very hoppy,  but definitely bitter at the end.  Very pretty orange color.
Tons of citrus (lemon, grapefruit) and pine hop flavors and aromas.  Strong bitter finish.  Alcohol is not noticeable at all.  Very enjoyable.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2013 Pale orange pour with a nice luminescence at the center. Big frothy head, booming floral hops in the aroma, Cascade and maybe some Chinook? Delightful, just like youd expect from SoCal masters like Stone. Caramel malts are initially detectable in the flavor but this one is really powerful in the hop department, with the dry-hopping contributing estimably not just to the scrumptious flavors but to the balance of the brew. Sessionable as hell, and compares favorably with high-level quaffers like Two Hearted.

more easy going then stones reputation would lead you to believe.  hops are certainly on the attack, but its hard to believe this is 70 IBUs.  still, very dry and more floral then strictly bitter.  an excellent showcase of the style no question, world class. however, this doesnt toe the line between IPA/IIPA as much as two hearted does (despite the similiarly high ABV for the style)
Sure, when I was in San Diego, I didn’t get a chance to try this.  Now I find it in Wisconsin?  Very hhoppy goodness.  If it wasn’t so darned expensive, I’d have it all of the time.
Bottle from BSF, GBBF ’08. Coppery gold with a white head. Sweet piney hop aroma. Sweet malts in the taste with golden syrup, balanced by grapefruit and intense concluding hoppiness. Classic.

Bottle - Dark honey color.  Thick white creamy head.  Excellent lacing. Tremendous hoppy/grassy aroma.  Earthy flavor with loads of grapefruit with similar mouthfeel.  Seriously dry finish.  This is right up there with Bells Two Hearted as the best IPA’s I’ve tasted.

the only thing that could make stone IPA better is if it were stone ruination IPA. hazy, newly minted penny colors indicate a huge dry-hopped flavor. aroma suggests grapefruits, grapefruits and more grapefruits - should i bring cottage cheese along for this one? bodaciously large hop flavors light up the sides of my tongue like broadway marquee signs. this is a showcase, full cast performance beer. every ingredient is in place and ready to perform. even the aftertaste lingers a bitterly citrus reminder of a great experience on the tongue. i love this beer. i would love it more had i never tasted the ruination IPA - comparing brothers: an obviously forgiveless sin.

Bottle.  Clear golden pour with a thick frothy white head.  Aroma is weaker than I expected, still a nice hop scent though.  Flavor has a sweet caramel base with a dominant bitterness.  Very well balanced and a nicely put together beer overall.

Such a delicious beer. Amazing aroma, full of piney, citrusy hop goodness. The flavor is full power - acidic at first, then a hop-splosion with a caramel-sweet finish. Like making out with a gorgeous chick who’s chewing hop-flavored gum. Nice long, smooth finish. Right up there with Two Hearted, maybe slightly less balanced.
Pours golden with a thin white head. Great hoppy floral aroma with some balancing malt. Great mixture of flavors with a delicious hop finish. Awesome IPA.

Pours hazy golden orange with off white head. Grapefruit hop aroma with some sweet maltiness. MIldly sweet with a nice balance of hops and malts. Medium body with soft carbonation and a sticky mouthfeel. Very good IPA.

Clear golden lagerish color with a finger of white head.  Grapefruit, floral hops and smooth cool malt aroma.  Almost buttery, it coats the tongue just slightly and delivers a great hop finish.  Bitter but fruity and bright.  Enjoyable, dare I say more so than Ruination?  Though it would be a preference of the night.

Great Great IPA, I’m not a huge IPA fan, but this one def rises above many others that I’ve had.  Its got a fresh hoppy aroma and great deep golden appearance.  The burst of hop flavor is smoothed by a citrus aftertaste.  Very drinkable!!

Rich pineapple and cream aroma with malty background, some citrus and flowers.  Golden yellow with a white foamy head.  Fresh citrus and pineapple flavors, sweet up front with a bitter duration.  Medium rich palate, not too heavy.  Good duration and flavors stick to the tongue.  Slight woodiness.  Just rich enough and with good fresh flavors makes this IPA solid and drinkable.

Bottle.  I’m surprised it took me this long to get around to trying this.  Nice yellowish golden color with a pillow of white head.  Floral and pine hops dominate the nose similar to Ruination.  Flavor is bitter balanced finely with good malt.  Leaves a great mild bitter aftertaste for about a minute then disappears for the next sip.  Moderate carbonation, medium bodied,  crisp and refreshing.  This has everything I expect from a good quality IPA.

On tap at San Diego downtown Courtyard Marriot hotel bar.  Bar tender told me he fought to get Stone IPA on tap for 6 months, so I salute him.  Pine and grapefruit aroma.  Pours orange with persistant white head.  Excellent lacing on the glass.  Not much malt flavor, but rich, complex pine and grapefuit hop bitterness.  Surprisingly restrained for Stone, and very drinkable.  Excellent IPA.

Bottle. This is a great IPA. Compared to Stone’s Ruination, it is a little more restrained (though make no mistake, this is just compared to its big brother. This is a big hoppy IPA.) and a little less balanced, with the hop bitterness lacking as full a malt backbone to balance it out. Pours  golden topped by a thin white head, leaves some lacing on the glass. Citrus hops on the nose, with some slight tropical notes. Big citrus hop flavor, with pine coming in, atop a light malt backbone. Huge bitter end. Very good, looking forward towards Stone being available here.

12 oz bottle.  Pours golden orange with a 2 cm iff white foamy head that is mostly diminishing.  Aroma of hops: mostly sweet, a little piney and resins.  Initial taste is citrusy sweet.  Flavor balances out and becomes very dry on the aftertaste, which lasts for a long time.  Light to moderate carbonation, hint of alcohol, light to medium body, and tons of lacing.  Great beer, very drinkable.

Sampled at 08vt brewers fest. Pours a gold/orange color with a white head. Aroma of citrusand floral hops, pine, lemon and a touch of sweet malt essence. Flavor is floral and citrus hops, grapefruit, pine, light caramel and has a nice malt background. Medium to full bodied with a dry and bitter finish.

From tap. Pours clear and golden orange with a lacing white head. Crisp peach and grapefruity hops aroma. Flavour is dense grapefruit and pine wood hoppy flavour. Mild sweet and fruity. Goes into a nice mellow and fruity hops finish yet with a solid bitterness.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2008 Poured it just now, sitting in front of me.  Initial smell is hops but not very strong, Appearance is cloudy dark, orange red with a thin white head.  Flavor is rather weak with some hops.  Palate is smooth and leaves a small bitterness.  Two sips, not very impressed but its not bad.  This is balanced but like, no complexity to it.  I need to try this again another day and rerate it, Im thinking my senses are attuned tonight. 

Rerate...yeah, its beautiful.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2010 Bomber. Pours clears golden orange leaving thin white film of head. Can smell it from 2 feet away. Huge aroma of floral and citrus hops with a touch of pine, orange and lemon. Flavor is floral hops, citurs and pine with touch of malt. Flavor does not match the intensity of the aroma, but still packs big hop punch. Drinkablility is scary as this IPA is perfectly balanced.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2008 Exactly what Im looking for in a great IPA. The floral, citrusy hops burst out of the bottle on the initial whiff, and the flavor is there to back it up. Nice orange/amber color, with a decent head. Beautiful lingering bitterness.

12 oz. bottle - Poured hazy honey color with medium head and great lacing on glass. Hop aroma is quite bountiful along with citrus. Taste is bitter on tongue due to high IBUs which makes for great IPA. Flavor is very similar to Bells Two Hearted Ale which is a good thing. My second Stone brew to date and liked both.
Golden pour with frothy head. Intense hop aroma and flavor- grapefruit, other citrus, and strong pine notes. Exceptional balance, one of the best IPAs out there.
bottle, hoppy aroma with good lacing.  Touch of carbonation and grapefruit undertones make this an excellent offering for sessions.  Good malt finish. One of my favorites

Got a 22 oz bomber from my local liquor store. Stone IPA and Arrogant Bastard are the only 2 Stone brews available in Texas, so I tend to take these beers for granted.

Poured a 1 finger head into my imperial pint glass.
Color is light amber.
Aroma is floral citrusy, powerful for an IPA.
taste is just the right balance between maltiness and hop bite that I expect from an IPA.
Drinkability: I could drink a lot of this but I usually get a lower abv ipa for a session beer.

Extremely well balanced.
Stone, you haven’t let me down yet.

Serving type: bottle

22oz bottle. Citric hop aroma with a slight floral scent. Two finger foamy head that last about 3 minutes and leave a nice lace. Light orange in color with visible carbonation. Taste is very hoppy with a slight maltiness in the background. Good carbonation makes this crisp and refreshing. One of my favorite all time IPA’s. Great out of the bottle, even better on tap.

Bottle from Kegs & Barrels in McKinney, TX.
Pours a nice clear gold ith nice white head. Aroma of grapefruit and sweet malt. Flavor is very nice, grapefruit hops, bold heavy malt flavor, nice strong bitter....This is an excellent IPA, full bodied and high carbonation....I like this stuff!.

22 oz. bottle. This might have been a little old. Pours a nice golden orangish hazed hue with a nice white head that sticks around and laces. Aromas were sweet and citrusy. Initial wasn’t as bitter as expected, but largely citrusy and sweet, lacking a defining malt character. Light bodied. Perhaps this has been on the shelf long enough to take away some of the hop bite. A very good beer, very sessionable, but nothing like the hop bomb I expected for this supposed top tier IPA. Rerate pending.. for now, a good beer but a little dissappointed from expectations.
Bottle. Golden amber color with an oily but small head. Nice aroma of heavy citrus hops   and very faint malt. Bold bitterness, and a very very light sweetness. An excellent IPA specimen.

This is an extremely fresh bottle, only about two weeks old I believe. Pours a light clear orange that is quite vibrant with a little bit of white head that fades fast and leaves just a little bit of lacing. Smell is tons of citrus and pine hops with  nice malt backbone that supports the hops quite nicely. Taste is just a pleasurable balance of the citrusy/piney hops with a caramel/biscuity malt support.  Really smooth and easy to drink. An exceptional IPA.

bottle thanks to metzlers in denton tx.  poured a clear gold with a white head.  decent retention and lacing was present.  aroma was slightly grapefruit and hops were noticable.  flavor left me a little disappointed for an IPA.  maybe i will try it again.
Draft, Dave Famous BBQ. Exceptional IPA, flavor, aroma and taste all great. Very drinkable.
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Great brew.  This is my standard IPA.  Easy drinking at a relatively high %. Hops, malts,  but they are overbearing this beer can be drank fast.

F-ing great.  Smell the supercharged Cascade like aroma of the Centennial, taste the 2 row and crystal malts, swallow and feel the smooth bitter bite of the Centennial hops and just revel in the glory of this beaut.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2009 [26Jul08] Bottle courtesy of Bottle Trek.  Pours a clear, pale, yellow-gold body with white head.  Aroma of pale malts, citrus and floral hops, and spices.  Well-balanced with a distinct mix of grapefruit and floral hops with green hops near the finish.  Medium-bodied with a crisp, bitter hop bite. {8/4/8/4/16}

[09May09] 22 oz. bottle, pours a clear, pale yellow-gold body with a foamy white head.  Aroma is a mix of citrus and floral hops with a hint of caramel malts.  Flavor is less citrusy than I remember; the floral and green hops are a little more dominant.  Still very well-balanced with hints of pine, caramel, and bread.  Finishes bitter and dry. {8/4/8/4/16}

an exellent IPA, but i have to admit i was a bit dissapointed, yes it had all the atributes of a great IPA, but i found it a bit underwhelming for all the hype, and the style ratings. Not a hop forward as i would have expected, quite subdued i found.
Bottle@ Marty’s Newton,MA. A nice Ambar color qith a foamy white head. Citrus fruity aroma. Flavor is hoppy and spicy. I loe that one.

Bottle.  Pours a nice light gold color.  Fairly wimpy head.  Intense citrus aroma, followed by flavor somewhat less intense than aroma.  Great overall balance, though not as interestingly complex as DFH 60 Minute.  Long lingering citrus finish.
On tap at a restaurant in Denver Int’l Airport.  I’m an IPA fan, and I was really pleased with this beer.  Very hoppy. Great flavor.  I like it a lot.

22oz into weizen glass.  Brilliant, clear golden color, frothy white head.  Cannabis, yeast, and grapefruit aroma.  Delicious, fruity, rounded.  This is what every pale ale should be as far as mouthfeel - slight alco-heat, NO stickiness, nice hop tartness.  Not as bitter as I was expecting.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2009 12 oz. bottle into sniffer.  Nice light honey color with pretty good white head that leaves some nice lace.  Solid refreshing hop aroma - mostly pine and some citrus - with a bit of a sweet malt essence too.  Pretty interesting flavor - crisp light malt upfront followed abruptly by a bitter sharp pine flavor that fades into a citrus hop flavor on the finish. Great.  Light bodied on the palate with the right amount of carbonation.  Overall: good brew, ideal for style, drinkable, and great for hop heads.

(RE-RATE) Same score.  Damn this stuff is classy and always a safe bet,

Hazy golden pour with an out of control thick and fluffy head.  Lots of piny hops with some sweet citrus fruitiness on the nose.  Slightly sweet citrus flavor with bitter hops to finish.  A little week on the end.  Very good IPA.  Like a sweeter, weaker version of the Ruination.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2008 The best part of this beer was the smell. It smelled great with loads of hops, citrus (mostly grapefruit) and pine. The head was foamy and stayed for a little while. The flavor started off by showcasing the hoppy bitterness and then transitioned to somewhat of a malty sweetness with the slightest amount of coffee hints.

One of the best IPA’s I have ever had.  
This brew kinda smells and reminds me of what liquid pot ( reefer) would smell like!  And that can’t be a bad thing !

Clear medium gold pour with a nice foamy white head.  Lots of citrus hops in the aroma.  Definate lemon and grapefruit hops in the flavor, with a good malt body in the background.  Nice bitter hoppy finish.  Medium carbonation.  Very nice IPA.

12 ounce bottle in pint glass.  Golden with lasting white head and lace.  Citrus fresh hop and grassy aroma.  Mild sweetness followed by lemony citrus hops, green hoppiness, that lingers in the back of the throat.  Crisp and dry.  Medium body and carbo.  Defintely good enough to be my new staple IPA, now that I can’t get Two-Hearted anymore.  Excellent.

Bottle at a wedding party. Pours an attractive light orange color with a medium white head.  Aroma features a citrus/flower bouquet that captivates that is very attractive.  Palate is refreshingly crisp, yet packs a huge flavor punch.  Primary flavor notes are of grapefruit, orange, lemon, and some malts for balance.  Starts and ends with a hoppy bitterness, but mid-palate is almost sweet with its succulent fruit flavors.  One of the best IPAs Ive tried.
Medium head, pours clear.  Just the right bitterness, very good IPA.  The best I can find in the stores in Nevada.

While appreciate the sample of this that was poured for me -- it’s not to say that’s I’d buy/consume a bottle.  If you’re a fan of IPAs, then dig in, but if you’re like me, then you’ll taste this and move on.
Bottle. Pours dark gold with a medium head. Nice lacing . Strong hop aroma. Medium palate. Very strong hop flavor with a hint of bitter at the finish.
Hazy golden with dense white head.  Faint hop aroma (was expecting a much bigger bouquet).  Distinct citrus/Cascade hop flavor and lots of bitterness with malt playing a nice second fiddle.

bottle.  Pours a bright golden yellow, decent half inch head that sticks around pretty well.    Aromas of dank citrus hops and smooth sweetness.  Flavors start with a sharp lemon citric bitterness and move into... more citrus hops.  Flavor shows little of the sweetness from the nose- hops forward on this one.  Lemons and grapefruit.  Some smooth sugar cookie malts do hold up in the background.  Crisp and bitter on the palate with some lingering sharpness, very full flavored.  One of the better stone offerings- a solid IPA.

Thanks to mar for this one...WOW! Amazing.  Rich gold color with a mostly white head.  Aromas are full and delicious: citrus, pine and some malt.  This beer is so well balanced...not overly malty on the finish but just so delicious and perfect.  GREAT BEER!
Bottle. Golden / Orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma is fruit, citrus, hop. Flavour is fruit, citrus, hop, malt. Full bodied. Nice balced beer.

Bottle - Thanks afire!  Poured a slight hazy amber gold with nice foam head.  Bread, slight citrus, pine, and Hops to the hilt smacks you around.  Pallet of breaded malts and hops with a slight sweet hop bitterness, dry towards the finish.  Well put together and a slight sugar sweetness helps with the bitter hop tang.

Bottle purchased in Houston TX.  small fizzy  (lasting head) into white (slightly sparkling) hazy golden body with good lacing present.  aromas of light to moderate cirtrus hops (with a touch of pine maybe?) and light malts (caramel).  also noticed a touch of skunkiness (though this did not distract from the beer).  flavor is initially bittersweet but finishes more on the moderately bitter side.  good balance.  long finish duration.  lively carbonation.  dry slightly sticky mouthfeel.
Bottled: Fresh hops in the smell with a nice bitter sweet taste. Pours a golden color with a froathy head that disapears to a beige lacing. It blasts with tons of hops in the mouth. Wonderfull beer!
Balanced, not overly complex and a wonderful drink. Lots of citrus and pine in the nose. Mildly bitter finish. One of my fave IPAs.

Tap.  Pours a beautiful golden-amber color with a medium-sized, frothy white head.  Nose is a massive assault of hops.  Taste is the same, though the hops do create an overpowering bitterness throughout the beer.  It seems a tad out of balance, with the strong hop flavor having nothing to back it up.  I think it’s solid but it could have been better.
Hell, disappointed by this one.  Expected much better from one of the mother breweries.  Maybe it’s because Ruination was so awesome that this one just pales in comparison.

Simply great stuff. Superb aroma...beautiful hops plentiful in the nose...the mouthfeel is very suited to traditional IPA styles, retaining a nod to tradition, yet pushing their own identity just a little (not as much as on some of their other beers) the taste sends shivers and tingle on the tongue. Balanced bitterness, yet fully embracing an intense drinking sensation. One of Stone’s finest brews.
Bottle from Whole Foods Charlottesville. Clear orange pour with a large frothy head. Oily pine and floral hop aroma. Very fruity hop taste. Nice and bitter. Medium body.

Pale orange in appearance, excellent fruity and slightly malty flavor. Mildly hopped (to my San Diego-style IPA taste buds). Mildly sharp taste on the palate. Overall a great beer; goes down well and is extremely easy to drink.
So hard to compare against Stone’s (much) stronger hop brews. Judging against only other IPAs, Stone’s is hoppier (surprise), but less of a standout than an example of what do to right.

(USA) Courtesy of AFI96, Thanks Waylo. Pours an amber / golden color witha med-white head. Aroma is of citrus and hops with a nice balance of hops and fruit. The finish is dry and bitter, but very refreshing. If you some spare cash give this one a try.

12 oz bottle.  Large white, puffy head above a deep rusted golden liquid. Complex aroma:  hops, maybe cascade, citrus and malt.  Taste - Theres the ticket!  Suprisingly bitter and creamy, tanic linger with the grapefruit kicking in.

Bottled. Poured darkish clear golden with a fluffy white head. Harsh resiny aroma, a bit of honey and citrus, kind of lost me in that it was harsh without being in your face. Mouthful is pretty similar, a light malt backbone props it up a bit, giving some jammy stonefruit and honey, a fair warmth kicks in with a decent amount of passionfruit. Long, bitter warm finish.. Its an OK IPA but there is nothing special to note about it imo.
12 fl. oz. bottle - tasting with yngwie, gunnfryd and Beer_2000. Golden/amber color, nice off-white head. Very nice hops and fruit in aroma. The same in flavor. I could easy drink a six pack!

12oz bottle served in a Duvel tulip. Pours an orange splashed gold color with a tight white head. Very fruity and citrusy on the nose with a nice malt sweetness to back it up. Nice balanced flavor with some peach and citrus notes. For all of the dry-hopping they talk about on the bottle the head doesnt last very long. Smooth and very drinkable. Finishes dry with some lingering bitterness, but not too much. Good stuff

Bottle. Aroma in the citrus hop department, some floweriness. Flavor more of the same, airy caramel malt more evident and contributing greatly to quaffability. Silky smooth. I was kind of expecting more hops, so my surprise may have hurt the rating since taking a step back I recognize what a superbly drinkable brew this is. There will be opportunity to correct this if need be.

Bottle.  Pours a clear, light orange with a thick white head.  Aroma of citrus and piney hops.  Flavor of nice citrus hops.  The bitter hops were balanced nicely with a strong malt base.  Not as bitter and powerful as Ruination, more light bodied.  The strong point of this beer was its nice malt/hops balance.  Still, I would have liked to see a little more flavor.  A very good IPA, though not my favorite.

Pours a nice cloudy golden color with a off white head. Very nice citrusy hop aroma. Flavor is much the same, very well balanced with a nice malt sweetness. Very refreshing IPA, another winner from Stone.

I enjoyed this far more than the Ruination IPA. The appearance was a bit cloudy with a nice light orage/amber color. The aroma had lots of citrus hops with the initial palate being very full. I did not care for the texture being very creamy and oily but the flavor was moderate in all areas with the bitterness not being to overpowering. I also liked how the alcoholic taste did not linger as much as the Ruination.

Pours a crisp golden color with a thin foamy head.  Aroma is citrus with hints of piney hops.  Taste is about the same, not too much bitterness.  The finish is very nutty and creamy malts.  Pretty well-balanced IPA, but nothing to write home about.

Poured from the bottle into a pint glass.  The aroma is hop-dominated, with citrus, earthy, and pine scents.  The beer had a cloudy, straw color with a very thin white head that had short retention.  A wonderful flavor, somewhat bitter and full of hops, with a touch of sourness too; above from what I normally expect from an IPA.  The beer has a rich, full and slightly wet mouthfeel, with ample carbonation.  Its a very good beer, but not quite worthy of a 4.0 overall in my opinion.

12oz bottle. nice dark golden color, foamy white head. aroma of hops and pine. smooth crisp taste, with a slightly bitter finish of hops and pine with an undercurrent of (malt?) sweetness. nice hot summer day beer. Im sorry I only have one.

Golden in color with an off white head.  Nose of hops.  On the palate it is citrusy with a slight bitterness and is somewhat light for an IPA.  Clean, crisp and refreshing with a bit of pine on the finish.

Had this at the KClingers in Hanover on tap.  Very little head that completely vanished.  Aroma was grassy, light citru and pine.  Taste was initially sweet, but with a long finish.  Very a bit thin on the tongue.

Bottle. It pours a quite clear, golden body with an off-white head. Lovely hop-driven aroma, a bit perfumed, with hops and resin. The malts are sure present, but overpowered by the hops. That continues in the flavor, theres a lovely hoppyness, pine and citrus, its quite fruity, and theres still room for the malt. Full-bodied, quite sweetish, and it finishes with the same flavors it has initially. Lovely and easy to drink. Dangerously easy to drink. (080626)

22 oz bottle.  Great hop aroma.  Citrus aroma is very dominant.  Taste is great and spicy.  Aftertaste is very orange-like.  I dont get a strong malt flavor.  Very smooth and refreshing.  Definitely repeat buy, if I can get my hands on some more.

Orange-amber with a medium dissipating off-white head.  Aroma of citrus, caramel, pine and bready malts.  Smooth and malty taste of citrus and woodsy hops nicely balanced by the sweet malts.  Finishes mildly bitter and somewhat dry.  Well balanced, solid IPA.

Bottle: One of my staple IPAs.  You can never go wrong going back to this one.  Pours a beautiful golden color with a nice, small, white head.  Smells like hops and citrus.  Flavor is a decent amount of hops, but not overdone.  Wonderfully balanced out with sweet malt and a floral undertone.  Has a perfect amount of bitterness in the finish and isnt so overpowering that even non-hopheads can appreciate this one.  Extremely crisp and refreshing.
12 oz. pours golden with small white head. aroma is citrus and pine. mouthful is full of hops with a bitter grapefruit that comes through strong. very nice robust flavor for an ipa...

I am surprised it took so long to review this offering from Stone.Poured a golden color with a decent white head.Aromas were of nice sweet hops,with citrus and grapefruit,of course.The taste is somewhat sweet with hints of light citus and caramel,with light spice on the finish.Good IPA.
Poured golden with a white head.  The aroma is sweet and hoppy.  Taste is crisp and bitter with a hoppy flavor.

the monstrous white fluff and commanding lace complement the cloudy gold color nicely. the aroma is replete with grapefruit and pine, but with a brooding maltiness underlying. it mocks my pretenses by being extremely drinkable, with an intriguing floral sweetness that is the perfect blend of hops and maltiness. i thought it would be twice as hoppy. finish is spicy and bitter. the head was still there well into the beer. dear lord, its lovely.
Golden color with a nice white head.  Aroma is spicy with hops, taste is not as bitter as expected, which I liked.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2008 Pours golden with decent head.  Hop presence which is well-balanced by malt.  Nice lingering finish really rounds out the bitterness.  Not as bitter as I thought it would be but definitely one of my favorite IPAs.

~Pours a pale golden color with off white head. Nice lacing.
~Nice sweet hop aroma. Grapefruity.
~Bitter hop flavor with sweet caramel notes. Yummy.
~Dry bitter finish.
~This is a great IPA

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2009 Re-rate May 24, 2009.  12 oz bottle.  Pours clear golden with a large off-white head.  Grapefruit hop aromas with a touch of spice, biscuit, a bit muted aroma overall.  Flavor is grapefruit and floral hops with a moderate bitterness.  Fairly dry.  Lots of lacing.  Nicely hop-dominated and quite a great IPA, but I dont think this is at the 4.2 level I put it at when I was starting out.

Previous rating: 12 oz bottle.  Pours a nice bright golden orange with a substantial white head.  Strong aroma is very much bitter hops with some citrus/grapefruit and spicy aromas.  Taste is bitter up front, grapefruit, spicy, orange, in a nice balance among the latter three flavors.  Bitter finish.  Excellent IPA. 9/4/8/4/17

Pours a light amber with rocky white head.  Aroma is of candied orange.  Taste is sweet with hop notes of orange, grapefruit and spice followed by a solid punch of hop bitterness.  Some toasted malt notes as well.  Just perfect.

Pours an orange golden color with an intense white head that foams up quick and slowly dissipates. Traces can be seen all the way to the finish. Initial taste is clean and crisp, followed quickly by intense and powerful bitterness and some minor alcohol   taste. My first IPA, and shall be trying more soon. Not for everybody though, especially if you arent expecting the bitter.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2009 Pours orange with this head. Smell is fruity and hoppy. Taste is harsh on the hops, more bitter than anything.  Crisp finish, mouthfeel is too thin. Pretty solid IPA.

Re-Rate: just sampled this next to two hearted. No Contest. Two hearted destroyed this one.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2008 The aroma is a bouket floral and resiny goodness. It pours a perfect pale color that has a nice and creamy small head that sticks around for a good while. Solid latice work. The flavor is outstanding (to say the least) Very pungent hop flavor with a nice lingering warm bitterness. Smooth to a little chunky on the palate (which I like.) Overall a great IPA... one of my favorites. Thank you Stone. The Lord bless the hop harvest.

Bravo to stone!! I have heard tons of accolades for this brewery, and my local grocery store FINALLY started carrying this. That being said, this is my first brew from Stone, and I am very impressed. Lots of citrus and hopps. Very similar to two hearted, but definitly stands alone with its own "style"

Visited San Diego great brew scene and Stone brewery kicks butt. This IPA is incredible. Light straw color tons of spicy citrus hop aromas and a great flavor to match and it gets better with ists crisp finish. Great brew

Bottle acquired as a bonus from mcferc4!!!  Thanks Rob!!!  Incredible dense white head that leaves significant sticky lacing.  24 karat colored brew...crystal clear with solid carbonation.  Aroma is bitter grapefruit and citrus.  Flavor has a touch of resin.  Freshly peeled orange and a touch of sweetness in the finish.  Good representation of the style.
great hop aroma, good bitterness, more bitter than hoppy.  Excellent example of a bitter North Coast IPA

As close to a perfect American IPA as Ive ever tasted (being a hop head).  Grapefruit / citrus hop aroma (Simcoe Hop) and nice bitterness - nice body, full flavor, touches of malt and nice lasting head.  My only criticism is it needs a little more hops - but that comes in the Stone Ruination IPA.  A beautiful thing.
Hazy golden color with hoppy resinous aroma.  Crisp.  Floral honey bitterness lasts on the tongue.  Near perfect IPA and one of my favorites.  This one is all about the hops.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2010 Bottle: Nice orange color, small head. Smell of citurs and sweet hops. Taste in citrus hops with a nice bitterness to follow. Bitter as sh!t... in the after taste...Light texture. Smooth and easy to drink, Good but not great. I bet it is great on tap though..

A beautiful golden orange color with a small amount of head that laced until the end.  Awesome crisp cirtusy hop aroma.  Smooth and malty at first taste but finishes strong on the hops at the end.  Best IPA Ive had.

A beer like this reminds me of the true definition of the word "quality" and that is the pecurlar and essential character
North Coast hopped the hell out of this beer and it shows.  But thats that character of a true IPA, correct?
The commerical description boasts proudly of its 70+ IBUs.
Personally, I believe there is more to a beer than hops..but if you want taste those flowerly little plants in every sip, you drink a beer like this

On draft at the Dilly Deli.
One of these beers that Ive drank quite a few of in the past and never rated. 
Pours a light gold in color with a nice frothy inch of head.  Smell is crisp, piney and floral hops.  Taste is clean, refreshing and more floral hops.  Not over the top, but a nice easy drinking, solid IPA.  This is an easy warm weather beer.  This is too easy of a drinker.  Very smooth and nice.

Stone IPA  Cloudy amber-gold pour with nice white head. Nose is all fruity, citrusy, piney floral hoppiness, with a deep character - I rather like the "cold steel" comment below - theres that sort of clean robustness to it. Good medium body that suits the style. The hops dominate the flavor, as you would expect in a good IPA. Strong, crisp bitterness that finishes very dry and lingers for a long time on the palate. But theres just enough sweetness to keep it balanced. Very assertive, and a great beer.

12oz and 22oz bottles, and on tap.
So if you cant tell by all the rave reviews and the top-5 ranking, this ones a Classic.  Here are my opinions after many many tastings...
Appearance: Clear, golden amber; frothy head, lively; looks clean and fresh.
Aroma: good hoppy citrus and pine needles with other less cliche things like under-ripe strawberries, herb gardens on a summer morning, and cold steel.
Flavor: west coast hops in the foreground with nice pale malts in the background -- remeniscent of homemade grapefruit/orange marmalade on fresh-baked bread in the Italian countryside -- refreshing enough to drink quickly on a hot day, but hoppy enough to leave a lingering bitterness on your tongue long after the last sip.
Overall, a great IPA.  Were lucky to have such a primo brew so readily available.

Pours a golden hazy almost brown color with a nice soapy white head. Aroma of sticky hops, citrus pine and malt. Flavor is hops, malt, citrus, pine. Finish is very nice with a touch of hop bitterness. Love this IPA, cant believe ive never rated it before.

Pours a clear, bright golden with a big puffy white head that lingers for quite a while.  Lacing is really nice on this one.  The aroma is all about the hops with citrus hops, mainly grapefruit and lemon zest, and floral resiny hops dominating the nose.  There is a noticeable, if light, bready malt backbone as well.  The flavor is a more subdued version of the aroma with citrus and floral hops playing their part.  For me, the sweet, bready malt backbone is more evident in the taste.  Mouthfeel is fairly light but creamy.  The finish is extremely crisp and clean with only a slight bitterness in the aftertaste.  The light and crisp mouthfeel on this one make it extremely drinkable and would be an ideal spring and summer IPA.  I could see this being a staple in my fridge if I had access to it.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2008 One of the best IPAs Ive ever had. Pours deep and golden, leaves a thick, lingering lace. Grassy, hoppy aroma, great hoppy flavor with a slightly cheesey, yeasty finish. You absolutely must try this beer- even if you dont like IPAs you will appreciate it. The fact that these are readily available in a six pack is proof that God exists.

Bottle.  Poured a clear, yellow/orange color with a long lasting, white head.  Hoppy aroma with slight citrus and floral scents.  Light body with a thin, slightly oily texture.  I truely enjoyed this beer and would definately recommend it to others and drink again.  I enjoyed the very slight citrus flavor and was very pleased with the just the second Stone beer that I have tried.  This beer gets better with every swallow.

i dont need to say much about this pour. If you know anything about IPAs you know that this is one of the best, most affordable and easy to find craft beers around. Stands with two hearted as the standard for a true IPA. Done right! pure and simple!

gold color white head,grassy hop nose.light bitter finish lingers on the tounge.I was suprised I thought that this beer was going to be hoppier! It is a good beer but I have had pale ales with more hop notes.overall good session ipa.
I was truly surprised. This did not even come close to my expectations of a Stone ale. Simply a pedestrian IPA.
another spectacular beer by the stone brewing company. definitely my 2nd favorite ipa second to ruination
This is the type IPA right? What an IPA is supposed to taste like: NW hops and citrus. Fresh and lightly malted.  Dry but not over-dry. Excellent balance. I love this beer. Best of trip.

Finally! An IPA that travels well and lives up to what an IPA is all about. I had one at the Pelican Reef in Cincinnati, OH, far from its San Diego origin. The aroma--pleasantly hoppy...like newly cut hay on a summer morning. The taste...hops galore, but well balanced...a slightly fruity appeal with a hint of clove. I brew my own for the freshest possible beer, but this beer was OMG, very good! Well done!

I had only enjoyed this in the bottle until my recent trip to San Diego, where I was able to  have it on tap. Very smooth floral hop flavor with just enough bite to make it interesting and very easy to drink.

This one was on cask at Beachwood BBQ with some special type of hops added to it.  Great on cask.  I think the bitter backs off quite a bit and the velvety potential of the beer really comes through nicely.  I think this is the way it should be drank.
very  rich hoppy flavor can feel the tongue tingle a little bit. strong aroma. fluffy white head.great IPA overall

Orange-gold with decent, creamy off-white head / Mild pine and floral nose / Light to medium body, modest fruit and hops with some creaminess and good finish / Subdued flavors of violets and pine with tangerine notes / A light, refined ipa, lacking big fruit or hops, but appealing for its elegant flavor palate.  Overrated but very enjoyable.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2008 On Cask (hand-pump) @ Stone Brewing World Bistro & Gardens. Special release with Summit and Amarillo Hops.  Pours light golden yellow, cloudy.  Small clear white head.  Sweet, orange aroma with a definite kick of hops.  Starts off with sweet tangerine/lemon notes then becomes intensely hoppy with accompanying spice and Ting. Hops spread to the sides and back of the tongue.  Cask gives the pallet a smooth rich texture with perfect carbonation.  Lingers a long time on the back of the tongue.  Great stuff!
Bottle at Flying Saucer. Very nice floral aroma. Pours a light golden color with thin white head. Very clean, crisp flavor with a nice little bite on the end. Very easy to drink.

Pours an almost clear amber color with a fluffy white head. Aroma of tons of piney hops yummy. Flavor is also tons of piney hops but with a nice sticky maltiness to back it up, second only to Bells Two Hearted IMHO.

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy light amber color with one finger head.  Nose is grapefruit, floral hops and malt.  Palate is orange peel, pink grapefruit and caramel hops with a pine bite in the finish.  Medium mouth feel and delicate, doily-like lacing.  A very nice IPA that I took too long to try.
floral, smell to it hazy, orange, color a minimal head, a light taste medium body, average carbonation, bitter, finish

Clear orange pour with a frothy white head that forms craters.  Nice big dry hopped aroma, citrus, grapefruit and caramel malt.  Sweet and bitter...  grapefruit, caramel malt, and all that good craft IPA stuff....a little bit salty with a bitter finish, slightly soapy.  Nice fluffy body, crisp, a little thin, easy drinking.  A standard.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2008 Bottle courtesy of Shyam.  Golden amber pour with pretty white head.  Big citrus, grapefruit, a little tropical fruit on the nose along with big fresh hops, spruce/pine but no skunkiness.  Nice hops and fruit in the taste, with a really dry, crisp, bitter finish that leaves some hoppage coming back around at the end.  Great balance in this beer.  Hops are very present but not over the top.  Wow.  I really like this beer.
Moderate amounts of IPA citrus in both the nose and mouth, in addition to the hop bitterness. Golden body with long lasting head.

The beer pours a bright amber yellow with a thin white head that is mostly lasting. The nose is a vibrant bouquet of bitter flowers. The front of the beer is smooth with a crisp taste. The tale is where the hops live, leaving a slight bitter finish. The mouth feel is clean and watery. Overall a great brew.
Nice looking, great tasting beer.  Poured a golden red with a nice large white head.   A nice palate with a strong hoppy flavor.  Great beer.  Worth it!
The Americanized version of the I.P.A. (big and bitter compared to the traditional style) exemplified perfectly.  Were all lucky to have this available on the East Coast.

Very well balanced IPA. Pours a copper-golden color, minimal head, pleasant floral aroma almost like jasmine. Taste was bitter but very manageable and palate was smooth with a full body. Crisp aftertaste. Very drinkable beer and one of the best IPAs ive had in a while.

A- Pours a deep, clear orangey tangerine color with a fairly small white head, not very much carbonation visible.

S- Smell is floral piney hops with a sweet, bready malt backbone.

T- Its easy to say there is strong hops all the way through this one but it seems that it starts off with a strong malt base thats sweet with light fruit notes and an earthy fullness and moves into a bitter piney hop flavor. The hop bitterness lingers long after the brew has been swallowed.

M- Semi thick, a bit resiny, perfect amount of carbonation.

D- This is dangerously drinkable. Its not that the alcohol is particularly high but I think the dangerous part about it is it is so tasty and easily sessionable. I could go through a few of these without even blinking an eye.
bottle.  light copper with clarity.  frothy off white head. lacing.  grassy hops, mild citrus, hint of liquorice, and thin malts.  tastes much the same.  perfume in aftertaste.

12 ox bottle from a trade with franksnbeans. pours golden with a solid white head that lasts till the end of the glass. aromas are citrus hop with a light maltiness underneath. flavours are hoppy but the body is thin which results in a bitterness that far exceeds the IBUs. enjoyable but not the best IPA ive had. it needs a firmer maly backbone IMO.

This is a very nice straightforward IPA.  Some floral hops, but mostly stringent enough to sense in the bottle, nice golden amber color , a lfair amount of carbonation but not too much, , some flavors of Gin and very nice bitter after-taste.  Nice palate, with just a little oily feel.
Stones India Pale is excellent. Definitely one of my favorites. If youre feeling brave enough try Ruination
Cloudy golden with foamy off-white head that thins quickly. Citrus orange aroma. Orange peel taste gives bitterness but yet smooth. Bitter smooth after-taste makes you want to take another sip.
Light golden color with a frothy white head. Aroma of caramel, malt and cascade hops.  Juicy citrus hops and moderately bitter. Surprisingly drinkable. Very good.

Usually buy this in bottle, but can also get on tap in NYC. Pours a nice vibrant goldish/brown color with a good head. Love the dominant citrus taste, especially grapefuit. Also like astringent finishing bite that settles at the top of the throat. One of may favorite IPAs to date.
i dont get the hype not the best may have been a bad bottle slight vinegar taste very bitter not much carbonation ill try again soon

Pours a clear gold into the glass with a small white head.  Aroma is almost exactly like smelling a pack of cascade pellets before dropping them into the boil.  Flavor is incredibly smooth with a nice bite to it.  Would definitely buy again.
Not as complex and balanced as Bells Two-hearted, but quite delicious and hoppy.  Doesnt bog you down like some IPAs, so you dont have to stop at six.
Not as good as Arrogant Bastard, but pretty darn good nonetheless. Very hoppy, as I like it.
This is what I consider a good base west coast IPA...good but not super complex.....a good session IPA:)

Bottle. Pours a clear golden with a small white head that fades leaving some lacing. Aroma of citrus  and floral hops with a solid malt backbone. Taste is the same as aroma with a hint of pine. Medium mouthfeel with a moderate to strong amount of bitterness. Very good.
Really lovely. Best balance of the generally available IPAs. Good nose great floral qualities, nice mouthfeel and we can get it either on draught or bottled.
One of my favorites.  Lots of hop aroma for a "micro brewery" and lots of hop flavor.  Golden and slightly hazy with moderate head and good retention and a body to support it.  Love Stone beers.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2008 Light golden color which I perfer IPAs to have.  The aroma is very nice comparatively speaking.  Very good initial flavor with the proper amount of hop bitterness that is important for an IPA.  I love when brewers are not afriad to use hops.  A high quality IPA.

honey gold color. thin head. nose isnt huge but pretty. flowers and vanilla. flavor is big but balanced. definitely a hoppy ipa but not obnoxious. grapefruit, blood orange, and vanilla is still there. mouth is crisp and light. dry finish whets the palate for more.

A Mes rate: Bottle at Toms UGT Pt. 2.Lovely semi cloudy golden colour with a thin white film. Big resinous hops, piney and lots of lychee and other yummy fruit. Lovely peppery finish with a nice dryness. Bloody good stuff.
Pours a dark copper. Citrussy, floral aroma, nice hoppy flavor. I will definitly drink more of this brew
Bottle.  Pours a light amber gold color with little head.  A nice strong hop aroma with a nice finishing hop taste.  A very good IPA but not a great IPA
Drank it at the Ahwahnee.  Pours into an amber color with a nice tan head.  Ligth/Medium bodied, piney aroma, well balanced, dry, nice hoppiness.

Rich, almost syrupy pour. Very floral, soapy, citrussy aroma, which match the bright hoppy tastes and rock-solid cereal malts ever-present underneath. A lot of great flavours melding in this one, on tap it must be incredible. Very headstrong but too beautiful to be anything less than accessible. Great stuff.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2010 Pours a clear darker golden color, or light orange with a smallish head but still some nice lacing. Crisp hoppy flavor with sweet citrus, moderate bitterness, and dry. Very nice with amazing drinkability. One of the best IPAs around. 11/21/08. Stone finally makes it to Florida (I say that even though I havent lived here long :-) I bought this bomber the day it hit the shelves and drank it one day later so I doubt Ill ever try a fresher bottle unless I make the trip out west. A healthy dose of pine and citrus hops with some sharp bitterness. This may not be the best IPA Ive ever had but it is one I often compare others to.
Solid IPA, not too overhopped, strong malt base to complement the bitter hops, you know the deal

Appeared very dark amber in the pint glass with minimal head.

It smelled strongly of hops even far from the glass.

It felt medium-bodied in the mouth and tasted very hoppy, not too heavy with little bite.

It was a very drinkable and great tasting beer.

Slightly dark copper amber pour with an initially large but fading caramel colored head. Hoppy aroma, mainly floral and spruce and I dare say, raisins. TIngly, bitter mouthfeel. Not the hoppiest beer Ive had, but there is a really nice malt backbone in there, delivering a lot of balance as well as some dried fruit undercurrents. Finishes with a slightly resinous citrus. Its not really as agressive, at least to me, as the description maintains, but for an IPA, Ill quote Goldilocks as saying... "Its just right".

Stone India Pale Ale is another very good IPA by Stone Brewing Company. The beer is orange in color with a very substantial off-white head. The aroma is hoppy with hints of caramel. The flavor is sweet and full of hops and caramel. This is just like a weak Ruination IPA.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2009 22oz pottle.  Pours yellow/orange with white frothy head.  Mostly dissipates and leaves decent lacing.  Smells VERY hoppy, with aroma of lemon and pine.  Taste is very bitter, and tastes a bit like lemon pledge.  Turns out to be pretty refreshing, but a bit too bitter for me.

Update: My palate has developed and Im into hoppy stuff now.

This is good beer. I am totally hooked on this stuff. If it werent so expensive, I would be drinking it every day. I would probably be bathing in it.

A delicious beer.

Woah!  This IPA is very piney and citrusy all around.  It starts off with a hoppy piney citrus aroma and continues until the finish with the same game plan.  The alcohol is subtle, but noticeable as this golden liquid makes its way out of the glass.  Good STUFF!

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2010 Re-rate: 22oz bomber. Pour resembles any American-swill; only thing, visually, that hints at a difference is the nice lacing. Aroma of citrusy hop. Flavor is a hop-explosion with some lemon or mandarin orange notes. Pretty decent amount of carbonation with a fairly thin body and a slightly oily texture. At the end, the beer is quite bitter: a really treat for us hop-heads, at a price that doesnt break the bank.

Bottle at the partyed out weeked of tasting at the shack of lucky pieres. Alround tasting: Peachy, citrus, lychee, super drinkable, bitterness not too over powering. The only one i went back for more of.

Bottle at Magic_dave6s disco dance tasting. Gold, thin white head. Hazy american hops. Mouth is quite watery hops, quite bitter, grass, slightly sweet. Finishes dry bitterness with some slightly sweet woodiness. Good.

From a 12 fl. oz (S) bottle with no expiration date or lot code.  Pours a hazy yellow-gold with some off-white head.  Good aroma of hops.  Taste of hops and a little bit of citrus.  This was not as strong as some IPAs I have tried and in that regard, I liked it a lot.
Bottle at Toms Glasgow tasting 2 ... Pale Yellow ... light fruity hop nose ... fruity hoppy light and tasty... quite drying
good example of its class... lots of hoppy kick but with a purpose.   Definitely a good beer.
cheers to lb4lb for this one. pours a nice amber color, one finger head with a good amount of lacing. creamy and hoppy. maltier than i expected for such an amber colored ale
A bit light for my taste. Clean, good hops; not much depth. But then, I prefer imperial stouts.
Its a good beer. Top 3 not sure. Aroma is what should be expected. I would buy it again

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2008 Golden pour with dissipating white head
Flowery, cirtus hops in nose
piney, grapefruit, VERy crisp and sharp.  Perfect IPA, in every way.

Typical IPA pour- clear golden with tight frothy head. Aroma and flavor dominated by hops- grapefruit, lemon, orange, piney, and floral. So well balanced, smooth, and agreeable. Gotta love this IPA, for it epitimizes its respective stlye.

Explosive beer here. The hop aroma was so strong that I  pulled my head back. Im not the biggest hop head in the world but this couldnt be denied and it was good. The aroma was full, the body a dark yellow with a lot of carbonation and the taste was full and complex. To date the best IPA I have had.

Pours an orange body with a white creamy head that left some nice lacing.  Floral and citrus hops on the nose with a hint of sweet malts.  The flavor packs a bit more punch than the aroma with a very nice balance between the ingredients, but theres actual character in this drink that I often dont find in double IPAs.  It has a nice bitter finish.  I even had this with a cigar which I highly recommend as it nicely accentuated the hoppy character in the mouth.
Great IPA. A Stone classic for sure. Wonderfully hoppy with a touch or orange. Stone rocks!

Pours a slightly hazy golden amber with a big off white head that leaves a bunch of lacing.   Aroma is a very pleasant citrusy hop smell and even some pine.  Taste is big citrusy hop with a great bitter finish and a little malt sweetness.  A very good IPA for sure.
Almost perfect in every way. This is a fantastic IPA. Low price for such a great classic.

Poured from a 22oz. bomber purchased locally.  Appearance-golden colored, brilliantly clear with a small white head, slightly rocky. Nice lace around the rim of the glass. Aroma is full of hops - grapefruit and pine. Flavors match the aroma with strong hop flavors citrusy and a little piney. Assertively bitter. Malty but not very sweet. Clean dry finish and an easy drinking mouthfeel. I could drink this beer all day. One of the best IPAs.
Light copper color with a thick creamy head. Aromas of floral hops and citrus. Nice hop bitterness with a sweet honey finish.

Bottle poured into shaker- poured semi transparent light orange, nice white head formed and decided to keep me company, light - if any, carbonation.  Heavy aroma of hops with light citrus and a pine smell underneath it.  Hits the mouth with a medium body, the hops stand out but actually are not overpowering (balanced), malt detectable after a few sips, finish has a sweet note to it.  Very drinkable, good definition of the style.
Bottle. Pours clear off amber with decent white head that lasts. Strong, pleasant, hop aroma. Nice hope bitterness. A fine heavy IPA
Pours clear( but I like a little cloudiness). All the flavors are there. More of a bitter hop taste  than the AB but  all in all Stone dont have a beer that isnt above the others.

Pours a clear orange beer with a nice frothy white head. Aroma is big time floral, citrus and piney. Flavor is the wonderfully bitter flavor of NW hops, my guess is mostly cascade for the flavor addtition although there is jus the right amount of caramel sweetness to balance the whole thing out. Nice long bitter finish. Tasty "Hop Burps" afterwards.
Pours golden with thin white head.  Aroma of piney and citrus hops.  Taste is crisp with nice citrus flavor.  Good bitterness with a not overpowering hop bite.  Good session beer.  Very good IPA.
12 oz bottle, Nice IPA with a citrus smell and a caramel color. smooth but strong on the palate, but i prefer stones ruination IPA
Bottle.  Pours a clear, golden hue.  Aroma of piney and citrus hops.  Flavor is nice and balanced, with a hint of honeysuckle sweetness.  Slightly bitter at the end, but not too overwhelming.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2008 Bottle, many thanks to Phil L for this one, cheers Phil. Pours crystal clear and golden in colour with good white frothy head that clings to glass on way down. Stunning hop flurry on first taste coating the interior of the mouth with a marvellous hoppy bitterness, pine and citrus in abundance, then the flavours are quite honeyish and piney. This is what an IPA is all about and what we in the UK have forgotten to make this well with a few notable exceptions like, Old Chimneys and Downton. A7 A5 F8 P4 OV 16
On Tap at the Grey Lodge Pub, Philadelphia in company of Loz, Casey and Traci, on my fortieth birthday 16-11-08. Pours warm golden to light amber with a white head. Strange hoppiness starts to show, I get a little sausageyness again quite strange but not unlikeable. Nice gentle effervescence, good hoppy bite starting to take over now, so different to the Chico but really quite lovely. A7 A4 F7 P4 OV 15
This is my hands down favorite for an IPA. This was the first IPA I liked and helped me to like others. Great golden orange color, great aroma. one of the best. great job Stones
Excellent hoppy aroma, and nice crisp tatse. I may have a 3-way tie for my favorite IPAs---Bells 2 Hearted, DFH 90 minute, and now Stone IPA.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2008 Bottle. Pours a nice amber orange with a white head. Real nice citrusy hop aroma. The sweetness of this beer perfectly balances the hoppiness. Goes down real smooth. A lot of fun to drink.

Pours a pretty golden color, with a thick white head that settles nicely. Soft nose of sweet hops thats very tantalizing... Delicious IPA, extremely smooth with a sweet kick on the front end that settles to the bittersweet hop finish. Did I say its shockingly smooth?

This amber/orange pour has a nice white head.  It smells sweet, loaded with hops, and has some pine sap in there.  Hop flavor but there is something subtle and sweet in there as well.  A very nice malt balance and just enough bitterness make this very enjoyable.  Smooth and light finish.
This beer might be my all time favorite.  It is very hoppy and has a great but not overpowering kick to it.  A fantastic brew...

off the tap at Stone Bistro on 3/2/08.... poured semi-transparent orange brown with a thin wispy white head..... aroma of tropical fruit hops, a sweeter sugary malt which acted a nice counterpart to the adjoining hops.... flavorwise, there was very little bitterness but there was a strong malt component which didnt totally overshadow the hops.  theres more of a balance to this when compared to the ruination but i lived the ruination a little bit more.

A light golden amber color with a small fizzy white head.  Average Stone citrus and floral hop aroma.  God they do that well.  Nicely balanced caramel sweetness with a citrus bitter finish.  Not really overpowering.  Kind of like Ruination-Lite.  Much more drinkable.  A nice light refreshing body.  A great beer.

Big bottle.  I am a big fan of malty brews, but this is one of the best hoppy beers out there.  The brew is bitterly hoppy, tastes hoppy, and smells hoppy.  The hop intensity is awesome but not too much.  I was very impressed by this wonderful brew.  If you have a taste for the hops, by all means, get yourself a big bottle of this beer.

simply excellent. bomber at AW Shucks in Norfolk. pours a clear, golden color with a small head. aroma is great with sweetness of flowers, orange, and pear. flavor is something only stone can pull off. perfect balance of huge hops and bitterness. one of the best.

Its worth the price. Most of the time its the most expensive beer in the store but it is worth it. Even better from a freshly filled growler at the brewery. The food at the Stone World Bistro sucks. The beer does all the talking for that company. This is my favorite indian pale ale.

Thanks to Amy for bring this back from Cali for me. Pours a cloudy amber with a nice thick head. Huge floral, citrus (more orange than grapefruit), pine aroma. Taste is dry bitter, hoppy, borderline grapefruit juice. Very smooth and crisp with nice carbonation and just enough malt to give it some body. Finishes very clean with maybe a hint of citrus. I thought this was an outstanding IPA and will have to figure a way to get more of this.

This has to be the most overated beer I have ever tasted. Almost no aroma. Looks not much different from a Bud. No body to speak of. Just some late bitterness. Thats all. Im thinking that people must really love the bottle or thay havnt had many other choices.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2008 Pours mild golden, 2 inches of frothy foam head. Medium strong hoppy aroma with a little bit of floral. Srtong hop flavor with a nice carbonation that lasts on the back of the tongue on the finish. Medium/light lacing on the glass.
Nice hazy amber with white lacy head. Aroma of pine and citrus. Flavors of grapefruit and hops. Solid IPA from a great brewer.
user_location: back in NJ!, New Jersey, USA

text: Pours a beautiful clear gold-amber with a light head which diminishes quickly.  Some lacing and a small stream of bubbles persist.  Strong smell of hops, taste is all hops from the beginning to the end.  Not complex but well balanced and has some real body to it.
Bottle:  Poured a hazy light brown with a semi white head.  Aroma of citrus and hops.  Good solid flavor but could be a bit stronger considering the rest of Stones lineup.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2008 Shaker glass.  Pours golden with a thick frothy head. Aroma of sweet malts and hops.  Big malt taste right up front, followed by a big bitter finish.  IO was expecting to be blown away by the bitterness, but they only present strongly at the finish.  One of the best IPAs Ive had.
pretty darn good IPA. hoppy, bitter, but not too overwhelming if youve had stuff brewed by Stone before.
bottle.  very hoppy.  i enjoyed this beer but apparently not as much as everyone else.  The bitterness was a little overpowering for me.

12oz bottle: pours slighty hazy golden brown with nice white head. aroma of citrusy hops. flavor big hop bite citrus taste not as strong as aroma but more grapefruit, decent malt to back it but the hops are doing all the work. very solid IPA

Pours a transparent golden yellow. Heavily carbonated with a thick frothy head. Thin elegant lacing. Strong citrus aroma, some bitter hop notes. Strong grapefruit flavor up front followed by earthy pine hops, with a bitter finish. The palate is very smooth and not harsh for such a strong IPA. Well done.
Easily one of the best IPAs out there.   Pours clear, golden. Aroma is highly floral. Starts bitter, finishes with a floral/citrus combo.

On tap at Brickwall in Asbury. Goldein in color. A bit of haze in the apperence. Big time aroma of hops. Flavor is of floral hops, some grapefruite and pine. Very crisp. I like this brew. Decently balanced. My taste if for more malt less hops. Liked it didnt love it.  But will have it again.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2008 ample caramel malt to stand up to all these hops. bright gold, oily pine aroma. strong even consistent hop flavor, sweet tropical notes of pineapple provide some balance but the gem is of course is the rich floral ride of hops

Stone India Pale Ale
ABV: 6.9%
IBU:
Volume: 12 oz
Glass: Tulip Goblet
Purchased at: Hopewell Valley Wine and Liquor
Consumed on: Friday, February 15th, 2008 at 10:55 pm

first impression: A quickly dissipating head and a slightly unfiltered, hazy appearance gives a mixed bag of anticipation, but Ive had this beer before, and know what Im in for. The grapefruit is amazingly present in the aroma, and the color, while not the most interesting or poetic, is certainly not unappealing. The taste is remarkable. It warms, and travels down the chest with a trail of hops. It is a beer with a taste history to it. You can remember the flavor for minutes after, and it is a great flavor. Wonderfully bitter with heavy malt undercurrents. It is an exemplar of an IPA. 

Aroma/Olfactory:
Malt is roasted, toasty, and weighs heavily on the flavor. 
Hops are resinous, very flowery, and brimming with grapefruit and lemon.
Yeast/Bacteria reminds one of a stack of stone slabs, a hint of surface water but not odoriferous or negative in impression. 
It is tasty, heady, commanding, intoxicating, present, heavy, and delicious. 

Visuals/Appearance:
Color is pale, orange, single noted, and without real depth. 
Liquid is just a bit hazy and quiet. 
Head is gone, but the lace is remarkable present. Hangs more on the glass than the volume itself. Quite white at the start. 

Taste/Flavor:
Sweet in a slight way, but more bitter
Bitter is the overarching sentiment here, and it delivers in droves. Its not ruination, but its not far off, IMHO. 
Sour notes come with the bitter and citrus components. 
Beatifully balanced in hops and malt. 

Palate/Tactile:
Body/Mouthfeel is full and long lasting. 
Texture is slightly cloying, not in a sweet way, and not like a stout, but it does not dissipate quickly. 
Carbonation is crisp but not visually active. 
Finish is quite bitter, and nicely so. 

Second impression: Overall, this is a great beer, a fantastic example of an IPA, a strong exemplar of Stones lineup, and just a pleasure to have. One of my favorite beers, by far.

Nice west coast style IPA.  Honey colored...nice frothy head.  Floral/citrus nose.  Pronounced hops, but not over the top...well balanced.  Grapefruit the most noticeable in the taste.  Nice bitter finish, but again, not too much.  Solid IPA.

Beautiful golden/orange beer with very nice frothy off white head. Floral/citrus hop aroma. Lacing on the glass before I even take a drink! The hops dont overwhelm you like the "Arrogant Bastard" by Stone. It is very balanced and a great drink with a yeasty backbone. Nice bitter finish, but not too bitter. Very "crisp" as advertised. The more I drink, the more I notice a soapy taste and finish.

Bottle.  Goldish orange appearance with a slight haze.  Strong hoppiness in the aroma with floral and citrus overtones.  Strong but not overwhelming in the hoppiness in the taste. Crisp and refreshing, one of the best IPAs I can get easily.

Sampled: tap, bottle, many, many times.  What do you say about this that hasnt been said?  It is hands down one of the best IPAs out there.  Everything a "true" West Coast IPA should be really, and on a continually consistent basis!  Thats all I need to say.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2008 Pours clear golden honey color with a white lasting head. Aroma of strong hops, citrus, and sap. Quick bitter note that lasts for a long finish.  Citrus, fruit, other typical IPA flavors. Light body that is crisp and refreshing. Overall good IPA.
22 oz. bomb, good white head, big alcohol and malt nose, very hoppy grapefruit flavor, excellent

12oz bottle. Poured a clear bronze with a nice head and visible lacing. Very floral and citrus aromas that continues into the palate along with piney flavor. This is a very medium bodied IPA with a very smooth upfront taste that finishes with the classic bitterness. This is one of the most unique IPAs I have tried and is very drinkable.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2013 This beer has all the makings of a great IPA.  Wonderful color, smell and palate.  As far as the head goes, its completely albino.  It had all of the piney, citrus, dry sweet notes of many other craft IPAs.  

Nice bitterness as compared to these hop bombs that we have today.  Much better than the original rate.
ON tap at Stone.  Deep amber yellow with a creamy white head.  Strong perfume hoppiness of citrus and pine with the hops showing in the taste nicely and a decent bitterness.

Lovely, hoppy aroma...very open and clean.  Appears coppery-gold with a slight haze.  Taste is bittery-floral - opens into a perfume-bitter arrangement...dries out on the palate to finish smoothly.  Great beer...incredibly complex IPA.
Pint 6oz bottle.  Thick white head and great aroma, not overdone on the alcohol percentage.  Overall a good IPA, definitely worth the five bucks.
Golden-Copper with thin sticky white head.  Grapefruit and floral aroma notes.  Grapefruit, hop-bitter, and mild carmel notes.  Refreshing with a lasting bitter finish.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2009 9/26/08  just as good as last rate, very well balanced bitters and citrus hops. chewier than remembered and going on the regular session list. adding one point to score.

2/5/08 bottle poured a lighter amber in color with tiny size bubbles of carbination and a one finger head of white froth letting back to become a thin layer. aroma has citrus hops, pine, grapefruit, and caramel malts. mouth feel is medium light with a flavor of hops that jumps right out. hops well out way the malt here with plenty of citrus, grape fruit, and resin to be had but still in control and not getting too bitter. just had the pale ale and this is an identical beer with juiced up hops content. really could slurp a few of these back, very enjoyable.
22 oz. bottle.  Pours a golden copper color with a nice size head.  Nice aroma of hops, floral.  Nice hop flavor.  Bitter in the right way, with a clean dry finish.  Quite good.
very good floral aroma, I wish women smelled as good as this beer. Very good taste with a slightly bitter aftertaste. Would buy again
user_location: The World of Beer, Texas, USA

text: UPDATED: JUL 14, 2008 Fabulous IPA.  Floral aroma with a strong burst of hop flavor followed by a clean, dry finish. Id open another one if I didnt live in Iowa and have to mail off for another.

Maybe I just expect too much from Stone,  but this one I found to be a very run-of-the-mill IPA....if anything a bit lacking.

Overall there are way better IPA options in the $10/6pack area for my tastes

22 oz bottle, poured a slightly cloudy golden yellow. A nice 1" creamy thick head that left great lacing throughout the glass. A generous amount of carbination bubbles rising through the glass. There was a strong hop aroma with a bit of a citrus scent as well. A nice bitter hop bite that lasted on the palate for a long time. The best straight up IPA Ive had so far.

22 ounce bottle shared with Illini08. Thanks! Pours a nice golden color with a small white head that disappears quickly. Contained a small amount of carbonation. The smell consisted of a lot of hops with citrus hints. It tasted about the same as it smelled. Very hoppy with a citrus aftertaste. Finished a little bitter. This beer would be great on a really hot summer day... or any day for that matter. A great IPA.

A benchmark for IPAs.  Solid body with a bouquet of hops that matches perfectly.  High IBUs but the blend of hops creates a smooth (for an IPA) satisfying finish.  Surprisingly bright color that pours nicely into a medium-thick head.  Everything you want in an IPA.
A great beer.  Perfect taste, perfect scent, great color!  Drink up!  Very organic tasting, good!
bomber 08 state of the union drinking game.  Pours yellow orange 3 finger bright white head.  Light hoppy nose.  Taste is sweet and light and pretty hoppy, not bad, no alesmith ipa or anything close.
Not what I like in an IPA...It starts out ok then fizzles.  Doesnt leave that nice hop finish....but I drank it all.

Outrageously hoppy, both in aroma and flavor.  Pours a very bright golden color into the glass with a frothy white head.  Aroma is strong in hops, earthy, citrus, grass, nature.  Flavor is overwhelmingly of hops, citrus, very bitter, earthy, and quite full.

12 oz. bottle.

Bottle. Clear light orangey-yellow with a white head that fades. Very hoppy aroma, with a woodsy hint of pine. Big flavor of hops and citrus with a wonderfully lingering bitterness. Incredibly nice IPA.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2008 Poured a hazy amber with a decent head that left a film of foam throughout.
Aroma is incredibly hoppy in an interesting, but pleasing way.
