Flavor reinforced the aroma, very citrusy and hoppy, but well balanced. Toasted malts are evident in the background. Very clean aftertaste.
Creamy, smooth mouthfeel and very clean aftertaste.
I dont drink a lot of IPAs, but if I knew they were all this good, that would change in a heartbeat.
Oh, the Hops!

On tap at Najas.

Amber color with a 1 finger head of white foam. Lace is very sticky and dense.

Aroma is of hops hops and hops. Piney and herbal, raw.

Taste is predictably hoppy with pine and spicy notes. A dry leafy flavor comes through as well. Malt is barely detectable as a grainy bready note. Good balance between flavor and bitterness.

Medium body and carbonation, dry bitter finish. Pretty definitive west coast IPA.

12 oz bottle at Stockholm Beer Festival 2007. Copper color with creamy head, hint of haze. Hoppy aroma with black currant and lemon. Sweetish and bitter flavor with citrusy hops and good honeyish malt backbone. Very good balance between hop flavor, bitterness and sweet maltiness. Very drinkable.

1l growler. Pours a nice amber yellow color, a little hazy but not totally. Nice frothy white head that fades quickly and leaves just a little lace. Smells of hops, not offensive hops, just damn hoppy. Crisp citrus smell, with a bit of pine. Tastes of hops as well. Green and grassy tasting, sweet up front with a bitter grassy finish. Thin but not too thin. A little lighter on the carbonation than I would prefer. Damn fine one-off by Stone. If youre ever in the area of the brewery get a growler fill of this and the Smoked Porter w/ Vanilla Bean.
12 oz bottle pours orange with a fluffy white head. Big hoppy aroma.  Taste of citrusy hops with some sweet malt in the background.

Not being a big fan of IPAs I usually rate them lower but, this is probably the best one Ive ever had. Citrus flavor dominated the beer taste and the perfect amount of hops made this beer have the perfect amount of bitterness.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2008 You cant say enough about the controlled hoppiness of this brew.  Normally, its not my bag, but Stone does an excellent job with this IPA.  Citrus flavors abound with scents and tastes of Seville oranges and grapefruit.  Smooth as an IPA can be in my opinion.
Bottle. Appearance: Orange, white head. Aroma: Very hoppy. Grapefruit, caramel, a bit floral. Palate: Medium, tangy. Flavor: Hops, citrus, a bit floral, fruity. Overall: A great IPA.

orange red appearance with slight head and only mild carbonation.  flavor is more subtle than most Stone beers and I was surprised by the high 6.9% ABV.  malt component is understated and unremarkable.  the hop finish though is quite remarkable and has one of the most complex hop flavors that i can remember.  the hops start with a grapefruit flavor that finishes in a smooth   grass-like earthiness.  very nice beer

Serious hop flavor here, the first sip will wake you up. Overwhelming (but nice) hop aroma as well. I had this with some spicy thai food and it matched well. Good beer but I dont know if it is the top of the IPAs... I have more drinking to do!
The best beer Ive had in years. I get it in the 22oz bottle. I savor every drop. Crisp and fresh. Great color. Slight citrus odor.
This is the best beer hands down.  I drink at about 15 pints of this stuff a week.  Very hoppy and bitter.  umm!   If you can, drink it at the brewery from the tap.  It is so much better fresh.
pours golden color with nice foamy head.  fresh aroma of citrus.  another smooth beer from stone very slight pine taste just the right ammount of hops.  Very solid IPA

Bottle. Pours hazy golden with moderate fluffy off-white head. Good retention and lacing. Aroma is fruity- citrus, pineapple, mango and mild pineyness. Overtones of caramel, smoke, yeast and dough in the aroma as well. Full palate. Slightly smokey toffee malt flavor, along with a light doughiness and nuttiness. Hints of tart fruit and resiny pine hop flavors throughout. Light bitterness in the back of the mouth. Bitter fruitiness of the hops and a bit of smokey malt flavor linger long in the finish. Substantial and very good, but also very refreshing.

Straw colored.  Very well dry hopped.  the aroma is huge, and the brightness of the hops is noticeable...  for sure you are going to get hit in the mouth with the hops, but its very balanced, and not just "hop juice".  I dont pick up much on the malt, just a well balanced IPA
This was a a good refreshing ipa and very enjoyable,not bitter at all and highly enjoyable  and will drink again.nice hops like i like and very smooth.CHEERS!

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2010 22oz bottle.   Hazy honey.   Firm head.   Hoppy aroma.   Quite drinkable, with a beautiful hoppiness, and nice, but supporting, malts.   Medium body with smoth carbonation.   Very smooth and drinkable for its size.    Great balance that doesnt finish at all harshly.  (4.1)  Rerate:   The aroma doesnt impress me as much anymore, and Im growing weary of paler malts.   Still tasty, but seems pretty average compared to the other SoCal IPAs that Ive had lately.  (3.9)  centennial dry hopped cask version:  beautifful aroma like sticking your nose in a bag of hop pellets. Very fresh and bright. Renewing my faith in how good this stuff can be.

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2008 This is what an IPA fan is looking for. Great aroma filled with citrus, grapefruit hops. Taste is crisp on the palate, with lingering bitterness. Very clean taste with a touch of sweetness on the tongue. Bitter.  Sharp and bubbly carbonation. Pours a clean white head. Great ipa for a hop lover.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours yellow with orange huess.  Foamy white head w/ great lacing.  Big old citrus and floral hop nose.  Great mouthfeel.  Wow.  Great light caramel malt backbone with huge citrusy and floral hop flavor.  Bitterness is subdued a bit, but significant enough.  Big balance, and huge drinkability.  Wow.
very smooth in the mouth for as hoppy as this ipa is.  dark straw color, this is the perfect beer for a cold winter night or a hot summer afternoon.

The color was a dark gold - light amber with a one inch head. Many little bubbles supported the head. Very hoppy piney smell. The hops were detectable upon tasting. The hops were more present as an after taste than overpowering on the first sip. Very refreshing and smooth. The beer was well carbonated but very drinkable. Alcohol taste is not noticeable, be aware.

Even though IPAs and the taste of hops are not among beer tastes I like this still isnt bad. Its better than many of the IPAs I have. Even though it has a strong taste it goes down smooth and leaves a pleasant feeling as it goes down the hatch. So drink up you IPA lovers.!

Dec. 2005 - Overall, a good IPA, but not a "wow"er.  It was a good beer with a beautiful head and lacing...a nice citrusy aroma. The taste was well balanced citrusy sweetness and hop bitterness...finished very tart (I wasnt fond of the tart finish). Good beer, especially for style, but I wont go out of my way to get another one.

Draught. Pours golden with a moderate white head. Aroma is Stone-style hops, mostly citrus and earthy. Flavor is mainly bittering hops, with a hint of citrus and a hint of malt. Kind of the Stone-style hop-bomb youd expect, but not too bad.
golden pour with a 2 finger white head.  hops, hops and more hops on the nose.  not real thick but quite hoppy but not much bitterness.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2010 12 oz bottle on 7/4/10.  Pours a light orange with a 1 finger white head.  Big citrus hop nose, orange peel with a touch of malt.  Medium to full body with more citrus notes - very fresh floral hops.  Smooth body throughout.  Clean bitter finish.  The perfect IPA.

bomber.  wonderful IPA!  a ton of hops in this one.... aroma is full of hops and citrus notes.  pours a nice golden color with a white head.  The dry hopping gives this beer the wonderful hoppy aroma... Clean, crisp and wonderfully bitter on the finish.  Medium body and excellent on the palate.... this is the ideal IPA.

[752-20071011] 12floz. Navel orange flesh aroma with a bit of lemon hops, malt base and rather sweet notes. Hazy, bright orange body with a quick creamy off-white head. Orange citrus hops flavour has a nice malty sweet chocolate background and a bitter finish. Heavy medium body is bitter. Very nice, fairly mild and drinkable hoppy beverage but missing a little balance.

poured a really nice head into my duvel glass, and the hops aroma knocked my socks off when i took a sniff.  lots of citrus hoppiness.  very nice finish.  really enjoying this one.  might need to have another one...
UPDATED: JUN 23, 2008 Golden color, head lingered throught, very hoppy, great flavor. Try the Runination for even more great Stone IPA flavor
One of my all time favorites. Golden color, substantial head when properly poured. Love the big grapefruit nose! Awesome citrus, crisp taste. Dangerously chugable. HOPS! Mmmmm

clear gold with a nice white head.  Lots of hops in the nose,  some citrus.  Taste is similar,  grapefruit,  piney hops,  oranges.  It has a very mild soap flavor as well.  Maybe some honey sweetness as well.  Finishes bitter and refreshing.  I could drink this the whole night.

crisp gold color with faint white head.  Bitter citrus hop aroma.  Similar flavor 
.
What he said below.  Crisp, clean and refreshingly bitter.  Cant say appearance is above average but quality of beer certainly is.

Pours clear golden with a big soapy white head that laces as it dies. Big pine, grapefruit, citrus rindy hops in the nose. Tastes as the smell promises, big huge hops with a nice bitter finish. Crisp, clean and light in the mouth with a tickle of carbonation. Rediculously drinkable and THE prototype for a delicious IPA.

Bomber from the brewery.  Clear light orange with large whie head.  Citrus and pine aroma that is very strong.  Citrus and pine flavor is quite large with medium sweetness and caramel.  Medium body and well carbonated.  Straight forward California IPA, nice and a lower total score than I expected.

Man, these guys over at Stone produce good stuff consistently.  This was really a good IPA.  

I was a bit worried that this was old when I first opened the bottle.  I got a little skunky aroma at first and thought I had an old bottle but it seemed to work itself out.  Nice hazy golden color, good tight head, beautiful lacing.  Looks and smells really good now.  Hoppy but not overpoweringly so.  

Not as hoppy as some of the other IPAs which is good in some ways but bad in others.  Was actually expecting more of a bite to this.  Its still pretty hoppy but I was expecting to be overwhelmed and really wasnt.  

This stuff is drinkable though.  Very drinkable.  I found myself resisting the urge to chug this stuff down at a couple of points.  

One of the better IPAs Ive ever had.  Is it the best?  Hard to make that statement but I will definitely be paying this one a visit again very soon.  Im hoping a fresher bottle will have a better kick to it.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2008 Damn good IPA!!! Strong piney hop flavor dominates this one! Pours a crystal clear amber with a sunset red in the ball of my half yard. Sweet but not too much so, bitter but not so much so. Very creamy on the palate, and yet bites the tongue.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2007 Pours golden somewhat cloudy with smallish white head.  Smells of hop bounty, citrus, malt.  Taste is clean and complex, strong pleasant fully hopped bitterness with hints of floral in there, loads of citrus.  Very nice.

Bottled.  Simply fantastic.  Pours a nice amber with little head.  Smell of hops and malt.  The taste is exceptional, the perfect mix of hops and a note of caramel.  Finishes superbly with no excessively bite.  Would definitely buy again.
Pours a great golden/light orange color and smells of hops.  The taste is great on this ipa.  NIce hoppy taste with some bitterness that you cant get enough of.  mmm mmm.  Great ipa.

From bottle : Pours a cloudy golden color with a nice half finger of rocky white head that leaves great lacing all around the glass.  Wonderful aroma of hops and some citrus.  The taste is just as wonderful, and very refreshing, could easily chug this beer, and i would if i had more, but since i only have this one from my SS, i will resist the urge.  Taste is hoppy, with notes of citrus and some honey.  Slightly bitter towards the end, but incredible smooth.  Medium bodied and a nice palate, smooth and lively.  Great beer.

Beautiful beer, a hefty golden color. Just barely cloudy. Pours with a small rocky white head that goes completely away. Good lacing. Smell is heavy if not harshly hoppy with pine and grapefruit. Also a myriad of other smells, rasin, raspberry or cassis, apple, a little oak and some honey. extremely refreshing taste. Starts bitter and ends with a sweetish note (for an IPA). Average duration. Palate was light, dry, and a bit metallicy, but only enough to stimulate the senses, still a joy to take down. Soft carbonation, very enjoyable brew.
A beautiful orange pour with a light tan head. Very floral IPA, all hops are floral and bitter but not so much grapefruit or acidic or piney. Very nice indeed.

22oz bottle.  golden orange with a decent cream head that dissipates leaving traces on the glass.  Aroma is very hoppy with a hint of wood.  Taste is full of hops with a grapefruit bitterness.  Finishes dry with no excessively bitte aftertaste, just a hint of that grapefruit..

pour is cloudy orange.  Head is honorable,  thinning out to a fine layer,  it stays consistent, and lacing is small, yet visible.  Couldnt really smell a lot, maybe congested, but I dipped my nose in this accidentally trying to get a feel for it.  Body is a little thin and the abv throws me off.  I almost dont believe it.  Some citrusy things going.  again, light.  Compared to the Lagunitas IPA, its a totally different color, clarity and feel, almost confused about the style now.  All and all, nothing at all overpowering, light tasting, and not offensive in any way.  I like the hops but really not enough body to balance out.  Still not convinced that a beer this light is only one percentile away from OE in abv.  Memory:  Im at bevmo looking for a good deal.  A guy Id seen somewhere before walks up and hands me a 22.   Its the guy at the 15 items or less row... see him every time Im at safeway.  Hes like "We just got the new Stone blah blah blah".  He grabbed my hand and slapped this ugly looking bottle in my hand and walked away.  I just figured the guy was on crack, got fired from safeway, and just happened to be in kill mode.  I hid the 22 behind the closest thing I could find, bought my 9.99 sale 12pk of heineken and walked out.  I dont think that guys a drug addict anymore.  Id buy this again in another month or so.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2009 Thanks ucusty! Pours a soft peachy amber with a two finger creamy white head. Very citrusy nose, mandarin oranges, apricot, light alcohol. The flavor is very hoppy, waxy , bitter, citusy, piney, spicy hops, mandarin oranges, maybe a little past fresh. Still good though. Long lasting warm waxy palate. Nice IPA.

The color was a cloudy light orange/golden.  The head was medium-bodied, foamy, white, and laced some.  The aroma was hoppy, citris, and aged.  The flavor was that of an imperial ipa.  It was very hoppy, pine, waxy/bitter, and citrisy.  The palate was aggresively carbonated.  The finish was hoppy, waxy bitter, and long-lasting.

This is your average IPA. Smells great and gives an appearance of the traditional IPA; however, flavor wise, I appreciate that long lasting hops giving the distinct knowledge of the IPA. Kudos on the all day drinking beer for a football game.
The aroma is a near perfect balance of hops and sweet malt.  Smells exactly like an IPA should.  Flavor follows suit impressively.  Very hoppy, but still fairly balanced.  This is a really good IPA.
I expected a lot out of this when I tried it in San Diego. However, its skunky taste made me drink the water at my table with my meal instead. Dont get the hype. A Redhook IPA blows this away.
UPDATED: JAN 5, 2008 Bottle: Very good IPA.  One of the best that I have had.  Hoppy aroma and flavor.  Not too overpowering.  This is what an IPA should taste like.

Had this beer on 9/12/2003.  Aroma is full of a nice hop scent.  Color is bright gold with a few light flakes floating around that look a bit like fish food.  Carbonation is light with a thin head.  Taste hoppy.  Starting with a medium body it goes down crisp with a malty taste coming on.  Finish builds with the malt fading out and turning to a full bitterness.  Its not as balanced as it should be, the bitterness is too strong and the hop flavor is too week

Another brilliant brew from Stone.  Pours a hazy amber with a frothy white head.  This beer is dominated by hops but is balanced out by a sweetness that doesnt make it too bitter.  Almost as good as their Ruination IPA.

Pours a great head with an explosion of hops.  The only complaint is that sometimes it has a bit too much fruit.  But that balanced with the high hop profile is the strong suit.
This is my favorite IPA

bottled, consumed on 11/27/07.  Aroma: hops.  Flavor: hops.  Thats about all there is to this beer.  I failed to detect any smell or flavor other than grapefruit/resin hops and the accompanying bitterness.  If thats what youre into, a great beer.  I like to taste some malt and maybe some yeast character, so not a lot for me here.

12oz bottle. pours clear light copper with creamy white head. nose is loaded with PNW hop notes of pine, grapefruit, and citrus. flavor is nicely bitter with grapefruit hop notes and a toasted biscuity finish. light body, sorta watery. the bitterness is there and you cant taste the almost 7%. this is tasty but it doesnt finish well, just sorta gets toasted biscuity. maybe this was a nice IPA 5 years ago but theres a lot of other IPAs with a better hop flavor.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2008 Very crisp.  Golden with a decent sized white head.  Aroma of citrus, esp grapefruit, and hops.   Mouthfeel is smooth with plenty of carbonation.  Taste is hoppy with a good balance of malt sweetness.  Hops are not overwhelming at all.  Finishes with light bitterness, less than expected.  A good IPA thats more subtle than other big hop brews.  Very easy drinking.  Overall, a great beer.

Bottle.  Poured with an impressive two finger head, and the body is a nice copper color.  Carbonation overall is excellent, and the lacing is prevalent 20 minutes after pouring.  Aroma is very fruity, and is most perfectly hopped.  Its really impressive that a beer dry hopped for 2 weeks is this flavorful.  Has a citrus, pine, grapefruit finish.

Im not an IPA-type but I do like this one (although I think Ruination is better).  It has a complex and enjoyable taste and aroma, with enough malty sweetness to round out the hoppiness.  Itr is orange gold, with a thin, white dissipating head, leaving a little weak lacing.  The aroma is mostly hops, citrus, especially grapefruit, and a hint of pine.  The taste is again mostly hops, citrus and pine, bitter, but with a decent sweet malty balance, aromatic, with a sweet, grainy note to the finish.

Pours a hazy golden with a smaller than I expected head that leaves nice lacing as the glass empties.  Possibly the finest hop aroma of any beer Ive experienced.  Smells like a double handfull of fresh Centennial hops.  Not much in the way of malt character or alcohol in the nose.  Flavor is bittersweet, balanced, with generous hop bitterness and flavor and another tremendous dose of flavor in the  finish.  I appreciate the cloudiness, but Id like it a smidgen darker.  Overall, though Stone IPA gets a big bravo from this hop enthusiast.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2009 Long the saving grace of many a Yard House, this beer holds up well over time for me; particularly in comparison to AleSmiths IPA.  This brew is a bit darker than most of the style, and manages to keep a great hoppy quality without a sharp finish.  Even some soft fruit comes through.  Way drinkable.

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2008 Bottle.  Perhaps this had aged a bit, but I found it good not great, perhaps I was expecting too much.  A nice golden orange body with an off-white head that laces nicely.  A balanced hoppy aroma.  Nice bitterness, grassy hops, not unbalanced.  Medium body, tingly with a light lingering bitterness. 

Update - a later bottle tried was even less hoppy and more stale tasting, seemed to definitely have some age on it, have not considered it in my rating.  Need to get a fresh bottle of this.

Update - Was able to try this draft at Najas Place in Redondo Beach, CA.

Golden amber almost no off white head.  Full piney dry hops, much better draught than the bottle.  Fresh crisp, lacking any sweetness but picking up some floral notes, this is all cascade and lingers nicely. 7 4 6 3
UPDATED: MAR 1, 2008 Bottle, Solvang, CA.Pale golden looks, fresh hoppy nose with some gummy bears. Full hoppy bitterness, which is pretty balanced and not too stingy. Quite balanced and strong IPA.

22oz.  Poured golden orange with a big fluffy white head.  Relatively translucent in the glass.  Mostly hops in the nose, very well balanced malt and hops.  Not as many hops on the finish as I expected.  This is a very strong example of the IPA style, not overboard by any means.  That said it didnt strike me as exceptional.
Poured orange with a nice fluffy head.  Great hoppy flavor with a good finish.  One of the better IPAs Ive had.

Bottle: Poured a cloudy amber color with a huge marang head which left huge lacing on the glass. Aroma is citrus, pine, vanilla and malts. Strong and hoppy. Taste has a strong pine hop presence. Another excellent IPA.

Good IPA.  Pours gold with an average sized white head.  Lively carbonation.  Starts slightly sweet with a nice bitter finish.   Very well balanced and easy to drink.  Bitter, but still smooth.  Hoppy, but not overly so.  If your preference is an insanely hoppy and floral IPA, there are other beers to try.
Pours hazy  gold with a generous solid head. Aroma is grassy, citrus, hoppy. Strong floral hop taste with a nice bitter finish. A great IPA Ill keep coming back to.

This appeared a lot lighter in the glass then I had expected, but was still a nice pale gold colour. The head was a healthy 3 fingers of cloud-like creamy texture. The lacing coated the glass, to where it was opaque - cool. Smell, oh, the smell. Grapefruit citrus, and pine hops, all in attendance, right where they should be, which follow through to shine in the taste. Firm body, nice balance, sufficient carbonation, dry - can a big IPA like this be called silky smooth?
Amazing hoppy yet slightly sweet aroma with a great milky golden appearance.  Great hoppy flavor and a nice hoppy finish.  Definitely one of the best IPAs I have ever had!!
Aroma of grass, flowers, citrus.  Huge bitterness upfront in the mouthfeel that fades into grapefruit.  Finish is dry and lingering, it will have your mouth smacking for hours afterwards.

Pours orangish, with fluffy head, that falls to a small lasting head, oroma is citrus and pine hops, the flavor is also citrus and pine, with some maltyiness, this is a really good IPA, its not as intense as others, but that can be a good thing

12 oz. - Pours a yellowish/orange with nice fluffy off-white head.  (Good lacing).  Aroma is of hops, grapefruit, pine and a little malt.  Taste is the same, decently bitter (70+ IBUs), mouthfeel - crisp, dry, lightly carbonated, medium-bodied.  A nice and well balanced IPA - but honestly: a little boring given its Stone.  It just tastes like a less bitter and flavorful Ruination.

Bomber - Poured a clear amber-orange in color witha small white head.  Small lacing.  Aroma is strong of citrus and pine hops with a medium current of malty sweetness.   Flavor is also hoppy with citrus and pine present and a medium amount of bitterness that lingers into the finish.  Finishes clean.  Medium body.  Very good!

Cold 12oz bottle:  Pours a clear dark yellow borderline orange color with a thin layer of alabaster bubbles mostly around edges and some lacing.  Aroma is of fruit, grass and malt.  Taste is of light malts, elongated bitterness, fruit and grass.   Nice blend.  Medium bodied and crisp, with ample carbonation.  Ending is of hops bitterness and fruit well blended.
Golden straw color, nice appearence. Nice hoppy aroma. One of the better IPAs out on the market. With out a doubt would recommend.
12 oz. bottle.  Piney and citrusy taste but very smooth and didnt seem as bitter as some other IPAs Ive had.  A beer that is very enjoyable to drink and I could drink all day.

Pours a hazy pale copper shade. Drank from a tulip, and had almost no head. Nose was hoppy citrus and pine. Flavor is smooth, and would probably be considered a IIPA from some other brewers. A really good beer with a clean finish.
UPDATED: MAY 25, 2011 Very solid west coast IPA. What else would you expect from stone! On tap at Y-not
I wish I could get this beer in Illinois since I have to drive to Munster, Indiana to get it.  Solid IPA.  Smells and tastes great.  A very smooth IPA that isnt too bitter.
From a bottle poured a nice amber color with a good amount of head.  Nice hoppy flavor with a good lingering aftertaste.

Poured into standard shaker glass. Very piny and fragrant citrusy aroma full of lemon zest notes and Colorado winter skiing. That was the highlight for me though. Taste is smooth but not enough malt balance a la Dogfish 60/90 Minute IPA. Refreshing but a bit standoffish with the finish. Mouth feels cottony and too dry after sips. If you enjoy the bitter hop finish then reach for this. It was fun to enjoy a bottle but I wont make extra effort to purchase this.

Pours orange/gold with a small off white head. Aroma is huge citrus and pine. The flavor is equally big, huge hop flavor, with a nice balance between sweet and bitter. A buttery resin finish that stays with you. Very nice IPA.

22 oz. bottle. The smell of fresh cannabis bud took me back to the days of yore with hydros and grow lights. Poured with no head. The taste was grapefruit bittersweet with enough of a malt presence to keep the hops from overwhelming. The full body of this brew carries the flavors nicely. Probably the best of Stones widely availible beers.Jan 2002
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: UPDATED: OCT 20, 2007 The pine taste is a lot more evident than the citrus taste but that is why I bought it I guess. Always refreshing, Ill welcome it whenever I can get it.
UPDATED: SEP 6, 2009 Piney/citrus hops dominate a bitter beer that doesnt seem all that bitter thanks to the well-balanced body and clean finish.  Great stuff.

6-pack from Total Wine in River Edge, NJ...bottle pours cloudy orange with an off-white head...initial smell is of a freshly opened orange juice quickly followed up by a floral zestiness...taste is citrusy accompanied by a mildly bitter hoppiness...nice mellow mouthfeel...this is an excellent IPA...thanks to the employee at Total Wine that recommended it.

After chasing 3 kids around Sea World on a warmer than normal October day, I came home to this, and wow did it hit the spot.  Hops, hops hops!  Citrus aroma, golden color, very bitter, and the alcohol is well-hidden.  An excellent IPA, my favorite.

12 oz bottle.  Poured a clear, light golden color with a thin white head.  Why do mine pour a thin head while others have claimed it poured a thick head?  I guess if I just turned the bottle upside down into the glass I could have produced a bigger head.  Strong hop and citrus smell.  Strong, sweet citrus taste - mainly grapefruit.  Bitter but sweet.  Clean tasting finish.

12 oz. bottle into pint. Pours a bright orange color with a long-lasting white head. Strong smell of hops and tropical fruits. Tastes of heaven! A near perfect balance of bitterness with touch of sweetness to finish. Very light and smooth mouthfeel for being an IPA. Call me crazy, but I perfer this to the Ruination IPA. Will purchase much more in the near future.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2008 The perfect example of an IPA, the only problem is i hate any and all IPAs. Smells and tastes supper hoppy or dry hops. Hazy orange color. And of course the usual cleaning product taste of an IPA. Ill recommend this for IPA lovers, but i will never drink this beer again.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2010 My favorite local brew, wonderful aroma with superb appearance and flavor.  It raises the bar for IPAs.  We are lucky to have such great breweries here in San Diego like Stone, Alesmith, and Ballast Point.  This brew has a grapefruit and pine aroma with floral notes.  There is a robust, grainy quality that balances the bitterness.  It has a powerful alcohol kick that leaves you satisfied.

Another fine and hearty IPA.  The finish is not quite as full as with the Ruination.  Almost a slight thinness at the end.  These Stone IPAs are very good, but the type of hops they use give it an almost citrus/sweet flavor.

slightly orange, im getting skunky, green grass, lemon peel aromas, the hops stick in the top of my nose. quick & smooth in the mouth,some aromatics. flavor starts with almost honey but the hops are so close behind, a little shrill, citrus near the edge but not over, clean finish, sufficient balance

Substantially hopped but surprisingly smooth, this beer is probably the epitome of "crisp and refreshing." Works equally well in cold or warm weather to make you feel the other way, and the dominating hop bitterness serves to remind you that youre still alive!

(Stockholm Beer Festival 2007) Bottle. Golden color, nice white head. Hoppy, grassy fruity aroma with sweetish notes. Some pine apple and grapefruit. Hoppy, grassy, fruity flavor, dry bitterness, grapefruit and metallic notes.

bottle from Whole Foods on P St in D.C. - 
dryer that most IPAs Ive tried.  Out of the plethora of domestic microbrew IPAs, this has got to be up towards the top.  The 6.9% alcohol lays in the background in terms of taste, and the fact that this goes down so easily makes it a beer that can catch up with you quickly, even as Im writing this.

Bottle at Akkurat - shared with Mette. Clear golden - white head. Grassy, dryness, light piney, light sweetness, light citrus, a rather simpel IPA -> simpel grassy hopped. OK - but it needs some complexity.

My IPA. Goes well with anything anytime. Nice balanced aroma and taste. Basic great IPA with a lot of hops but has complex balance with some sweet malts. A little dry pine and citrus flavors shine through.

Bottle.  Light orange and slightly cloudy with  full floral aroma and a hint of malts.  The flavor is what you expect, but surprisingly smooth with a faint bitter aftertaste.  The malty profile is also great.  The flavor in addition is a tad oily and the above average ABV is noticeable.  This is a great IPA with or without food, because the flavor does not beat you over the head.
bottle. Farly dry, With a nice pleasant bitterness. very cleaned brewed, very nice. well balanced bitterness, aroma hops and malt sweetness.

(bottle) Hazy straw colored body, big white head. A sweet, hoppy and wonderfully floral aroma. Flavor is hoppy but very smooth all the way with just a little bitter bite on the finish. Also sweet. Medium bodied but thick mouthfeel.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2007 Wonderful cali iPA thar really sets the standard for ipas.  Large airy head that quickly disapates to fine film. Wonderful Flower aroma.  i was lucky because the hop flavor was awesome.  finishs with a nice bitter grapefruit flavor.
Good beer for IPA lovers.  Definetly above baseline.  Great aroma, sweet and hoppy.  Flavor didnt have as much kick as the aroma.  Wish it did, but good beer overall.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2008 Oh my....I did not expect I would like this so much.....The aroma and taste in the back of your throat is so outstanding, so perfect for an IPA - I still cant believe it.  Sniff the dry hopped goodness of bittern grapefruit.....WOW!!!
Bottle. Great beer. Rich colour. Great aroma. Smooth poor. Excellent American beer. A great beer.

I love this IPA. The pour is smooth and creates a nice 2 inches of white head that dissolve into belgian lace before I get through my second sip. The aromas are beautiful, I recommend using a brandy sniffer to capture the grapefruit, lemon, pine resin, and sage. The initial taste is a mix of the aromas and the mid-taste. The mid-taste is a herbal fruity bitterness that overpowers any malt sweetness, and slowly fades into a tangy bitter aftertaste.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2007 Bottled.  Pours a light, hazy orange colour.  Nice, stable white head and good lacing.  Aroma and first taste is all floral hops.  The finish is short with slight hop bittereness.  Very similar to Ruination, just less bitterness.  I really like both.

Bottled. An orange coloured beer with a big and persistent creamy white head. The aroma is very hoppy: there are notes of orange, grapefruit and pine. Very nice. Also the flavour is very hoppy with grapefruit again. There is also caramel malt. Medium body, dry finish, long and very bitter aftertaste. Another nice beer fom Stone.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2008 Dull label.  Sweet, fresh aroma with floral and citrus notes.  This is a nice, rich IPA - hoppy but balanced, robust but smooth. Grapefruit and pine touches.  No missteps here - I can see why this beer is up near the top of the charts.

Draft, Frisco Grille.  Pours a bright, clear medium-orange color; white head with fine-bubbled lacing.  Very mild hop aroma; mostly sugar and lemon dishsoap (which I guess depends on your dishsoap); surprisingly light, as this is allegedly a fresh keg.  Excellent, oily hop character upfront; almost like a fresh-hop ale (odd considering the lax aroma); resiny, fruity and floral hop character with a mild maple syrup / candy sugar maltiness keeping things balanced; no astringency, intensely drinkable.  Medium, sugar and fruity finish.

Aroma of water in a sewer pipe, of course in a good way. Taste is rather unfriendly as with most IPA.  Bitter hops and its like you are chewing on grapefruit rinds.  Werent hops supposed to be a preservative for beer?  Nuff said.  Im not sure why they became the desired flavor.  Some mild carbonation raises its head above the rudeness. Cannot quite get used to this bitter bite. Quite rude and offensive. Lingering unfriendly bitter medicinal taste that just keeps going and going. Will not buy again, a little too much for my lager lovin girlie taste buds. On style if you like this kinda beer.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: UPDATED: NOV 12, 2007 Was nice. Poured a light amber hue and had a big foamy head.  Lots of hops in scent and flavor and a nice bitter after taste. Also detected hints of pine and citrus in the scent. Recommended but preferred second to Ruination IPA.
As another mentioned....very good, but not quite as good as Arrogant Bastard
Floral hoppy aroma, with a slight spicy/piny character. Light resin, but somewhat fruity - solid malt backbone.

Bottle.  Floral hoppy aroma. Poured tarnished gold with foamy hoppy white head.  Hoppy flavour, with faint malty sweetness to avoid unbalance. Lasting bitter and hoppy flavour.  One of the best IPAs Ive ever tasted.  Only my second 5 in a year.
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text: Bottle - 12 oz. Hazy light amber body with low carbonation and a thin but lasting off-white creamy head. Very well balanced malty/hoppy aroma that carries bready, herbal and flowery notes. Wonderful sharp and dry hoppy taste that leaves a long and robust bitter aftertaste. Excellent IPA.

I have been very impressed with all of the Stone brews thus far.  The labels are very cool and the brews ere excellent.  This IPA is one of the better Ive had in a while and the alcohol content really helps my rating as well.  It is disguised in a flavorful, hoppy, crisp pale with a terrific finish.  I really like this one.
i never used to like ales that tasted like they were flavored with a pine branch. consider me converted. the alcohol content certainly helps.

This is one of my all time favorite IPAs.  My only other favorite is DFH 90 minute.  I love a robust IPA.  This beer is hoppy, but not overly hopped like some cheap IPAs.  The aroma, and the head are perfect for a beer like this.  Stone certainly lives up to its reputation.
A very lovely beer, but for me it takes a back seat to the Arrogant Bastard.

Pours a cloudy gold with a one finger head. Smell is highly sweet with a touch of lemon. Flavor seems somewhat light but thick with personality at the same time...almost seems hefeweizen-esqe, though Belgian at the same time. Starts off slightly in citrus and delivers a high level of bitter into your mouth. Gets smoother as time goes on. Smooth, but a bit strong on the mouthfeel. Highly drinkable.

Bottle. Big, bright hops on the nose. Grassy and earthy with some citrus fruit. A sweet caramel malt hides behind the ever present hops. Some floral notes as well. Pours full gold with a white head. Loads of sticky lacing down the glass. Big hops and malt on the palate. Tons of flavor but remains quite balanced. Rich, full bodied and creamy. The finish lasts forever. An excellent IPA.
nearly perfect ipa. one of the best smelling beers around and beautiful to behold. deserves its top 10 ranking

Without a doubt the Hoppiest beer Ive ever had.  I knew right after that moment that it would be ranked really highly on this site.  It was a little too much for me, but it definitely wasnt bad, Id like to try it again one day.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2010 
Name: India Pale Ale
Date: October 28, 2001
Mode: Bottle
Source: Ziggys, Chattanooga
Appearance: slightly hazy copper, whispy white head
Aroma: aroma of fresh hops on sweet malt
Body: big burst of hop flavor with a rich malt body, long bitter finish

Name: India Pale Ale
Date: July 17, 2002
Aroma: aroma is still there
Flavor: the hop character in the flavor is all but gone, still a nice lingering bitter finish
Overall: what a difference a few months make, not a beer to lay down, not even in a fridge

Name: India Pale Ale
Date: September 04, 2003
Mode: bottle
fresh new bottle and the hops are as big as ever in the aroma but still a bit subdued in the flavor

Name: India Pale Ale
Date: October 27, 2006
Mode: bottle
Appearance: opaque orange, nice lace
Aroma: big sweet citrus hop aroma with a slight grassy character
Flavor: lots of hop flavor, good dry malt
Overall: remains an excellent hop delivery vehicle through warming

Name: India Pale Ale
Date: January 19, 2007
Mode: bottle
Source: roadtrip
picking up much more caramel sweetness in the flavor, still lots of hops to balance, much more balanced, 

Name: India Pale Ale
Date: October 10, 2008
Mode: draft
Source: summits woodstock
Appearance: clear copper, frothy off white head, thick lace patterns
Aroma: sweet crystal malt aroma with abundant citrus
Flavor: lots of hop flavor, nice citrus, well balanced with a backing crystal and caramel sweetness

Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 8/10; Overall: 15/20
Rating: 3.6/5.0Drinkability: 7/10
Score: *** /4

Name: India Pale Ale, Double Dry Hopped
Date: October 06, 2010
Mode: Draft
Source: Duckworths Stone Tour
Appearance: hazy gold, wispy white head
Aroma: sweet pale malt aroma, lots of citrus and floral hops
Body: body is a bit thin
Flavor: sweet malt flavor, lots of citrus hops, light flaral, long lasting balancing bitterness

Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 12/20
Rating: 3/5.0Drinkability: 7/10
Score: ** /4

I enjoy IPAs more than most styles of beer, and this one really confuses me.  Maybe it was the particular bottle I had, but it was almost a caricature of an IPA.  The floral hoppiness was almost too much so.  The bitterness was a little too exaggerated.  On the other hand, it was delicious and I enjoyed every drop.  Strange.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2008 Poured from a bottle.  Poured a golden copper color with a 1 finger off-white head.  Aroma is hops and pine with some hints of fruit.  Nice malt backbone with some hints of citrus.  Leads to an awesome hop bitterness that gives the beer a crisp flavor.  Awesome, awesome beer everyone should try.
UPDATED: SEP 3, 2007 Beautiful copper color with white head, and aroma and flavor full of hops.  A delight to drink.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2011 8/27/07.bad news...finally got this at work...copper color with a fluffy white head. very grassy piney aroma. flavor has some caramel and sweet malts to balance out the hops. the hops are definitely there but not over done as many west coast ipas tend to be. this beer is to be used as a tool with food rather than food itself...
double and triple dry hopped ... aka ipa with a shitload of hops! = awesome on tap at papago 4.2+

Pours a brilliant copper with a small head. Very slight malty aroma - difficult to discern. Tastes of berries, very floral hops, but a well-combined taste, smooth and pleasant. Almost creamy body with decent carbonation. Lovely hoppy finish, great beer. Many thanks to G for the taste!
Cask-GBBF. Yellow with a small white head. Hoppy aroma with pine, grass and peach. Bitter and dry, with a long hoppy aftertaste.

12oz bottle.  This is a great beer.  Thick fluffy head.  Smells great when you pour it--strong fresh hop aroma.  Not quite Ruination strong, but it pretty much smells like a pile of hops.  Tastes the same.  Good fresh, bitter flavor.  Im more of an Imperial IPA person, but this is one of my favorite everyday beers.

Pours a hazy golden color with a small, white head.  Sharp, crisp, piney hop aroma.  Starts sweet, then malts are met by a big citrus body.  Lemons and grapefruit dominate here.  Finish is very bitter.  Not bad.
What a wonderful IPA.  Aroma of candied fruit, and excellent crisp palate. The flavor is exactly what an IPA should be - well rounded. Delicious.

Pours a solid hazy golden colour with a white sticky head. Big hop floral aroma with sharp notes of orange peel. Lots of hop flavour, from start to finish. Starts with a light sweetness, with some citrus fruit notes in the middle, and big hop bitterness in the finish. All and all top fn notch IPA.

me and my friends bought a six pack of this to be adventurous, i have not had anything better, but of coarse i am relatively new to the beer scene, the flavor was so perfectly balanced between medium bitterness and a sweetness that hits in the beginning, i loved every sip and this is now my friends favorite beer
UPDATED: JAN 6, 2008 12 oz. bottle. Golden pour with a strong delightful aroma almost matched by its taste. Surprisingly good for a year round brew. Wish I could find this at home.
best ipa ive ever had, hops are REALLY strong but refreshingly bitter without being overpowering, hints of sweetness in the finish

The was the first IPA I ever enjoyed and even slightly appreciated.  Aroma isnt the typical IPA hoppy apricot smell. It is there, but much lighter.  Slight and mild bitterness, not overpowering at all.  Taste is not too intense at all.  I really want to try this again after I try some more IPAs to see how much I still like it.
22 oz. great hop aroma right from the start. crisp, fresh hop flavor, very citrusy/orange and somewhat sweet. slightly sticky mouthfeel, but smooth overall. One i could drink frequently.
This is one of my top 3 favorite beers brewed in the United States. Definitely my favorite IPA overall. Yummylicious!
Good flavor. Lacking in hops, expected more from an IPA. Not quite as good as I was led to believe.

Cask gravity at GBBF 2007.  Its just grapefruit juice.  Gold with slight haze, bubbly off white head.  Lots and lots of grapefruit.  Fine in mouth.  I was really looking forward to this and its still a little lacking in the mouth like the pale ale.  Great, great hop though and decent balance.

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2008 Bomber Bottle: pours copper gold with faint orange-amber high lights and a white head, nice lacing of fine bubbles left on the glass, pine hop and citrus with malt sweet aromas, faint pineapple and orange fruit fragrances, little vanilla on the nose, hop citrus bitterness on the tongue with malt sweet, pale malt and faint caramel flavors, appears to be brewed more towards the hops rather then the malt, I found the malt flavors were limited if the beer was too cold, allowing the beer to warm brought out the malt flavor, medium or so mouth feel, has a hop bite that leads to a nice dry finish Old Rating 8/4/7/4/14.......................New rating, very good, certaintly made to the hops side of the spectrum, hops dominate throughout, the citrus hop bitterness has a real drying effect at the finish, New Rating-8/5/7/4/15

Hazy yellowis body with a firm white head of small to medium bubbles.  I could smell the hops from about 3 feet away, but there was also a slight hint of caramel.  As expected, tons o hops in the taste.  Piney, floral and bitter hop flavors all made an appearance with the bitter taking center stage and lingering the longest.  Not very full in the mouth, but not thin either.  Just about right. A very tasty IPA indeed.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2008 Rich honey to amber colored pour with relatively short lived head.  Smell at first is big bold fresh hops, but in a matter of a couple minutes, the hops dissipated dramatically, and turned into a lightly aromatic honey and caramel with the faintest hint of alcohol.  Ive never noticed the hops aroma fading, or especially that quickly.  Taste was actually rather smooth, sweet, and very mildly bittered and flavored from the hops.

Pours a hazy gold with highlights of yellow and orange and a medium-sized white head. The aroma is floral with hops, complemented with some grass and some honey. The mix of grassy, flowery hops and malts makes for a very seductive smell. The flavor follows the aroma: a firm hop bitterness made from flowery, fruity, and spicy hops. There is a touch of citrus and grass, too. The hops are well-balanced by sweet malts that provide flavors of honey and sweet, very light crystal malts. The finish is dry with a sweet but hoppy aftertaste. I am quite curious what hop varieties were used - they are delectable and much more subtle than most high-alpha-acid US hop varieties. Overall, very pleasant.
Beautiful golden color with a nice stiff head.  Something slightly off on aroma which I cant put my finger on.  Smooth mouth with a slam of bitterness at the end.
A fantastic IPA.  This beer has plenty of bite that goes great with just about any meail  It reaks of malt and hops and the taste confirms it.  For a "basic" IPA this ranks near the top.

12 oz to pint. Nice white frothy head with good retention. The aroma is as expected for a beer with an obvious multitude of hop varieties... extemely stong but not overpowering, a lot of citrus/fruity notes as well as a some caramel and clove notes. The bitterness overpowers the maltiness but in a good way. Has a medium body with a slick texture and a long finish. Very happy with this beer.

What a terrific IPA!  Out of a 12oz bottle, the hoppy aroma hits you instantaneously.  The taste is very citrusy and extremely hoppy.  The hops slam the back of your throat but in a very very good way.  I really love this beer.

"aroma- citrus, floral, resin. appearance is a little a clear honey color that looks crisp and clean with bubbles bursting to the top. mouthfeel- you get hit with the hops at the beginning, middle and end- yet there isnt an overpowering bitterness- a good strong one with floral and citrus undertones. Malt is present in the middle- minor sweetness, nothing thick or sticky- just a mellow malt presence. This made the body feel a little thin but the hops make up for the malt thinness. Just as ggod at the beginning as the end. Has all the tastes of a good IPA without overpowering the senses- citrus/grapefruit, floral, pine. VERY drinkable "
Pale orange color.  Big west coast IPA hoppy flavors.  Grapefruit, pine, citrus.  Nice hoppy aromas.  Love this one.  Right after the regular pale you really taste the extra hop jazz going on.

Drank on June 24, 2007. The aroma was a moderate to heavy hoppiness with a little citrus smell. The head was small to average, creamy and off-white in color. The head lacing was fair, the head was mostly diminishing. The body was hazy and the color was orange. The initial flavor was moderate bitterness with the finish the same, the finish was average. The body was light to medium, the texture creamy and the carbonation soft. This is an excellent beer!

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2009 old rating:
6/4/6/3/12- 3.1.

pours a semi-cloudy amber-orange with a small foamy white head, good lacing.

smell of light grapefruit, dry leaves, hops, a touch of citrus, and grass.

taste is creamy yet crisp, grapefruit, lemon, bitter hops, slightly metallic, grass, and danelion, bit on the watery side as it warms, leaves mouth dry, ends bitter.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2010 Bomber, Pours a slightly hazy copper-amber color with a medium white head that has good retention and shows some sticky lacing. Aroma of  weedy hops, citrus, and some sweet vadalia onions. The flavor mirrors the aroma with a little spice thrown in. Mouthfeel is full and satisfying. Finish is medium and hoppy and clean. Overall: First rate IPA

Rated 7/26/07.  Bomber in Las Vegas, NV.  Clear, dark golden color with a rocky white head that settles to a thin film.  Wonderful lacing.  Aroma is primarily grassy, herbal, and lemony hops.  The aroma is strong, but not as overpowering as many dry-hopped IPAs seem to be.  The flavor shows strong herbal hops up front, with a decent amount of buttery malts to back up the hoppy punch.  Definitelt some pine resin in there too.  Medium body.  Very crisp and sharp.  Id prefer a little more malt to balance things out, but this is a very good IPA nonetheless.

Had this on draft back on 11Jul2007. It was the cask version specially hopped with Simcoe Hops. Nice golder/copper color. Nice hoppy smell. This beer had great hop flavor but an almost surreal hop sweetness (unlike any other beer) and smoothness. I could drink this version all day long. Bottle the Simcoe version please. Ive had the regular bottle version of stone IPA and it is good... but this is awesome.
Lite copper with smallish fading head.  Obviously hops are featured on this piney,grapefruit  aroma, and the taste displays a citrusy floral hop explosion.  Nice IPA

22 ounce bottle.  Damn, this is a great beer!

The pour delivered a glass of golden-yellow ale tinged with orange.  A thick, foamy white head developed and stayed around.  The lacing was very good.

The aroma was rather complex.  Primary aroma: fruity, citrusy.  Secondary aromas: caramel, cherries, hint of cloves, hint of caraway seed.

The taste just about knocked me out.  There is a very bitter "kick" when the ale first meets tongue.  The hoppy bitterness continues and finishes with another "kick" at the end.  Primary flavor: grapefruit/orange citrus, that is well balanced between the two.  Secondary flavors: caramel, slight lemon, slight floral.

I will definitely be having a few more bottles of this in the near future.
Not an IPA fan, but if hops are what you want hops are what you get!  Very bitter.  Tastes like a becks on steriods.

Bottle.  Huge rush of sweet hops - grapefruit and lychee, light citrus with wood and peach.  Golden pour witha a clingy tan head.  Hoppy taste with a hearty caramel malt background, bready and biscuity with mild-medium bitterness and just a touch of alcohol squeezing through.  Dry and hoppy, but again, not over-the-top.  Slight note of yeast.  Medium body and made for volume drinking.  Really well balanced for an IPA, with a stinging floral/spicy overtone.  Not as earth-shattering as it would have been, say, five years ago, but this is still superb everyday stuff.

HOLY CRAP!  as soon as i opened this thing i got a huge smell, before i could get it in the glass.  once i got it in and got a taste, it almost knocked me back.  huge hops like the bottle claims.  very filling and the bitterness stays right through to the end.  i might have a new favorite brewery.

This is a near perfect IPA.  Wow, its amazing, I love the bitterness in it, the aroma is amazing and the after taste is just awesome.  Next time, Im getting the 6 pack of it.  I sampled the 22oz.  It was great none-the-less.

Draught at d.b.a. Glowing orange colour. Slight haze. Small white head that clings to the glass. Orangey and citrusy hops and malt aroma. Piney notes. Soft hop bitterness, then a good solid malt flavour. Apricoty finish.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2007 The first time i had this beer I was at a park and didnt have a bottle opener.  I popped the top using the side of my car and it started shooting out so naturally I put my mouth at the end of the bottle to waste as little as possible.  As I began to chug, I realized I had a new favorite beer.

Tried on tap at the brewery in one of those tiny taster glasses after going to the tour.  The tour is great!    2 finger small bubble head of medium duration. (Perfect for me is a 1 finger head of  long duration) .  Yellow color.  Wonderful hoppy aroma that sticks to your tongue and hangs out for a while.  Its great to try IPAs super fresh like this one.  Bitter, but in a good summer refreshing way.  Drinkability fades with time.  My favorite of the tasting.

22 ounce bottle.  Pours an orangeish gold with a decent head.  Citrus and piney aroma.  Flavor is not well-balanced though.  All I taste is the hops, with a very bitter finish.  This beer is very highly rated though, so I will have to give it another try.
On tap in Del Mar.Beautiful thick white head with perfect lacing. Nice citrus hoppy aromas.Smooth and bitter on the palate. Not over the top hops with a smooth easy finsh.

I dont think theres anything I can say about this brew that hasnt been said.  Its one of my favorites and is absolutely delicious and complex, yet accessible for those with a weaker palate.  I love amarillo hops and this beer is chock full of them.  Easily my favorite IPA at the moment.
Prob my favortie IPA due to the fact there is stuff in there other than a mouthfull of hops, Nice different malts hops and slight yeasty character. kind of fruity too. Greast BREW!!!!~

Bottle poured into a pint glass.  Pours orange with a small frothy white head that is mostly diminishing but leaving very good lacing.  The aroma is of citrus hops.  The flavor is of citrus hops with some roasted malts.  The body is light to medium with a creamy texture and lively carbonation.  Overall a very good balance between bitterness and hop flavor and malts.

Pours medium amber forming a large frothy head from a 12 oz bottle.  Grapefruit, pines, malts and hop resin permeate up through the lovely ale.  Ive waited a long time to savor this particular beer, and its only my secound Stone brew.  Flavor is full bodied malts, pines and grapefruits.  The beer has a very dry and crisp ending.  The bitterness says "drink me again..." This is a high end IPA, up there with the best.  Oh, only to wonder how the on tap or cask version could be??!!  This beer is to be savored and truly represents American beer making at its finest.
user_location: The Crystal Coast, North Carolina, USA

text: UPDATED: JUN 5, 2008 Bottle bought from LiquidSolutions.biz. The smell is fantastic, full of hoppy goodness and citrus notes. Full bodied taste, with a high drinkability factor, and a fine crisp finish.

Bottle that theisti brought back for me from Bottleworks, in Seattle. Pours a sparkling gold with a rocky, off-white head. The nose is of strong resiny hops, citrus, pine and a light caramel malt in the background. The mouthfeel is medium-bodied, creamy and bitter; just the way I like my IPAs. The flavor is citrus, resin, and pine with a nice malt backing and some fruity notes. This beer, however, is all about the hops. A great bitter finish that lingers at the back of your tongue and begs you to take another drink. This is definitely a top tier IPA and one that I hope will eventually make it to KC. Thanks again, Tim.
Refreshing and hoppy., its got a herbal hop presence with medium bodied malts and floral arrangements. A winner for the IPA

Bottle from Virginia. The aroma is fantastic with tons of hops and sweet caramel malt. The appearance is deep gold with a foamy head. The flavor is very bitter with plenty of sweet malt to balance. The palate is smooth. A very good IPA.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2012 Re-rate 1/24/12: Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Thanks zvikar. Slightly hazy deep golden. Aroma of piney and grapefruity hops and some malt, slightly caramelly. Flavor starts sweetish and malty and continues with lingering grapefruity bitterness. Medium-bodied. Nice and quaffable. 6/3/7/3/14=3.3
<BR
Bottle. Clear orange color with a medium off-white head.  Floral and fruity aroma with lots of hops, citrus, and some peach. Flavor is malty sweet with some caramel and some fruitiness, and evolves into lovely hoppy, grapefruity, bitterness. Nice full-bodied. Great and refreshing. 8/4/8/4/16=4

Bottle. Nice sweet hops aroma. Pours a small head that quickly dissipates to a thin layer of white on top of a light copper color. The taste is a great blend of bitter hops and sweetness, balanced perfectly, and making this beer remarkably drinkable. The hops are muted enough that I could happily session quite a few of these. The only negative is that the mouthfeel is a bit sticky for my preference. Still, a GREAT brew.

very bitter beer about as bitter as you can get before it becomes to much. looks great smells nice. the first taste is a punch in the face of bitterness only for the biggest fans of IPA but a must try for all beer lovers.

Bottle. Pours golden/light amber with a small head. Aroma of hops. Flavor is what you would expect from an IPA, only deeper and more bitter. I cant feel any fruits probably because they are masked by the bitterns. However, the bitterness persists in the aftertaste and leaves you with a pleasant experience wanting for more. Overall, a very good IPA.
Any good IPA needs to be heavy on the hops, however it has a good bitter finish.

Deep copper and tawny beer with a nice rounded head and masterful lacing. Stone never ceases to amaze this IPA lover. Big fcitrus, piny, grapefruit nose with equally potent flavor and deiciously bitter finish. One of my favorite IPAs!  Not well balanced, but well balanced isnt always well.  Stone keeps it real with this monster "regular" IPA.  Yum!
First thing you notice is the clean taste followed by a crisp, almost non-existant aftertaste. It is pretty hoppy but Id like more hops. A very drinkable, light body IPA.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Malty hoppy pine needles aroma. Sweet malty hoppy bitter piney flavor with hints of grapefruit. Sweet malty hoppy finish with a long bitter aftertaste.

Smallish white head. Amber body. Deep, firm malty aroma with resiny, citric hop notes, as well as dry straw and grain. Beautifully clear. Deep, sweet, firm, dry malty straw taste with intense floral, resin, hay and pine needle notes. Clean, smooth mouthfeel, yet sharpish. Long, drawn-out dry hay and resin aftertaste. Absolutely gorgeous. (0.355l bottle at Oliver Twist.)

Pours golden yellow with a white fluffy head. Aggressive west coast hop aroma, very pungent. Lots of tongue splitting hops up front. Alcohol is well hidden by the hop bitterness. Not much malt flavor to speak. The hoppiness is very refreshing. This is what I think of when I think of an IPA.
Pours light amber.  Tall foamy head.  Great aroma, lots of hops, and bitter fruit.  Flavor was good, complex.  Texture had carbonation, but retained the smooth feel I like in IPAs.  Recommend it.

A Great IPA. This beer that has all the taste you would ever want. A nice orange and foamy head mixed with a dark golden body that is exploding with hop aromas and flavors. The dry hoppying really fills in the brew with its outstanding aromas.

Bottle. This to me is what beer is supposed to be, starting with the aroma. Malt smells of caramel, hops of pine and a strong citrus mix, and yeast of dough and broth. Color is clear amber, head is fizzy white with excellent lacing and is mostly diminising. Flavor is almost perfect. Starts lightly sweet and moderately acidic, then finishes lightly acidic and moderately bitter. Palate, also perfect. Light to medium, oily with lively carbonation and nicely dry. I hope to find Stone beers in FL some day.

Honestly, how the hell can a guy dicerne this IPA from a slew of other good IPAs? I will say i can tell when an IPA is up to par, but when i find a good one like this, it tastes the same as other high rated IPAs. Maybe my taste buds have permenat hop burn? Good times though, lots o hops, but what sets it apart to make me drink this over say Furious or Masalla Mama?.......nuttin!

pours a dark gold with a one finger bubbly white head. aroma is a huge hop aroma with some nice malt, yeast, and melon, pine, and orange characteristics, and some watermelon as well. has a light to medium body with some lacing and good carbonation. flavor is the same as aroma. it is a little creamy on the palate and a little sticky on the lips. also has some flaky sediment and a nice dry hop aftertaste. a little oily and slick on the tongue also. a very nice,smooth, and balanced ipa!

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2007 Pours a deep golden with a thin but solid white head. As a rather sweet flowery pine aroma. Slightly sweet initial flavor with a strong hop bitter after taste. Some definite lively carbonation followed by a mildly rough finish round out a truly  pleasurable drinking experience.

650 ml bottle.  Pours golden yellow with a dense white head.  Moderate lacing.  Intense flowery citrus and pine nose.  Moderate body with slight malty sweetness up front followed by a notable hop profile.  Nice IPA.
nice citrusy, hop (cascade?) aroma and flavor, smooth mouthfeel; Ill certainly buy this one again
UPDATED: MAR 15, 2008 Brought back by a friend that visited San Diego. Light hop aroma. Hazy orange color. Sweet hop taste with lingering bitterness. Sticks to your mouth.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2008 Very golden, not much if any red. Long lasting head. Sweet, peachy smell and taste, even a little lemony. Smooth finish and not quite as bitter as many of its peers. A little alcohol warmth too.
[Tasted next to a Bear Republic Racer 5]
The Racer is more red color; more apiricot and pine flavor; and more bitter. The Stone is much sweeter, smoother, and lemony-peach.

Bottle. Nose is sweet grapefruit and piney/grassy hops. Clear orange with a foamy head that leaves thick lacing. Nice palate, citrus bitterness and a strong mouthfeel. Not overly hoppy, nice balance. Could use a bit more floral hop flavor.

I was not thoroughly impressed with this beer, the aroma is there but only after pouring it out of the bottle, smelling it after opening it left me with virtually no impression of the beer.  The strong bitter impression I expect from a good IPA just isnt strong enough, its almost too smooth.  Perhaps Ive been drinking too much Dog Fish Head and Great Divide, but this just does not stack up for me.

Bottle.  Poured a cloudy golden color with floating sediment and a thick white head.  Strong lacing.  Great hoppy aroma with nice citrus tones to it.  Pleasant mouthfeel.  Flavor is hoppy with hints of pine and grapefruit.  Another tasty offering from Stone.

On tap at the Cherry Cricket.  Pours golden orange.  Head remains while drinking.  Aroma of floral, hoppy citrus.  Good malt balance with hops.  Finishes crisp, not bitter.  Stands along with Averys and Odells IPA.
Orange. Large, frothy, white head. Tons of juicy, resinous, pine, and citrus hops. Just enough malt for support. Medium body, balanced carbonation. Great brew to get your hop fix.
UPDATED: MAR 19, 2008 Very good IPA. Classic, clean and refreshing. I can hardly think of a more true to style example of what an IPA should taste like.

Subtle hop aroma of grapefruit and pine. Taste was the same. Nice palate that was smoothe, flavorful, right amount of heaviness and velvetity-ness-nous. Finishes with bitter hops. nicely balanced, not over-powering.

Clear copper orange, small white head. Aroma of citrus hops and a touch of pine. Flavor is grapefruit hops, with some more citrus and pine. Malts well this is just a hoppy ass beer they give it a backbone but only lend a biscuity touch which I love. Easy drinking, great mouthfeel, a classic example of what an IPA should be. This is a straight up hop beer.

Cant believe it took me so long to try this, but it was worth the wait. Had it on tap no less at Opals Marina the other night. Great, very balanced, with wonderful drinkability. Everything works; smell, taste and color. Very, very good.

Ive been dying to try this one but had to wait until I could get out to California.  Picked up a 6 pack at a Vons in Encinitas.  Well worth the wait!  What a distinctive flavor.  Wonderful hops - just the right bite.  I wish I had time to try this one on tap.  It reminded me a bit of Bells Two-Hearted - but not quite the Citrus taste of Two-hearted.
This is a wonderful example of an american IPA. great strong hop flavor but perfectly balanced with the maltyness. very easy to drink, great beer, ruination is even better!

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2007 Fantastic Beer. Great balance of hops and bitterness. My personal favorite IPA. Great hops with just the right amount of malt. Wonderful beer.  It took the drinking of many lesser IPAs to realize this is truly the perfect one.

Mondial de la bière 07. Couleur orangée, claire, mousse tient vraiment longtemps. Arôme houblon, pin, agrumes. Goût bien houblonné, sans être trop fort en amertume, car bien équilibré. Agrumes, et malt caramel. Corps moyen, effervescence faible à moyenne. IPA très bonne, mais me semble très surévaluée ici...

Appearance: Pours a light orange body with a medium white head.

Smell: Profusely fruity hop aroma, with brilliant notes of grapefruit and golden raisins.

Taste: Generous amounts of fresh hop flavors, none of which are overpowering. Grapefruit, pine needles, and juicy orange slices progress to a light caramel maltiness. It all leads to a short-lived, subtly bitter dry finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied, with a fine, resiny texture. 

Drinkability: Unsurpassing drinkability! An excellent IPA charged with great hop flavors and enough malt to remain well-balanced.

Poured a cloudy straw color, with a massive white head that is fading rather quickly.  The nose is bursting with fresh hops, theres no doubt about this.  The taste builds and fades with a massive hop character with a taste stuck in there that reminds me of green grass.  The bitterness hits you with a subdued yet noticeable shot of the finest american hops.

Poured from a 22oz bottle into a pint glass.  This beer poured a clear light amber color with a thick bubbly head that slowy faded away leaving some thick lace on the glass.  Carbonation is noticable.  Aroma is all citrus hops.  Flavor is caramel malt with some spice notes.  Undertones of grapefruit and pine are also present.  You feel a nice spicy hop bite on your tounge.  The beer is medium-bodied.  It ends with a very dry, bitter finish.  This is an above average IPA, but for me I would prefer a little bit bigger flavor to go along with the excellent hop kick.

Awesome. I am a happy little camper. I love an amber colour drink that you cant see thru. i poured the 22oz into a 23oz cup very slowly so i could fit it all in one pour.... this left almost no head. this is an IPA. i wonderful IPA. Take what you think an IPA should be, stick a stone label on it and you have this beer.
friendly little brother of ruination.  less character but still a great ipa.  hoppy and bitter.  perhaps a bit less intense than other stone brews
UPDATED: NOV 7, 2007 Citrus fruit nose. Very prominent hop flavor and smooth as silk. Alcohol is very well hidden.
Very solid, very hoppy IPA. Pours a translucent amber. Smells of citrus. The hops lean more towards grapefruit than pine, although pine is there too. Orange rind-like finish.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2007 Wonderful brew!  This IPA pours a clear light orange with good lacing and wonderful citrus aromas (mosty grapefruit).  Bursting with hops flavor, perfect blend of bitterness and maltiness, and finishes just as bitter and refreshing.  Has a very refined clean, crisp flavor/palate/finish to it, something youd expect out of a great lager, which makes this tremendous.  Great brew, and just as good as the Ruination IPA, in my opinion, but is just plain easy to drink, near-perfect blend and complexity, I really wouldnt change anything about it.  Basically perfect...not many competitors.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2008 12oz bottle.  Pours a light bronze with notable carbonation.  Aroma is divine with the smell of fresh hops - going so far as to remind me of the aroma of some cask ales.  Flavour is heavy hops on the piney side.  Bold and full hoppy aftertaste.  Rewarding.  RE-RATE:  Just had a fresh bottle.  Absolutely outstanding.  The fresh hops werent as piney as I previously found.  Further re-rate:  A bottle from a different batch seems to have lesser aroma and warmer piney bitterness.  I think its the beer, but it could just be my tastebuds.

On tap.  Pour was a clean golden copper with a one-finger tall white head that hung around for quite a while.  Nice lacing.  The aroma was the expected citrus and piney hop combination.  Pleasant, although not remarkable.  The flavor was dominated by piney hop flavor with subtle citrus hanging around the edges.  Super dry, super clean finish.

Bottle as shown. Pours a light amber color with a little white head that last with nice lacing. The aroma is very hoppy with hints of wheat grass. The flavor was also hoppy but smooth and a great finish, reallly enjoyed this one.
12 oz bottle. Pours clear golden color with small white head. Floral hoppy aroma. Hoppy taste with bitter after taste. Very clean finish.
Amber, some haze. Bit grassy on the nose, a touch of ammonia. Pleasant bitterness, crisp and clean on the palate, not like my previous experiences with Stone, a little more user friendly!

On draft, amber pour with a nice white head. Smells of pine, hops, and a little sweetness. Taste was surprisingly mellow, not as hoppy as they would have you believe. Nice mellow flavor, easy drinking beer. A fine I.P.A. that doesnt kill you with the hops.
user_location: Hastings on Hudson, New York, USA

text: rolled into this one right after a Ruination IPA...12 oz bottle...cloudy yellow orange..citrus, pine and fruity aroma..very hoppy...great drinking beer..in my top 10 beers to buy again

Bottle - Slightly hazed orange pour with a creamy head.  Aroma is floral and citrus hop.  Flavor is big and hoppy, matching the aroma of floral and citrus with a good balance of malty notes.  Finishes clean and spicy but not necessarily dry.  Very drinkable for a big hoppy IPA.

Pours a clear orange with moderate white head.  Aroma is certainly hoppy, but not overpowering.  Medium-bodied with a taste that is smoot, bitter, and finishes dry (but not too dry).  This is an IPA that even my wife could drink with its rich flavor and smooth taste.  I liked this even better thatn the reuination IPA

Pours a cloudy orange with a light fizzy white head.  Smells of rich floral hops, some malt characters, and some grapefruit.  Smells like an IPA.  The taste has a nice sweetness to it, rich hoppy characters, with some bitter sweet fruits.  Really, really, well balanced.  Might be its best feature.  Really easy to drink and leaves a nice grapefruit taste in the back of the throat.  Solid brew.

22 oz bottle.  Poured a hazy orange/gold color.  half inch of white head.  Exaclty what I would expect from an IPA.  Hoppy, piny, citrus, nice malt backbone.  Good IPA, but it didnt impress me like I thought it might.  Really nothing to seperate it from the pack.  Drinkable and quality, but maybe a little overrated.
hoppy hoppy hoppy. aroma hoopy and uplifting. the flavor of this beer is awesome high hops light malt. pours a very nice light copper with normal head and heavy lacing. i like it alot.

A very good IPA.  Smooth finish, nice hops flavor, some pine.  Good citrus aroma.  Not much citrus in the flavor though.  Its good, but I dont know if Im really wild about it.  It just doesnt have a whole lot of pow to in terms of citrus and hops.  An easy drink, but I think its overrated.

1.9pt bottle, $4.49.  Aroma is pure catnip!!  Heavy pine resin, flower,  and citrus hopps dominate the aroma.  Id love to put this in front of a cat and see what would happen.  Average sized frothy/foamy off-white head that left excellent lacing and mostly diminished.  Very nice amber body.  Flavor starts lightly sweet and bitter and ends moderately bitter.  Finish is average.  Palate is medium bodied and flat.  This is a beer for hop heads (like me!!) and really shows off the extreme of the style.  Crispy bitters for sure.

22 oz bottle.
Hazy golden with a thick lasting off white head and sticky lace.
Aroma is citrus and floral hops with a good dose of caramel.
Flavor is piney grapefruity hops, balanced with some nice caramel sweetness.
Finish is long and mildly bitter.

Hoppy aroma, hoppy taste!
This beer shows well, follows up great, and finishes perfect
Stone is new to New Jersey, so I am just discovering this - this one was a big surprise.
The ratio of hops in the flavor is perfect.  Too many brews try to get hoppy and get a little silly, not these guys.  Dont get me wrong, the hops are strong, but its perfect.
In my mind, this is the best tasting beer today.  (Sorry Sierra Nevada)
good hoppy aroma and bitter hoppy taste! had in 12oz bottle at some bar in hollywood, very impressed a step brother to stone ruination IPA. light amber color, frothy head, very crisp and smooth.
22oz bottle. Poured nice golden color with good carbonation and a nice white head. Smelled of hops with more hops. Tasted even better. Def a beer to def all the time.

Rated 1/28/06:  Got a 22 ounce bottle from my favorite store and let it chill for a week. Opened it and poured my first glass. Beautiful dark golden/light amber color with good carbonation and a very nice looking head. Took a big ol wiff and HOPS!, HOPS!, HOPS!....the hop aromas were jumping out of the glass, so I took a taste and MORE HOPS. Good character for this beer, Stone has a knack of brewing their beers to the maximum potential of the relative styles they make and this IPA delivers. Fresh tasting ale with complex hop flavors that seem to kick you at first but soon come together into one damn good beer.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2007 deep golden with a nice creamy head. beautiful floral, piney, citrus aroma, with some mild spice. moderate to light carbonation with medium body. hoppy flavor of citrus, pine, some earthy sweetness. bitteness dominates the palate. true to the stone style

I looked up hops and there was no picture of Stone IPA :(.  Hazy dark yellow, big white head.  Aroma is different, floral and citrus, with a touch of cheese.  The cheese isnt a major thing, but just a minor flaw I noticed.  Overall its an invited aroma.  The first sip reveals a somewhat thin, bitter beer.  Im not loving the aftertaste.  Im prefer some more malt in a beer this big.  Im going to have to disagree with the majority here, I think this is a pretty week showing from a great brewery.  I find AB, Old guardian, and ruination far more interesting.
Piney resin and citrus aroma.  Pours blonde.  Great hop character, pine and citrus like the aroma, with a good malt backbone.
One of the better IPAs out there.  Golden color with minimal head.  Lots of hops and pine in the aroma and taste.
Nice dark golden colored beer that gives off plenty of aroma of flowers and hops.. tastes spicy and bitter with a biting flavor that ends with notes of citrus...

22oz bomber via trade with illinismitty. Thanks, Sean! Served in my trusty Duvel tulip. Pours a beautiful golden orange/amber, with a nice sized soapy, foamy white head. Spotty lacing. Aromas of hops, spice, flowers, citrus, rind and some sweetness. Fore is astringent, spicy, hops dominating. Back of the tongue brings a bit of the malt sweetness, but mostly the overpowering hop bitterness and bite. Medium mouthfeel, semi sticky, coating the roof of the mouth. Finish is medium length, spicy, bitter. The citrus and hops really dominate the finish, not as much malt balance as I would have liked. 

In comparison, I like Two Hearted, 60 Minute and Titan IPAs a bit better, but this is still very, very good.

This beer pours out a hazy light brown with almost no head. Aroma is hugely floral and hoppy. I could tell this one was gonna be a sticky IPA just from how sweet it smelled. Taste is as expected, sweet malts with massivly floral hops consisting of various citrus and pine pitch. Not bad at all but it left me wanting something more.

Huge hop boquest as soon as you lift the cap, pours a nice medium amber color witha thn white head. Medium to light mouth feel with a huge hop flavor balanced by some malty sweetness. Great all around IPA
One of those beers that would be tough not to enjoy. Wonderful citrus hop aroma. Pours a nice copper brown, thick head. Earthy malt backbone. Silky smooth hop finish. Top notch.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2007 Bottle... poured a hazy, unfiltered golden color with a bright frothy head.  Sweet, citrus hop aroma.  A really nice, not too carbonated palate which I like sometimes in a good IPA.  Flavors of earthy, piney hops, citrus, caramel, and a nice creamy malt finish.  This is one of those beers that you try, and are unexpectedly blown away.  This beer doesnt deserve any beer rating below a 4!

Bomber, (with a special thanks to John_Adam2002 for this!), pours a clear golden with a large foamy white head and great lacing.  A very nicely blended aroma of floral, citrus, pine and just a touch of caramel.  Flavor is a touch subtle on the hops (of course this is an IPA and not IIPA so thats expected), but very pleasing, with a malty middle and slight lasting bitter finish.  A fuller palate and actually a bit creamy.  This is one I would definitely include in the regular rotation if I could get it around here.  A very well balanced and drinkable IPA; another great one from Stone!

Insane that I havent rated the one before. I must be slipping. So in order to do it up right, I picked up a bottle at my local grocery store and went to town. Aroma is grapefruit, orange peels, caramel and pine. Appearance is absolutely stunning dark golden color with tiny bubbles, a nice egg-white one-finger head. Mouthfeel was creamy. Flavors were incredibly balanced with a two pronged malt / hop attack. The only thing I could I didnt care for was a bit of alcohol about mid palate that was slightly off-putting. Other than that a fantastic beer.

12 oz. bottle. Exactly what I look for in an IPA. Refreshing, very drinkable, and no overpowering bitterness like a lot of double/imperial IPAs. Aroma is citrusy, with a hint of mint. Color is pure gold and clear. Very white moderate head. Citrus very noticeable in the taste. Slight soapiness in the finish. I hope to "borrow" many more from my brother.
one of my favorite IPAs. hoppier than a lot of other IPAs but smooth as well. packaging is top notch as well

Fantastic IPA! Probably the best standard IPA Ive had to date. Fantastic aroma, pour, and color! This IPA has everything you could ever want - a fantastic balance, firm hops, yet noticable citrus hops that will entrance your mouth until the very last drop!
