UPDATED: MAY 29, 2012 A very good IPA, one of the better ones. Pours a nice golden color with a nice head. Tastes good and has a nice citrusy taste and a good hoppy beer.
Bottled. Hazy golden coloured with a small head. Hoppy with notes of citrus, fruits and yeasts. A bit thin and mild.

10 dollars for a 6 is the only downside but certainly worth the price for this delicious hoppy beer. Refreshing and with a slight bite which leaves the palate searching for more. The bite is not overwhelming, dare I say it is slightly smooth? yes. Ive enjoyed everything ive had by stone and this is one of my favorites.
Until I discoved the AleSmith IPA, this was my favorite.  And sometimes I still choose this over the AleSmith.  This diserves its famousness.

Cant say much here that has not already been said. This beer is a hallmark IPA of the west coast style, and was one of the first beers to get me addicted to hoppy brews, and always comes back to me as a great session beer. Crisp and refreshing.
Excellent aroma, great balance of hops, citrus flavor and bitterness. Only down side is a hint of alcohol.  I love this beer - very much worth going out of the way to find it.
Hops and sweet citrus aroma. Flavor is crisp, whispering apples and oranges, moderately acidic with just enough hops punch. Nice creamy, assertive texture. Highly drinkable.

Excellent brew, what less could you expect out of Stone.  Lacing like whoa, not the most powerful of aromas though.  Nothing like ruination.  Good balance, smooth beer.  Mouthfeel was pretty good, but sometihng wasnt sitting well with me, cant put my finger on it.  Tastes a nice bit of hoppiness but nothing to overwhelming.  Bit of an alcohol presence unfortunately, which surprises me since Stone Ruination is nearly a percent higher, and I just finished one of those and tasted no alcohol.  Oh well, very good beer nonetheless, but this will be my last today cause Stones other quality is they get you drunk fast... God Bless Hops.
12oz bottle, very nice IPA with great balance, which is what really stands out about this brew is the balance not the over presence of hops, sure they are there but not overbearing, a darn good IPA.

(Bottle, Akkurat, Stockholm, 13 April 2007) Amber colour with a short off-white head. Seriously hoppy nose with notes of pine needles, resin and citrus peel. Fruity, very hoppy, taste with pine needles, resin and notes of grapefruit (more in the background of needles and resin). Fairly dry. Great hop character, but still the brew is in perfect balance, since the hops arent as aggressive and persistent as they can be in some IPAs. Lovely beer.

Bottle, pours hazy amber/copper with a medium tight white head. Aroma is grassy/citrusy hops, spicy/licorice malts, and dish soap. Flavor is fruit, assertive bitter hops, as well as slightly sweet malts for balance.
Bottle - Nice pour with a medium head.  Taste was good throughout the beer.  Really enjoyed this beer.
Pours a hazy light orange with a small head. Big citrus aroma, grapefruit, some pine as well. Very nice flavor. Good stuff.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2007 Another great offering from Stone...this IPA is damn good, but living in SD has gotten me spoiled on the hops - this one is just your standard interpretation of the American IPA.  One knock I found on it was a slightly metallic aftertaste... still recommended though.
Strong Hop aroma and flavor. Moderate bitterness. Decent mouth feel.  An all around good IPA.

Real killer stuff. Hardly ever do you get so much hoppy bitter in a beer so easily drinkable. Drinking this beer is like hanging out with Jackie Chan - dude is strong enough to kick your ass at any given moment, but hes too cool to do you like that.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2007 Im not an IPA lover, but I loved this beer.  Rather than the astringent, bitter hops that Im used to from IPAs, this one was very lemony and flowery--very delicious.  I will seek this one out again.
One of the best IPAs Ive ever had. The aroma was a combination of citrus and hops. The flavor was a perfect balance of the two. Wasnt too bitter.
Bottled.  A pretty darned good IPA.  Pours gold w/creamy head, bitter as hell, w/some citrus.  A good IPA but not too extreme.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2007 Possibly the most unique "single" IPA.  The aroma and flavor are the most flowery of any IPA Ive tried.  It also has a crispness not apparent in most IPAs.  I wasnt sure what to make of it at first, but by the end of my first one, I was hooked.

Bottle at Mad Mex (Monroeville). Pours orange, very slightly cloudy. Aroma is classic IPA citrus notes. Hops get you on the initial sip, but in a good way. Grapefruit-pine-citrus-hops. Will try this one again.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2008 Burnt orange, slightly hazy with a smallish head that lasts and leaves a wet kiss of  lace. Aroma is dominated by pine-citrus hop,  but sweet malt body is noticeable enough to make a nice counterbalance. Slight banana-soap aroma is a bit out of place here though.  Body is light-medium, a little too fizzy and watery. Flavor is strong hop citrus and resin, but malt backbone is almost big enough to balance and then fade slowly into the background as the woody-tea leaf finish and aftertaste take over. Nice, but overrated.

This beer was poured into a snifter with a good head to it. The head was very creamy and frothy and had a nice smell of malt and hops. The taste is vey bitter and has an extreamly hoppy bite to it. This is probally one of the  best IPAs i have ever had

Consumed in triumph since ai was able to return home instead of staying away for a week at a time todnight.  Hooray.  Bottle said 100+ IBUs not 70 but yet is IPA m Zoinks!   As I opened the bottle it seemed as if I was in a bag of pellitized hops from home brewing.. I want to say cascade and northern brewer.  maybee williamette...  sue me.  body crisp and of course hoppy.  I think I will send Maria some of this.

finishes dry and sweet. aggressive as the bottle says. you get what you expect. behind the scene malt character which i would like to taste slightly more pronounced. best thing to say about this one is it is really satisfying.

(On tap) Slightly hazy pale amber with an off-white head, leaving laces. Fresh, citrusy aroma hops. Medium body, lightly sweet caramel malt and a somewhat astringent grapefruitish bitterness. The finish is dry. 230307
Very sweet and sour aroma, dominated by citrus.  Taste very similar to grapefruit...sweet and bitter.  Not as smooth as I would prefer, but not bad.

22oz. $3.49 from Bashas.  Now this is an IPA!  The Aroma knocks you down as soon as you pop the top.  For the homebrewers here it like sticking your nose into a freshly opened bad of hops!  Pour was a light golden color and the head was intense....too intense.  Stong bitter hop flavor that did not dissapoint!

Pours a nice clear, deep gold with a frothy off-white head with good retention and heavy lacing. Smells of potent grapefruity and peachy hops with some malt in the background. Absolutely delicious. the 70+ IBUs are very apparrent in the taste. The hoppy bitterness sticks to the tongue. Great long, yet dry finish.
22oz Bottle. Pours a nice golden colour with a medium head. The aroma is hoppy with slight tint of citrus. Very nice hop flavor and long lasting.

This beer pours a cloudy light tan color, with a pure white head that leaves behind very good lacing.  The aroma promises hops in abundance, and the flavor deliveres.  Crisp strong hop flavor, and a beer I can drink all night long.

Poured from a 22 oz. bomber into a commodious Guinness Stout glass.  Pours a dark honey to light amber color with a creamy, off-white head and a fair amount of lacing.  I suppose I must be deranged - that or an ignorant Philistine but, for aroma, my notes say "smells like beer."  The first sip yields a moderate to agressive hop bite which I would describe as floral and lingering, as the hop bitterness hangs around for a while.  Its a medium-bodied beer, well on the dry side and with lively carbonation.  A fairly drinkable and complex brew, given that the last third of the bomber - once it has warmed a few degrees - reveals some residual sweetness.

Pros
- is 100% Rheinheitsgebot compliant - nothing but malted barley, yeast, hops and water in this beer 
- nice buzz value.  With its 6.9% ABV, one bomber produces a mild head buzz
- the brewer makes no apologies for, and even trumpets, the hop bitterness on the label.  This is hoppy beer.  Damn right, and was meant to be.

Cons
- I have no choice but to rate Stone IPA "move to the back of the line" on both repurchasability and refreshability (how easily it slides down the gullet when youre hot and thirsty).

As this review reflects my own personal taste, please dont cop any negative takeaways.  I have zero doubt that this is a superlative beer, one that is meant to be savored and not "slammed." And - as is obvious from the other reviews - its an exemplar of the style.  I can only assume that IPAs are not my strong suite, not my preferred style.

Very clear deep amber color, no head.  Can smell the alcohol and the hops. Very bitter. Can feel the weaknes compared to the Ruination. Very nice taste, slight alcohol warming at the end.  Can definetely see myself buying a sixer of this for a night.

This IPA is a hazy light amber with a fluffy and elastic white head that has great retention.  The aroma is hoppy!  It is tangerine peel with spruce.  It is almost creamy on the tounge.  The carbonation is appropriate and it leaves the mouth cleanly.  The flavor is dominated by tangerine peel.  Bold and bitter!  Yes!

Bottle.  [Blind tasting session @ Sk8viking]  #13 Average fizzy white head that was mostly diminishing. Good lacing. Clear sparkling body with an orange hue. Aroma was flowers, grass, grapefruit, citrus, caramel, licorice. Medium bodied with an average carbonation and a dry texture. Flavor was moderated bitter with licorice and caramel sweetness. Nice dry and slightly licorice sweet finish.

Pours an orange color with off-white creamy head.  Aroma if great with nice amounts of floral and citrus hops and last but not least some malt.  Taste is fantastic.  Wonderful balance of the hops creating a nice citrus flavor with a modest malt backbone but yet its so well balanced.  Moderately carbonated it finishes a little dry.  An excellent IPA.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2007 Orange peel hue, creamy white head, very fragrent...floral and and citrus tang, DRY texture, lively carbonation, like the Rumination without the steroids, bitter aftertaste that stays with you ffor a while.  Gotta love the Stone Brewery!
almost bronze in color with floral hops on the nose.all hops first piney then fruity nice long finish

Bottle: Hazy copper color with a white head. Aroma, citrus, pine, some herbal notes, oranges. Flavor, nice crisp citrus hops, some caramel and pale malts, grapefruit. A moderate carbonation, some nice bitterness, very drinkable IPA.
22 oz bottle.  Pours gold with a very slight white head.  Aroma is hops, grapefruit and pine.  Taste is  bitter with a creamy carbonated bitter pine grapefruit finish.  Very good.
Pours slightly hazy,, with rich golden color.  Impressive citrus flavors with a moderate, yet smooth, bitter finish.  This is a very dry beer without almost no sweet taste.  An excellent beer.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2008 Blind rating at sk8viking´s. Pours a clear golden with a white head. Has floral smells of hops. Dry, with fruity hops flavors. Creamy mouthfeel. Short, slightly dry finish.Rerated on tap at the brewery.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2008 22oz. bottle served 46F in snifter. Hazy tawny port in colour. Strong but very pleasant hop aroma with an abundance of fresh mown hay. Hop notes lingered for minutes.until my tongue begged for another fix... but, that eventually washed out to white noise. No malt flavor to mention.  I enjoy the aroma much more than the taste.  Thank you andyhite.
Cheers Brother!
22oz. Poured a hazey golden yellowish color. Aroma of citrus and hops. TAste is smooth full bodied and nice hop finish.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2007 This is the last IPA I will try ,I hate them,way ,way too much hops,why bother putting in malts? just brew the hops so some idiots can enjoy a super bitter brew to think theyre a  real men by drinking it.Just Stupid.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2007 Pours a slightly cloudy orangey golden. Aroma is the show stopper with a wonderful bouquet of citrus hops with grapefuit up front. Taste follows the aroma with more floral hops than anticipated. A little bit on the bitter side, but not in a bad way. Mouthfeel is smooth and clean. Highly drinkable. Nice IPA.

This was the first time I saw Stone products in 12oz. Bottles so, I picked up a 6 pack. It was a bit pricey at $9.00 but, Ive never been disappointed by a Stone beer so, I tried it.
It poured up a nice golden color with a ½ inch head and a very hoppy nose, it obviously received a heavy dose of dry hopping. The body was a bit thin but the flavor and bitterness were right on. I enjoyed it but wouldnt rank it in my top 10 IPAs.

Nice drink - not as great as I was led to believe but still a good IPA. Heavy hop body with a strong, but bland malt essence. Not bitter enough to be memorable and not malty enough to be smoothly appealing. The citrusy hops play the starring role, as they should, however the rest is a tad predictable and maybe too spicy for the lack of malt body. Better than average however I expected more from the makers of the Arrogant Bastard.

12oz bottle.  Pours a bright, light orange/golden color with a generous foamy white head.  Aroma is interesting and little different for an IPA.  Floral hops but theres also almost a slight fruitiness to it as well.  A little bit of pine too.  Taste is very bitter and slightly hoppy with a nice spicy kick to it.  Very interesting. Im impressed.

Coming from a fan of IPAs  this is a wonderful and easy beer to drink.  Kind of lacks that bitter hoppy bite that you would get from the Two Hearted Ale.  but in exchange for that, its smoothness going down is wondeful.  nice beer
This was a tremendous beer.  The beer poured deep gold color wth a firm head.  It has a hoppy note and a bit of a citrus zip keeping the bitternes clean!
Beautifully crafted beer. Full of citrus and pine aromas. Pours with a great golden color, this beer is one of my favorites.

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2008 Hazy orange with a tight white head. Very woody, piny aroma. Massive hoppy character, mostly resinous and woody, slightly floral, but not very fruity at all. Pale biscuity malt takes a backseat. Very bitter finish. I like my IPAs with a little more fruit and a little more sweet malt character. Still very good though.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: pours nice with a golden light amber color. has a good head with grate laceing for an ipa. Has a smell of citrus,pine and hops. Tastes of the aroma. Great ipa

wow. thats a hoppy beer. served cold, pours a nice golden color with a tinge of orange. a relatively thin white/off-white head.  huge hop aroma with some citrus flavor. taste is great and smooth, with that hop explosion unlike most IPAs ive had before. excellent overall.
One of my favorite beers.  It turned me onto all IPAs and gave me to insight to how great beer can be.

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2011 Bottle. Pours a hazy orange body with great white lacing that coats my glass. Aroma is bready, malty, citrus hop. Mouthfeel is medium and bready with notes of sweet malt, earth, bread, toast, and bitter citrus hop.
What a great beer. One of the best. It explodes out of the bottle and doesnt stop. Citrus, pine aroma and flavor. Try this one.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2008 I was very impressed with this beer.  First off, I like the way its brewed- with no additives etc etc. It really changed my whole outlook on IPAs.  I normally am into malty style ales but the hops came through very pleasantly in this.  Thats a lot to say for a beer that takes credit in its amount of hops usage.  Anyway, it poured a nice gold/orange color with a small head.  The aroma was of citrus and pine.  The palate was very crisp and drinkable, and the taste was nice and mellow, citrusy, with just the right amount of hop bitterness.  Overall, just a great, very enjoyable IPA.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2007 Nice pour from the bottle, a cloudy orange with a nice head. Aroma is hops, hops and more hops, and a little fruity. Flavor is all hops, hard to discern any other tasting notes because the hops are so strong.   A nice bitter finish and youll need to be careful cause the alcohol is very well hidden.  A nice IPA, I just dont think microbrewery plus pouring tons of hops into you beer = 99th percentile.

12 oz bottle 6.9% ABV.  Pours cloudy amber and flat, next to no head to speak of.  Aroma is hoppy and even though the ingredients are simple, a bit fruity.  This is an OK IPA with the typical hoppy bitterness but nothing that stands out.  Stone has many other versions of the IPA that are superior.

22oz. Bomber

I cracked open the bottle and immediately got hit with a whiff of hops. I have a feeling Ill like this one.

Stones IPA poured a chill hazed tarnished golden with very lively carbonation rising from all over the bottom of my pint glass. Sitting up top is a nice 1+ finger creamy white eggshell head. 

Smell is of hops. All hops. Big piney, oily hops. There is a citrus freshness that pokes its head out in the middle. There is a little earthiness at the end. As this beer warms, the malt that holds it all together comes through as a nice backbone aroma.

Taste is what I think an IPA should taste like. The malt in the smell is a nice sturdy backbone. The hops take center stage though. Hop oils abound followed by pine needles. There is that citrus again on the middle of my tongue. This all leads into a moderate bitterness that leaves me wanting more.

Mouthfeel is close to perfect. Medium bodied. Slick, oily mouthfeel. Goes down awfully smooth.

It would be very easy to drink these all night long. The bitterness leaves you wanting another drink right after the last. The abv is hidden very well. Dangerously drinkable.

Sampled 10/21/06
Bottle.  Very nice hop aroma.  Well balanced flavor of floral hops, malt and fruit.  Tasty beer.
Excellent IPA. Taste on pallet was smooth and delicious. Appearance is the only thing i dont know of cause i had to drink it out of the bottle. Very good though and very hoppy. Perfect.

bottle: pours a cloudy hay colour eith a large white foamy head. aroma of citrus hops and quite a bit of caramel malts. the flavour is dry and bitter to start a lighter hop taste than i excpected. finish real smooth with the sweet fruit taste. a very easy drinking ipa. i must say this beer is getting better the more i drink it. it seems to really smoot out as i t warms up.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2008 On tap at Stone. Golden orange with white fluffy head. Aroma of funky pungent floral and herbal hops with maybe a touch of english malt. Very floral flavor is accompanied by some grapefruit as well. A touch of caramel malt makes an appearance, but this is hop heavy in flavor and aroma. Finishes very dry and resiny. Very enjoyable.
Surprisingly light  citrus aroma. Golden color with light white head that laces. Starts with floral bitter, backed lightly by malt. Very firm mouthfeel. Creamy. Very nice bitter finish. Really nice.
I really liked this beer. Good IPA Great hoppy taste. Not as good as HopSlam but still a very good beer.

Pours abright golden with a tan head. The aroma really didmt hit me. The taste was hopped sweet and fruity. Finish is hoppy .....for a while. Not what I expected. Did not live up to its rating for me.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2007 This is a great IPA.  They sell Stone in all of the stores near my home, so I usually have a six of this in the fridge.  The pour is orange/hazy with a nice creamy head.  You can smell the hops on the pour.  The taste is sweet to start with a great hoppy finish.  I could taste the hops ten minutes after I finished it.  I look forward to tasting other Stone beers.  This one is great.

12oz pour. a bright golden sunshine color with nice rocky head that laced the whole way down the glass. great hops + malt balance with a nice hoppy/piney finish. Awesome IPA. Alcohol well hidden. I couldnt beleive it is 6.9%.

Poured from bottle. Nice Golden orange color, small head that left some great lacing...Partially cloudy in appearance. Aroma of sweet grapefruit and hops. Taste is sweet up front, citrus, grapefruit and pinapple, with a nice hoppy bitter finish. Excellent IPA!

Pours out with a wheaty head- not much lacing to speak of. Smell is very floral. Taste is grapefruit and pineapple. Medium carbonation with a refined moutfull- smooth malts and that great fruit hops. Aftertaste is all hops. 

All in all this is a class leading IPA. I could drink this the rest of my life and be a happy guy. Too bad the closest distriution is a several hundred miles away.

Thanks CarterHayes for the bottle!  Excellent IPA, probably among the best. Amber pour with a thick, white head. Bright, floral hoppy nose, and throughout, with some lemon and grapefruit.  Outstanding.

Pours a clear deep gold with a substantial long lasting head.  Pine and grapefruit nose.  Taste is a mingling of citrus, light bread crust malt, and piney hops.  FInishes with a pretty high bitterness and a grassy wood taste.  Pine still lingers in my nose after drinking.  Medium body, silky effortless mouthfeel.  I cant deny the quality of this beer, but I simply cant bond with it.  A definitive IPA, but I like mine with slightly more malt flavors.
UPDATED: JUN 26, 2008 pours a pale yellow, smell is wonderful. hoppy and grassy baby, lotta pine also.  taste is also very piney.  like drinking a liquified christmas tree.  pretty darn nice

12 oz bottle. Stone is one of my favorite companies and once again they got it right with this IPA. Pours a golden amber with an average white head that disappears leaving decent lacing. Aroma is of hops, hops and more hops. Finish is hop bitterness but not overpowering.

why is everybody ridin this beers jock? its too yellow looking first off secodnly the aroma is one dimensional just resiny hops. the taste is way too mellow. hoppy but weak and watery and just bitter. dont get me wrong i love hops and ipas and this beer is decently made but id rather drink about a hundred other ipas instead. and for real no way is this the 10 bucks a six pack it goes for everywhere. very middle of the road.

Oh yes, Im drinking one right now. To say that Stone IPA is "hoppy" would be putting it modestly. BIG hop flavor and BIG hop aroma with a ton of hop bitterness. Plus its 100% all natural brew. Cant beat that.

(bottle)poured into a pint.  darn good IPA.  pours a clear golden with full frothy head that sticks.  carbonation is present.  aroma is of fresh hops.  taste is mild hops with a sweet aftertaste.  has a loose front, middle, and a sweet finish.  very good.

Floral hoppy nose, same with taste...perfect balance... the malt is in perfect harmony with the hops...subtle grapefruit..refreshing..light amber color, pours a fluffy white head that doesnt last...one of the most perfect IPAs besides dogfish head 90 minute... lacing is sweet as well....:)

Bottle. Gold, thin shortlived white head and moderate condition. Excellent resinous piney hops, orange citrus and sweet malt in the nose, more citrus in the mouth with a resinous hop bitterness, a spicy pepper note and slight sweet perfumed maltiness. Lingering solid but restrained peppery hop bitterness in the finish.
12 oz. bottle from de reuze market in grand rapids. very impressive ipa. not as strong as the ruination, but way better taste than most microbrews.

Poured lighter than I would have expected.  Hazy macro color.  On the virge of a white.  Nice white head that died down but provided nice lacing.  Centennial hops in the aroma.  Sort of thin watery mouthfeel with plenty of hop flavor and bitterness.  I agree with other people that I probably like this more than Ruination.
UPDATED: APR 11, 2007 Bottled and tap @ the Brewery.  Smells hoppy and lemon grassy.  Apearance is of a rich apple cider or juice.  Tastes grassy, and of grapefruit.  Lasting hop flavor.

Poured from a bottle, working on a cold so might have to re-rate some day.  For a orangish amber color beer this one looks pretty darn good.  Now I am starting to understand why people like Stone so much.  Head was a creamy white that actually held its head well.  Again with the cold, I smelled a sweet fruity almost peppery aroma.  Flavor had a small bite to it that was enjoyable.  Overall a good one from Stone.

The 22 ounce bottle poured a slightly hazy orange-amber beverage with a full creamy off-white head that was fully lasting and left great lacing on the glass. The aroma presented a huge hop profile with orange peel, grapefruit, and a light herb character. The body was full with a soft carbonation and a smooth creamy texture. The flavor starts off lightly sweet and maintains that sweetness throughout the long finish. The flavors of orange and pineapple are subtle but detectable in the background.

Bottle 12 oz.  Pint Glass.  Rich Amber color.  Beautiful hop aroma of citrus/grapefruit and pine.  Strong and bitter hop taste is apparent but the slightly sweet malts balances it out perfectly.  Very well rounded for an american hoppy IPA.  I love this beer.

Stone brewery has impressed me yet again.       
It pours a dark amber color with a thin white head. This is a great value for such a good IPA.
A worthwhile ale.  Much better balanced than the ruination.  If memory serves me right, its rather bold, but not over the top.  Bitter, pleasant sipper.
Dark orange in color with small head. Great sweet aroma and fruity hop filled flavor. Lots of hops but not too bitter.

On tap - Gingerman, Collins, Copperfields, others. NYC

perfectly proportioned IPA. Im not sure, but I think I like this more than their imperial (ruiniation). Perfeclty balanced, nice coppe/orange/amber color, beutiful head. Nice citrus overtones followed by nice malt flavors to balance it out. 

Love it.

Pours a healthy and hazy golden amber with an inch or more of rocky white foam. Great head retention, wonderful stick-to-the-glass lacing throughout. Good citrus and floral hop aroma with notes of blue spruce. 

Quite hoppy up front with bitter dry citrus and fresh juicy citrus at the same time. A bready caramel malt is found well behind the hops, with just a touch of licorice in the finish. The malt is somewhat similar to Arrogant Bastard, though well subdued. A bitter grapefruit hop resin lingers well into the aftertaste.

Medium bodied, fully carbonated.

had this dozens of times but im not sure why i havent rated it yet!  12 oz bottle that oozes biting hops even before decanting anything.  an onslaught of american hops in the aroma - the dry hops are powerful and up-front.  pine, pine resin, grapefruit and lemony citrus, lightly peppery, and a faint presence of pale malt and grass.  a true showcase of hops and without going obscenely over-the-top with alcohol or bitterness, this IPA achieves what an IPA should taste like.  the finish could be fuller but no flaws aside from that. excellent!

Working my way through the Stone lineup. This is a very strong/good beer. The flavor is very noticeable and good. With something this strong it is really smooth and no after tastes. The smell was excellent. and look was great. I cant wait for the nest one on my list from Stone Brewing.
Hoppy beer with touch of maltiness.  Pours golden brown with medium head.  Overall good IPA, clean on the palate and crips aftertaste
I really enjoyed this beer. I thought the bitterness was perfect and it had a great aroma to it, however I agree with the previous rater that is did have a strange/off after taste.

THOUGHTS: Great aroma and mouthfeel but a little too much bitter, metallic aftertaste. A pretty good beer for its style, but not on of my favorite styles. If I want hoppy Ill take a double IPA. Not enough balance in flavor.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a light to medium, clear amber with a small, white head that mostly diminished and left virtually no lacing. The aroma was moderate molasses malt and heary grapefruit and orange hops. The initial flavor was lightly sweet, acidic and bitter. The finish flavor was moderately sweet and heavily bitter with a long duration. Both were dominated by citurs hops, but a little too much for my taste. The body was light to medium and dry in front and oily in back with fizzy carbonation and a metallic finish.

Another big thanks to BuckeyeBoy for this one. Pours a light golden with a niced sized head. Good carbonation and sticky lacing. Aroma is nice an hoppy with some mild citrus and pine mixed in. A very good flavor of piney bitter hops and light citrus and malts. Finish is quite dry and bitter. I wouldnt want it any other way.
IPA with a maltee maltee comparison to other nonmalt IPAs out there, defiante dimmension, not tooo bitter as well nioce good IPA creeemeee mouthfeel

UPDATED: SEP 25, 2007 The pour is a tanned shade of golden yellow with a good rocky head.  Butterscotch, lemon and pine aromas hint at the perfect balance this brew strikes: juicy peach, grapefruit and cool leafy bitterness give way to a smooth caramel sweet finish.  A flawlessly rounded rendition, to be sure.  If it had a bit more of a gritty bitter edge it would be unforgettable.    Updated.  On tap at the Dominion Brewhouse.  Aroma is fairly dull with mild flowers and sour citrus.  Tastes of white rice with honey and a touch of soy, some oyster crackers and salt.  Strange.  Overly smooth in the mouth and somewhat lifeless.  Its either the bottom of the barrel or a dirty line, but this one was done in.
Pours a light golden amber with a medium head. No lacing. Tastes of citrus. Goes down pretty smooth since it is so well balanced. Many can be enjoyed.

Bottle from Wilburs poured into tulip at 52 degrees - Pours orange amber with a 1/2 finger off-white head; nice floral, grassy, and pine hops with a little malt to the nose; Floral, grassy, very light citrus hops provide the bitterness while a touch of malt provides some sweetness on the initial taste; A mainly malty but lightly hoppsy and clean aftertaste; Full medium body; Light carbonation; Probably the hoppiest beer Ive had to date. I didnt know an IPA could have this much complexity! i have to get my hands on some more of this.
I enjoyed the citrus and pine. Finished with a long bitter ride over my palate. Drank straight from the bottle. Wish I had a glass, I just havent gotten geeky enough to ask.

Pours a nice orangish amber color.  The aroma isnt dominated by hops like the AB, but instead gives a nice malty presence.

The flavor is very well balanced, with a good floral hop profile that is balanced nicely by the fruity malt.  All in all a nice IPA, but I will stick to the AB from these guys.
user_location: Farewell Minny; Hello Puyallup, Washington, USA

text: Bottle. Pours a clear bright copper with a lacy white head. Aroma of pine and grass with a tiny trace of skunk - the hoppy variety, not the lightstruck variety. Light to medium with medium carbonation. Taste starts sweet with bread and  fruit followed by a mostly piney finish and a resinous aftertaste. A smooth and refreshing IPA.
I absolutely love this beer. I find it to be the best beer that can be bought in a six pack. It is incredibly refreshing and has plenty of hops.

Clear bright gold. Very fine white head settles to an incomplete cap leaving nice lacing.

Nice mix of bready and crackery malts provide a solid base for bright citric hops. Pretty classic AIPA here!

Bright and lively in the mouth. Medium body with excellent balance of malt and hops, both of which are distinctly American in character. Good length, ending with a snappy bitterness.

Carbonation is a little high, which dries the mouth, but thats a niggle really. Very drinkable, and my favorite of the "standard" Stone offerings by far.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2007 Bomber. Clear amber color with a large head. Spare lacing. Aroma of grapefruit, oily resin and sweet caramel malts. Very balanced. Tasted some tropical fruit, caramel malts and citrusy, grassy hops. Light to medium body. Big, bitter finish.

This golden ale poured with a modest off-white head that dissipated right away. The flavor is citrus and pine with a long bitter finish. Im not much of hop-head but, even though it is very heavily hopped, this brew is balanced enough to be quite enjoyable.
Poured amber with a slight haze. Small white head with lots of lacing. Huge hop aroma and flavor. A highly sessionable IPA. One of the west coast greats. REPRESENT!

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2007 Bomber.  Yellowish golden color, hazy, decent amount of carbonation, white head with thick lacing.  Aroma is of pine hops, weaker citrus hops.  Taste is mostly citrus/grapefruit with more pine.  Intriguing long bitter finish.

This beer always underwhelms at first -- its significantly lighter in color than most IPA/DIPAs I drink with a much weaker aroma and a lot less oomph in general.  But theres a subtlety and pure enjoyment here that is undeniable and keeps me coming back.  Racer 5 is still my go-to IPA but sometimes this just hits the spot like few other beers.

I was expecting a little more from one of my favorite brewers. This was a different IPA than I am used to. The pour was a medium dark amber with a thread o head. The aroma and taste were all pine. I have not experienced this much pine in any beer yet. It was different, but not what I was hopping for. The aftertaste was nice and bitter, but I was hoping for that in the beginning also. A slightly above average IPA.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Great hop aroma, clear dark color with medium head, big hopy flavor and great mouth feel that sits on the back of the tounge
UPDATED: JAN 11, 2007 goood.  hoppdddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddd

Another perfectly crafted brew from Stone.  IPA is not my favorite style, but I like this beer a lot.  It goes perfectly with Indian food.  The aroma is great, the hops are pronounced and well-balanced with the other complexities of the flavor.  A very drinkable, very good beer.
I just dont know what to say about this one. Grapefruit and pine. Ahh. Citrus is fresh off the tree. If you love hops the way I do you will simply love to drink this. I could have it every day.
Bomber.  Cloudy orange rust pour with thin white head.   Pine aroma with nice strong hops and faint orange-citrus.  Sweet citrus taste with fantastic bitter finish.  One of my favs of the style.

My brother picked a bottle of this up for me when he was in Indiana.  Shared with Duane.  Light honey colored pour with a small white head.  Piney aroma, not very strong though.  Flavor of tons of piney and citrusy hops but very well balanced.  Very tasty, easy drinking IPA
UPDATED: APR 18, 2007 Not very sweet on the nose.  Definitely a pine hoppiness.  Tastes dry, crisp citrus hop.  Very straightforward and well crafted.
I was expecting so much more.  Run of the mill IPA for me.  FFF pale ale had more hop character than this...

On Draft.  Wasnt a big fan of this.  My friend who was drinking it with me said he had had it before and it tasted much better previously.  Maybe I had a bad batch, will rerate later.  But the sample I had was very flavorless; some hop presence, but very watery.
UPDATED: MAY 1, 2007 Cloudy golden color with little head.  Aroma is sour and hoppy.  Flavor is pretty hoppy and bitter.  Great IPA.

Pours an opaque amber-orange with a rocky off-white head that fades to a cap.  Aroma is surprisingly balanced: grapefruit and pine resin are kept in check by a strong malt presence that lends sweetness.  Same cannot be said for the taste:  slight alcohol hit, but tons of grapefruit, pine, a bit soapy but not distractingly so.  Not surprising for Stone to turn out a hop bomb here.  Long and lasting bitter finish.  Not exactly balanced ...might even be more malt presence in the Arrogant Bastard.  Good none the less - aggressively hopped and bitter, even for an IPA.
This is by far the best IPA Ive tried.  The hop flavor is big and bold.  The scent alone keeps me sippin it!  Im not a huge IPA fan, but I will  buy this beer again.

Poured from a fuckin bottle into a goddam tulip glass. Pours a hazy gold with more than a cunt hair of head. Tons of fuckin pine and citrus in the nose. Actually, it smells faintly fuckin resinous, almost like good "kind bud". This IPA has a delicious blend of hops with some really fuckin good citrus undertones. Good mothefucking lacing too. Malts seem to have "got the fuck out of town" on this brew. Perfect carbonation makes this very refreshing, and the finish is fuckin long, smooth, and almost hot. Not a trace of an undesirable bitter aftertaste...But fuck all these descriptive adjectives...It is almost fuckin perfect. FUCK YEAH!
Out of 12 oz. bottle in pint glass. Nice deep yellow color. Nice hop flavor, very bitter. Semi-long finish.

I started drinking beer about 15 years ago, considered by many to be the most influential years in micro/craft brewing. Over the years I have enjoyed many a brew, but have discovered my true passion to be with IPAs. Among the myriad of india pale ales sampled along the way, Stone IPA is Numero Uno. Bar none. Go to your local grocer and invest in a sixer. Thanks for your time, and ERNEST ANASTASIO FOR PRESIDENT IN 2008!
On tap @ coles Buffalo NY. Along with Racer 5 my favorite IPA. Great color with thick beautiful head. Huge hop flavor & aroma with citrus presence. Great IPA

pours amber with an ungodly beautiful head thats thick and foamy, revealing a thin film of lace.  on the nose, i get hella hops and bitter orange and maybe some mango too; split the difference and call it tangerine.  the taste is smooth and complex; a lot of pine and spruce, followed by a grassy finish.  also, offensive bitter finish...i love it!  this beer covers the spectrum of the palate.  so much could be said about this beer, and im sure many have said it before me. this is a damn good beer!!!

Bottle. Pours a deep gold color with a smallish white head. Aroma of fresh hops. Taste is very hoppy with a strong pine presence. Very fresh taste. Slighter thick palate. The flavor of pine lingers for a long time. A pretty good beer and a great example of an IPA.

Bottle.   Pours a hazy amber-orange color with a large off white head.   Aroma is huge floral hops, grapefruit, orange, pine.   Flavor is much the same hops, grapefruit, hints of orange, pine, apple.   Palate is a crisp and medium bodied, lasting bitter finish.   Beautiful is an understatement.

Bomber courtesy of secret santa! Pours a cloudy orange, with a finger of off white head. grapefruits, orange, piney, hoppy smell, could sit and smell this one without even drinkin it, but thatd be stupid. Tastes very similar to the smell, strong orange after taste, and the almost 7% ABV is just not there. Very well balanced and Delish, yet another winner from stone.
great hops, fruity, smooth, sumptuous aroma. as near perfect a representation as i can conceive of what is becoming one of my favorite styles (IPA)

Amazing IPA!  Perfect amount of Hops (a lot), and a great combination of citrus/floral/etc.  Perfect amount of bitterness.  By far, this IPA along with their Ruination IPA are my favorites.  Buy one and enjoy, you will not be disappointed.

pours clear and light amber.  Average rocky white head.  Aroma; nothing other than cascade hops.  Grapefruit and pine.  I smell no malt or yeast.  Flavor is lightly sweet and heavily bitter again the grapefruit dominates.  Finish is long, infact I can still feel/taset it hours later.  Light to medium bodied creamy and softly carbonated.  Every time I drink a stone beer I wake up with a massive headache.  Dont knowif thats normal of not.  If you like sour grapefruit then you love this stuff.

Clear bright amber, with a small offwhite head that dissipates before long.

Big blast of hop aroma - green herbs with sweet spice.  A little fruit is there in the background too.

On the palate, the hops hit right away, with pine, herbs, and grass.  Carbonation is a little coarse, but mouthfeel is rich.  Malt contributes body but not overt sweetness...I like that quality a lot.

Delivers most of the character of the Ruination IPA for a lower price point.  In fact, I prefer the balance of this brew to the Ruination.  A must for fans of grassy hops.

Bottle - November 2006. Pour a deep,clear, golden color wit a rather small creamy white head. Aroma is of grapefruit, citric, resinous, pungen, hoppy and very nice. Taste is piney, grapefruit, tangerines, herbal hoppy but with some malt balancing. Mouthfeel is medium, creamy. Nice aftertaste.

Bottle. Golden pour with nice creamy head that lasts and provides good lacing. Strong citrusy hop aroma. Flavor is very similar to Arrogant Bastard, complex hop profile. Smooth, good aftertaste. Perhaps my favorite IPA.

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2007 Golden straw color with nice white head.  The aroma is of light malts and big grapefruit citrus, little grassy hops.  Light mouth feel.  Not too much malt character but it is made up for by the complex hop finish.

A good but not outstanding IPA.  The aroma is good: hoppy, but not strongly so.  The hops dominate the flavor, leading to a crisp finish.  The greatest weakness is that it seems rather thin up front; malt richness not present.  A little more malt would greatly improve this beer.
12oz Bottle. Pours out an orange amber topped with a cream head. What a great Hop aroma. Very hoppy I love it. Very well made.

Great IPA...of course, to be expected with Stone.  Quite similar to their pale ale (also an excellent beer), especially with the grapefruit background flavor.  Perfect amount of bitterness, perfect amount of sweetness.  Cant go wrong with this beer.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2006 Great off-white frothy head lasting a good part of the beer. Clear sparkling body but did notice tiny body particles and a thin density. Brilliant amber IPA coloring convinced me to drink.

Heavy hops aroma, slight lemon but more grapefruit/orange; quite like a fruit punch. Light yeast aroma that I thought was a bit meaty, more so as I finishes the glass. Initially lightly sweet and acidic, this IPA finishes with the acidity elevating to a moderate bite and lasts quite short.  Fairly full bodied as it is an IPA and a bit dry but has a lively carbonation.  This a very good IPA even though it left a slight metallic feel in the mouth.

god this is good : Great smell when you open up the bottle, marmalade orabge colour, small but stable head, lacing = very good , delicous delicous delicous, oh man is it delicous, im in hop heaven! sampled with barry and he liked it, at least thats what he told me, he didnt like red truck...hmmm

Clear tangerine, ebullient  bubbles terminateing in a lumpy whipped cream head. Magnificent lace. Aroma disappoints with its mild ambiguity butterscotch, parmesan, bubblegum, pinesol; an inauspicious beginning. I think Stone forgot to dryhop this one. Crackery malt evokes sensations of orange blossom honey and breadcrust, while resiny hops brand a double-edged blade of hot/cold spice: cinnamon and peppermint. Fleeting off-dry finish dosed with lemon pepper. Substantial palate, sensual and lubricatory. Citric, floral, and burnt sugar/cigar ash hop aftertaste. Bitter but not cloying. Decent IPA, though far less flavorful than expected.

Pours an orange amber with nice lively appearance, good lacing and head.  Cheesy, smoky, citrusy fresh hop aroma. Full bodied, smooth and long finish. Flower and perfume. Well balanced and not overpowering. Doesnt show its strength. I like.

UPDATED: DEC 6, 2006 12 oz bottle shared with StompBrockmore - Pours a light honey colour.  Decent head, but that went fairly fast.  Aroma - WOW.  Huge citusy-sweet hops that got me all excited-like.  So, I was ready.....and then.......nothing.  Well, something, but not much.  There is a strange sweetness to the beer, and after that huge hop aroma, the flavour is kind of tame.  Drinkable, sure - but given the amount of seriously great American IPAs around, I probably would be in no hurry to grab this one again.  Being Stone, the stakes were high, but I was slightly let down by this one - probably a result of a few things - super high expectations, the grandiose claims on the back of the bottle, and having this back to back with the Smuttynose IPA, which made this one seem a little......washed out.

12oz bottle, shared with VeloVampire - I had high expectations for this beer, following its fantastic reputation. Given that this is a good beer, I cant help but feel it is overrated. It pours a nice golden yellow with a bit of amber that is typical for the style. The head was white and fleeting. Aroma is a big hoppy blast, and quite sweet in the nose. Nothing terribly surprising or complicated happening, but definitely an inviting citrusy aroma. The flavour expands upon the scent, amplifying what youd expect and making it bigger in the mouth. Very sweetly hoppy and citrusy off the top, with some orange flavours playing, followed by a solidly crisp and bitter finish. It didnt take my socks off and slap me around with them, but this is still a solid IPA. Ive had better though, and I think this one might glide by on its "bad boy" reputation a bit more than it deserves. Had back to back with the Smuttynose IPA which I thought was much more complex and superior.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2010 12oz - Fleeting head over light tan liquid.  Apples, honey and hops on the nose.  Roasted barley and citrusy hops.  Really one dimensional and average.

Four years later - This is thoroughly refreshing, sight, smell and taste.

got this bad boy from Ross. poured a nice amber with a off white head that left some good lacing. aroma big hops, orange and lemon, grassy,  a sweetness that I cannot tell if it is honey or brown sugar maybe it is both. flavor dry hops, grapefruit with no sugar on  it, pine, perfume and a slight ash tray taste but not in a bad way as it warms do get some sweetness. this is a good IPA
This beer has a great hop aroma.Pours light in color with a big head.Has a good amount of hops with a lot of malt.Has a medium mouthfeel with a great hop finish.One of my favorite beers.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2007 Bottle.  Typical IPA color with a nice, foamy head and good lacing.  Very flowery aroma for an IPA.  Flavor is fruity and bitter and perfectly balanced.  This IPA is well deserving of its lofty status.  Maybe my favorite beer.

Re-rate - This is my favorite beer on the face of this earth, so I have to give it a 5.
Bottle. The smell is amazing, very floral. Head is fizzy white but quickly diminishes. A strong beer, medium body. The taste is floral, piney. Definately a solid choice.

Bottle. A small head when poured into a pint glass.  Excellent aroma.  A bit of bite to it when first sipped...possibly due to the carbonation.  High citrus and a bit of pine taste.  Very drinkable IPA.  Overall and excellent IPA, although not as complex in flavor as Dogfish Head.

On tap: Appeared classic cloudy amber with nice lacing and head. Expected hoppy notes, very crisp aroma. Starts off with the fruity punch, followed by the hopping senstion. Dry hopped for sure, this is one of the most crisp ipas ive had. Perfectly bitter. Dangerous., but good

Bottle to shaker (pounder). Pours out a pale gold colour with a light creamy white head with nice lacing. Scent is light earth and sweet floral hops.  The hop is abruptly agressive and then quickly subsides to mild sweet hops. Taste is as above- abruptly aggressive hop elements with a grain element additionally intermixed. Mouthfeel is smooth and the finish is amazingly smooth if not a bit quick. A good brew overall but it unfortunately seems a bit short lived and relative to other stone brews slightly lacking in aggression.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2012 This beer smells amazing! My wife said it reminds her of pomegranite. It definetly has the classic IPA citrus/hoppy smell with a beautiful gold-orange hue in the glass. Taste is slightly sweet, lots of hops with a good amount of biterness that lingers for 4 or 5 seconds after taking your first sip. The alcohol content in this one is not obvious at all. One of my favorite beers from Stone.

Citrusy,fragrant hop aroma, big tangy blast of hop taste with just the right amount of malt backing,its your IPA if your looking for all kinds of correct balance and just the right edge of hops, me ,I prefer a slightly stronger hop kick(Tyranena Hop Whore)
Light amber color, Just the right amount of bitterness to the taste.It has the aroma and taste  of hops . The  taste of an almost perfect IPA. It was soooo good.

Gold color with a weak white head and a bit of lacing.  Heavy hop aroma and heavy hop flavors.  The IPA lovers will enjoy, but Im not a fan.  Still, if you like the heavy hops, youll like this  And the gargoyl is cool too!

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2007 Where exactly does the Stone India Pale Ale fit in?  I see Ruination, Anniversary IPAs, Vertical Epic and all manner of colored fonts and leisurely demons.  Its all a bit confusing, and somewhere in the mire of Stones ubiquitous beers I suddenly stumble across the small bottled India Pale Ale.  Where did it come from?  What does it taste like?  Employing my trained tongue I gave it a sampling, totally unaware of what to expect.  What I found was yet another ho-hum Pale Ale like so many others, characteristic of the style and well brewed but unexciting after having the same taste over and over again.  Even the sinister balrogs on Stones bottles have become mundane, resulting in an unjustified apathy and blasé attitude.  But label art is hardly germane to the actual beer.  Stones unadorned IPA is thick and peach-orange colored with a very thin white cap that reduces down to a doily like web of spacious but connected foam threads.  One need only approach the IPA to get an impression of the aroma: hops dominates with an orange and tangerine cofactor.  I was a bit surprised to find less grain/hops/oats/biscuits smell in here than in similar tasting beers.  Its a disturbingly smooth and flat beer reminiscent of milk, painting the tongue with a very dry yeastiness and manifesting a slight hop burn in the back of the throat.  Oddly this hoppiness grows for several seconds after the sip until its detrimental to the taste, and then passes.  As a staple IPA it tastes good enough to justify purchasing a pack for friends at a party, but its a bit too flat and a bit too dry even for my own liberal arts college tolerance to accept.  Yet another washout for the whole style and another lukewarm brew from Stone.

Beautiful golden ale with a big, rocky white head and light aroma of perfumy, orange hops. Sparkling dry flavor, strong carbonation and loaded with hops. Finish was short and somewhat tart. The 6.9% ABV is masked quite nicely. An excellent IPA, I like it even more than the Arrogant Bastard.

Bouteille 1Pt. et 6 oz. par HoggTownHarry, partagé avec LadySusan. Jaune/orange pale et pas trop claire, mince collet avec un peu de dentaile. Bon arome dhoublon mi-amère, un peu florale. Bon goût dhoublon assé amère et très plaisant, elle est forte en alcool pour son style mais tu ny goûte pas.

Seriously This stuff is wicked good!  The aroma alone is absolutely gorgeous.  A wonderfully sweet fruity hoppiness, roasted nuts, and caramel is indescribable.  Appearence is an orangish/ amber color with a small white head.  Flavor is big on the hops, pine, and a subtle carmelized malt note.  Palate is bitter/sweet and last quite a while. Overall, This is one damn good beer.

22oz bomber. Clear golden to orange color with white head. Aroma is mostly pine hops and a hint of sweet malts. Nice hop heavy pine flavor with a slight under current of malty sweetness. Good lacing to the finish where a lingering pine hoppiness awaits the imbiber.

Bottled, sampled with Stegosaurus. As soon as you crack this gem open an aroma of strong hops and pine fill the air. Golden pour with thick head and strong lacing. Flavor was citrus and floral hop. (LOTS OF HOP) This was blended good and quite enjoyable.

Bottle sampled with The Mad Indian at his house. Pours golden\copper with a decent size off-white head. Aroma of pine and citrusy hops. The flavor is slightly sweet, citrus, and moderate bitterness. The alcohol is masked very well, good balanced brew. Good body, great brew.

This is simply a great IPA.  Wonderful hoppy nose.  Pours a fantastic golden color.  Flavor is rich with hop complexity, but is not overly bitter.  Now that I can get these in sixers, I can die a happy man.  Cheers!

Color of clear golden honey  head medium off white  nose of pine and bitter hopps , smoky / toasty ,  mint , and cloves  taste is gummy hopps , tar , and toasty malts  light bright semi carbonated body  aftertaste chewy long lasting hops and smoky malts
Nice golden-orange with a good sized head. Very hoppy aroma.Tastes of citrus, pine, and a little sweetness. One of the best IPAs ever.

Sparkling golden with a brilliant white, creamy head, good size, longevity and lacing.  If you like hops you will love the nose, fresh pine and resin with subtle citrus.  Flavor is much the same, fresh pine and grassiness from the hops with still the subtle grapefruit citrus hops.  A SUBTLE toasty, caramel sweetness but nicely done so.  Bitterness is medium-high but never harsh and complements the hop flavors brilliantly.  Palate is medium in body with a soft to lively carbonation and a creamy yet refreshing feel.  Finish is long, refreshing, and bitter, but still sweet with grapefruit.  Truly a remarkable IPA, and this coming from a non-hophead.  Flavors meld so well together and remain so ultimately fresh.  Stone delivers once again.

My uncle purchased this and he knows nothing about beer. What luck! This beer is hoppy, but smooth. Beautiful color. It is just asking you to drink it. Kind of bitter, but not too bitter. I finished the first beer then looked at the bottle... 6.9 percent alcohol. You could not even taste it. It was just that subtle. Had three more and the beer just got more enjoyable with each consecutive bottle. As far as IPAs go, they do not get much better.

Had a nice light orange color and great aroma of citrus and pine.  Can definitely sense the hops in this one.  My only issue with it was that the finish was a bit too long and bitter for me.  Certainly a good brew though.

excellent ipa...light orange, almost amber body...nice, welcoming floral hop aroma that is light in pine, and finishes light in sugary malts...flavor of a light ipa, strongest in piney hops and a touch of sugar...nice palate leads to a crisp, refreshing finish...

Stone India Pale Ale
22 oz bomber
Recent brewing, chiseled into 10/06
Medium pour in a tulip glass.


Poured clear amber with a huge frothy white mostly lasting head with excellent lacing.

Smelt of moderate bready cereal malt,  grassiness, lemon rinds and grapefruit.  Overall soft and inviting.

Flavor was upfront moderate to heavy  grapefruit bitterness with light lemony sweetness followed by a slightly harsh pine bitterness and soft clean earthy feel on a long lingering grapefruit finish.  Mouthfeel was light to medium, creamy, softly carbonated, with some moderate astringency and slight alcoholic warmth.

Overall, this is an excellent IPA with envigorating hops taste, but it feels like it could have delivered just a bit more on the malt sweetness on the finish to balance out the equation towards perfection.
I cant believe I havent rated this, but this is the gold standard for me in what an IPA should be. Light gold, with a decent white head. Huge hop aroma, and the bitterness is just perfect.

raisiny and citrusy in scent 
aminimal head, white foam, and golden in appearance. I think I can taste a hint of grapefruit also

Clear copper beer with a medium white head . Aroma is sweet and citrusy, but ithe flavor does not follow, only offering hops and water. Certainly better than your average IPA, but easily bested by any of Stones other IPA offerings. $2/12oz

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2006 Excellent IPA with a medium gold color. Less hops and body than Arrogant Bastard---which is to be expected. Also a bit sweeter. Ill buy again but prefer Bells Two Hearted and Founders Centennial IPAs.

Deep orange-gold color, nice medium off-white head.  Intense aroma of flowery hops with some fruit.  The flavor is  well-balanced, both sweet and hoppy.  Pleasantly bitter finish.  This is a great IPA.
UPDATED: JAN 20, 2009 Bottle.  Huge hop smell and taste.  Sweet, lots of grapefruit, just a great beer.  I would use this as an example of great American beer.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2007 What can I say but yum.  This has to be one of my favorites, a wonderfully fruity sweet hop aroma accompanies the flavor wonderfully.  If you love hops, this brews for you, flavor is full and fruity, with good carbonation for the beer.  Pours a thick white head with a clear golden body.  A great brew.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2009 Nice bitter IPA, has an airy mouthfeel that doesnt seem as crisp as it should be.  one dimensional, not very clean. very orangey throughout.  The aroma is the best thng about it, huge outstanding hoppy nose. the rest is good but its not as good as torpedo or union jack. definitely good but overhyped.
Like everything else from Stone, this is a great beer. Nice and Hoppy but not overbearing.
lovely american version oof the pale ale. not over hoped nice flavours of citrus but not too over the top, extremly refreshing.

(Bottle) Pours a dark amber with a lasting white head. Not very carbonated. Long bitter aftertaste, but well balanced and creamy mouthfeel. Actually doesnt seem as bitter as advertised. All in all, a very good beer.
Outstanding IPA.  Pours a orange(ish) coppery gold color.  Not much of a noticable nose.  Floral citrus flavor goes a long way.  Somwhat sweet, but tart hoppy finish is memorable.  A Home Run.
Golden copper with sparse carbonation and a huge long lasting rocky head. Bready citrusy aromas. Touch of malt up front and hops mid and late for a sustained hop finish.

[Sampled at SBF -06]
Hazy golden. Small bubbly head.
Big, powerfull, fruity hoppiness.
Dry and big hoppy bitterness.
Sweet and citric.
Pours a clean golden amber with an off-white head that lasted thoughout the pint.  The aroma and flavor was a sweet floral balance.  One of my favorite IPAs.
good ipa, nothing special.  good flavor and clean bitter aftertaste.  kind of a boring beer by stones standards.
user_location: The Land of Milk and Honey, Ohio, USA

text: Stone IPA is like a good friend, who is always there for me.  Its available at every damn store in this city, relatively inexpensive and very good.  Its a shame I havent rated this until now.   One of my top 5 IPAs.

22oz bomber, no date.  Pours a clear orange amber with a two finger light yellowish head.  Pretty lacing.  Aroma has lots of grapefruit and pine, with some slight floral hops.  Sweet caramel malts in there as well.  Nice and bitter up front, but the malts come back nice and sweet, though there is a lingering bitterness.  Flavors lean more towards pine and floral, though the caramel malts do make an appearance.  Just before the finish there is a slight chalkiness.  Medium bodied, moderate to light carbonation, very smooth.  Very good.  The first IPA (or APA, for that matter) in a while that has made me happy.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: oh my god this good beer probley the best ipa I have ever had the pleasure of drinking pours a deep gold with a off white head rich hop aroma taste is hoppy but just right lingers for a while ohh and did I mention it complents food very well
Pretty damn good.  Nice piney hops, but not too over the top.  Stone makes some great beers and this is one of em.  Its neck and neck between this and Bells 2 Hearted for my fav IPA.

Bottle.  Shiny copper coloring.  Thick foamy pour.  Lacy head evaporates slowly, coating glass.  Hoppy in aroma but surprisingly subtle, more balanced in taste.  Incredibly smooth finish.  "Its like theres a party in my mouth and everyones invited"
Hop explosion!! Citrus aroma as well as flavor. mildly sweet with grapefruit hop finish.

I wanted a classic when I was down in Ohio and finding this puppy did not disappoint!  Pours a golden dark yellow with a sweet mild hop that comes through right upon opening.  A lingering wisp of sweetness trails with you throughout the brew.  This one goes down SO eay, its bound to get you into a lot of trouble if not checked.  In a way it sort of reminds me of the effects of an Orval.  This is a top beer!

awsome well balanced ipa. definitely one of the best out there.  aroma sweet hoppiness. flavor the same with the right type bitterness in the finish.  all flavors come together very well in this beer.

bottle . . pours nice dark yellow with creamy white head . . aroma is obviously mainly hops, floral . . sweet . . tastes sweet hops, well balanced . . VERY smooth and not bitter even with finish . . VERY nice . . this one lives up to its name . .

Deep gold, with a massive head that fades to a lose foamy mass, that laces down the glass before the first sip.  Sharp strong aroma of hops.  Medium body with a refreshing hop bitterness that doesnt sour the taste.  The finish is a bit tart.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Athens, Ohio, USA

text: awesome base ipa.  very hoppy aroma and flavor.  nice malt backbone.  not overly bitter.  i could drink this all summer long and be a very happy person.
A fine IPA with few equals.  If you want a satisfing west coast IPA then here you go.  When you have graduated from this one then youll be ready for the Ruination.  Enough said
Bottle:  Orange amber color with a small white head.  Aroma is sweet with malt and citrus, hops aplenty.  Taste is a solid hops feel with citrus and floral tones.  Simple and delicate, yet potent.

12oz bottle poured a clear gold color with a nice white head. Had aromas of pine and some yeast character. Taste had a smooth bitterness with a dry finish that lingered. Overall a basic IPA that didnt have much of a malt presents.

This pours nice and golden, white head with some lacing on the glass. Certainly looks like the perfect refreshing summer brew. Floral and piney hop aroma that comes through to give it most of its flavor. Crisp, and not overly bitter, very good.

Sorry peeps, I think this IPA is over rated.  It pours a dark straw color with large fizz and a big head that dissipates quickly with minimal lacing.  The aroma is mild, considering 70+ IBUs, with carmel notes and floral hops.  The bitterness hits quickly but leaves quicker than I had hoped.  Dont get me wrong, this is a damn good IPA, I just do not think it is worthy of a 99.

Another great product from Stone brewing,  these guys know what they are doing.  I have had this one so many times that I stopped counting but it is up there with Three Floyds Alpha King.  I love this stuff!  The aroma is very floral and pungent, and the taste is a great bitterness that is far from overwhelming mixed in with awesome floral and piney tastes from the hops.  A great IPA and a standard in my everyday beer rotation.
Bottle. Lovely, aromatic stuff; just a bit of carbonation bite, very floral.

22oz bottle.Pours a clear dark amber with a nice head.The hops just jump outand you know its gonna be good.A nice balanced flavor of grapefruit and no bitterness.This goes down so easy especially when the weather is hot.

Im not a big IPA fan, but this is a very pleasant beer.

not as strong as other IPAs, a mellow flavor actually

Very warm and lemony
bottle: amazing...strong hop aroma with scents of pine and citrus. the flavor is near perfect. It has strong hop flavors but not very bitter...very smooth finish...a truely balanced ipa.

Pours golden orange witha medium white head that cascades well and doesnt disapate much.  Aroma is dominated by hops, mostly citrus, some pine, bit of caramel in the nose.  Flavor starts off with a nice maltiness and moves to a ncie citric ending.  Finish is shorter than I thought it would be, bitter, but not overly so.
If not Victorys Hopdevil, Stone IPA is what an IPA should be. Stone brewery has not dissapointed me yet.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2009 This is simply awesome. I have been an IPA head for a few years, largely thanks to Stone. For a straight up IPA, this is one of the best. I can drink this all day. Its crisp and well balanced, great hop start and finish.  If I become an alcoholic, it will be from Stone beers, i love them and can always rely on them being scrumtrulescent! 

rerate: from a 4.2 to a 3.8. This beer seems to be getting less balanced for me. I just did a blind tasting with 3 other great IPAs and this beer was least impressive. The bottle "drink by date" (which is a bad dating scheme) said 1/11/10 which is months out, so this should be good.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2008 Bottle thanks to Ross.  Pours orange-gold with a 1 finger frothy white head.  Nice grapefruit and slight sweetness in the aroma.  Excellent flavor of grapefruity, piny hops with just enough malt to balance but still let the hops shine.  Nice smooth medium body.  This is an excellent example of what and IPA should be.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2007 Nice golden pour with great hoppy smell.  Hits the palate with a nice, smooth hop flavor and malt undertones that balance well and finishes nicely.  Seems to go great with just about any food around.  Classic West Coast IPA flavor - one of the better ones around.
Bottle.  One of my favorite IPAs.  Hoppy and malty flavors are perfect.  Grapefruit flavor is strong, and it has a great crisp finish.

My favorite IPA.. perfectly balanced hops to malt ratio. A good helping of alcohol but not enogh to ruin the taste. The hop flavor is delicious a nice meld of fruits, flowers, pines and grapefruit. Finish is refreshingly bitter and crisp.

An attractive looking hazey orange beer with quickly dissipating white froth.  Brilliant nose of brewery air, fresh picked hops, pine, grapefruit, and apricot.  Balanced yet bitterly hoppy with enough malt sweetness to successfully bring out the complex flavors of the hops.  Finish is crisp and superbly fresh tasting. Certainly an I.P.A. to look up to.

Bomber.  Aroma is dominated by pine with some citrus notes.  Its similar to the pale ale, but stronger and sharper.  Color is a clear blonde with a thin white head.  Flavor is piney, sharply bitter, lasing into the finish--very one dimensional.  Some warming.  Overall, pretty disappointing beer.  One dimensional, very light, bitter, lacking malt to balance and not nearly as much hop flavor as Id like.  This finished near the bottom of the pack in a blind tasting of 8 IPAs.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2006 Huge hop aroma.  Floral and citrus all over the place.  Flavor is pretty much the same.  Just hops and hops and hops.  Of course, plenty of hop bitterness.  The only thing lacking is the malt.  No "malt backbone" to provide a foundation for the hops to rest on.  This lets them really run wild, but makes the beer a bit too much to handle. Its almost like eating a whole lot of BBQ sauce on too few ribs.  Its tasty, but needs more.  I know Stone prides themselves on going overboard, and they managed to do exactly that right here. Pretty good, but not great.

Most disappointed with the aroma...Could be more citrusy/fruity/flowery...Great clear orange/amber color...Initial Taste was not bad for sure, nice hop bite, but the aftertaste was quite booozy, alcahol like. Not bad, but not as good an ipa as one may expect from previous raters.

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy orange/gold color with a white head.  Great IPA aroma that youd expect, hoppy, grassy, grapefruit, pine resin, floral notes, etc.  Very pleasant aroma for sure (golden raisins in there).  Massively fresh flavor with nice hoppiness and a subtle bitter finish.  Chewy malts and nice citrus up front with a nice grassiness in that finish, which is rather dry.  Mouthfeel is crisp and fresh with nice carbonation, very nice.

He shoots, he scores!  This is a wondeful IPA... Pours an orange-caramel into the glass, with a sticky, frothy head, medium retention and wonderful webbed lace.  The nose has all youd expect: grapefruit, citrus, pine, floral accents.  These transfer directly into the flavor dept.  There is a faint caramel malty sweetness which underlies a huge hop contingency.  Grapefruit, citrus, and candy orange slices are noted in the mid-palate, whereas the side- and back-palate are peppered perfectly with a mildly-lingering pine resin dry-hop.  All of the wonderful complexities of this brew come together almost flawlessly.  It has a very nice, refreshingly creamy (and cleansing) finish that works wonders for the overall effect!  Truly, one of the best IPAs one can have.

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2006 (Bottle, thanks to Thaichile) Pours clear amber. Light head. Aroma of sweet fruits. Citrus and piney hops. Nuts, resin. Sultry smell. The flavour has a peppery feeling. Resin with some stickyness and alot of bittering hops. Fruity and oily. Leaves a numness in the mouth. Rather big afterbitterness. First sweet, then dry. Thich, malty body. Lovely.

22 oz. bottle. Pours a bright gold with a white foamy head. Big citrus aroma. Flavor is decidely hops, but not overwheling like the Ruination IPA. There is some malt also present in the flavor. This is a very good IPA.

Draft at Pipers Creek. Pours medium gold with a bit of white foam atop, maybe some suds. Incredibly fruity citric hops on the nose, the attack, the mid palate, the finish...how else can you describe it? Fruity and floral and botanically correct, just a very luscious taste explosion but very balanced. Nice malt backbone but only just enough. The malt is essentially a dance floor for the John Travolta that is the hop bill in this beer. Outstanding!

Bottle. Poured a light golden color with a white head. Looks marvelous! Aroma is hops! Smelling citrus, reisen, and pine. Flavor is rich and full of hops. Very smooth flavor, the hops are not overbearing at all. In fact the beer finishes with a little bit of a sweetness. Very smooth IPA. If I havent had the Diamond Knot IPA this would be the top IPA for my taste but it is a very close second!

Orange in color, slightly cloudy.  Head disappeared pretty quickly.  A generous hoppy and slightly floral aroma.  Lots of hop flavor, but not over powering - actually very smooth and almost restrained from beginning to end.  Very slight sweetness, almost orange-like citis flavor throughout as well.  12 oz bottle, $1.69.

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2007 22 oz bomber from local grocery.Massive head, dissipates after 10 minutes leaving a lof of lace. Cloudy blonde amber color.  Nice mellow flavor, a bit boring. No bitter aftertaste and lacking in hops. Medium bodied and VERY smooth.

2006 bottle.  Pours a bronze amber with a froathy white head.  Aroma is "to the max", with citrus fruits, flora notes, hops, and pine.  Flavor is a bit mellow, with a nice smooth mouthfeel, with some hops coming through, as well as the citruis.  Definitely doesnt hit you with bitterness like the Ruination.  Incredibly drinkable.
Easy to drink, widely distributed.  Give one to a friend who drinks the yellow fizzy stuff and watch his eyes light up.  Highly recommended.

Poured a cloudy copper/straw color.  Medium white frothy head dispersed quickly, leaving a persistent lacing.  Aroma is pure malt, mingled with hoppy goodness.  Im an IPA fanatic and after a recent string of Belgium samplings, this was a nice homecoming.  Stone IPA has a big pine/hop taste that balances well with a sweet malt and citrusy fruit flavor.  This leaves only a slight bitter aftertaste when compared to the Arrogant Bastard and the Ruination IPA.  This isnt the "death by hops" experience many IPA fanatics drool over but it is an excellent IPA to be enjoyed by both fanatics and neophytes to the style.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2010 Ok the double dry hopped version needs a separate rating, cause it is not the same beer.  Enjoyed during Chicagos Stone Week.
Pours orange white creamy head. Awesome nose of fresh hops   Bitter pine citrus juicy n drinkable   Really solid. 9/4/9/4/16 4.2


22oz  pours orange with a small fading head.  aroma of floral and malt actually pretty weak for an ipa and especially a stone.  a nice medium mouthfeel with a good amount of carbonation, flavor of malt and a light citrus hoppiness  -slightly bitter  at first disappearing rather quickly.    theres no date but i think stone must have bottled this a few months ago and most of the hops deteriorated.  ill have to rerate when i try a fresh one.

Big Bottle.  Very legitimate IPA.  Great fruity aroma.  Great sweet fruit taste with a terrific transition into a very smooth hoppy ending.  Very nice feel in the mouth - medium body and smooth.  Eas to drink.  #3 on my IPA list thus far.

Everything great in an IPA, this one has. My one complaint would be that the hop profile isnt as complex as some other (newer) IPAs, in that it is really all about the grapefruit with this one, whereas some styles present sweeter fruits (mango, peach) as well. Extra point overall for reasonable ABV for a session beer, minus point overall for relative expense.
UPDATED: APR 14, 2007 light copper/dark yellowish color with a nice white head.  Aroma of citris and hops but not over the top.  A nice solid IPA.
A treat, from the smell to the look to the taste. As hoppy as youd expect but not painful; starts out with citrus flavors and ends with a more earthy, grainy vibe. Well balanced and delicious.

12 oz bottle, via IrishBoy.  Pours a clear gold colored body under a one finger off-white head of decent duration.  No sediment in bottle.  Aroma is very citrusy with some lighter caramel and toasted malt below.  Lighter notes of toffee, iced tea, and lemon grass.  Flavor is pretty hoppy, but not necessatily overly bitter, just a nice cleansing crispness.  The malt is pretty tamed down, but it is noticable.  Mouthfeel is on the thinner side with fizzy active carbonation that foams in the mouth.  Pretty middle of the road this one.  Enjoyable, but nothing that blows you away.

Im a huge fan of Stone, and their Ruination IPA is probably my favorite beer, period. But I felt this let me down a little.


*Head* - thin, sparkling


*Color* - Transparent, a blush amber


*Nose* - Powerful acidity in high tones, bittersweet, bearish, with a hint of sourness.


*1st Impression* - smooth and sweet before the hops charges in. Unusually "sparkly" sensation on the tongue, very crisp.


*Middle* - roaring surge of hops, gentle decay.


*After* - diminishes too rapidly after the glorious middle, but this quality adds to smoothness and drinkability.


*Overall* - This beer didnt quite live up to my expectations. It was very enjoyable for 80% of the experience, but the ending left me longing for more. This is a great beer, but I felt a little disappointed.

Not a huge fan of IPAs, but I tried to rate this in its catagory.  One of the best IPAs ive had.  It has a semi-light copper color.  Nice foamy head.  Taste is very complex.  Hoppy start, nice tingle bitter taste, then finishes with a nice dry hop.  Stone Rocks

This had an average head,which dissipated quickly.The color was a nice amber.Aroma was very appealing citris(oranges),hops,It was begging me to taste it!!It tasted of caramel,oranges and yes,UNGSTRUP,I do taste the slight coffee.Bitter finish.Very nice beer,but I can only drink 1 or 2 at a time because of the high alcolhol and heavy taste.Very good beer.

UPDATED: SEP 18, 2011 First rating. Sampled from 12 fl oz bottle courtesy of Marsiblursi. Clear orange color, tan head. Very hoppy scent, sweet sticky with a hint of alcohol. Big mouthfeel with fairly low bitterness (for this type). Hoppy and sweet taste, bitter aftertaste. 8-3-7-4-13=3.5  Rerate. Bottle at The Rover, Göteborg. On December 20, 2008. Cloudy orange color, white head. Fruity and hoppy scent. Fruity hoppy taste. Full mouthfeel, high bitterness. 8-3-8-4-16=3.9Rerate12 fl oz bottle at 3 Små Rum, Göteborg. On October 2, 2009Hazy golden color, fluffy lasting white head. Hoppy, acidic, floral, citrus, perfumy, bitter scent. Bitter, sweet taste. Smooth mouthfeel, high bitterness.7/4/7/4/15=3.7RerateDraught at Moeder Lambic, Brussels, for the Stone beer festival. Sampled on September 16, 2011As "Stone Double Dry Hopped Ruination IPA"Hazy yellow to orange color, small white head. Sweet, malty, caramel, hoppy, citrus, tropical fruits scent. White pepper, fruity, hoppy taste. White pepper and hoppy bitter aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, high bitterness.8/3/7/3/14=3.5RerateDraught at Moeder Lambic, Brussels, for the Stone beer festival. Sampled on September 16, 2011Hazy yellow color, fluffy white head. Sweet, caramel, hoppy, citrus scent. Sweet, caramel, hoppy taste. Smooth mouthfeel, medium high bitterness.8/4/8/4/16=4.0

"Im not a huge fan of IPAs, but Stone is starting to change my mind. This beer pours a beautiful golden color with a nice white head. The aroma is tops--lots of citrus and some florals in the back end. The taste is crisp, with lots of hops to be sure, but a nice balance at the end with the malt notes coming through. A very good IPA

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2009 Re-rate:  Stone IPA is good, but ODells (Boulder CO) is better.

Stone: Hoppy, yes.  Balanced, no.  A little thin across the middle of the palate, and overly astringent.  Love the hops, but needs some beef as well.
My new favorite. Im obsessed. A+  If you like beer this is one you shouldnt pass up.
Very interesting.  Pours clearly with a light white head.  Smells piney and a hint of grapefruit.  The first taste is of bitter floral hops followed by a nice finish that is smooth and lingers.

This brew is RIGHT ON! The best IPA i have tasted. Smooth, bitter beautiful head. I am very impressed by this effort.
If you love hops, this is the beer for you.

Pours out a nice brown color with a thick white head.    Aroma is very hoppy.  Flavor was a nice balance of hops.  Was very impressed with this brew.  IPA and IIPAs are brews that I am starting to become a fan of.  This is a great example.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2007 Pours hazy golden orange color with white head. Strong citrusey and hoppy aroma. Very citrusey flavor with intense suggestions of lemony dryness. Nice quality hop flavor with a dry lingering finish.

Bright orange with a long lasting off-white head and prevalent lacing. Aroma was prominent citrus, ruby red grapefruit with some pine.  Flavor of big sharp resiny hops propped up by smooth, not-too-sweet malts. A nice lasting bitterness on the finish.

22 oz. Bottle: Cloudy gold with lots o bubbles rising to the white stiff head.  Sticky lacing shows itself around the top half of the glass.  There is a sweet, citrsuy hop aroma showing juniper bushes, green veggies in the garden and grapefruit.  The taste is wonderfully dry and bitter with floral notes, sagebrush and an ultra bitter grapefruit aftertaste.  The carbonation is lively as it dances around on the tongue.  The body is full and has a smooth feel.  Like Stones goal - this is a robust beer that is BIG and will teach any macro lover a lesson about real beer.

(Bottle via trade with IrishBoy, thanks Richard!) Hazy amberish yellow body with a rather frothy white head. Aroma pretty strongly hoppy - alternating between piney and fruity.
