Well, Ive been drinking a few different ipas recently, so I felt ready to give this highly rated brew a try.  Wow, much hoppier in both aroma and flavor than any others I have tried.  The hops dominated too much for my taste, but I guess thats what its made to do.  A treasure for hopheads for sure. Still, a fine beer.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2006 Pours a light golden with an ample head and active carbonation. The nose dominanted by citrus, pine, and a whiff of humus, and the first sip - ahhh! This is a macho IPA, with a powerful blast of hop flavor and a full, rich mouthfeel, but that doesnt mean it lacks refinement. Quite the contrary - this beer brings forward plenty of sweet citrus and floral tones, it balances the aggressive hops with a warm roasted malt, with flavors that pass from grapefruit to malt to nuts, hiding the alcohol nicely, before drifting into that long and lovely bitter hop finish. This is a great beer, worth revisiting time and again.


Upon numerous additional encounters with this beer, my rating has fallen somewhat. Sure, its a great "first-sip" IPA, but its not my top choice for a well-balancing drinking IPA. Rather, it comes out on the sweet, sticky, oily, nearly IIPA side of the matter, and that hurts it in the scores.

Hazy golden orangish color.  White thin wispy head.  Aroma of citrus and piney hops.  Starts slightly sweet and finishes big and hoppy.  Malts are pretty much hidden.  Nice hop backbone for this aggressive beer.  Taste is nearly all hops in every dimension.  Finish slightly sweet and highly bitter.

Pours crystal clear golden orange with a rocky ivory head. Smells of herbal hops, fruity yeast.

Taste is all hops. Sharply bitter hops offset with lighter fruity citrus hops. Medium bodied and lightly crisp. A dry long lingering bitterness. Good stuff, not a classic but good.

Bottle. Foamy white head dissipates somewhat quickly. This is an odd aroma beer-- from the bottle you get a concentrated hop-forward, full body IPA blast, but in the glass a lot of that fades away, leaving subtle citrus (grapefruit) and grassy/pine notes; not the hop assault on the nose I was expecting. Very well balanced hop and malt taste-- initial spice and bitterness is immediately smoothed out by slight sweetness. Medium body. Finishes quite dry, while at the same time leaving a nice sticky sweet aftertaste. Stone is fantastic and consistent across the board, an easy favorite!

Hopheads would love this beer.  It has a pure a hop flavor as anything that Ive had before.  Personally, I prefer a more balanced beer, so this was a little too bitter for my tastes.  But by definition, this is probably the perfect IPA for those who love hops to dominate.

Ah... as this warms, the hops really come out to play.  Pour was a clear golden color with just a little head.  Nice intricate lacing as it went down.  Aroma is of grapefruit and pine forest with just a little sweetness under there.  Flavor mimics the aroma quite well.  There was sufficient malt presence to hold the super-hops in check.  Finish was piney and a bit bitter.  This was just powerfully good on all fronts.  Get some!
UPDATED: DEC 22, 2006 cant wait to visit the brewery, amazing stuff, this is definately a staple, very burley, not your average ipa.  buy this today

A citrus bouquet of scents rises from a crisp gold beer. Texture is slightly oily. Flavour is hops all the way and the malt is strong enough to balance them. The slick texture cries out for some spicy food for compliment.

bomber bottle from Eric ( Heemer77 ).  color is a bit paler than I expected but the appearance is of a hazy honey color andl has that nice foamy, rocky head.  initial aroma is of grapefruit zest.  to me this is a great example of a beer with high hops that is in perfect balance with the malts.  If I had sampled an IPA like this several months ago, I would have understood much sooner what it means to be a HOPHEAD!  Thanks Eric.

This is a good american IPA.  The aroma is very nice and I love the orange-tint to color.  It just looks like it will taste good.  A funny thing on my first bottle, I  could have sworn a slight diacetyl flavor(butterscotch) in the background.  I tried the second bottle (which is what I am rating today) and it was not there?? Maybe a faulty batch on  the first one?  Otherwise this is a good IPA from Stone who usually mucks up beers with bravado and stupidity (see ruination and arrogant bastard ales)

Poured a golden amber with a foamy off white head that laced the glass.  Grapefruit and floral aromas. Very hoppy.  The taste is somewhat smooth at first with a slightly bitter aftertaste.  Not as good as some other IPAs Ived had (ie Victory HopDevil) but still very solid.  Would prefer a little less bite at the end.

This was the first IPA I had ever had.  Since then, I have had great ones and not so great ones, but I always remember that time I was trying to keep up with the guy next to me while he was drinking 10 cans of Tecate, I was quite done by the time I got to my 5th Stone IPA.  Today, I appreciated the beer much more than that.  Great stuff

12 oz. bottle. Thanks to DUANE, the best trader here! Poured a golden amber with an immediate grapefruit hop nose. Huge foamy white head.  The nose is citrus and grass and just from the nose, my mouth is puckering and watering. That is stick with hops. Wow. This is hops, front to back. The front is sweet and grassy, then I get pineapple and grapefruit. The sweet sticky hops then move to the back with a smooth balance for so many IBUs. This is fantastic. Duane, am I a hop head yet????

Beautiful appearance.  Clear and golden with a distinct hop aroma.  The taste is a good mix of sweet malt and bitter hop.  The hop aftertaste doesnt attack the throat and is certainly not overpowering.

Holy crap, why have I been drinkking anything else?  Gret deep rich malt flabor nicely balanced and refresed by a good deal of hops.  Nice white foamy head.  Good amount of bitterness, but still very drinkable.
UPDATED: JUL 27, 2008 tried on draft after a tourof the brewery, SO FRESH! one of the elite American IPAs

Clear, dark golden color with off-white head. Really nice hop aroma, sweet, piny with prune notes. The taste if full of piny and perfumy hops. Good bitternes, balanced by a decent sweetness and fullness from the malts. A dry, hop aftertaste, but not overpowering.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2005 One of my favorites.  Average for Stones standards; big hops flavor with citrus backing that does not let up.  Crisp bitter end.  If you like IPAs and have not tried this, you are a tool.  Go to the store now, buy one, and you will definitely enjoy it.

Bomber.  Pours a clear orange yellow color with a small white head that laces well.  Aroma is of piney high alpha acid hops; floral and spicy with a definitely malt back bone.  Flavor is upfront spicy and hoppy (grapefruit and spruce) and caramel sweet.  Moderate ester profile to complement the hops and malt. Finishes dry and pleasantly bitter.  Mouthfeel is fairly full and smooth with a perfect carbonation level.  Great IPA.
Deee-licious. Appealing amber. Grapefruit hop bitterness entices and delivers. Balanced hops throughout and a great lingering bitter finish. Did I mention deee-licious?

Wow, Ive really been in an IPA mood lately (4 in 4 days), and theyve all been excellent.  Yellow-orange, a hoppy and extremely dry head. This is a top-notch IPA, very hoppy (but not when compared to Stones Ruination).  Goes down smooth - can drink all night.
Nice Amber color. Smells of hops... tastes of hops... yummy! Hop Hop Im a bunny! A happy Bunny.
This is the beer I use to convince people that Sierra Nevada IPA isnt the be-all of IPAs.  The hops ALMOST, but not quite, overpower; the last half of the glass is even better than the first.

Hops dominate, in aroma, and in flavor. Not as complex as ruination, but a great IPA. the first Stone beer I had, but Dont know why I havent rated it. This is the beer that turned me on to hops. Very nice, enjoyed drinking it, always do.

(on bottle)Had this one a bit too warm, so...Beige head and a light orange colour. POwerfull nose, like a bag o´hops hauled in your face. But the flavour it self is actually pretty balanced; sorry Greg. The finish, though, really takes revenge and makes you feel like the Joker; a grin from all the alpha, like a cramp.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2013 Whatâs not to like about this beer. Made by a company that knows hops, this is a great little brother beer to ruination. Great golden color, super hop bite.aroma is a perfect fresh representation of centennial hops, amazing.

Perfect golden color, nice fluffy white head, lasts a while before fading to a few islands and nice lace.  Aroma is mostly hops, with undertones of peppery herbs (woodruff?, wormwood?), citrus, alcohol and grapefruit.  Taste was a celebration of very bitter hops -- 2 weeks of dry-hopping!  Moderate malt, but unroasted.  Other flavors included tea, lime, green pepper, and juniper.  This bitter taste is quite lasting, although rather refreshing.  Dead-on mouthfeel, not too much carbonation.  Excellent IPA.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2008 22 oz. bottle. Pronounced head, flavor and aroma of, wait for it, hops... citrus, grass, lawn clippings, and a little dirt that is interesting. Mouthfeel is pleasantly full, refreshing but with some weight, very slightly viscous. Lasting bitterness but not over the top, grassy notes on lingering finish. Awesome lacing, altogether great looking and tasting. Quite good.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2006 Aroma:Full of exotic fruit hops aroma...
Appearance:Clear orange,small head....
Flavor:Caramel,exotic fruit hops....

Nice golden color with a white head.  Smells lively, fruity, of citrus zest, and hops galore.  Taste is obviously hoppy, also spicy and a bit of grain on the bitter finish.  Nice cripsy mouthfeel.  Actually I didnt like this one too much, but its a well made beer, and lovers of the style should try it.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle.  It pours to a huge thick, fully lasting rocky white head with excellent lacing atop a golden body.  The aroma is oranges and is very hoppy.  Kinda piney under all those oranges.  Light malt hides there too.  Odd hints of ketchup linger below this.  The flavor is pretty good.  Not as good as Ruination, but still good.  Oranges, sweet caramel malts, light pine hints.  The palate is crisp and refreshing with a medium/light creamy mouthfeel.  This is worth trying.  :)
bottled, amber color w/ off white head.  rich hoppy nose mixed w/ orange and hops.  full bodied, hoppy as expected. bitter aftertaste.

Bitter, bitter.  Just past my bitter limit, I stress just.  I knew going in that this should be expected.  Good flavour and aroma.  Still a very good beer.  I would like to try this with different food to get a better sense of the beer.

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2005 Very bitter, citrusy finish (thats why were drinkin it, right?). Subtle, lightly carbonated palete. Thin white head, copper to yellow gradient body. Very bitter. Wait, did I already say that? Maybe I shouldnt be drinking this with this sweet food. 

Rerate: Not nearly as bitter as when I foolishly at ate with very sweet food, though Im gonna keep the rating the same. Taste was very hoppy, bitter, yes, and pretty good at that, though nothing fabulous. I probably overrated last time whereas this time was spot on: balanced taste, balanced aroma, though nothing great (9+), so this will stick with a 3.8

I bought the bottle from HalfTime beverage but realize its easily available at most beer outlets in my area. It had a flowery aroma that wasnt too imposing. The hops are definately there but arent excessive. It had a moderate to dry finish. Its a solid beer to me with a fresh crisp taste but it doesnt seem out of the ordinary-just a good IPA with an awesome mouthfeel to it.

Spectacular beer.  Pours copper, with a thin head.  The aroma is of citrus and hops, with a hint of flowers.  The flavor is the perfect combination of hops.  Bravo.  I liked this better than the Ruination, and its available in a six pack.
Pours a copper color.  With almost no head.  The beer itself, has a nice cirtus kick and is very hoppy.  Very tasty and enjoyable beer.
Copper colored, strong hops aroma and an even stronger hops taste. very bitter and crisp but without a lingering aftertaste. THis and Lagunitas are definitely my top two IPAs.

Received courtesy of my friend Sal Paradise from hawkeyenation.com  This is heaven.  Perfect IPA.   Two Hearted Ale is the best I can get around here, but this is better.  Floral scent.  Grapefruit and pine.  Wish I could get this all the time here in St. Louis.
Small white head with a clear light orangeish body.  Lovely hoppy aroma, citrusy with a hint of pine.  Nice bitter flavor.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2005 Tap. Lightish orang with a stiff cream colored head. Flowery fruity aroma with notes of orange and pine resin. Totally hoppy aroma and taste with some definate pine presence. Very crisp in the mouth. Hoppy bitter taste that lingers a bit on the back of the tongue with a slight alcohol warmth at the end. Nice body, not too thick, but still very crisp and clean.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2010 Is this beer really that good? Dont get me wrong, a very pleasant highly hopped and modern style but just not mind blowing. Hops show good complexity with metallic hardness, aniseed and a grainy farmyard character early. The best showing I have seen and clearly this bottle was in better nick than a Purvis-sourced sample from 2008.
April 2008 (3.2)
Funny beer. Nose shows some faint hope sweetness and a funky, dirty fruit note. Not really hoppy at all in terms of aromas, at least in the traditional sense. Mild palate weight with elegant fruity notes before a harder metallic-like character kicks in.
May 2005 (3.1)As can be expected from the marque a full flavoured in your face interpretation. Mild herbal nose with some fruity ale traits. Very similar early in the palate before giving way to some full throttled hop action. Long, strong finish, but just a touch too abrasive at the end. Served by the bottled at RFD in Washington

I love stone they do really well with every thing they do.  This one starts pretty well by pouring a nice orange color with a thick head.  head seems to be pretty well present throughout the whole beer.  Nice hoppy aroma.  A little too hoppy for my preference but still a killer beer, very pumped to get more products from stone.

This came in the typical Stone 22oz silk-screened bomber with the gargoyle on it. This poured out a light orange with a tall rising out of the glass head of off white foam. Scattered lacing was left around the glass as this was consumed. Strong floral aromas rose from the glass that was backed by and equally string citric piney smell. Completely hop dominated nose but not to the point of being over done, there was a doughy malt presence keeping it in check. Citric bitterness hit the tongue first with a slightly sweet malt coming though shortly after. The after taste was mildly bitter with an earthy hop bite. A fairly balanced flavor that keep the emphasis on the hops. Mouthfeel is clean and crisp with about a medium body. I could drink this stuff all day, one of my favorite IPAs.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2006 Very pleased to be the 666th rater. <img=http://www.ratebeer.com/images/smilies/4.g />
A mostly clear, deep amber body under a mostly lasting, rocky, off-white head that laces in morse code (a dash here... a dot there...). Heavy pine and citrus aromas, with soapy touches of Irish Spring® and black pepper. Flavor starts with a smooth malt, then its all delicious, grapefruity hops. Despite some dryness, I find a long, tinlgy hop finish and a clingy mouthfeel. Extra points for the 2-color screened bottled. Id like to try this alongside a Bells Two Hearted and a Dogfish 60 (but, hey... who wouldnt?)
P.S.  I looked up "hops" in the dictionary (as per the advice of the Commercial Description) and did not find a picture of Stone IPA. I did not find a picture of anything, for that matter. I feel used...
<font size=-4>Trade with <a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/ViewUser.asp?UserID=1 size=-1>

bottle from brickskeller.  color: pale gold.  aroma is hoppy, but more herbal than most american IPAs.  flavor is fairly hoppy, still piney despite the aromas indication.  a little light on the malt for my taste.

On draught at Mugs Ale House. 
Transparent charneol colour. Big citric/mandarin nose. Citrus anf grapes are most prominent in flavour, malt balances pretty well. A dry hopped monster thats crisp still. Very flowery. And drinkable.

Pours amber transparent with a nice thick head that stays around.  Initial aroma was strong hops then a little malt creeped through.  Flavor is mostly hops but a nice malt taste in the background.  Pine and citrus also come through.  This beer has some real carbonation that helps to give it a nice feel on the palate.  It is a very solid IPA maybe the best Ive tried yet.  Great flavor and nice on the palate.    I have a ruination in the cellar waiting and this just got me all that much more excited to sample that one!  Stone Rocks!

Initial strong aroma of hops that settled down to a more subtle hop aroma after a minute. Poured with a golden color, and a frothy head that was still a half inch thick a few minutes after pouring. Very well-balanced flavor with a mellow hop bitterness and a good amount of hop flavor that melded very well with the malt backbone. Rich mouthfeel that felt almost creamy from the fine carbonation. The beer coated the mouth for several seconds after each sip. This evolved into a pleasantly ligering aftertaste that was a good mix of bitterness and hop flavor. This is an excellent, well-crafted beer.
Granted, there are no bad Stone beers and this one added to my excitement.  Very hoppy and a good set up prior to experiencing Ruination IPA.

One of the best IPAs  Ive ever had!!!
Not overpoweringly hoppy, just the right amount of hops for this type of beer. also gets you drunk right quick lol.

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2011 April 19, 2005, chilled 12 oz. bottle (also sampled in the 22 oz. "bombers").  Been drinking this for months, cant believe I havent rated it yet.  Huge aroma invites you to dig in.  The powerful burst of hoppy -- yet balanced -- flavor keeps you coming back.  A world-class brewery, and an IPA against which all others are judged.

Oct. 26, 2011: More than six years later, Stone IPA is still the "gold standard" - as good as an IPA gets.

Pours a clear gold color with a thick rocky white head. Excellent aroma of resinous and spicy hops. Excellent flavor of spicy and resinous hops with caramel and a strong lasting bitter finish. Light to medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Excellent IPA.

Pours dark golden orange with nice soapy white head. Huge pine hop aroma with just a touch of citrus. Lots of pine and citrus again in the flavor, but it doesnt have as much of the bitterness you would expect from the aroma. Still very nice indeed.
a very nice ipa.  nice hoppy character with grapefruit flavor as well as a more complex malty undertone.  a very nice beer.

Brewtopia 05.  Poured a deep orange yellow with a medium grapefruit aroma.  Taste was strong grapefuit but not bitter in the aftertaste.  Some sweetness coming through as well. Slight burn on the tongue at the end but well balanced with strong hops without much tartness.

An old rating...from early 2003.  Pours a deep orangey color, nice big white pillowy head.  Nose is big floral & citrus hops..it slams you big time.  The flavor is big Cascade too....nicely bitter yet exhibits a nice malty sweetness in the middle giving way to big bold bitterness in the end.  Nice full mouthfeel.  One of my favorites.

Great orangey amber pour with a 1 inch thick white head.  Soft but solid piney nose.  Great flavors...hoppy, floral, grapefruit zest, and  malty with a delectable smooth,  buttery like silkiness.  Bitter finish with a touch of sweetness.  Alcohol is virtually unnoticeable.  Awesome overall feel to  this one, not as hoppy as I was expecting but great nonetheless.  I should have bought more of these.  Another solid brew from Stone.

In the bomber bottle. Dark gold to light amber in color. White head with big individual bubbles. Heavily carbonated. Fantastic hop aroma. Faint aroma of a pine tree. Awesome buttery mouthfeel at first sip. Very high hop bitterness to the flavor. Tastes of grapefruit rine, maltiness and pine nuts. Awesome palate. I love it.

Bottle: Poured a orangey color ale with a medium head with standard retention. The hops and their nice floral aspect overpower aroma. Taste is quite bitter with some lingering sweetness in the back of the palate. Good body and alcohol level does a good job of keeping this beer together. Not my favourite style to begin with but this was very enjoyable nonetheless.
This is great. It hurts me to say but, Ale Smith is slightly better, but this is fantastic.

Full orange hops aroma, with pine and malt. Orange/amber, pours a large, rocky, custard head, leaves some lace. Big orange flavoured hops at first, well placed malt and some piney hops in the aftertaste. Well balanced, full bodied, sticky, chewy, resiny, wonderfully bitter, everything an IPA should be! Sensational!!!


 Thank You Very Much rudolf!!

Oh yeah.. this is one hoppy beer.  Cool and refreshing the whole time.  Not much of a bite though, which I love.  The aftertaste is bittersweet, rich with hops.   Its almost a perfumy taste at the very end.  Very unusual, but good.  Not something I would drink too much of in one sitting, a little too rich for my blood.

22 oz bottle.  I am am an IPA fanatic, and have waited quite a while to get my hands on a bottle of this stuff, and finally found a bottle in Nevada City, CA.    I dont have a bottle of Lagunitas Maximus or Lost Coast Indica (my two favorites) to compare this to, but here goes anyway.  Pours a nice copper color, with good slighltly off-white head.   Nice clean malts with killer hops is what I taste.  Smooth on the tongue, and with a great overall flavor and balance.  This I think sets the standard for an IPA.   The overall feeling is perfect balance.  I may have trouble getting this brew in Eureka, so I  may have to settle for the aforementioned wannabees, but this is the best of breed in my opinion.  I will ask my local COOP to import it.
HOPS!! This beer is full of it, the flavor of the hops is almost overwhelming, but very tasty. Dont drink too much or youll be sorry!

Hops galore! What can I say that hasnt already been said about this? It was a great IPA...I cant think of one that Ive had that is better, honestly. Next in line would be Pyramid IPA, but its hard to beat this one. If youre a hophead then you have to give this brew a try.

A nice white head on top of a great golden copper colour.  Spend some time taking in the hoppy-sweet aroma that comes off the pour.  It has a sweet almost maple  taste which blends itself well with the strong bitter hop flavour and rich malty background.  This is a beer to be enjoyed!

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2007 Love the puffy lasting white head. Maltier flavor than I was expecting, still well balanced though. Drinkable and smooth. Great every day drinker for the hop head. Certainly a respectable IPA but not worthy of a 99, imo.
Hops Hops Hops. Lots of aroma and well mantained flavor. Nice amber color with great lacing. Youre gonna like this one.

Bitter hops dominate this beer in almost every catagory.  I like a better balance of malt/hops in general.  This balance between sweet and bitter is one of the basic ingredients in the delicate interplay or complexity in a fine beer.  This comes up a little short in my judgement on most levels...However...I still enjoyed the hell out of this stuff and would certainly try it again, and I look forward to trying this brewers other offerings.

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2016 Amber colored, moderate head, decent lacing and retention. Fruity citric aroma with some grapefruit. Pale malts, a touch of caramel, big fruity flavor with a moderate to high level of bitterness.

Chock full of hops. Strong hop/floral aroma. I have never been a fan of I.P.A.s Too bitter for my taste.
 Personally, this stuff made me choke. 
It looks really inviting., but it tastes bad.
A good friend of mine who is an I.P.A. drinker thinks this stuff is great.
So, there you go. Dont listen to me.

bottle.  nice orange color with usual white head that lasts for awhile.  full of hops, not overly bitter. well balanced beer that does not overwhelm in complexity of taste.  good introductory i.p.a. for those discovering the micros.

Very nice floral aroma, nice medium orange color with normal white head. Plenty of hops in the palate and a very dry hoppy finish.  Well balanced, but overall, not as hoppy as I expected, and not as good as a Sierra Nevada.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2005 Golden color with orange notes, good carbonation for head retention.  Copious dry hopping evident from predominately hop aroma.  Medium body with residual sweetness indicative of Stones lower attenuating yeast.  Fruity esters from the same complement the hop flavor, which I would describe as being more floral and tangy than an astringent bitterness.  Well balanced for a big character beer, as Stone is wont to create.

The hops come forth as soon as the cap is popped from the bottle. Besides hops the nose is sweet and bready. Of course the hops are flowery and citrusy. The color is orange amber and it pours with a good head that lasts but is not frothy. The flavor is hoppy(of course) with a slight hint of honey and bread. The mouthfeel is moderately full and is just right for the style. The finish has a lasting bitterness with pine citrus notes. Very good beer, in fact the best IPA Ive had to date.

(12 oz bottle; 22-Nov-04) An excellent IPA with a sweet, bready maltiness and a balancing, moderately strong, fresh hops flavor.  But I wouldnt say this IPA is dominated by hopped by any means, and thats fine with me because I typically prefer a more balanced IPA.  Once the sweet breadiness wears off a bit, the hops bitterness is moderately strong and extends the finish considerably, but again, its not as bitter as the description would lead you to believe -- Ive had many IPAs that were much more bitter.  It has a malty and very bready nose, but also some mild hoppiness.  In fact, if youve ever been to the Stone brewery and reveled in the glorious aroma, this IPA smells just like that!  Medium bodied, but the mouthfeel is quite full and substantial.  Medium golden color, somewhat cloudy.  Whitish head has good size on the pour, but settles to a thin sheen, leaving modest lacing.  Very well done indeed!<hr>Rerate (12 oz bottle: Hi-Time Wine Cellars; 01-Feb-05 and again on 17-Mar-05) Im doing a separate review for this bottle since its apparent to me that my previous rating was for a bottle that probably sat around for a bit.  I just purchased this bottle by mistake, but I wish all mistakes were this fortuitous because this must be a very fresh bottle, and it has inspired me to do a second complete rating.  Whereas the bready maltiness showed quite a bit of presence in the previous bottle, here, we have an all out hops assault on the taste buds and nostrils.  In fact, Im not getting any breadiness anywhere.  The nose is very hoppy with a moderate, sweet citrus aroma in the background.  The flavor is very hoppy, very bitter, moderately citrusy with a mildly sweet and fruity base for balance.  This beer is dark golden in color and completely clear, not one iota of haziness, unlike the bottle in my previous rating.  The off-white head pours to almost a full inch in height and maintains a thin layer for the entire session, leaving numerous streamers of lace drooping all over the glass.  For a standard IPA, this is superb.  And proof that freshness matters with IPAs.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2005 After years of begging out of state friends to bring this to me when they came to town, someone finally came through. Pours a light orange color with a thick head. Good lacing. Its very hoppy but not overly bitter. Very tasty beer. Im glad I finally got to sample this brand.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2005 Fantastic!  Very light orange color, slightly cloudy.  Hoppy scent and flavor, but not as strong as the Ruination IPA from Stone-try that one too.  Great lacing all the way down.  Head reduces but never disappears.  Enters mouth discreetly and flavor builds as it travels to your belly.  You cant go wrong with this beer.  Also, its great with smoky barbequed meats.

Close to my ideal beer.  Sampled on draught at Tria in Philadelphia, PA, which incidentally is a GREAT beer bar and well worth a trip.  Big rocky white head tops a pale, clear, slightly orange body.  Huge hop nose, very flowery.  Initial sip knocks you back with bitterness but subsequently sips reveal a subtle complexity.  Stone managed to get the right balance between maltiness and hoppiness.  The resut is a full bodied beer that just seems right.  Very refreshing and thirst quenching, although a bit too high in alcohol to be my session beer.....

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2010 A good IPA in the West Coast microbrew tradition.  Good aromatics and  crispness with a downplayed malt character.  Restrained citrus and resin in the nose and taste gives way to clean bitterness in the finish.
A harmonic, melodic balance of ingredients that fuse together to provide me with everything I look for in a beer. I really enjoyed this one.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2005 This one pours a light amber with a creamy, not bubbly, offwhite head.  This is, quite simply, an amzingly hoppy and amazingly great brew.  The alcohol is very prevalent, but this one is dominated in nose and taste by the pineapple/citrus bitterness.  There are some malts, but they are minimal.  I like balance, but in this case I make an exception.

pours a clear orange with a small white head.  armoa is sweet and hoppy.  taste is a nice grassy hoppy taste but pretty well balanced with sweetness. grapefruit goodness.  good somewhat resiny mouthfeel. very drinkable.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2006 Orange color.  Lots of citrus hops in both the aroma and  taste.  One of my favorites.  I love the hops.

1/20/06 Re-Rate
Bottle.  Pours clear orange color with a thin white head.  Mostly piney hop aroma with some citrus.  Very pungent, piney hop taste, a little grapefruit as well.  Very bitter.  Light and easy drinking.  I like this beer, but with it being one of my first ratings, was very high.
not near  enough hops this si a pale ale not an IPA. the malt presence is gone almost immediately and the hops right after. The worst of the STONE beers in my opinion, and I am a fan of their beers.
Truly good stuff. Bitter with fruity tones. Very drinkable and great ABV. Awesome IPA.

Okay, so this thing smells like christma, hoards of piney and citrus hops. Interestign orange colour with a small head that left a smooth lacing. I was almost afraid this would be too hoppy and bitter. But it was very smooth and good. Balanced enough for an IPA this thing explodes with hops and leaves a crisp bitterness on your tounge. Im looking forward to the bottle of runition sitting in the fridge!
UPDATED: MAR 27, 2005 (Bottle)I have to agree on the hop factor. Really hoppy but didnt balance well. A medium but slighty above average ipa.
Aroma of hops and perfume.  Hops dominate the flavor and palate as well.  Light amber color.  Did I mention the hops?

Pours a medium white frothy head with a fair amount of lacing.  Nice carbonation bubbles sticking to the sides and a beautiful amber color to the beer.  Smells hoppy and a slight sweetness to it, simple but divine.  Tastes hoppy with the slightest sweet taste to it, aftertaste goes from sweet back to bitter and lasts awhile.  This is how IPAs were meant to be it is a real treat to drink this beer.

Beautiful copper color in an English pint. Citrus and grapefruit aromas. Good fizzy head that laces decently. Somewhat dry with light fruitiness.   A nice full bitterness on the finish with big residual aromatic hops. Slightly unbalanced but a great session ale.

Rich orange-gold colour, 3 finger head. Mild aroma...the taste, WOW, this is  damn good stuff. from the bottle description, I was worried this might be too hoppy for me, but luckily theyre in perfect balance. Hoppy, sweet maltiness, orange, perfect bitterness and medium body, this would be a great beer to drink all the time. I cant imagine any ber lover disliking this one.

If there is a better IPA out there, I hope to find it some day but until then, I will remain convinced that this is the Holy Grail of IPAs......   Glowing apricot/amber under a nice off white head and lots of lacing.  Hoppy and sweet aroma of citrus fruits (grapefruit) and a little peppery spice.  Flat-out great hoppy flavor but with planty of well balanced sweetness including a hint of peaches and bubble gum.  Many IPAs, even good ones, often cross the precarious line of bitterness but this one dances it like the old Michael Jackson (note the subtle beer writer double entendre).  Mouth feel was soft and full.  Finish was clean, bitter, slighly oily and in a word: perfect.  What else can I say except : when will Stone Brewing make this beer easier to get a hold of in New Jersey?????
simply the best beer i have ever had thus far.  i love the sweet taste at the beginning of each taste, but that is followed by an even better hoppy favor that i simply love.  the best.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2005 Truly a bitter hops lovers dream.  The aroma is amazing but it took drinking this on a few occasions to get acclimated to the bitter finish. 
Re-rate: Malts improve with age and so does the beer in general.

A well crafted beer.  From the Head, Color and Aroma to the great taste.  Great balance. I sometimes find the hops overwhelming the body in many IPAs.   One quibble is that I prefer East Kent goulding Hops.  Currently, though,  this is my favoite IPA.  Pizza Ports Franks Double IPA is competition.  Oh, one other thing, this is DRY, although you wont know it till you get up off the Bar Stool.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2005 Stones most enticing hop aroma delivers its promise to the very last dry-hopped drop!  This is the best IPA Ive tasted, with an equally beautiful pale malt finish brewed nearly to dryness.   Having finally tasted the draft version at Dominions Beer Fest only increases my admiration.  Stone has clearly mastered the art of hop extraction!
Top stuff. Big hoppy aroma, citrus, pine. Sweet yet hoppy. Very balanced. Medium bodied. Great beer that I could either sip, or happily down a few of on a hot day. Great beer.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2005 Another exceptional offering from Stone.  Pours a deep orange with hints of gold. Lite  minimal white head.  The aroma is wonderful.  Bright hoppy citrus and sticky pine.  Very fresh smelling (like Im holding a handful of hops fresh off the vine) with some lite malt holing it all together.  The flavor is very nice.  It starts with a creamy, litely sweet malt (caramel?) mixed with citrus (orange) hops.  Moves to grapefruit flavors mixed with wood and pine bitterness.  The finish is long, bitter, and dry.  You get a hint of alcohol warmth, which is nice.  The body is fine.  This brew leans to hop heavy but the malts are study enough to keep it all together.  Very tasty!

Rated this again out of a firkin (sp?) taped at falling rock during GABF.  Had been dry hopped for some time.  The aroma was more pronounced this time with excellect citus hops.  Very floral.  the flavor was just as excellent though I noted it was significnatly more sticky in body.

Pours golden to light amber with a big fluffy yellow head.  Wonderful citrusy, flowery hop aroma.  First in the flavor comes a good malty taste.  Slight amounts of caramel malt.  Most of the hoppiness is in the finish.  Well balanced IPA.
Wonderfully hoppy with a delicious bite.  Balanced bready flavor, with a great flowery aroma.  This coupled with the Double Bastard are my first experiences with Stone, and Im a better man for it.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2006 Bottle at Chris_os, thanks to joet for bringing it. Tryed just after Great Divide Titan IPA, this was sweeter but still very hoppy, with a pile of piney American hops. A bit better balanced than the Titan, but not so great. My first San Diego beer is fairly impressive.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2010 Bottled at The London/Joet Gathering Chez Chris_O.  A copper coloured beer with a soapy white head.  The aroma is pleasantly hoppy not too aggressive with orange and pink grapefruit notes.  The taste is very nice with more hops and orange flavours.  An easy drinking IPA.  Score 3.7Subsequent rating also scored 3.7.
First IPA.  Pours into a light amber.  Foamy head that is gone after a few sips.  Nice bitter hoppy flavor.  Very nice.  Not a mouth feel I like... but it is ok.  All in all... a good beer.
A fine entry by Stone in the IPA field.  Beautiful head and wonderful amber color.  I like this one almost as much as I like the Ruination IPA.

12 oz bottle. 51.5°. NB Worthy glass.  Golden, hazy orange with a 1/2" off white head. The aroma is hitting me and I am a foot away from the glass.  Aroma of sweet citrus, almost a ruby red grapfruit/orange salad with honey on top.  The smell is realy sweet, almost like peach jam.  The flavor is sweet fruit (orange, peach) that shows some hops character, but not overly so. This is a really well balanced beer!  The finish is semi-dry -> dry, with a ton of citrus fruit.  The mouthfeel is pretty nice, but not spectacular. I was expecting a hop monster and was pleasantly suprised.  I wish I could have this as an everyday beer. Big thanks to Clark VV.

an aroma I grow to appreciate more and more every day: Cascades!  PLUS some interesting peach, marmelade, and bread notes; full-on, open-handed, in the face, hop-wollup (as opposed to brass-knuckled Ruination).....serious malty base to tip the scales; quality brew, of course
UPDATED: FEB 26, 2005 Very balanced.  Too balanced for my taste.  A very mild IPA.  Almost overly malty for an IPA
Nice pour from the bottle. The best lacing ive seen since pouring bottles of beer into a glass. Hoppy aroma and lasting flavor made this a good one. Will buy this one next trip to the beer store

This was the beer that alerted me to the brewing genius that was Stone. Its a fantastic example of everything that an IPA should be, loaded with hops, bitterness and just an amazing flavour that is among the best of IPAs. I actually preferred this to the Ruination, which I thought was perhaps a bit much ambition for it to carry. Excellent.

Translucent strawberry blonde, with a white cloud of of head that quickly gave way to clingly ring of lace, but with only a swirl the head came right back to life, giving away that incredible hoppy aroma.  Pine trees, citrus, grassy, this thing has the whole nine yards.  The first sip goes down dry and lip-smackingly bitter, but somehow the malt fights its way through and holds on to the back of your palate after the first coat of hops saturates your tastebuds into submission.  Maybe my sample was getting a little old (6-8 months Id say), but I kinda tasted a little vanilla in the aftertaste, something I didnt notice when I had the first 2-3 from my 6 pack.  Alcohol also makes its presence known after about the half pint mark.  For some people balance in a Beer is important, and I sort of fall into that catergory, but sometimes in life you find balance in inequality, order in chaos, yada-yada-yada.  This Beer is the gold standard of American IPAs, and my personal favorite from Stone.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2005 I thought that all of Stones brews were supposed to be real bad-ass beers, but this is one well-balanced, tasty, refreshing IPA.  Pouring a clear amber color with a sudsy white head, this has strong (but not overwhelming) piney and floral hop aromas.  Theres some decent malts at the base, but the hops do take over with pine, grapefruit, and earthy herbal hop tastes.  Theres also a bit of an almost peppery spiciness to the drink.  Its got a refreshingly bitter finish that leaves me thirsty for another.<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Stop, Highland, IN<font size=-1>

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2008 Sampled agian recently, again from a Stone IPA glass. Just a solid IPA. From a bomber and drank out of a Stone IPA glass. A nice gift from my brother. Slightly cloudy light orange color. A medium sized white head. Aroma immediately hit me with bready goodness. A hint of oranges and some pepper. The taste is up front and very hoppy. A nice balance of fresh hops and some spicy clove in the finish. It has grapefruit and some nice light malts to counteract that taste. The finish is smooth and carbonated. This also has a hint of tangerine or some other more delicate citrus fruit than just grapefruit. Very nice.

Well, for an IPA, this is one hoppy beer.   It smells of hops, it is very hoppy in flavor and I cannot think of any part of the beer that doesnt have some hoppy part to it.  If you like IPAs definetlly try this one, its solid.

This beer has the most diverse description of a beer I have seen on Ratebeer.com yet.  While some found it very hoppy, even to the point of being unbalanced, others were suprised that it wasnt as dry as they expected and found it very balanced.  I fall into the latter.  I lean towards the APAs vs. the IPAs for the very reason of balance.  While the true Hophead disciple will love say Victory HopDevil, I gravitate towards the Sierra Nevada APA.  All of that to say that this Stone brew falls more into the balanced category.  Which ultimately worked out for me since I bought this since it is available in Ohio and Stone APA isnt.  I very good beer! Strong floral aftertaste. Quality product. One of the best Ive had.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2008 Id been led to believe that this is the benchmark IPA, and its easy to see why. The hop attack is huge. It has all that resin, oiliness, pine, grapefruit,  flowery character and all the rest you expect. Its big, bold and brassy. As upfront as they come. But, despite all that, I didnt find it too aggressive. In fact, I found it a quite smooth drop. OK, its quite straightforward and maybe a touch one-dimensional, but I found it very appealing. Bottle, at the Brickskeller, Washington DC.

Delicious hop flavour in this IPA, as you would expect for this style.  nice color, nice head.  Very clean tasting, almost medicinal with all of those hop oils coming through very strongly. good, but not my favorite for this style.   not quite sweet enough to balance, and not quite enough character to make it one of my favorite IPAs.  I think this beer would benefit greatly with about 5-10% more crystal malt (or other similar unfermentable 40L range) added to the grist, but thats just my personal perferance.  very delicious.  very drinkable.

Intensely hopped but not in a bad way, this is some heavy duty IPA right here-and I usually dont like IPA.  As a bonus the intensity of this brew puts you under enough for surgery after 1 or 2 12 ounce bottles.  And as always, make sure its been kept refrigerated since its nice and unpasteurized.
Orange color with little head.  Very hoppy aroma.  More in the taste... umm... yeah, there are hops in the beer.  Not much else.  A little on the disappointing side.
The cascade hops hit you and hit you hard, and the beer has a crisp, dry flavor that is full of hops and not much else.  Refreshing but not very well balanced.  I expected more for the hype.

Man, my palate must be getting jaded.  I finally tracked this one down on the East Coast, and thought it was merely very solid.  It isnt particularly distinctive, just an excellent representative of the style.
Amber Coloring with Big White Head.  Huge Hoppy Bite With a Warming That Lights you up For Christmas!  Amazingly, Not Very Dry... Crisp... Alcohol Very Noticeable for 6.9%

this one surprised me....for an IPA, it was very citrusy and floral, and reminded me of wheat beer, not an IPA....for the true hop heads out there, try Arrogant Bastard ale from Stone, it is truly a bitter treat, but this offering seemed to be more sweet and fruity than what I expect from an IPA

Near clear light amber with decent carbonation and a thin but determined white head. Mild caramel and floral hop aroma. Good body and mouth feel with a balanced bitterness. Round, smooth flavor of a little malt, a little caramel, and a lot of hops. Quite good, although this particular bottle seems a little old.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2005 After suffering through the hell that was Arrogant Bastard, I was leary of trying this.  But, since my credo of "Ill try anything once" invaded my decision making, I decided to sample it.  Im glad I did.  Aroma is like a piece of bubblegum filled with orange and grapefruit.  This is a very drinkable brew. Nice, subtle sweetness with a sour grapefruit/orange finish.  This is a fantastic brew; Ill be buying more of these in the future.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Clear light amber colour. small head with decent lace. lightly hoppy nose. dry haoppy taste
UPDATED: JAN 31, 2008 Wow, this is a true IPA. Most hops Ive had in an IPA. Not for the fant. VERY hopsy. STRONG. 1 is enough, heartburn sets in. IPA personified.

big robust hop nose.. piney, a little cirtusy... pours clear and golden witha big fizzy white head. Head leaves pretty quick.. lotsa hops.. hops hops HOPS. great taste, clean crisp in the mouth. Cut right through the curry I was eating. Fantastic brew.
user_location: New York, east village, New York, USA

text: A wonderful IPA, strong, hoppy, golden, and drinkable. This is ruinations tough little brother. The beer is like a sunrise on a day after a rain, bright, goldenrod, majestic. The hoppy nose is a near-perfect compliment to the lemony-grapefruity aromas that waft from a freshly-poured 22. I am a believer in drinking all good beer from a large-mouthed Belgian beer glass, and to truly appreciate this beer, you need to first inhale its essence. But that only barely prepares you for the oral assault you experience when this hop-bomb touches your tongue. Almost sweet in its balanced maltiness, this IPA is very nearly the avatar of its genre.
This particular IPA was on tap at OBriens.  It was a "fresh hop" brew on cask.  Big pine and grapefruit nose, with slight barnyard and citrusy notes.  Rich gold color and light effervesence.

Hazy golden color. Very nice and fruity aroma: hop, malt, oranges, fudge, pink grapefruit. Quite dry texture, thin body, the malt shows better a bit later, and of course very hoppy (and well fruity). Very good.
The color is opaque, amber, warm. The aroma is of fragrant hop; elderflowers. The taste shows a very perfumed hop and balanced bitterness; at the end the bitterness is dominant. Great.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2005   Wow.  This beer has a fantastic aroma and looks wonderful when you pour it.  The taste has a lot of hops, but they are quite easy to take in.  The pour has an orange color which is very nice to look at.  The flavor is bitter but easy to drink.  The aftertaste is one of the best.  Im glad I was able to find this.

Bottle Pours a very pale crystal clear golden orange with a medium sized but dense and creamy off white head.  Lots of fine sticky lacing.  Aroma is a quite intense floral hops. Very shap.  Flavor is much softer than I anticipated.  Flowery, and malty  but very easy and drinkable.  Some caramel and light fruits in the flavor as well.  Feel is very smooth and rich.  Carbonation is quite soft and just a very drinkable IPA.
On tap.  Color is orangy golden with white head.  Aroma is floral and citrus with a blast of hops.  Taste is excellently hoppy and crisp with a nice balance of malt as it warms.  SO GOOD.

Bottle.  Bought this one at Mad Mex in North Hills of Pittsburgh.  Pours a wonderful amber (but surprisingly clear) color and laces well without a huge head.  Nice nose of citrus and sweetness.  Great flavor of bitter and slight sweetness along with a nice flavor that is hard to pinpoint.  Great stuff, on the lines of Victorys Hop Devil.  This one may be better, but I need about 30 or 40 more to be sure... and then Ill have to taste Hop Devil again for a case or two.  and then....etc

Purchased this one from the brewery--- they filled my growler right from the tap.  Such a fun way to get your beer!  Beautiful, reddish-golden ale with a light lacy head.  Strong hoppy character as advertised, with excellent balance of flavors.  Unique and totally drinkable.

Bottle.Pours a clear light copper hue with a rocky head and great lacing. Notes of citrus, pine and malt in the nose.   Great balance hoppy flavor that accents the malt in the body.  Good pine and citrus bitterness that lingers a good amount of time going down your throat.  This is a great IPA.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2005 Thin/Medium, crisp mouthfeel that leaves a ton of flavor behind. Like sparkling spring water with a glorious addition of spicy hops. There is some malt and bread to balance the hops kick. Cant ever go wrong with this one.
Ahh, hops.  Candi sugar, green floral and grassy hops.  Grapefruity.  Lemon pez.  Floral, bitter finish.  Really lemon pledgey.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2004 Pours a bright golden orange. Nice sized white head. Aroma of pine and citrus hops, a little whif of alcohol and malt too. Flavor is full of hops. Palate is happy, wow, might be my favorite IPA to date. Thanks to SHAG for this tasty brew.

The first word that comes to mind when imbibing this wonderful beer is power. Everything about it screams "more". Its hard to believe a beer that is so hoppy can be so well balanced and malty. The mouth feel is incredible as each bite, er...umm. drink is absolutely filled with richness and delight. A true to style IPA that could only have been made with an American Flare.

Pours a deep gold with a thin, yeasty head. Aroma is strong and hoppy with a firm backbone of malt. Very hoppy flavor as well, with the sweet, fruity malt coming in on the back end leading to bitter hop finish. An excellent IPA.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2005 This is a damn good IPA.  IPAs are soon becoming one of my favorite styles of beers.  This ale starts out with a stong aftertaste, but once you taste buds get acclamated then its smooooth sailing from here on in.  This beer has a crisp beginning with a mildly bitter after taste.  For the money there is no IPA better than this one.  Go out and get it!
slightly dry,sweet, and fruity, initial hoppy bite with a nice lingering maltiness. an awesome ipa!

Aroma:  Citrusy, grapefruity hop over caramel/toffee malt.
Appearance:  Darker gold color, low head retention.
Flavor:  Grapefruity and flowery hop flavor.  Nice malt backbone and flavor.  Well balanced flavor.
Mouthfeel/Palate:  Nice and assertive bitterness,which gives way to sweet maltiness.  Medium mouthfeel.
Overall:  Straightforward IPA, but good stuff.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2009 Classic American IPA
Light and hoppy aroma belies what comes with your first sip. 
First impression makes you do a double take, glorious hoppiness. Very fresh tasting hops with hints of fruity sweetness. Thick refreshing finish focusing on the malty/floraly finish as the bitterness fades. Makes you want even more.
Golden-orange appearance, finger amount of head that fades quickly.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2008 A really pretty orangey apple juice clear pour with a short soapy white head. Slow moving carbonation. Clean fruit, pine and flowery aroma. Relatively straight forward for Stone. Herbal with fresh grapefruit. Mild toasted to a charred flavour. Lots of minerals. A malty caramel and soft peach flavour kicks in near the end. Nicely balanced. Very tastey.

12 OZ bottle (thanks Sam). decants a golden-orange color with a big sticky white head that laces the glass... minimal carbonation...scents of plumbs, musty caramel and ample floral hopping.  Starts mellow with a nice whack of fruit laden malts....THEN the hops take over and make a complex  floral/grassy/bitter mixture from those northwest cones melding with the ample cramel malts gives a buttery peach impression...finish is surpisingly thick with the bitterness restrained by the maltiness plays long on the aftertaste as a lingering bitter fruit impression. A big beer for the style.

After many years of searching I have found the perfect IPA. Hoppy, Dry, Powerful but really easy to drink. Outstanding with Italian food. Great with everything else, even Ice cream. It is really easy to consume more than is safe.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2004 Pours gold-orange with a medium head. Aroma reminded me of the glorious day i imbibed of a Dreadnaught--citrusy, lumbery, grassy, and fantastic. Taste is as good as the smell, with a wonderful hop bitterness, gaining in sweetness as it sits in the mouth. An excellent IPA.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2007 I love IPAs, but this version was one of the worst I have had.  There was no head formation. The color was cloudy amber.  Something is wrong with this bottle.  The IPA was thin with strong hoppiness.  This must have been a bad batch.  Joss  on 11/27 also had a similiar experience.  I will try this IPA again.  It has received such great reviews. My next bottle was consumed on 5/23/06.  This was excellent.  Very balanced and highly citrus flavored beer.  The beer poured to overflowing the glass with the head.  The grapefruit aroma and taste were present throughtout.  This was one of the better IPA this year.  I am rerating based on this bottle. I enjoyed an excellent draught from The Capital Ale House on 2/10/07.  It was a well balanced IPA that I wish had purchased a larger glass.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2005 This is the first in a series of beers that I SWEAR I thought I rated already but I guess I didnt.  I had this on tap on Ginger Mans in NYC.  This beer was hoppy and delicious... great aroma... all the right moves.  But it didnt quite satisfy when I got it home, in the form of a pretty thin and empty finish.  Dying to try the Ruination.

Bottle
Grassy and piney hop aroma.
Amber, low carbonation, lowish head.
Hop base, malt still detectable, but the balance is evident.
Medium to light body, sparkly mouthfeel.
Bitterhop aftertaste.

Dark, golden,  pours with a nice head. Viciously good. One of the most satisfying IPAs Ive head yet. The bitterness makes this beer. Stone does another great job of punishing the palate with an excellent beer.

Nice golden body - great, creamy head, long lasting. Nice hoppy flavor - with a bit of sweetnest with the bitter. Im an east coast guy and on a trip to LA I finally tastaed one - now I know what the hype is about. Great smell - I could live off of this one. However, does it beat my local favorite, Dogfish Head 60? Hmmm, Id love to get to the bottom of that question, unfortunately I probably wont get a change to put the two next to each other soon.

(Draft) Golden amber color with a nice white head. Flowery citrus Hop aroma with a bit grainy sweetness. Wow there is a beautiful hops explosion that is fantastically aromatic and citrus that mellows to a bitterness on the finish. Delicious

Tight head and froth.  Gorgeous.  Tiny bubbles that just sit in the brew act like a scrim--have never seen anything like that.  Orange-red color.  Floral aroma.  Easily one of my favorite IPAs.  Loved its purity claims and entertaining definitions on the bottle.  Love the Californian Gargoyle on the bottle.  (I was in a NYC deli and saw this as a single bottle in another random six-pack.  I brought this and three other high-end beers to the counter.  The new clerk asked is boss.. how much for this such and such cider?   "Ah um," says the busy manager, "$1.75".  The clerk rings up each bottle as $1.75.   I pay my seven dollars and RUN.)

murky golden/orange color with an average head.smells of oranges and flowers.the taste is hops and a bit of grapefruit.very much like the ruination but a bit smoother.this is a very nice ipa.especially at 3.10 for a duce duce.

Pours a beautiful dark orange with a big, light tan had. Big floral hop aroma. Taste is of hoppy bitterness, which lingers, but this is balanced enough to be very refreshing. A treat that is readily available and reasonably priced.

Orange golden beer, thick foamy off-white head. Nice bitter hoppy and flowery aroma. Mild and fresh with toffee tones in the background. Hops is dominating in the flavor that has a nice sweet middle. Very well balanced bitterness. A soft and smooth beer that I could drink again and again......

Bottle. Hoppy, floral aroma, very pleasant. Golden color, white head. Lots of hops, nice and bitter, and plenty satisfying, but just enough malt flavor to offset the hops, making it very drinkable. More hops in the aftertaste, and I want an IPA to remind me what it tasted like well after the fact. I think the extra hops and alcohol in the Ruination makes this beers big brother the better of the two, but this beer is every bit as good. I could drink this every day for the rest of my life and be completely satisfied, I thank my local supermarket for being well stocked with bombers of this.

Loads of hops in the aroma, pines, citrus, and some malts in the background. Yellow/golden body, with a medium creamy white head. Very bitter flavor, good hop flavor, citrus, earthy. A very nice ipa. And very extreme...
Great IPA. Creamy/buttery head. Nice amber color..loads of flavor.  One of my favorites.

Wow! A love of hops is obviously the origin of this delightful brew.  Sweet and full with a hint of pine or maybe alcohol.  Clear, deceiving color does not alert you to the secrets locked inside the glass.  There is a space on the cooler shelf from now on for my new favorite.

Let me start by saying my expectations are sky-high, and that I love great IPAs, I will continue my review following the dots ... mmm mmm Good!  Yeah this is definitely an excellent IPA, the initial flavoring is strong and distinct.  The after-taste is unusually subtle yet powerful.  It really does an excellent job of masking the underlying power and presents itself as a hoppy giant.  Completely enjoyable and a superb brew.
Light, citrus hop aroma.  Medium mouth feel.  Difficult to describe flavor but very good.  Pleasant lingering taste. Golden color, no head retension.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2004 Sweet hops of toasted lemons. Spicey notes maybe cinnamon. Copper beauty nice amber waves of grain. Thought this would be the  1. Why should l try to fool myself and settle for less. Lovely flavor large flowery  bouquet that is hendered by temp. Yet in all still satisfyingly crisp abundent to thirst.

Light copper color, fluffy white head that lasts, nice lacing. Aromatics are very malty... almost worty with a floral citrus finish. Flavor is extremely well balanced between the hops and the malt. The bittering hops are up front and assertive but moves into a very hoppy flavor with a huge malt backbone, finishes slightly sweet. The mouthfeel is pleasant, medium and slightly dry. Very drinkable, the alcohol is a bit on the high end for a session beer... but thats okay, I enjoy it thoroughly.
Medium color, nice white head. Tastes of floral and citrus. Overall a great taste and would make a great air freshner smell!

Clear dark golden, thin but long-lasting white head. strong and potent hop aroma, grapefruit, mint, lemon, speces, and orange-peels. Big floral and citrusy hop flavour, hints of mint, honey and pine. Sharp hop bitter finish of mint, lime and grapefruit. Medium bodied.. Hop monster!
very refreshing at the end of the night.  citrus and piney hops.  actually quite well balanced.  the 6.9% is not evident at all.  probably my favorite ipa at this point.

Stone IPA pours much clearer and lighter than the Stone Pale Ale. Pours a light golden peach with a fine tantalizing white head that just coats the entire glass with sheets of beautiful lacing. Fuck, this is amazing. 

Aroma is dry, crisp, spicy and fruity with pancake batter, citrus flavor and peaches. Obvious dry hopping (I hope) with some other tropical scents. 

Honey, lemon, wheat grass, grapefruit with a sweet cedarlike finish. This is fantastic! I had never known what wonderful flavors that little hop flower could bring to beer until I tried this. I really enjoyed this!

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2004 Finally came across a STone dealer near Chicago. Thanks Liquor STop! Very nice IPA, a little clearer than Id like, but looks good nonetheless. Citrus and malts in the nose, Nice amber color with thin offwhite head. Now, I like those Piney hops in the taste. An Oh, so, nice IPA. The best Ive had...

This is a perfectly carbonated pale golden gem of a beer. The vanilla colored head is gorgeous, fluffy, and perfectly foamy. As the head slowly dissipates it leaves and abundance of thick, intricate lacing. This beer looks good! Aroma is strong and hoppy. This isnt a sensitive beer; its a full frontal assault on the senses. Aroma is loaded with big bursts of hops, grapefruit, pine, and sharp notes of alcohol. Flavor starts off sweet with malt, cherry, and berry flavors. Soon pine nut, tobacco, grapefruit, and sharp hops flavors take over. The beer finishes with a mouth filling burst of bitter hops followed by an alcohol KO. Overall, this is one of the finest beers that Ive ever had the pleasure of tasting. I cant get it locally but if I could then Id keep it on hand at all times.

One of my favorite standard IPAs. Pretty strong hop aroma and flavor but not as overpowering as some stronger beers. Surprisingly well-balanced and easy to drink. This is a great session beer in my opinion.

Pours a clear amber colour with a medium rapidly diminishing head. Aroma of fresh hop flowers. Flavour of hops but nowhere as bitter as expected from the huge hop aroma. Good mouthfeel with a dry finish.

I love stone almost as much as I love a well crafted IPA, and this is a winning combination, deep citrus intensity, layered over a delcious hop presence, this precise layering is what makes me determine this such a well balanced ale, crispy mouthfeel that maintains buoyancy while still holding a string presence, I like seeing a little sediment in my IPAs which is really the only thing this one is lacking in appearance, Ive learned that I definatly need to try more Stone ales
Good beer, although I am not a big hophead.  The hop and malt aroma was great.  The beer is crisp with lots of bitterness which lasts way after finishing the beer.
Loved the hop to malt ratio, great color and finish was average to long and with the hops they use, it was great

Good beer, but not as hoppy as I expected. However, very smooth with no aftertaste. 
Good enough to try once.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2006 Bottle:  Big piney and moderate grapefruit hops with hints of peach, apricot, and caramel.  Pours a bright transparent amber with a small white head that has fair retention.  Quick sweet caramel and apricot up front.  Hops in the finish are mostly pine with some grapefruit and floweriness.  A very well balanced IPA.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2004 from the bomber into the glass / thanks kevin! / looks a little soapy, but its smooth, clean (at first), and juicy. floralness and grapefruit dominate. amarillo in this? not sure. suprisingly, its not that bitter; perhaps my palate has been assualted from something, but theres definitely something sweet about this. the richness within this is a little stomach twister. i think this rating was done at a slightly inappropriate time. in the end of it all, the aftertaste is a bit dry and chalky. not bad, though. maybe it's because i recently had some gumballhead on tap, but i find this comparable to gumballhead and i prefer gumballhead.
Ok, this beer is supposed to be crazy hoppy, but it falls short of that expectation.  Still a good beer, but not as hopilicious as I expected.  However, very smooth with no aftertaste.  That helps.

This is my "standard" beer.  The Vons (grocery store) has been stocking this regularly, and is on sale occasionally, so i always have several bottles on hand.  In the past sierra nevada pale ale, and back when bridalveil was being bottled, either of those were my stock beer,  no longer.
this is a great beer!

Golden amber in color with a great huge floral cascade hop aroma. Huge cascade flavour, a bit dry, thinner  then Id prefer, light on the bitterness for an IPA with some tasty biscuity malt backing things up but overall a bit simplistic.
great IPA, probably the best, but onlt second to Ruination. full bodied taste, good strong hops, rich and sweeter, not very bitter, good head and thick lacing.

THIS BEER HAS A MEGA HOPPY FLAVOR AND IS CRISP SMELLING AND TASTING.  THOUGH THE AFTER TASTE IS NOT OVERBEARING, IT IS STILL ANOTHER PART OF THE BEER NOT TO BE MISSED!  THIS IS THE BEST BEER I HAVE EVER HAD!
open the bottle and Hops overflows.  great smell, thick white head, very smooth with a balancing taste of malt and hops.  very good IPA
Bottle.   Poured with a light amber color.  Large whitish head.  Aroma is like opening a bag of hops when brewing.  Flavor is smooth malt and nice hop finish.  Really nicely made.

Bottle poured a cloudy orange color with a nice head.
Strong hopps flavor with citrus  and fruit.
bitter finisg!! great beer if your into hopps hopps hopps!!

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2006 Had to re-rate.  As Ive had much more ipas recently and have had the opportunity to learn,  this is much better than initially tasted.
Freshness  is what comes off this brew.   Citrus and pine esthers take me away to another place.  Easy-drinking balanced ale with ample body along with the hop presence.  Very dry finish with the requisite bitter finish.  Not over-done as I believe Ruination to be.  But hey,  I may just have to re-rate that one, too.

Orange and pine hop nose. Good clarity in orange golden body with dense and lasting white head.Very nice lacing. Bitterness though noticable does not seem overpowering. Sweet malts shine through to balance nicely. Orange and spicy pine-like flavours in the crisp, dry finish. Body is medium. Alcohol not at all apparent. Very tasty. Bottle. Thanks Dorwart.

Great IPA from an awesome brewery! Nice orange color with the same flavor nose. Wonderful hop aroma and full taste. Kind of a fleeting finish compared to many IPAs, but still leaves you wanting more. Very good IPA

The grim, growling gargoyle glares at you from the label, both offering protection from all things bland and dire, and also daring those not ready to indulge in a torrent of flavor to begone, and be untroubled by these blissful beers.
Appearance: a perfect, peachy hue, and a good, frothy white head.
Nose: somethin else! A panoply of fruit, a citric cornucopia! Peaches and apricot, grapefruit, pineapple, melon, berries, and more, all in one little aroma!
Alert and lively, zesty, generous, and gorgeous!
Taste: superb! Fantastic flavor, yet none too bitter. A huge blast of hops jumps on the tongue, but not so severely. A firm body, also, excellent balance and malt backbone. 
More of a piney feel comes through as we drink, but its a minor note among so many others. Finish is medium, but tasty and satisfactory.
This is an IPA the way they are supposed to be! 
If these excellent ales were available in my area, you can be sure that my fridge would be stocked well with these! Tasty, and drinkable, and rewarding!
GOOD BEER--- BUUUUUURP . Thank You sir may I have another and another and another.... has a little kick and a lot of taste. one of my personal faves....

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2004 Clear golden brew with not much head.A fantastic nose.Like some one just smashed a fresh Florida Grapefruit in your face.That hoppy scent is so hard not to love.Wowie Zowie ( old Frank Zappa song ) that lovely bitterness from the hops is enough to stop your heart !!! Then a nice floral finish makes this a dynamite IPA.
Yes, its hoppy. Had it on tap and from bottle. Both were very enjoyable. Its better on the colder side.
Excellent.  Hop Heads Unite!  Amazing brewery.  These beers stand out.  IPA is addictive with an amazing amount of hops and bitterness.
This one poured with a very hoppy, citrusy scent and a dark orange-brown hue. Lawdy,  this beer does have a chewy, hoppy taste that embraces the tongue! This is a GOOD  beer!

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2006 I just had to rerate this one, as it as vastly improved this year. This IPA has a super hoppy taste that is refreshing, tastes like a fresh spring day! Great finish of more hops, and very fragrant. This is a classic!!

Wow--a truly unique, refreshing brew.  Pours a remarkable golden color.  Aroma is strong and citrusy, and quickly permeates a large room.  The initial taste is one of amazing character--an obvious bitter taste of hops, but also combined with a distinct maltiness and a spicy citrus flavor.  The body is medium, as advertised, and the finish is smooth, citrusy and very long-lasting.  The alcohol warms the stomach intensely.  If you can withstand the bitterness, this is a beer with amazing character.

Best before 9-2-04.Aroma is a perfect balance of pale malts and a tease of crystal with some nice earthy hops,very little citrus or grapefruit compared to say the Smutty IPA.Nice deep gold with a somewhat short head with some good lacing.This beer is all about balance and overall quality.Lots of hops with the same amout of malt to make this one hell of a session IPA.Very nice but like many hyped beers,I wanted more hops.Maybe next time?

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2012 Even after all of these years this is one of my favorite IPAs .+++ Sampled from a 12 oz bottle this fine brew pours a clear orange color with a medium sized yellowish head. There is a strong hop aroma with both flowery and grapefruity elements. The flavor is heavily hopped with much grapefruit coming through but there is also a strong malt presence that balances this beer far better than their Ruination.

The head vanishes almost instantly but the crisp bitter bite of this brew makes up for any set backs in its appearance or aroma.  You got to give it up to Stone brewers for creating these damn good recipes and expierments they do.

Best IPA Ive had to date...no question. Pronounced hops but not rough on the taste buds. Beautiful deep gold color and thick head. Citrus flavor with little aftertaste. The above average acohol content gives it a warm feeling on the way down. Well done stone. Ill have to try the rest of the line.

Pours a deep golden colour with a thick head. Standard I.P.A. aromas ie. citrus hops, malts. The taste is a knockout punch. Big hops,pine, citrus, grapefruit, some peaches strong malt backbone, nice mouthfeel. A great I.P.A.

Thanks to Lord Gorlock for this one.  Pours a amber/golden color with fairly active carbonation and a rocky, dense head.  Aroma is wonderful, fruity hops and not much else.  Flavor is very tasty, but lack balance.  Of course, this is an American IPA, so what did I expect?  Hop flavor is exceptional, and mouthfeel is smooth.  Great lacing in glass.  Id definitely like to try more beers by this brewer.

poured a light golden color with a thick whte with impressice retention.  Flavor was  mildly sweet with a good hoppy bite that was not to overpowering just right for the other flavors in the beer.  I could detect a skight lemony presence in aroma and flavor. good ipa

Pours a nice light copper color. Very aromatic. Smells very hoppy with some sweetness. Power hop flavor. They did it with this IPA, very hoppy but so well balanced. Little alcohol kick at to give it a nice finish.

Poured bright orange with a thin short lasting head...smelled a little sweet with strong earthy undertones...a little malty and first on the tongue and then very very hoppy...finished crisp and warm...great IPA

12 oz. bottle.  Pours light brown/orange with a fairly small, white head that almost completely disappears.  Aroma is hops, slight alcohol, honey, and perhaps slight citrus.  Flavor is immediately slightly malty sweet and very, very hoppy, with a tiny alcohol warmth on the way down; pronounced grassiness in the middle.  Aftertaste is remarkably bitter, but pretty clean.  Not as clean and crisp on the palate as Id like, wth a slighty syrupiness to the beer.  Is this a 4.1?  Hell, no.  Really good, IPA, though?  Sure.
a honey hue w/nice hoppy aroma & flavor, an IPA worth trying.  great bitter taste.

Bottled.  Good sized head, color like in the picture, kind of golden honey with some orange, great lacing, fully lasting head, crystal clear...beautiful, beautiful beer.  Very aromatic...sweet, grapefruit, honey, sugar, floral; smells like a good IPA.  Front is sweet and malt laden honey and sugar, middle is more balanced with hops and finish is definite hops, powerful hops, but the malts are fully lasting and some alcohol flavor comes in to balance out the hops...its fantastic.  Bitter, fantastically bitter, but nearly balanced with a long lasting...balanced...finish, slightly sweet.  Wow.  Fullish medium body, some syrupy character, pleasant, lively carbonation.  Good from start to finish and Im having another.

12oz bottle  Big head, looks great, malt, hops, yeast...its all there in the nose, real nice medium bodied at best, nice drinker, bitter leafy finish.  Well integrated IPA. Drank out of the St. Vrain.

wow..., great ipa best ipa ive had. amber,/golden body, small to medium head. great hoppy ipa taste. awesome taste , awesome taste. just great all around. smooth just, awesome flavor, best ipa ive had. great aftertaste and finish.

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2004 I am thankful I can find this beer easily. It has an awesome citrus and floral aroma. The taste is quite bitter and easy to sip on. This stuff is addictive and I will continue to purchase this! RERATE : Had this again tonight oh yeah baby, better than I thought!

On tap. Met 2 friends at a bar and I recommend a round of Stone IPAs. The other 2, having been raised on swill, did not like it. Me neither. I LOVED IT! And I got to drink their pints also! Orange/amber color with a firm but small white head. Incredible citrusy hop aroma. Great hop bitterness which was even better by the time I finished the 3rd
pint. My new favorite IPA.(for now)

Best IPA Ive tried yet. Simply perfect. Great light amber/golden appearance with a medium white head. Aroma is well balanced of fruits and hops. Flavor is well-hopped, not too complex, but just great. Slightly citrus, crisp. Could easily drink a bunch of these. Great.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2004 Favorite IPA -- hops are everywhere without making the beer lazy.  Anyone can throw a ton of hops into a beer, but they seem to have found the perfect amount at Stone.  The Ruination IPA is nice too, but I think this beer is even tastier.  DRINK!

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2007 Nice looking orange-golden colour with a thick lasting off-white head.  Nice citrus grapefruit, pine, resiny aroma with some spicy character as well.  Flavour is surprisingly sweet and fruity with plenty of malt to back up the hops.  Some cookie dough character also ends up in here.  Nowhere near as bitter as I had been expecting but a fantastic well balanced IPA.
This is a beer I can drink on a regular basis, one of the best IPAs. Stone knows what theyre doing haha. Nice tangy taste and a great orange/copper color to it. Great citrus aroma. Cant beat it.
Just an amazing work of IPA art. This is a brew you can spend night after night after night with. Or come home to on a hot summer day. You know it will never let you down.

wow, let me tell you. THis stuff is pretty darn good. Pours a beautiful copper/orange/amber mix with a medium sized medium lasting white head. THe nose is sweet with hops and the taste is sharp with hops that finish bitter with a tang of sweetness. Pretty good. one of the better IPAs that I have had. Not overly powerful.

on [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ in brooklyn. i dunno, every new stone beer i taste i expect might be the one to really convince me how good this brewery is. but this seemed like a pretty typical ipa. a huge amount of hops and some decent marmalade and doughnut sweetness. nothing wrong with it in particular

Oh, Mama!  Been drinking many great IPAs of late and this is one of them.  This golden/amber nectar with a frothy white head attacks the nose with that citrus/hops aroma Im coming to love.  Mouthfeel was smooth and creamy and lightly carbonated.  The flavor was, well, awesome.  Clean, crisp, refreshing citrus notes.  Just a great brew.

When it comes to IPAs, it doesnt get much better than this.  Citrus, lemony hop aroma mirrored with similar flavors.  Not overpowering but enough to fulfill you.  Spicy lingering finish.  
Medium boided with nice carbonation.  Well done.
Bottle. Medium white head with orange color.  Stong hop aroma of grapefruit that carries over into the flavor.  Long hop finish.

Bottle.  pours a lovely orange color with hops apparent immediately.  amazing aroma of hops, a bit of malt, and jasmine as well as other flowers.  the taste is also packed with hops but not overly bitter, again a jasmine like flavor almost like jasmine tea but more bitter.  very refreshing brew, great for the summer...one of the best ipas ive had!!!!

Bottle. hops, yeah, we got that. pours a cloudy orange yellow with a fluffy white head that sticks around to a lesser degree. has a very strong. Very strong hoppy, citrus aroma. the taste is a solid citrus/hoppy flavor that is strong without overpowering.  this is the best IPA Ive had. finishes with a touch of malt creaminess(i dont know if there is any malt in this, but that is the taste i get). but the flavor is great. it is fruity without being cloying and extremely hoppy without overpowering. this is an extremely well made beer.

Bottle. Nose is easy to describe: hops, lemon, and a little black pepper. Taste is f*****g amazing. I dont know if words can describe this, but I will try. Clean, fresh taste, with a little zest. Mouthfeel is full and very clean. First tastes notes are Early Grey tea, lemon, and black pepper. Second notes are carbonation and wood/pine. Finish is slightly dry and clean. This is hands down the most balanced beer I have ever had. This is the IPA in which I will forever measure other IPAs against.
Very nice IPA.  Purchased a 22oz bottle from a local beer store.  Enjoyed so much I had them order me in a case.

Bomber, from CA, 06.17.04  Pours a lightish (for an IPA) golden amber with average, thick head and immediate lacing.  Hops aromas are floating about the room, sweet flowers like honeysuckle, orange blossoms.  Smells absolutely scrumptious.  Flavors are very nicley balanced; sweet, malty, and pungent; fruity hops. I wish the ABV was lower since its just an IPA, not a double - Id like to drink a bunch and 7% prohibits that.  Great feel; wet and refreshing with a quick hop bite.  If I lived on the West Coast, I could imagine this being my everyday IPA.  Living on the East Coast, Im not ashamed to consistently enjoy DFH 90min and Smuttynose IPA - this beer is right on par with those.  Very good, but overrated on this site.
