Bitter and Hoppy from the start. Stone IPA is cascading hops with that bitter undertone. Excellent Beer!!! Hoppy and gets sweet closer to finish. Nothing more to say but Stone is awesome beer.

Light amber with a medium diminishing frothy off white head.  Aroma of pine, resin, grapefruit, bread, apricot, caramel.  Slightly astringent.  Medium watery body with lively carbonation.  Strong flavor of grapefruit, pine, toast, apricot and pepper.  Refreshing. Very good, although a little astringent.  Big thanks to DocLock for sending this to me!

Bottle:  Medium amber w/ a lasting white head.   Lemony citrus & toasty malt; medium fruitiness, malt also lighly bready, but citrusy hop dominates.   Seems to be lightly solventy piney/hairspray aroma when it warms.  Well balanced w/ a citrus hop flavor, a little too well balanced IMHO for an IPA, bu t I didnt make it!  Light caramel, malty, hop flavored finish & aftertaste.  Drier m/f, alcohol a little warming, but mostly well hidden, medium body.  Im still not a hop head, but fully enjoyable for an IPA.  Not quite as bitter as I expected, especially from Stone, but still very good.
A nice and smooth IPA that has tons on floral hops within.  Very drinkable, but not as drinkable as I thought it was going to be.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2004 Bottled.  Clear tangerine color with fluffy white head.  This had a very potent hop aroma and a beautiful flavor dominated by hops but also full of fruity notes.  A truly awesome IPA.

Pours a cloudy golden-amber, almost similar to a wheat beer, with a nice 1/2 head. Hops are readily present in the aroma, along with slight hints of fruit. The hoppy flavor may appear overwhelming at first, but is nicely balance out with malt for a smooth, crisp finish. Full boddied, crisp, tasty, and well worth a try.
On tap at the brewery:Golden orange with a moderate head and great lacing. Nose is cascade hops, apricot and orange. Flavour is bitter and hoppy but well balanced.
Wonderful in every respect, my favorite part has got to be the middle, with its brilliant hoppiness and an almost sweet finish
UPDATED: FEB 26, 2009 A great IPA.  My favorite.  Great hoppy flavor, but still sweet enough.  Has a nice thick feel, and is light enough to be very drinkable.  I could drink this stuff all night!

22oz bomber...clear copper pour with a large off white head.  Wonderfully floral hop aroma.  Slight metallic aroma is detectable also.  Nicely hopped, easy beginning, building to a rather intense middle and a strong ending.  Nice bitterness beckons for another sip.

bottled: i have had this a couple of times as many of us have and i really cant say enough. this to me is the standard for american IPAs. its unbelievable. now ive argued the arrogant and double bastard hype...they arent that great but are good. this is stones great beer. one hundred percent over the top hop kick you in the ass style flavor. the golden color on the beer is almost hypnotic, not your typical color and look. just perfection in a glass. more of a floral hops then citrus and vanilla buttery smoothness. i enjoy this to ruination just because its a notch down with a little less alcohol that is very drinkable. this is the benchmark and the goldstandard. lets see someone outdo this. im rarely this kind to beers but this is superb.
Beautiful, golden color.  Great head.  Great tastes, oh the hops.  It was bitter, but in the best possible way.  I want more.
Looks very nice, mild sweet hoppy taste. Nicely balanced. Overall a fine brew.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2004 Bottled from Happy Deli NYC-pourd a light golden orange, White head.aroma is hopps and citrus.Taste is bitter but not overpowering,.crisp clean mouthfeel, I could drink this all the time.

Slightly hazy amber body, medium sized frothy white head.  Aroma abounds with hops; piney, resiny, delicious hops.  Flavor is the same, big citrus notes and lots of sticky hops.  This is backed up by a sweet malty backbone and it finishes dry and peppery.  Im so glad I finally got my hands on some Stone brews!  Even my girlfriend loved it and shes normally not an IPA fan at all.
Too a trip to Dallas and had the chance to pick this brew that is unavailble to us in Fl. The aroma was as hoppy as I have ever had and the finish is dry and bitter. Good beer if this is your style

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2008 As far as an IPA goes, this is perfection. Pours a perfect amber color with a great white head that lasts long and it leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is filled with hops. Taste is slightly sweet at first then ends with a nice light bitterness. Very smooth and creamy. Great brew.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2004 mmmmm...hops.  It is a clear rich gold poor with a nice white head.  Very nice citrusy, floral hops in the aroma.  Oh, but the hops are a powerful (and pleasureable) presence.  Slight malty sweetness help balance those oh so lovely biting hops.  I really love this one and would have it again in a heart beat.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2015 Very bold and fruity but a bit creamier than most IPAs. A very good offering. I hope to find more Stone IPA variations to compare against.

3/15 Years later this really is still a Benchmark American IPA, less fruity than mAny, hop forward and has some weight. Great Malt balance, even some subtle chocolate for me.
Pours golden clear with a small white head. Aroma is pure hops as expected, but this one does not impress me.  Grapefruit rind and hops in the taste.  Good, but not great.

True IPA aroma, hoppy nose, very refreshing. Gold, small bubbles, small but long lasting lace. Bitter at front, medium full body. Crisp, refreshing, great for session time. Very nice but you can find more refined competitors IPA around.

Golden-orange colour with a decent white head. Aroma is big and hoppy and flowery. Flavour of hops, hops and more hops, with enough malty sweetness to keep it in line. My first Stone beer, and it was pretty much what I expected - hoppy and good.

Thanks Radek! Appearance is a golden colour with a white as can be head. Aroma is hoppy......very hoppy. Cascade hops here? Anyway, the smell makes your mouth water. Taste is hoppy bitterness to the max. Everything about this beer is hops and bitterness up the ying yang. Nice one Stone!
Clear copper with a white head, large bubbles. Fruity nose, hoppy, with citrus notes. Flavor slightly sweet, a bit thin, very bitter with grapefruit and violet notes.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2007 Oct 2007. Lightly hazy orange body with a modest creamy off white head. Modest resiny hop aroma. Moderate bitterness throughout, light resiny character, very muted citrus notes. Smooth average to medium palate. Hops are pleasant but surprisingly muted. May have sat in the cellar just a bit too long. 7/3/7/3/15.

May 2004 Rerate - Hoppier aroma and a lot more resiny than the previous sample. Upped the aroma and overall 1 pt each.

May 2004. Thanks for bringing this great find Radek! (and Tim for the wee bottle I took home with me) Golden yellow colour with a solid white head. Nice hoppy aroma and plent of hoppy bitterness but not nearly as much of either as I expected. Fairly well balanced which I was not expecting either. Very drinkable, and a very nice beer but a bit disappointing. I will likely re-rate with the bottle in the fridge and a fresher palate.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2005 Pours a dark golden color with a small head.  Scent is very fruity and the taste give you a blast of hops. Then the aftertaste of even more hops kicks in. A great IPA, not as good as Dogfish Head however.
This IPA is a hop heads paradise! Powerful hoppy bitterness with toasted, carmel malt. Slight toffee flavor. fruity and good. Another nice one from stone!
This is my favorite beer.  The hops, lord this has the best hoppy taste ever, very complicated, multilayered.    Head is great.

The aroma is exactly my idea of IPA. Some malts, hint of fruit and lovely hops. Could have more body, the hops overpower the malts, but more of both wouldnt hurt. Id call this a very nice session ale.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2012 actually, this is one of the better IPA´s I´ve tasted, but I´m not exactly a IPA man. Dark yellow amber colour, very hoppy citrus aroma,  taste was VERY pleasantly hoppy, nice finish. NICE IPA!

re-rate
now a hop addict, world class

Golden w/ orange hue. Dense, fluffy white head. Crisp, fresh citrus aroma w/ an almost tropical fruit character. Sticky, resiny feel. Big, hoppy flavour w/ some nice biscuity malt & just a hint of mint. Long, extremely bitter finish.
Love it, but still missing something. I could drink this beer forever though. one of the better IPAs
Bottle. Great pale orange color with a nice white head. Smooth mouthfeel, plenty of alcohol kick, and that floral aroma. From start to finish, outstanding.
Yet again, another terrific beer from Stone!  Great coloring, flavor, and aroma.  this beer has it all, if you love ipas this has to be one of the best.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2006 Great orange color, with a white head.  This was something special.  I really enjoyed the flavor and texture.  a great beer. 7/3/3/5/18

RERATE: Dark pale color with super thin ring of white film.  Very fresh aroma. Floral light citrus aroma.  Flavor is fresh, light malt sweetness. Dry bitter finish.

Great aroma, hops and grapefruit. Color is a nice gold. Taste is mostly the same as aroma, hops and grapefruit. Body medium to thin. Hops/bitterness is not overwhelming. The taste improves as it warms.

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2008 I always heard it was good, and boy did it smell good upon cracking it open. The amount and types of hops they use make a very nice bouquet of pine/citrus hop notes. Upon pouring it out it had a large foamy white head. It is a very smooth beer with a somewhat bitter after-taste, but not too bitter. A great very clean tasting beer, you can tell they do it right.

Poured a deep amber/orange with a large frothy white head. Strong floral hoppy smell with hints of citris and malts. Smooth to drink. Bitterness after taste is almost done to perfection (not too much and not too less).

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2004 22 oz bottle:  this beer is truly delish! i could drink it ALL DAY LONG.  or until i passed out.  milky frothy white hed, looks like fluffy clouds. the color is one of orange and gold combined. Smells of, um hops?  This brew puckers my lips at first encounter, it's sticky, resiny, and pungent as a mofo. The mouthfeel is smooth and buttery, and slight malts too.  i'm way into it. stone leaves you wanting more and more, tastes better everytime in my opinion.

Tap (5/03/04): I think this is the beer I had (not anniversary).  Pours with a golden, clear color with a nice frothy, white head.  Aroma: lemon, hops, spice, orange.  Flavor: initial sour lemon, orange rind, citrus, hops, dish soap, apple.  Aftertaste: sweet lemon, fortune cookie.

Stone IPA pours a golden color with some miniscule floaties.  It has a huge, frothy, white head that lasts forever.

The nose is huge on hops (kind of on the grassy, piney side)!  There are also some grapefruit tones.  Very appealing!

The taste is hop juice up front, leading to some citrusey, bready malt.  It ends with a big, bitter hop finish and aftertaste.  Its medium bodied and fairly well balanced - though it obviously favors the hops over the malts.  The slight malt and citrus help balance it well.

Overall, this is probably the best IPA Ive had to date.  Its a nose ahead of Avery IPA and Victory Hop Devil.

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2007 Orangey amber, white head, PNW hops. Nice mouthfeel, citric, piney, mildly sweet, nicely drinkable. RERATE 5/14/04: I keep coming back to this one. Of the four Stone beers that Ive tried, this one is the nicest. RERATE 11/07: Sort of watery, kiss of caramel and maybe butterscotch, piney Centenials. Refreshing.

Beautiful aroma--tons of pine with hints of citrus.  Smells very yummy.  Pour is a transparent copper with a quicky dissipating fine white head.  Creamy hoppy, bitter, butterish tasting.  Hints of citrus in there as well.  Very 1 dimensional, but good.  An upper-level IPA. (Southern Tier--must re-rate, Hopdevil, and SMuttynose come to mind)

Juicy, sweet hops.  This is really the standard for IPAs in my book.  The hop/malt ratio is balanced so delicately that the bite is rounded out beautifully by a spicy, sweetness. If I could have an every day beer on tap this would be it!

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2004 Pours a light amber, filtered, with a bubbly off-white head.  Flowery, citrusy aroma.  Slightly bitter, tastes of citrus...almost grapefruity...and flowers.  Very dry and crisp.  Overall, delicious.

This is a new IPA, sporting a gargoyle emblem. A transparent bottle that really shows big bubbles in there. A bit dry aftertaste a surprise but otherwise a nice drink. Can be session starter or go with food. Hops and citrus. However bitterness.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2004 Nice Rocky Head. Amber in Colour. The Flavour is of Hops in the IPA tradition. The Head dissipates slowly.WOW! This packs a Hop Wallop. The Alcohol is present as the flavours of Malt, Caramel, Grapefruit and Tangerine Prevail. This is one Creamy Concoction with Hops in Abundance. Prepare yourself to enjoy this brew with great Vigor. Salud!
UPDATED: JAN 27, 2006 Very hoppy, with citric overtones. The bitterness is prevalent but well balanced.

Pours dark gold, with a nice white head and great lacing.  I swear I saw the Taj Mahal in my lace!  Very hoppy aroma, with some citrus.  Tastes very hoppy, with a dry, bitter hoppiness.  Finishes very smooth and complex, with a creamy, hoppy, great mouthfeel.  A delicious IPA, and worth seeking out.  One of the best, as usual, from Stone.

Boy this smooth.  Its hoppy but the finish is rather abrupt.  Mouthfeel is excellent.  A little on the floral side which is a negative to me.  Nice malt understones.  This went down way too fast for a 6.9%er.
UPDATED: SEP 13, 2006 Golden yellow.  White head.  Lots of hops.  Aroma and flavor are dominated by them, of course.  Very good IPA.  Gotta get it fresh.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2005 An outstanding IPA.  Very smooth with well blended flavors.  Pours an enticing golden color, with a small white head.  If you want to introduce someone to IPAs, this is the choice.  Does not have as strong of a citrus aroma and bitterness as most IPAs.  Also, the bitterness does not kick you in the back of the throat like some IPAs (not that that that is a bad thing, but its tough for a person new to IPAs to get used to).  The bitterness kind of builds slowly to a crescendo, and then slowly fades.  Great beer.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2005 Re-rate 1/24/05 - Beautiful light amber pour with a small but long lasting head that leaves a good amount of lace.  Strong hope nose, pine and floral hop bitterness.  Wonderful body, not too thick or thin.  Great hop profile, a very smooth hop bite and a long pleasing aftertaste, backed by a great malt body.

Draft, Golden colored beer. Hops dominate the aroma and flavor. But I was surprised by the malt backbone in this one (I know it's Stone, but I thought I remembered less malt). There's also a little creaminess to this. Very good.
I prefer the Ruination, but this is quite excellent.  Decent hop flavor.  Expensive in my area though.
22 oz bottle. Clear off yellow color with a lasting white head. Big hoppy aroma. Flavor is hoppy with a nice hop flavor/bitterness component. Extremely well made and drinkable.
user_location: Good Beer Bar Deprived, New Jersey, USA

text:
UPDATED: JAN 24, 2006 Small head, but leaves a fizziness on top of the beer. Body is an attractive gold color which really catches the light. It is very yeasty towards the bottom, so be careful when pouring if you dont want it. Aroma is full of mostly hops and some yeast. Hops aroma is a citrus (grapefruit, orange, and lemon) plus some sort of piney resin thing. Yeast hints are a barnyard/silage type of thing. Taste is very smooth and bitter. Full of lemon, grapefruit, and orange which acts as a sweetener to me. Mouthfeel is slightly lacking, its a little watery and slightly oily. But the flavor is definitely there.
Side note: 12oz bottle doest seem quite as good (10/7/2004). Another update (1/24/2006), 12oz seems pretty good, but do notice it isnt bottle conditioned like the bomber.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2004 Pale gold brown clear with a medium size and medium lasting head and some real nice lace. Stunning aromatic and floral aroma bursts forth on opening the bottle and pouring this beer. Flavour is like the aroma but with added passion fruit and rosewater/turkish delight. Lingering crisp bitter hoppy finish. It's even good enough to consider changing ones fave style.
I'm not a fan of hops, but certainly not a fan of this beer --I will say the alchy is up there! ;)
Not for those who do not appreciate hops...hey, it's from Stone Brewing.  Deep golden color, hops in the nose and on the tongue.  I like hops.

Good fecking Christ! What an IPA. What a beer. Definitely on my top 5 IPAs of all time. So much of everything right in this beer that I don't even know where to begin. It's a benchmark by which to judge all other IPAs.

pours golden/amber, yellow at edges.  fine rocky white head that lasts.  good fizz.  medium hoppy nose and pleasant complex floral aroma.  I'm not a hop-head, so I was worried this might be strong for it's class, but I was so wrong.  the start was surprisingly sweet and malty, then hoppy.  the hops are there, but this is very well balanced.  there are so many IPAs out there that are too hoppy for me, but this is tight.  buying these in sixpacks is a very good thing!!

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2004 Ahhh... such a masterpiece here. Pours a deep gold with a fluffy white head.  The head commonly sticks around till the beer is gone, and leaves decent lacing all the way down.  The aroma is quite hoppy and wonderful.  The taste... wow.  Wonderful fresh hop flavor balanced by the ideal amount of sweet, light malts.  Perfectly bitter too.  Malts kind of creep around the sides, evident but recognizing their place in this beer.  Body and mouthfeel are just flawless... wow.  I love this IPA.  Its not my favorite... but it is damn near perfect.  Ive been lucky enough to have had it bottled and on tap quite a bit in the last week- on tap the hops are a bit fresher tasting and more evident, but its definately very similar. :) (edited on 6/10 because apparently I had a cascade pellet stuck in my nose.)

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2004 Beer pours with a lovely golden, tan rue that is broken up by a frothy bubbly luscious head. Its nose is incredibly satisfying. Earthy, flowery and fruitilly bitter. Very smooth mouthfeel - almost silky. Perhaps the most truly delightful aspect of this brew is how its hoppy tartness is juxtaposed against its acidic palate. All in all look for this brew to smell wonderful, taste roundly bitter, fade into acidity and make love to your mouth.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2006 Frothy white head over a clear golden/amber body.  Caramelly-sweet aroma that centers heavily no silage (musky acidity).  The flavor has a leafy sweetness with a sour, bitter hop taste.  Smooth mouthfeel.  This beer is well-made but its kind of one-dimensional in terms of hopping.  To me, it has too strong of an acidic tartness.

1/24/06 - 12oz bottle thanks to Blake.  Orange blossom honey and zippy orange peel in the aroma.  Fantastic aroma!  The flavor still has the silagey grapefruity tartness but its very enjoyable.
On draft at Charlie's pub in Olde City.  Super pour.  This one tastes fuller and drier than today's other IPAs (Yards, DFH 60).

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2005 Best IPA ive ever had.  The aroma just blows you away.  Citrisy lime and grapefruit scents.  Taste is smooth with a lasting hoppy/citris flavor.  Cant believe this beer has 6.9% alcohol.  You dont taste it at all!  Great beer!

I am a big fan of IPAs and this is definitly among the best, if not the best everall. The commercial description says it perfectly by saying crisp and refreshing bitter character. The sweet hints also further enhance the beer.

Bottle.

Nice golden/orange hue, massive creamy head that left more lace on my glass than ANY beer I've ever had!  Amazing structure!

Nose is fresh, cascade hops forward and lots of them, I don't get much maltiness here.  Essence of grass, lime, pine resin, peach.

Mouthfeel is smooth and full, some maltiness, but the hops are acidic and over-the-top, drowning out the maltiness in a sea op hops.  I guess it's medium sweet, but the hops and their acidic tartness throw the balance to the dry side, leaving a bit of tongue-bite as though I'd been smoking a pipe to long.  Fresh hops flavor, clean sharp finish.
Very drinkable for an IPA, and I wouldn't call myself a hophead really.  Nice.

Great grassy hop aroma dominates but there is some malt at the end. Poured with a white full head, clear yellow in color. Good hop bitterness but it has a balance of some malt sweetness in the finish. As the flavor fades the finish gets dry and bitter. This is a good overall IPA there wasn't the crystal malt flavor that I have seen in other IPA's. I still like the DFH 60 min more but this is also a good IPA that I would drink again.

Pale golden body with a massive beige head that refused to die due to nice natural carbonation.  Aroma is floral, grassy, piney hops with an infusion of yeasty bready malt.  The taste is a wonderland of hops with spicy-hot pine resin like quality to the beginning of each sip.  Following that first assault by the hops, there are additional waves of grapefruit rinds, black pepper, marigold, and orange blossom.  The malt adds a butterscotch like sweetness to the mix, and the yeast adds a grittyness to the mouthfeel.  This is one of the absolute great IPAs anywhere.  I thank 123456green for the bomber, and look forward to the day when I can get this at my local store.

Another score for stone brewing company.  This heavily hopped american IPA is a beauty.  Copper/bronze and clear with vivacoius bubbles and average head with a gorgeous hop aroma.  As an IPA lover and hophead I appreciate the somewhat overtly hopped nature of the beer.  It is certainly a little out of balance in favor of the hops though.  The malt is just there like a backdrop, a canvas for Lee Chase's bitter palate of warrior, centennial, and whatever else he has hiding in there.  I could buy a six-pack of this and drink two a night after work and be happy.
very nice speciman, not a world beater,  floral nose, moderate citrus, good astringent finish, maybe it is a world beater but it will be a while before I get another chance to sample - too bad
Smooth, perfectly floral, a beautiful color, and tasty beyond belief. The perfect IPA.

There is something special about this beer! I can't put my finger on what it is but I really want to quaff this one. There is a sort of sweet-tart flavor there that teases you to tip it back and finish it. Looks fairly standard with a medium white head and an orange/yellow color. Aroma is outstanding with truckloads of citris and flowery hop, almost pollen like. Flavor is undescribable with citris and flowers, sweet malt just tickling your senses. Yes this will be a regular for me from here on out.

smells AWESOME.  hops, citrus, spicy, a wonderful aroma.  pours out a light brown color with a small white head.  still cant get over the smell of this.  now the taste- oh my god. this is great.  this is the best IPA i have ever drank this is awesome.  hops hops hops, spicy with a dry aftertaste that goes down so smoooth.  if you have never had this, go find one and drink it.  had this rating posted, and thought i would add a comment- this would work as something i could slam down until i was unaware of my real name.  this is so good.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2004 I agree with all those seduced by the smell of this beer: like a summerdress in a field of cornflowers! The appearence is less inspiring, a kind of taco-shell yellow with a sudsy head. The texture is so pleasingly velvet and the flavor kind of reminds me of waffles and oranges. I expect the hops to be overwhelming, given the reputation of Stone, but they are not: generous and fresh and fruity but not overwhelming. Gentlemen, nits can be picked here, but lets face it, this is one of Southern California's most important beers, a very complicated refreshing and exciting beer that surprises with every sip.

Soapy/sudsy white head on top of a clear orange yellow body.  Big malty aroma with plenty of citrusy hops coming through.  Aroma is just excellent.  Flavor doesn't quite live up to the scent.  Soft, sweet, easy drinking.  Lacks a bit of the hop bite I like in an IPA.  Very orangey flavors. Juicy mouthfeel ends fairly dry.  Real good brew but not my favorite IPA.

Poured a light, clear copper colour, with a decent head. A little more clear than what I had expected.

Smells, well like an IPA should, clean and crisp of citric hops.

Taste is strong of citric hops with a lightly sweet malt background continuing throughout.

Mouthfeel I found disturbingly thin, not because it is really thin but because it was thnner than a well built pale ale, and I expect an IPA to have a heavier mouthfeel than an APA.

Overall this is a good, well-built beer, just not as good as expectation and hype. I'd drink again, most definitely, but I won't hold this up as the best IPA I've ever had, it's not.

Draught, at Craft Bar, 43East 19th Street, Manhattan.  Amber with a ringlet lacy white head. Super hoppy aroma with a viscous hop syrup flavour & texture. Aroma is sweet then bitter. You could almost say that the beer is obnoxiously hoppy. It does have a certain velvet quality to its palate but I dont think this extreme hopping does the beer any favours. It's an IPA for the sensory disabled.
Aroma is hoppy but complex. Amber appearance with medium head. Flavor is pleasent blend of hops and bitter. Good with mild/medium cigar.

UPDATED: SEP 24, 2004 I prefer this to the overdone Ruination.   The floral aroma is interesting in its strength and durability, but the flavor is slightly unbalanced (a source of pride for Stone), as all the hops come up front.  There is an admirable chewy thickness and livliness that is enjoyable.  I'm still not a Stone devotee. Crisp finish.
excellent, with all the hoppiness you could want, it,s number one on my list

UPDATED: APR 23, 2005 Citrusy (oranges and lemons) aroma.  Cloudy medium/light orange body with a not so white foamy head.  Really good taste  Orange and grapefruit taste very dominent in the hops with a smooth honey-like finish.  Incredible IPA.
UPDATED: MAY 5, 2008 A damn good IPA, my favorite up to this point.  Very hoppy yet not too overbearing bitterness.  When i think west coast IPA, this is ideal.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2004 big on hops, somewhat cloudy but rich and full of rich malty flavors. could use a little more hops in the aftertaste area. Nice smooth finish, as it warms becomes somewhat rich and full body. Very good beer to have stocked in the box.

Poured a slightly hazy golden/copper color, moderate head. Big hop aroma, a little citrusy, some underlying malt. Flavor is big on hops but has enough buttery malt to back it up. Lingering bitter finish. Smooth round body. A damn fine IPA.

Clear dark golden color with big off-white head. Ummmm, lots of Northwest hops in the aroma, and some malt. Bitter at first, in the middle, and the end, with lingering hop aftertaste. There is malt to back it up though. A very good Amercan-style IPA.
This IPA was explosive in my mouth.  I could tell if I was coming or going.  I enjoyed every second.  Normally the alcohol would be too high, but it seemed to hold well with the dry hopped demon.
Translucent amber, fairly small head. Cascade hop aroma is quite strong. Grapefruity. Super-hoppy, crisp. Malty adds the perfect balance. An awesome IPA.

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2004 Bright orange color with a foamy white head that leaves pretty, sticky lacing down the glass.  Big hop aromas and full malt flavors to balance it.  Rather robust.  Finishes clean with a bit of hops hanging on.  Huge without being over the top.    This is one of those beers that I forget about.  It's so good, but I seem to pass on it for other IPA's often only to wish I had selected this one.  The fact that it's so readily available here in Ohio has me taking it for granted.  For shame!

Immediately reminded me of Bridgeports' IPA, which is very good.  Since I had that beer a long time ago, I can't tell which is better, but this is also a very good beer.  Aroma is great, of fruits.  Cloudy orange with a nice sized head.  Very smooth drinking despite having a strong hops character.  Very solid overall.

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2004 Overall nice malt flavor, but the hops almost came off as "burnt".  I'm not sure how that's possible. Weird. The fact that I saw my first girlfight in a nice bar while sipping this has to count for something lol

Aroma:  scents of hops, malts, and tropical fruits.  also, slight metallic scents.

Appearance:  golden yellow colour.  small, white head.

Flavor:  sweet, malty, hoppy flavors.  fills the nose and clears the sinuses.  

Palate:  hops that momentarily scrape the skin off the back of the tongue--other than that, remarkably smooth.  slight fruity, earthy aftertaste.

Overall:  not a bad IPA.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2005 Clear amber color, thin head, mild carbonation. Light floral aroma. Taste... Whoa, now thats what Im fn talking about! Nice creamy texture. The hops cling to the tongue just long enough and then release so the beer finishes clean. Nice lacing on the glass. The aroma was a bit mild in this savage beer but the flavor more than makes up for it. I cant wait to try ruination.
one of the most perfect american ipa's.  very balanced, with a sweet and a malt(!) taste.  nice hazy orange color.  so easy to drink for the strength too.  beware! but find it

This is a great IPA. It's much more drinkable than Ruination.

Pours a clear darker golden color with a really nice off-white head that left a beautiful lace down the side of the glass.

Smells of floral hops, mainly, with some maltiness coming through.

Tastes very smooth for being so hoppy. You can definatly taste the alcohol. I'm thinking Chinook hops but there's a bit of grapefruit aftertaste which makes me think maybe some Cascade, but I think Stone doesn't use Cascade. The hops are complex so it's not like they just dumped in one type and forgot about it. The bottle states that they dry hop as well. The care here shows.

Mouthfeel is full and creamy with just enough carbonation to cleanse the pallet. Drinkability suffers only because of the high alcohol content, but it's quite good.

From the second you poor this beer you know it's going to be good.  Orange/rust body with a good inch size delicate head on it.  The head settled and you end up with a great lacing pattern.  Flowery, sticky resin aroma hits you right before you take a sip.  Flavor is intense...great hop flavor with a malty body.  Always a favorite.

So, maybe it is because I've been spoiled by the NW Style IPA, but I can't help but feel like this beer is so average.  The color was really nice, but the love that makes up an IPA is all filtered out.  It smelled pretty medicinal, it tasted bottled, maybe a little old.  It wasn't bad, just wasn't great. I think I'll stick with Arrogant Bastard the next time I go for a Stone beer.

OMG...Maybe the most perfect beer I have ever had. The aroma is something I would like to engulf my house.  The hoppy aftertaste is something I will never forget and contiune to search for in other beers.

Has a clouded orangish/tan color with some carbonation and small diminishing head.  Smell is of hops/citrus.  Taste is lightly malted and finishes with a hop/citrus/acidic flavor.  Overall a fine IPA with great hop flavors.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2008 [bottle] Pours a coppery color with a nice white head and good lacing. Rich citrus and hoppy aroma with a slight earthy undertone. Good hoppy start with a slightly sweet and citrus follow. Finish is a good mix of the hoppy bite of an IPA and a slight malt addition to make it nice and smooth. Silky mouthfeel.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2006 Bottle, 22oz. Sniffed the cap after pouring and thought WOW.....hop time! Very fresh, natural and potent, piney,  resinous hop aroma. Slightly hazy, pale, deep golden color with a copper hue. Good beige head & lace. Constant hop flavor and bitterness projected from a smooth, creamy, light roasted malt background. Medium body. Alcohol is there but not distracting. Well integrated quality product. Stood up well to my mesquite grilled chicken. (add on 4/8/04): Very rich, rather sweet, stickey, lightly roasted malt flavor. Be sure its at least 50 degrees F to wake up all those flavors. 11/01/04: This stuff is so rich. Its like some signature concoction youd get in a fancy glass for dessert at a good restaurant. The last few I had the head was so firm I almost needed to use my teeth. There is a nice pepper spice note in with the flavors and hop bitterness thats very pleasing. 5/27/05: Im dropping it down .1 to a 4 which puts it even with Ruination. 4/4/06 Down another point. My world is getting bigger.

Pours a clear copper color and is topped by a off white head.  An immediate big hop aroma jumps from my glass and overpowers any malt presence that this beer might have.  The aroma is grassy, herbal, citrusy, & it has  a sweet hop nectar character.  Quite simply, as I take my first sip, I know this is a hoppy bitter brew.  The hops explode on your tongue.  There is a balancing malt sweetness here that is required to carry this hop bomb.  The hop character has strong notes of bergemot as well as some resiny overtones; this is just pure hop nectar.  A very fruity beer, made more so by the citrusy hop character.  Quite over the top in it's hoppiness.  This beer is just damn good & I am so happy to get this on tap on a regular basis.

Finally got to try some off the tap after consuming countless bombers.  Hazy orange body with foamy off-white head.  Full floral nose with plenty of citrus and pine.  Hops overpower, but don't dominate the smooth malt flavors from initial taste to finish.  The standard-bearer of IPAs deserves all of the praise it gets.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2005 Pours clear orange/copper with a thick off-white head. Extremely perfumy, hoppy, floral aroma with toasted grains and mango/tropical fruit in there too! Taste has huge notes of grapefruit/citrus, hops, pine and plenty of sweet toasty grains/maltiness to back it up. Just delicious. Lingering bitter grapefruit rind finish. Mouthfeel is very full, round and creamy with subtle carbonation. Spider-web lacework with good head retention. One of the best IPAs on the planet for sure.

Bottle pours a light amber with a nice creamy off-white head.   Visible carbonation, beautiful lacing.   Aroma is of sweet hops and citrusy grapefruit.   Initial taste is a bit biting, but it quickly mellows with a smooth finish.   Mouthfeel is think and creamy for an IPA.   One of the better IPAs that I have had.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2011 Lawnmower clippings blowing over honeyed malts...Floral fruitiness surfing grapefruit rinds into a portentous wooden, resinous bitterness...This is a very good IPA, a super clean and very drinkable example of the West Coasts finest...
Bitter, but bitter in a very good way.  Like all Stone brews the hops hit you like a brick-wall.  Very nice in general, head was nice and lasting.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2011 pours beautiful hazy amber orange with tall white foamy head that lasts a while.  Can smell the fruity hops from over a foot away!  Flavor is all hops, easy on the malt (less than an arrogant bastard for example), and all nicely resulting in a lovely bitter (can you say pucker) finish.  One of the purest regular IPAs Ive tasted.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2004 a wonderful ipa. pours a slightly cloudy golden orange with a quickly dissipating off-white head. hugely floral nose. clear hops with a bitter bitter aftertaste. a tad on the thin side, but overall a really great brew.
Nice golden amber color with a fluffy white head. As expected, loads of spicy hops and citrus in the aroma. Flavor is bursting with fresh hops, grapefruit, pine and spice. Excellent IPA.
As much as I love stone, this beer seems over-rated.  Pours a medium amber with small white head.  Flavors are of a basic IPA, floral, citrus, a little sour and light on the palate.

It pours a clear filtered? yellow with a small white head, this could be a pilsner and giving it 3 makes me wonder if I'm too kind just because it's Stone. Aroma is hop essence literally.. with a hint of fuel and quite salty as well together with the more traditional citrus, lemon and grapefruity profiles. A good sniffing which appeals me by its originality. Taste surprises right away being very citric. I simply don't understand how so many people can love it that much since it's so distracting? Neverthless, there's a touch of honey malt and it's very clean. Talking about balance is totally out of place though and it didn't seem particularly pleasant. The body is honest, a solid medium body, but not as mouth-filling as other Stones I've had. Basically, this was totally blown away by the Lost Coast Indica we've had just before. Just altogether way too citric sour for my liking, possibly the tartest IPA I've had to date and while it's a characteristic I truly love in many belgians, it didn't seem to fit here. Thanks Martin!

Nice amber appearance and a decent foamy head.  Bitter enough for the hopheads and balanced enough for the average person.  A solid IPA that is more refreshing than just about any other IPA I've ever had.

The best IPA I've tried, and the first I've ever really liked.  Beautiful color, although the head didn't last as long as I would have liked.  As with most Stone brews, the closer I got to the bottom of the glass, the more I enjoyed it.

Bottled. Moderate head with nice lacing. Hoppy aroma. Clean and crisp without being overly bitter. Well balanced with a mellowing presence of malt. It's not as complex as my personal favorite, Victory's Hop Devil, but very, very good.

Hoppy aroma.  Clear bronze color with a foamy head.  Mild hoppy flavor with a touch of grapefruit in the aftertaste.  For some reason I felt like it was thinner than it should have been.  I have to say, this beer grew on me with every sip.

Nice golden color, with a decent size head that dissolved quickly. Nice grapefruit aroma. Hmm...more mellow than I'd expected, but it has been aging for a while. Think I'm drinking it at just the right time too. Not overpoweringly hoppy, but certainly with that bitter kick to it. Another winner from Stone.

Pours a clear amber shade, with a wonderful head, and incredible lacing.  Aroma of grapefruit and pine.  Great bitter taste that isn't too harsh.  A wonderful IPA, that's simple in design, but awesome in results.

Wow what a beer-So good in fact that I found myself making up words to describe just how good an IPA this is.  Aroma is wonderful of pine, citrus and those glorious hops.  Flavor was so complete that it will be some time before I am able to, with an un-biased opinion, rate an IPA.  Beautifully put together .   This is a truly magnificent beer...Thanks Shag.

(Bottle)  Strong grapefruit and hops aroma.  Amber color, 1/2" foamy white head falls to a thin layer within a minute or so, but leaves nice lacing.  Citrus and pine taste, with little malt, alot of bitterness that extends into a long aftertaste.  Palate is tingly, crisp, and dry.  If you can measure a beer by how likely you are to suggest it to another (and isn't that part of the ratings process?), this beer ranks right at the top with the best of them.

Paid $3.79 for a bomber.

Great amber/orangy color, small head, but really looks nice!

That smell is a 5- that's the smell I look for in a good IPA- the smell I love, the smell I think about when I'm somewhere without beer. Sweet citrus... very strong. As soon as I popped the cap, I smelled it. LUSCIOUS!

MMM tastes so good. Sour citrus, moderately hoppy, great bite! This really is a good beer! One of the best IPAs I've had in awhile!
Draft:  Very nicely hopped in the nose and aroma.  Sprucy and earthy.  A touch of sweetness in the finish - which I love!  A deep golden color below a white head.  This is an excellent IPA!

Orange color with a normal sized creamy white head.  Average carbonation.  Immediately noticeable flowery hop aroma.  A nicely balanced, not overpowering, heavy hop flavor that sticks around in the mouth for a while.  A very good beer.
A good IPA, and by the ratings, seems to be one of the best.  You'll like it if you like bitter beer.  Impressed, though I just wish it maybe had a sweeter start, with the existing close.

22 oz bottle, goblet.  Tall, creamy, white head is well lasting and sits on a deep golden-orange body.  Cookie, light bread malt (M); spruce, grapefruit hops (H).  Simple, powerful, and clean aroma.  Moderately sweet, moderately bitter flavor becomes a lightly sweet, heavily bitter finish.  Very clean.  Medium-heavy body, creamy texture, lively carbonation.  The bottom line is: yeah, it's one dimensional, but it does it so well.

11/29/03.  Poured out of 12 oz. bottle, bought at Liquorama in Upland, CA 11/5/03.  Pours to a clear, bold golden body-- looks rather full.  Rocky, off-white head that hangs around thinly with very good, sandy and shimmering lacing.  Carbonation runs through the body pretty vigorously.  Fresh, bright hop aroma with some delicate malts and hints of cloying sweetness.  Taste is a little bit of hay, no-nonsense bitter hops and pale malt.  Stings with carbonation and burn of hops.  Quite complex assortment of flavors going on with the tease of overwhelming bitterness but the balance of a subtly sweet outline. Very substantial mouthfeel, medium-full.  Finsh lingers long and turns to a somewhat harsh but pleasant bitter malt glow-- like fresh barley malts bursting in your mouth.  Mellowed but still punishing.   A deceptively simple brew, this just does what it does extremely well.  And I'm sure it's fantastic with spicy Indian or Mexican food.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2007 2003 Draught. Yes!! I love it. I get tired of all of these new super wowee double ultra IPAs. . .  I like a sessionable IPA.  2004 draught.  Yes. Good. Balanced.Having had bottles of this twice now in blind tastings, I havent been as impressed.  I actually got some yeasty, blandish, sourish type notes, almost buttery.  Though the mouthfeel is still creamy and soothing and the nose expressive.

Hoppy as any exmaple that is available on the market today.  The overall strength of hops somewhat takes over the the other subtle flavors that show as it crosses the palate.  Overall it is a definite "must try" for any fan of the style, but unbalanced overall.

Big head and citrusy-hop aroma start off nicely on top a beer that is just a shade lighter than many IPA's.
The body was a little thin and the finish was short.  With an IPA like Ruination, I don't know why they need this beer.
Golden in color with a small white head.Great hop aroma,citrus.Hoppy from first sip to last,never mellowed.A good IPA.
this is a monster hoppy ipa.  strong hoppy, floral smell with a bitey hop aftertaste.  good lord, this is a hophead's dream

White foamy head with lacing.  Golden appearance which is see through.  Smooth, drinkable, well balanced hops and malt.  Nice (small but effective) hop aftertaste.  Hop acidity tingles on my tongue as the beer goes down.  Slightly dry but not overly so.  Excellent beer.
Very hoppy. Loads of cascade. Great refreshment. Unfortunately the finish is slightly thin and short.

Lighter color than expected- seems like the probably stuck to just pale malt without any character malts.  Not to worry- this beer is all about the hops anyway.  Aroma and flavor are overloaded with NW hops which pack a huge punch to the senses.  Very resiny almost like that of an I2PA, yet it is still very drinkable.

Another IPA that is just way, way too hoppy for this rater. Wow! A small sized white head that was creamy and smooth with fine-medium sized bubbles that mostly diminished. The body was carboned and cloudy with a golden hue. The nose is hops without question and the flavor is bitter and very hoppy. The palate is tingly and hoppy. This is a medium-full bodied IPA with good lacing. Just too much hoppiness for someone who is not a hop head.

This bottled brew poured a large head of white colored fine to medium sized long lasting bubbles that left behind a slightly hazy carbonated light yellow brown colored body and a good lace.  The aroma is all hops and the mouthfeel is tingly and stongly hopped with a lingering hop presence.  It has a hoppy flavor with more hops for added flavor to go with the hop that are in the flavor next to the hops that were added to add more hoppy flavor to this very hopped brew.  Did I mention that it had hops in it?
This was very nice. Very well balanced and smooth. Beautiful in the glass. Citrusy, green fresh aroma - hint of malt. Nice hop finish. Thanks again to Fly :)

Very nice, Very clean IPA flavor.  not as overpowering flavor-wise as some of the other offerings from Stone Brewing.  This IPA has a nice crisp flavor, and it does not linger and burn your mouth like some of the super steriod-laden IPAs created for mere shock value.

I'm not a big fan of IPAs but this beer was nice.  The color is a clear orange like the picture.  The bright head didn't last too long in mine but it was there.  Aroma as well as flavor was a balanced malt and then it hit with the grapefruit, citrus, pepper.  Excellent beer!
Clear orangish color with a white head. Intense grapefruit hops and slightly floral aroma. Very nice crisp, citric hoppy flavor. Pretty dry finish, with a strong hoppy aftertaste.
hoppy hoppy hoppy. got love those hops. I wonder if it is some nice casscade hops that give it a citrus flavor. One of my favorite IPA's.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2011 December 2003: Very nice resinous, floral hops aroma. In my mouth there is a marriage of hops and ,malts, with some citrus dancing around.... very good! 7-3-8-4-15 

Double Dry Hopped version on tap at Oregon Brewers Fest, July 31 2011: An orange amber IPA with a thin off white head. In aroma, pungent and fragrant floral hops, resinous, with a bit of catnip. In outh, a good biscuitty malt with very resinous pungent hops, mentol, coniferous, quite nice and challenging. 8-3-8-4-15

Bought in the ubiquitous 22 oz brown bomber..with as always the imformative back panel.
Ok this is simply a marvelous IPA to just look at..a work of art it seems a shame to have to drink it! Hazy light amber colour with a fantatsic large creamy white head..even the carbonation strings seem perfect!
Well the aroma of the hops is also great..its a treat to the nasal passages, quite flowery but yet not sweet smelling.
well what can is ay about the taste but hops, hops,hops yet it alo has a creamy sweetness..that isnt completelly over whelmed by the hops ( this must be a Stone thing, I tasted the same in the 03-03-03 Vertical)..very nice.
Great feel in the mouth with just the right amount of hop aftertatse to keep one coming back for another sip.
Most drinkable IPA I ever had..very good indeed.
UPDATED: NOV 16, 2005 Dark amber color -- able to see through in a glass. The taste is extremly full.  Strong malt tast and bitter hop aftertaste.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2005 Pours thick, this is a Stone Brew. Head is white in colour, moderate in size and mostly diminishes. Nose is fruity malts and bitter hops that bite at the nasal cavity. Front is heavily sweet malts. Body is hoppy as expected, but its the malts that make this such a great IPA. Orange, banana and clove are in there. Finish is pine tree bitter hops with lingering fruity malts. This is truly an extroidnary IPA. Overall, delicious, very drinkable,  a spectacular example of the style.

Thanks to Kinz for sending me this brew which backed up its placement on my BeerList. I have had Stone IPA exactly one other time, at a beer tasting party I hosted in February 2000. That was before my Ratebeer days, so all I had was my fond memory of it. Apparently it made an impression on the rest of the attendees at that party as it was the highest rated overall brew among the following other 11 beers: Steinlager, Carta Blanca, Beamish Stout, Zwiec, Young's Oatmeal Stout, Pilsner Urquell, Edelweiss Weissbier, Krombacher Pils, Mendocino Blue Heron Pale Ale, Sierra Nevada Big Foot and Rogue Dead Guy Ale. That's a pretty head group of beers! It's as good as I remember; it's only too bad that I can't get it in my local market!! Sweet hoppy apricot nose with a bit of a sour pungent aroma. Cloudy gold in appearance with good visible carbonation. Small, off-white head with excellent lace and good retention. Piney hops with some creaminess as a cutter. Just the right amount of sweetness. Good warming alcohol at 6.9%. Elixir-like qualities!
Very hoppy but well balanced by malt. Amber in color. Enjoyable. Had it at a beer festival at Split Rock, Pa. I enjoyed this. very flavorful.
(Bottle)  Pours a golden amber color with a medium white head.  Flavor is hoppy with a bountiful aroma.
Pine and citrus aroma with clear golden amber color and a medium white head.  Flavor is excellent with a wonderful hop bite.  Alcohol is very well hidden.  A great IPA.
It's very refined, but almost too "warm" around the edges. The clear taste is superb, but not acidic enough for me. It needs more "edge".
Golden color with a nice white head. The taste is fruits with a nice hoppy finish.

Bottle: nice aroma (Cascade probobly) head true to style. Strong hop bitterness with malty backbone followed by crisp dry hoppy finish. No holes in this beer. excellent lacing. A bit more straw colored than the regular pale ale but no less malty. The only better IPA I've had is my own.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2008 Bottle pours a hazy orange amber color with a nice rocky head and good lace.  The aroma is citrus and pine.  The flavor has a good floral hop show of grapefruit and pine.  The palate is average with some decent cleansing bubbles.  Overall, this is a good IPA.
Hoppy brew for hopheads, I liked it but I could not drink a lot of it, too hoppy for my tastes.

Crisp, golden color with a cohesive white head.  Aroma is fruity and hoppy.  Flavor is thick, resiny and chewey with hops.  Not overly bitter but chock full of that good hop flavor.  Very above average.

Golden orange with a slight haze.  Large, thick head that dissipated over time.  Lacing all the way down the glass.  Aromas of fresh hops and ripe citrus.  It has a nice bite from hops but not over-powering.  A citrus flavor coats the mouth and has a pleasant after-taste.  Wonderful IPA.
This is the best hoppiest beer you will ever find. Thanks HH. This is truly a good beer. Long live hops :-)

Very nice crystal clear orange color with a big frothy off-white head that leaves creates nice glass lacing. Super citrus, grapefruit aroma some sweet malt also. Flavor is grapefruit and sweetness. Bitterness really kicks in towards the end. Yum this stuff is good. Body is medium  and not overly dry but still very crisp. Some stickiness is noticeable on the teeth. Overall an excellent IPA, one to which others should be compared.

Pours a juicy orange color with a nice off-white head and good lacing.  Aroma is very citrus with some floral notes as well.  Mainly grapefruit smells in this beer.  At first this beer is surprisingly sweet but ends with a huge hop bitterness.  Body is medium with a rather dry finish.  Very good IPA.
UPDATED: NOV 1, 2003 Killer IPA, big-time grapefruit smell, see-through copper.  Sweet and fruity with brutal hops.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2003 1pint 6 oz. bottle poured orange/amber with lively carbonation and an off white head. Sweet flowers and sugar aroma, generous hop bite and bitterness with an awesome floral taste. hides the alcohol well except for a warming in the back of your throat and the buzz at the end of the bottle :). very nice

Color is a lighter shade of pale yellow, some hazy cloudyness with a finger high white head of looser thickness, fades and bubbles down to some bubbles along the rim. Lace in webby loose sheets. Smell is quite floral and sweetly hopped lending light pine, light grapefruit and a touch spicy. Not all that strong but very fresh and hoppy. Swirling brings out some soft caramel malts and alcoholic warmth. Taste is a calming smooth, subtle hoppy little treat. Solid floral and dried sense of hops with a good touch of pine and grapefruit mixing with peach notes. Nice light backing of soft caramel malts; a bit of toasted bread. Well balanced and the bitterness is well under check with nice lingering spicy dried grapefruit notions in the finish. Lightly creamy and a fair medium body feel with a crisp, clean subtle hoppy finish. Maybe expecting to much from this beer with all the high recommendations. Its a solid IPA for sure, but didn't quite make the impact on me with more of a mellower hop flavor then I was anticipating. Comparisons aside, this was very close to Town Hall's Columbus Pale. So as an IPA this was more like a great pale.
nice dark orange colour and the aroma was terrific. interesting bitter flavour (very good indeed).

Wow, great aroma.  Starts out as sweet peaches and finishes with a nice soft floral aroma.  Ok head with light carbonation but leaves some great lacing on the glass.  Flavor is hoppy but not so much that you pucker up while drinking.  Quite bitter flavor too with a little citrus.  Color is a cloudy amber orange.  Finish is bitter and lasting.  A top quality IPA that is not over the top hopped and balanced very well for the hops that are there.  Stone comes through again.

Purchased inexplicably at a corner store in New York's Chinatown, where one could also obtain a durian or some lap cheung. Golden/amber, dense offwhite head, much lace. Aroma is what a field of hops must smell like. Tastes of pine and citrus, some grass and a powerful bitterness. Not much in the way of malt but sufficient to carry the hop-load. Medium body. I should go back and tell the woman behind the counter at the store that this is "hen hao pijiu!" (very good beer!)

This brew was sent to me by Andrew196 a few months ago and is finally getting to see the light of day, Thanks for the brew Mike! 
Poured into my Samuel Smiths Nonic pint glass, this Stone IPA poured a massive cream-colored head that very slowly dissipates but leaves behind a colossal mass of smaller rocky head and  lacing; in the lower portion of the glass sits a sparkling copper colored brew.
 The aroma and flavor are burly with citrus, mainly grapefruit, some notes of caramel, spruce, and pine shine through. The alcohol makes itself recognized, but mainly in the finish I can feel the warmth in the back of my throat. 
Great bitterness, not overpowering at all. This IPA has a slightly oily, medium, crisp palate, very lovely! 
 Overall this is a BIG Citrus, Grapefruit IPA, one that will not disappoint!

Aroma of sweet pine. Taste of pine, malt and slight citrus. Very smooth and drinkable. Ever present hops with out a strong bite which adds greatly to the drinkablity. Great with food. Nothing exotic but a very good representation of what I like the style to be.

(draught) Pale gold. Rather dense, slim head, yellowish. Nose like a freshly opened bale of hops. Unrefined, lager-like malt under harsh metallic hops-taste. Medium bodied. Aftertaste is again - just more hops. This is not bad, but, by Jove, beer has to be more than just hops on steroids.
UPDATED: NOV 29, 2003 Best IPA I've had thus far.  Nice orange appearance with a flurry of flavors.
This beer is a lot like the ruination but without the hop kick in the junk you get from ruination. It's a very good IPA.
Amber color with white large head. Aroma is of hops and very strong.Hoppy bitter taste that has a hint of pine to it. Not as smooth as the Ruination IPA but still a solid Hopped up IPA.
Light orange colored and crystal clear with an inviting fluffy white head.  Huge hoppy aroma and flavor.  Perfectly bitter beer.  Excellent.

A hop monster. Possibly one of the best hop aromas I've experienced. They leap out of the glass to destroy my nostrils. Destroy, damn it! The taste....wow, american hops like crazy. Rich pine, woody, floral. Damn! Hops! Who likes hops here? Do you? Then drink this IPA, damn it!

Deep amber color.  Small off-white head mostly diminishing.  Aroma is strong hoppy aroma (pine).
I must admit on the front end that I love an IPA.  In this case this is one of the better varieties of same.  Strong hoppy, bitter taste but with substantial malt backbone. Full bodied. A good effort Stone
Top 'o the hop pops up with a piney woods sap smack. Get it Jack? Orange, bitter, very drinkable.

hazy copper color with a small white head. Very nice pine and citrus hop aroma. flavor is grapefruit, with pine and floral notes,with some malt sweetness leading to a bitter hop finish. nicely balanced and well done.
ok....a wonderful appearance, a thin head that dissapates quickly. The beer has an amber color, and a very hoppy smell. The taste is bitter, veryyy nice. Slightly sweet.

Firm white head, short lived. Hazy orange/gold color. Spotty laceing. Clean, piney, resiny nose. Medium body. Aromas roll over into the flavor dept., with some minimal maltiness backing them up. Finish is dry. I expected more from this brew, top 50 material? I think not. Good brew but the Victory Hop Devil kicks the Stone gargoyles ass! In this case anyway.

Hazy golden hue with small head but good lacing. Nose is pine and grapefruit with hints of buttered wheat bread and light spice. Oh yes, there be hops here along with twangy fruit and an undertone of sweetness. Dry and astringent on the finish. Almost oily feel. Big and bold IPA, one to put your macro beer drinking friends into hop shock.

Pours surprisingly light amber with modest head and light carbonation.  Aroma is floral  American hops in the citrus grapefruit style.  Taste is honey, malt, grapefruit.  Nice body.  There is a long semi-sweet aftertaste with hops and malt.  The hops do not outdo the malt, although the malt is sweet and somewhat thin. The 6.9% alcohol is carefully hidden, I would not have guessed.  This is an outstanding beer.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2003 Pours golden with a small head and medium carbonation. Floral, citrisy, grapefruit aroma. Taste pine, grapefruit, woodsy. This IPA doesn't have the malt kick to balance the hops like dreadnaught or dfh 90, but it is balanced by other flavors and its subtle malt end quite nicely. An excellent IPA right up there in the same league as 3 floyds and dogfish head. RERATE 08/31/03--One last comment about this beer. I bought a sixer of it, and I have been noticing a unique balancing act this beer does. After every sip, the hopiness is overwhelming, and stays completely unbalanced until the very very end. Then, a small spike of maltiness hits just as the flavors have all finished. Every sip, every time. This is an outstanding beer. I am upping the flavor and overall by one point

Golden with white head.  Sharp pungent aroma of spicy hoppiness(elements of pine and citrus).  This beer is all about the hops including notes of pine, citrus fruit, and earthiness. Leaves a long dry floral bitterness on the tongue.  Overall there is a nice balance used to keep the hops from being overwhelming.
This is an excellent IPA.  Good balance, excellent flavor and aroma.  Not much head, so the picture is a little deceiving, but tasting nontheless.
dep gold, white head.  citrus and fruity hop aroma wit some earthiness.  nicely balanced with sweet honey and malt flavours, big citrus piney hops and a mild roasty finish.  a fine ipa.

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2006 Orangey-gold colour.  Rich woody nose with orange, toast, peach, kumquat.  Long hoppy palate, some biscuity pale malts.  Standard issue stuff, moderate bitterness and a bit fruitier and more approachable than most examples.
Way hoppy, nicely bitter, pours a tad cloudy.  A good beer to teach that Budweiser swiller what a beer should be.

Pale in color with a definate malt background.  Typical c-hop character, Pine, grapefruit, soem floral.  I bit bitter for my liking.  I would have rather a bit more hops in the flavor and aroma area.  Good overall.

Golden in color, light for a pale ale, with a huge head of tiny bubbles.  Perhaps the best head I have ever seen.  Beautiful floral hop aroma.  A very balanced brew.  Nice citrusy hop finish.  Even better than the Arrogant Bastard Ale.

This is the best IPA I have ever tasted.  It is perfectly balanced.  Nicely golden and a glorious head.  What type of hops do they use?  It has a wonderful hoppy flavor, but is not overpowering like most IPA's that try to go over the top.  Way better than the other IPA variations that Stone is offering.  I just wish I lived near the brewery because a 6-pack cost 10.95 in Mass.  Ouch!

Very nice golden transparent color,small but very long lived almost creamy white head.The aroma was definately hops nice citrus notes with a mild malt as well.This has got to be one of the best smelling brews i've been able to have in a long time.The flavor is superior nice hop taste with a mild citrus and decent hop presence i believe that due to my oevr excitment it maybe just a tad over warm for a decent experience but,hell i just couldn't wait for it to get there.It is slightly sweet in the beginning but later turns to a nice hoppy bitterness,not in an over powering damn thats hops taste but damn thats good taste.The after taste is a very nice hops presence that is not overly strong but gentile more or less caressing the palate making you crave more.What a fine brew,i wish i had asked for more but alas one is all i have and i have to thank Hopscotch for this one.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2017 
Aug, 2003 Bottle - gift from Nuffield. Lychees aroma. Soft citric. Bursting citric hop flavours which become stronger with each sip until there is a long bitter burn. Sweet malt. Darjeeling tea. Each sip is different. A beer that develops and changes. Damn interesting. [3.8] 
Mar4ch, 2017 Gosh, it seems a lifetime ago that I first had this - or at least, a different life. I think this was one of the top beers on RateBeer, and it was a bold forerunner for beers that are pretty commonplace now. In the years since I have met and drunk with Greg Koch, the man who founded and ran Stone Brewing, and I have gradually ceased contact with pretty much all the folks I used to drink with. RateBeer is a different place now, and the folks that were central to its growth and success, and shaped its early destiny, have mostly drifted away. If we are in touch, its mostly through Facebook, and the rare, occasional meet up. The beer? Well, I think that what I said back in 2003 still pretty much holds true. I never really acquired a taste for these hop drinks. The malt character is not there - its a pale biscuit malt. Very bland and characterless. The beer is filtered and force carbonated, popped into a can, and meaningless. Theres no magic here, and I get no sense of ale - its a pale lager base, and then lots of hops put on top. I can drink this, as somehow Stone manage to cram in that many hops, and still make it palatable. The sweetness of the malt helps, I suppose. This is like drinking a strong Euro lager with strong hop flavours added. Take away the hops and, for me what you are left with is something undistinguished, but quite drinkable. To be honest, I prefer drinking strong Euro lagers, though I like one of these hop bastards now and again. I like this one for its status, its history, and for what it means to me personally. [3.1]

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2008 Much like the Ruination, but with some subtlety and deftness.  Pretty light copper color, decent head that slowly fades.  The smell is hoppy, hoppy, hoppy, with the signature grapefruit juiciness mixed with spruce and a bit of earth.  Really nice.  The taste in the mouth is almost identical, with the malt balancing out the hops beautifully.  Just a really great beer.  10, 5, 9, 4, 19. RERATE:  7/4/08 - This is sort of a painful rerate for me.  Stone has long been a favorite, and God knows I don’t want to become one of those people who find it fashionable to beat on the brewer for no good reason.  But I’m simply not enjoying this beer like I once did, and a re-rate is in order, knocking it well out of my top 10.  Appearance has remained the same.  Aroma has altered - spicy, earthy, very little grapefruit, that note has unfortunately been replaced by a slightly vegetal note.  Some pine and spruce remains.  Good, but nowhere close to where it used to be.  Flavor matches the nose, with the addition of well balanced gummy malts.  But there is that clear, slightly vegetal note that persists that just doesn’t float my boat.  I know that hops vary from year to year, and perhaps this beer will come back to what I used to adore.  But for now, it is time to take things down a notch or two.

Medium gold color, with a fair sized head and good lacing.   Hoppy/pine aroma with accents of citrus.  Hop taste dominates early with the malt backbone becoming more prominent as it warms.  Great bitter finish.

Clear amber with a reddish tinge color.  Medium/large creamy white lasting head.  Crisp, fresh, candy apple like aroma( very similiar to their Vertical Epic 03).  Notes of caramel, lime, and sweet malt.  A creamy malt taste with a drying bitterness.  A little too sweet for for, I prefer the Ruiniation.
nice strong ipa.  good flavor, touches of malt.  Not really as oppressive as some ipa's.  if this is the best IPA's have to offer... i'll keep my stouts  :)
A good hoppy IPA.  Lovely sweet aroma mixed with the bitterness that any good IPA should hold.  A touch of honey blends with the heavy (but not too heavy) hops.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2005 Bottle. Quite hoppy and sticky, with some lychee pine and peach, with a touch of alcohol in the finish, palate is full-bodied and sweet and then bitter. Soft floral hops in nose and flavour, nice.

Very nice aroma--grapefruit and a touch of orange and other citrus.  But the flavor disappoints me--less rich and more acidic.  There are plenty of UK beers that are better drinking experiences than this because they achieve a better balance, although this one charges mightly at the malts too.  Good palate, carbonation but not oppressive, smooth.  Good head though plain color.

22 oz. brown bomber bottle. No freshness date, but none needed, as it doesn't last long on the shelves around these parts. Poured out a hazy orange-yellow color. Stayed cloudy throughout the experience. It is an experience every time I have a new Stone beer.
A wonderful experience, for the most part. Thick white head left chunky bubbles in the glass. Aromas of fresh hops, sweet malts, and some caramel also. Bready, yeasty aromas as well. Tastes great. Finishes clean, with a tangy hop afterbite to it. Try some for yourself.
Stone Brewing has yet to fail to impress me. This is  probably the best IPA that I have ever had. An in your face kind of hoppiness that you rarely find, even in other IPA's.
The Stone brewing company in never disapointing.  This is a great IPA.  It is a bit more hoppy than most IPA's but that's the way Stone makes beer.  Too the extreme.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2016 This seems to be a very competetive category - the IPA.  Stone IPA?  The best word I can think of to describe the taste, without being too techincal, is "flowery"!!!  It tastes like someone dunked a bouquette of intense lilacs into my beer!  However, I will admit, unlike some other IPAs I have tried, (again this is not my favorite style of beer), its definately drinkable.  -At 6.9% ABV, its got a little KICK too. Definately Unique stuff. 2016 Update: Major upgrade in all departments! Stone IPA is still one of the best ever.
Dark  in color with that fantastic Stone bitternesss. Nicely well balanced with great malts that blend extremely well wiht the tooth enamel stripping hops.Great mouth feel

Very light amber color almost an orange like color to it.  Beautiful nose of citrus and hops.  The flavors are intense and complex .  Starts with citrus flavors and a slight hint of carbonation and growing into an outrageous burst of hops.  The payoff is long and smooth.

I poured myself a pint and then decided to fix the back tire on my mountain bike.  But before I started, I drew in the huge hop aroma and sipped a bit from the cold brew to wet my appetite.  After about 15 minutes, I was back to the ale and WOAH - I was gribbing the side of the pint with pure astonishment - there was a frothy, creamy head of pure hops growing tendrils of rich flavor to my tongue.  I may have always drank this too soon and too cold!  This ale is perfectly balanced - creamy head, crisp hops, a little bitterness, a bit of flowery dandelion.  I can't think of a better ale to entice a novice to the hop side of the force.

Enormous smell of floral hops and sweet malt has my mouth watering. Body is a cloudy orange with dashes of gold, completed by a full head of white foam.  Taste is very interesting; big time apricot sweetness then BOOM!, a crash of hops of refined design. The hops are so clean and crisp you can almost feel your tongue crackle. Perfect carbonation and no alcohol in the flavor. Aftertaste is of light fruit and bitter hops, but finishes without approaching the disastrous realm of metallic and pencil shaving hop-aftertaste. Bravo for a job well done!

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2011 22oz bomber-hmm, i think this brew is somewhat of a bust.  The aroma was excellent, great citrus aroma with grapefruit upfront.  appearance was golden yellow, but carbonation and head were minimal.  palate was nice and chewy.  tons of hops, with a decient malt backbone but not as good as the malt in hopdevil.

ReRate-tap-tucson beer fest
ok, here is what everybody is talking about.  my bottle must have been old because what i got on tap at the fest was one hell of an ipa.  this may be the best one dimensional brew out there.  the aroma is just this side of paradise!  thanks to the guy at the Stone booth for the sticker :)
This beer is pretty much all hops.  This, along with Bells Two hearted are the most citrus-y brews out there (at least bottled and widely distributed).  This is one i dont drink that often even though it has to be the best widely available brew in my neck of the woods (desert).  

Re-Rate 2011 Either my tastes are changing or this beer has taken a turn for the worse.  Really catty which was common for ipas from this generation but now i can taste it much easier.  I dropped the rating down 2/10 of a point.  Two hearted is way better!
Hoppy city.Nothing but hops and malt.I really don't know what else to say about it.I really didn' care for it as much as everyone else.Overall it was not terrible with a bitter finish.

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2004 All Stone IPA variants rule, but their standard IPA is the best.  Strong, complex hops  are supported by a surprisingly good malt backbone throughout.  Every aspect of the profile has been addressed in a masterful way.  Stone's cheesy marketing campaign is completely blown away by the very high quality of this brew.  One of the top IPA's of all time.....  immensely excellent.
My favorite pale ale.  There is some subtle citrus/floral stuff in here but it is mostly just crisp, dry hops and that seems ok by me.

Two words:  "HOP BOMB!"  Man, this brew is hoppy!  Pop the cap, and immediately the hop aroma begins it assault on your nasal passages.  It pours a very nice amber, with a rather small, white head.  I smell some citrus, and perhaps a floral note or two.  Taste is hopaliciously bitter - it just punches the back of your throat.  The only complaint I have, is that it seems to be only hops - the flavor doesn't have much character beyond that.
Nice pale amber. Thick head with good lace. Aroma redolent of floral, earthy hops. Nice medium body with very crisp hops flavor. Nicely balanced by malt. Hints of butter. Excellent IPA.
Beautiful clear orange witha  thick white foamy head.  Hoppy, fruity (almost like pineapples) nose.  Medium bodied, malty witha nice hop flavor and bitterness.  Very good.

Incredible aroma, creamy, frothy head, and a very big hoppy flavor, that was extrememly enjoyable.  I will be honest I expected a little more from this IPA, but I have no major complaints. I was more entertained watching the head dissapate and the designs in the lacing too think about too much else. I am a bit of a hophead so this was a really good experience overall.

Rocky, white head.  No visible carbonation.  Sweet aroma of grapefruit and PNW hops.  Hazy, medium golden color.  Very bitter, however not a 90 Minute IPA, and I presume certainly not a 120 Min. IPA, I guess I'll have to drink that first.  Grapefruit.  Light on the tongue.  If you like lots of hops, you will like this.

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2003 Poured a nice amber color with a good white head. Lots of hops and a very good flavor. A nice lingering aftertaste. I heard so much about this and I'm not disappointed. The best IPA I've had.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2004 Clear amber color with big head and tremendous lacing. Aroma is hops, very floral, tons of dry hopping in this one. Flavor is strong and overpowering of hops with a citrus moutfeel. über-bitter and dry. I love the flavors in this IPA, just can't get enough. delicious.
Beautiful rich golden color.  Nice white head. nice hop aroma.  Not sure I like the aftertaste but a very good IPA overall.
UPDATED: JUL 28, 2003 Aroma what an aroma a hop heads delight not much of an effort to balance this baby out but I like it none the less

Great IPA! Medium head. Very pronounced aroma of hop, one of the best aromas ever. Excellent balance of bitter and dry flavors. One of the best colored beers I have ever seen, only the premium Belgium beers do better.

In my humble opinion this is the IPA against which all IPA's should be measured. Crisp, clean, flavorful and refreshing it is everything an IPA should be. Hats off to the Stone Brewing Company for giving us such an outstanding ale.

Deep bronze in colour with a fluffy white head and some great lace.  Huge aroma of floral hops.  Has a deep hop flavour and a fantastic hop bitterness in the finish.  Thanks to CaptainCougar for sending this to me.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2005 Very nice IPA.  One of my favorites when Im looking for a crisp IPA with some bitey, piney bitterness.  I like the victory more for its balance and more of a malty body.  It just matters what mood Im in.  Stone is cheeper than Victory so that can put me in the mood for Stone quite often.  ReRate 051405:  Most tastey Stone IPA Ive ever had.  Extremely fresh tasting.  Aroma is like sweet wort, and hops are as fresh as can be.  Taste is just about perfect right now.  Perfectly balanced.  Wow, Ill be drinking this more often.  Bumped up from 4.0 to 4.2.

I'm no hop-head but I enjoyed this. As I don't get very into IPA's I don't have much basis for comparison here. Really nice aroma of pines and grapefruit. Very hoppy but didn't really offend me, nice subtle sweet flavors underneath. Super-clean finish.

In a word, boring.  It's such a highly-regarded brew, perhaps my expectations were just too high!  Incredible golden color, like bottled sunshine!  Amazing!  But the flavor was too single-note.  Super hoppy, sure, but nothing special, nothing to run back to.  Like a quick hop fix, or a rush of any kind; ultimately not truly satisfying.

Orangish amber body with a nice floral, piney, citrusy and hoppy nose. Very thin head. The tongue had hops on it but seemed thinner than the Ruination and it finishes drier than the Ruination. This is still a damn tasty beer, though. Bitter with a slight sweetness. Finishes dry but with a smooth aftertaste. Good beer.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2003 So, i buy this yesterday and my brother says it'd be the perfect beer to rate for my 100th beer.  he said it's one of the most amazing beers made and i guess it is by looking at the scores on here.  too bad i think it's kinda crappy.  i like the painted label.  i like the color (nice golden with ambery hues).  the smell was a bit whatevery.  then the taste... first i have to preface it by saying that i love hoppy beers and bitter beers, but whatever good hoppy/bittery taste it has was completely overshadowed by this awful lingering aftertaste.  it was so awful that i had to go brush my teeth (twice) and when that didn't kill the taste, i did a shot (or was it three?) of Jim Beam.  Yuk!  (on a sidenote, my brother says it isn't the freshest Stone IPA he's every had)
Excellent! If you like hops and bitterness this is for you. This ale is a golden beauty.

Wonderful aroma! The flavor of this beer stands tall among the IPA's I have tasted thus far. The bitterness is fantastic and the acidic and dry finish just kills me. I really think this is an outstanding IPA.
Damn that's a lot of hops.  Reminds me of Victory's HopsDevil but without all the nasty spices.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2003 There was a really nice sweetness in the aroma. Good golden brown color. Nice buttery hoppy taste. This was very good, but had been travelling along with Greg across upstate NY, so I will re-rate this when i get a fresher bottle.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2005 Clear deep golden body with moderate carbonation and a snow white head. Hoppy, tropical fruit aroma suggesting mango and papaya with a toasted biscuity malt underbelly. Great balance and great depth of character. Nice hop kick, but not overpowering or one-dimensional. Pairs very well with food, better than most IPAs. A sentimental favorite of mine and probably the best beer available for the price in my area.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2008 Golden body topped by a thick white lasting head with good lace.  Sweet hoppy aroma wtih a lemony character.  Great aroma.  Sweet and fruity hop flavor with a slight lemony character.  Medium bodied and slightly dry.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2005 Rerate Still a damn good IPA, just did not blow me away this time- call it sophmoric excitement from the first time I encountered a Stone affecting my high rating. Original 4.5 Deep dark golden color upon pouring. Head was smaller than expected - but leaves a bit of lacing. The aroma improves as it warms - starts off with a blast of sprucey hops but settles into a warm fruit like nectar. The beer is constantly active in my glass with massive amounts of bubble action. The flavor is initially hoppy and sprucey with a nectar sweet undertone aftertaste. Probably the best IPA I have had to date - does not assault you with hops and leave you hanging without a few malty notes to even it out.  Looking forward to the Ruination and Arrogant Bastard that I also picked up at Bacchus in Chattanooga.

My first Stone's and without a doubt, the best AIPA that I've had.  A very mature, hoppy, candied-yam aroma. Beautiful bottle, painted label, apricot-colored beer.  Hop and pepper character, followed by a fruity sweetness.  West coast hops are my least favorite, but this was obviously done with a lot of attention and craftsmanship -- without being ham-handed last minute dry-hopping. Long, sawing hop finish, which fights with the sides of your tongue.  A man's beer.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2003 12 oz. bottle Stone scores again (surprised?) with this fist-sized cousin to the beautiful 22 oz. works of art we all know and love, or should. Don't make the mistake of drinking this out of the bottle, though - there's a big beer inside of there, with an assertive hop  character and brilliant, clear golden hue. A worthy IPA, and less intimidating than it's brethren.
UPDATED: NOV 12, 2004 Much lighter than Ruination, this beer will get you by. You can easily drink 6 of these and feel ok.
