Solid head. Hoppy, aromatic nose. The bitterness is sturdy and crisp. Hopheads every where rejoice. I've had a few of these beers over time, and it definitly holds up. Another outstanding beer from Stone.

I'm still a big fan of Dogfish Head 90 Minute IPA, but this is a fine beer.  I'm becoming a "hop convert" after all, where I previously preferred maltier brews.  Rich, amber color.  Bold, knock-you-on-your-ass hops.  What can I say.  Hops, hops, hops!

Nicely, crisply hoppy but balanced by malt presence.  I tried the Dogfish Head 90 Minute IPA recently, and Stone IPA holds up well.  Smooth and refreshing, Stone IPA is a nice example of the style.  Although, for the record, I do believe diversity and original interpretation is tough to come by in an IPA.

Well, for me a hop-lover living on the east coast, this was one that I really needed to try and isn't always readily available. I bought two bottles, a 12 ounce and the normal 22 ounce large bottle. This rating is from the Large bottle. Pours a orange colour with golden highlights at the bottom. Little head, but it was poured from the first half of the bottle, so an adequate head couldn't be formedd. The aroma is purely hops. If you continually smell this beer ever thirty seconds, your mouth will literally water. The taste is purely hoppy as well. A great mouthful, not too much, not too little. The aftertaste and palate of this beer is great as well...lingering hoppiness and subtle floral elements as well. This is truly an IPA winner and should be sampled by everyone regardless of their beer preference. One of those beers where 'hop heads' go crazy for.

Hops galore!  This has become one of my favorite, drink anytime ales.  Pours with a beautiful golden-amber color and a nice creamy, lasting head which provides nice lacing as it gradually dissipates.  Flavor and aroma are virtually all hops - spicy, grapefruit and flowers - with just enough malt to be recognized.  Nice, crisp and easy to love.  Good on it's own or with food - can definitely hold it's own with strong flavors.
Poured from the bottle with a creamy head and an slightly hazy, amber color.  This is an EXCELLENT IPA and has instantly become one of my favorites.  This is a great example of an IPA!
UPDATED: MAY 21, 2003 Yellow straw in color with a small frothy head. Hoppy and lightly malt aroma. Hops, hops and more hops with a bit of sweetness; give me more.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2003 To be honest I was expecting this to be over-hopped but it really wasn't. I enjoyed the hop flavors here but it seems to be missing something that Lagunitas has in the hop department. Behind the hops I can taste a very good beer here, so it gets points for that. Not much for me to say that hasn't been said except that I don't think this beer deserves some of the scores it gets (overrated)

UPDATED: APR 20, 2004 Beautiful color. Tastes like I bit into an orange peel -- my eyes popped wide open! I'm not sure whether I like this style yet; I'll have to try it out some more, but has an awesome aroma -- a floral/citrus scent -- could serve a double function as a nice potpourri for the house.
CRISP! easily drinkable, you should definitely pick this up!, perfect IPA, hops hops hops hops!

Finesse? From Stone? Really? Yep, This one is a great session beer, and I mean that as a compliment of the highest order. Clean and crisp, but huge, assertive hop presence. Malt is there, nicely in the background. Very Good beer.

Very cloudy yellow color with a large foamy white head. Aroma has a nice floral base, a hoppy body, with citrus notes. Flavor is pretty smooth overall and rather acidic, with a slight bitterness in the finish. Palate is a little thinner than I'd like. A great IPA, maybe a slight dissapointment after all of the great things I've heard about it on this site, but still very good.

Nice IPA but with the high ratings over this one I expected something more than exceptional. Has a nice marriage of malt/hop flavor and only a slight bitterness compared to most other IPA's I've had over the years. I still think the Alesmith beats this one though. I will definately drink it again, but there are many just as good as this one and better.
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text: Very, very good IPA. Typical Stone hoppiness (which is awesome!) Delicious citrusy notes in it. Beautiful, creamy head, Nice mouth feel. Very refreshing after a hard run on a hot day. Not overwhelmingly strong, either.

Definitely one of the best IPAs I've had. Somehow the incredible amount of IBUs don't   overwhelming or lead to excessive hop burps. Lovely to look at (the picture here does justice) and the aroma is exceedingly crisp. I wish this was available in Kansas, thanks to TAR for hooking me up!

On tap. Golden amber color. Beautiful floral hops, citrus aroma. Very well balanced hops, a little sweet and surprisingly not that bitter. Outstanding IPA. Up next is the ruination IPA, but I think I'll be having this quite often in the future.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2004 Golden color with a creamy head and nice lacing.  Aroma was filled with citrusy hops, orange rind, and some grapefruit.  Very hoppy, bitter, nice sweet finish.  Very balanced, very good IPA, my favorite!  I thought I had rated this too high, but upon revisiting, its really a top notch IPA.
Bottle.  Darker golden color.  Nice citrus/hop nose.  I was expecting more hops than I could handle, but even though they are strong, the balance is excellent.  A fine quaff!

Having had some IPA's that have hops strength that can shrivel tongues, this came of as rather well balanced. Meaning that while the malt flavor is well subdued I was not over powered by the hopping, just greatly pleased. Very nice. Really impressed that with all the hops hat may have died for my pleasure, they did not do so in unnecessarily
Lots of hops and a nice color. A good beer to have a warm summer day. Hints of citrus in this brew. Good, but not world class.

Even an angry 19 year old waitress couldn't mess up the pour enough to effect the head on this beer!  This is a great looking IPA.  When I 'taste' a beer, I drink it in a special way.  I take it in fully allowing it to roll completely over my tongue, and down my throat.  I then immediately exhale through my nose giving the aroma and the flavor a second chance to show their stuff.  The flavor is nice and hoppy.  I also catch a bitter flavor wrapped up in there.  I love this beer.  It has a great drinkiblity that makes you 10th pint as fun as your 1st.  Stone makes a super IPA!
Quickly disapating head, modest carbonation, fantastic amber color.  Aroma of hops, taste of hops, burbs of hops.  I love Stone Brewing!

22oz. bottle. Pouring smoothly into my pint glass, I can see the light amber/orange colored brew slowly rise to the top forming a nice one inch slightly off white head. What a fine sight it is. The first thing to hit my nose is pineapple, like I just opened a can as I often do. Then it starts to become more complex with other fruit odors, maybe a little bit of a peach schnapps smell or, maybe its that I detect a little bit of the sweet smell of honey. Wow, my rookie nose is really showing its character, or is it that the complexity of this beer is blowing my mind? Upon the first taste I notice the malty sweetness and flavor explosion. Nice and bitter with plenty of mouth watering hoppy citrus flavor. Extremely refreshing and inspiring. The head retains itself at about a quarter inch leaving a nice lace to the end. Or no, its not over yet, I still havent finished the bottle. The rest pours smoother as it has warmed a little. This beer must be bottled conditioned because it is now cloudy in my glass, as the complex flavors improve. I know that this is the best IPA Ive had yet.
Great India pale ale. Nice balance of malt and hops. Finishes clean crisp and bitter.
Orange-Amber like body with good head and lacing.  Aroma is dominated by hops with a flowery compliment.  Flavour is very hoppy and slightly bitter.  Finish is long and enjoyable.  A hophead delight.

Appealing amber color with a nice hoppy aroma.
Nice and smooth going down.
Great beer with after taste of hops around my mouth.
I get a nice warm feeling as I finish this beer.

(Bottle) Very exciting opportunity here - my first Stone! Pours a thinly laced, white head and a gorgeous golden body. Papaya, pear and hops nose. Nice balance, full bodied, hoppy flavour with a smooth, lightly bitter finish. Truly a worthy beer of the highest percentile - and the aroma is captivating. Cheers to CiderGuy for making this fine beer available to me!
PIZZA HUT IS NO OLIVE GARDEN ,BUT WITH ANY FOOD THIS BEER DELIVERS THE PERFECT TASTE,AROMA,HOPPINESS, AND A LITTLE THIRST QUINCHER TO GO ALONG WITH IT ..TRY  IT YOU'LL BE GLAD YOU DID...

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2007 Nice color and off white head start this much anticipated brew.  Nose is dry hoppy with a little grapefruit aroma, as well.  Very nice, and well balanced, and it has an almost pilsner-like quality to it!  Flavor is also quite hoppy, but this has to be the smoothest hoppy beer Ive ever had.  The hops just seem to roll from the front of the tongue to the back, leaving with a medium bitterness aftertaste, which again fades into notes of grapefruit.  Truly a wonderful IPA!

Huge hop aroma and also a light touch of mint.  Medium orange in color.  Taste is nice hops, not real green and not overly mellow.  Sweet and somewhat fruity finish, like a fine cider.  Could have used a littel more cabonation and head.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2009 Light golden color with a full head.  Smells like apples, little like peaches, almost like apple cider, very sweet aroma.  Wow, so bittersweet, very dry, with very full and enjoyable hop flavors.  Not as sweet as it smells, but more balanced.
An excellent IPA.  I like this one better than ruination because of the slightly lesser hops content.  A great floral smell, beautiful look, and an amazing fruity, hoppy flavor.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2007 Its not as overpowering as Ruination, its the perfect balance of hops and malt. Apperance is copper with a moderate head. Aroma is of oranges, pine, and hops. I could smell this all day! Flavor is hoppy with a complexity of citrus and pine. The hops are not as overpowering as one might believe based on Stones reputation. An absolute beauty of an IPA.

Draft and on cask at the Stone Kickoff at the Blind Tiger Ale House in NYC. Tale of two different monsters here. The draft version was a good solid IPA with just the right amount of hop flavor. The cask was like drinking a totally different beer. It smelled and tasted florally (sp) with a good hop bite. Was a little more cloudy then the draft.

Thick rocky head that disappears quite quickly.  Pale golden color.  Enormous amounts of lace on the glass.  Looks like a traditional IPA.  Smells of hops and sweet flowers, a nice balanced aroma.  Hopped quite well with a suttle balance between the hops and the malts.  I like the Ruination better.  However, this is better than most IPA's on the market that I have had.

What a great beer. Stone IPA presents with a golden amber color and a slight haze.An obvious hops aroma was present the minute the beer was poured. Despite the vast amount of hops this beer is incredibly well balanced.

Very nice IPA, but pales in comparison to the Ruination IPA.  After having the Ruination, this seems tame, but it's still an excellent example of a good West Coast IPA with plenty of hop bitterness.  Overall, a very good beer.

If you've never tasted this beer, you, my friend, are in for a real treat. It has a very crisp taste to it. You need to try it very, very cold-almost freezing, to bring out that awesome taste. Stone Pale Ale, I.P.A. and Arrogant Bastard Ale, are quite simply the finest beers in the world. Haven't tried Double Bastard yet. It's hard to find, because it's a seasonal brew. Looking forward to it though! : )

Pours a light amber with nice head and constant bubbles though the end. Very nice hops aroma. Tingles the tip of your tongue at first, then comes a wonderful blast of hops all over and, finally finishes with bitter on the back sides. Being a prodominant fan of Weissebier I was very impressed with this beer. It has renewed my opinion of IPA.
There is a difference in West & East Coast brewing styles.   This IPA has all the features of a West Coast IPA I expect.

Aroma was hoppy with some citrus. A hoppy flavor with a touch of caramel when warmed. It has a hint of pine. The color was golden with a small bubbly head. This is well balanced, but I have many IPA I enjoy more.

- cloudy, orangey/amber color, light white head, brussels lace, well-hopped with a malty mix in the aroma, just a touch of sweetness typical in English ales; excellent flavor, well-hopped, but well mixed with the malt flavors, just a touch of sweetness in the aftertaste, bitter at the beginning, a great IPA, one of the best Ive ever had

The best West Coast IPA I have ever tasted, Hop Devil being the best in the East.  Awesome aroma of fresh hops, a tiny smidge of malt (and I mean tiny), great aroma, great color, absolutely great everything!  One of the very best...what more can I say.
UPDATED: FEB 16, 2003 The only 5.0 on my list... Start with the unbelievable hop aroma... and then on to nirvana!!! I can't decide which is the better Stone IPA... this one, or Ruination!?!?!

This hazy, orangey golden brew has a medium, white head. The nose is full with herbal hoppiness and the slightest nuance of maltiness. The palate brings out the malty character with roasted grains and nuttiness. The finish resumes the hoppy character with some herbal/lemony bitterness.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2003 Reddish-orange, mostly clear (filtered?), disappearing head and light carbonation.  Aroma is equal parts sugary malt, sort of like pound cake, and citric hoppiniess that is lightly acidic.  The flavor profile is dominated by a pungent, sharp bitterness.  There's a bit of malt sweetness here I think, but more in the needle-in-a-haystack sense.  Rather harsh and reminiscent of bile.  The aromatic hops are quite nice, and I'm pleasantly reminded of the Arrogant Bastard, but I find this too acidic and bitter to be all that enjoyable.  I actually prefer the Ruination to this one.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2003 Talk about hops. This beer was loaded. If anyone knows how to hop out a beer, it's Stone. If you lust for hops like I do, get this beer. Aroma, taste, everything loaded with hops. What a great beer.

I have not had a better IPA.  Stone Ruination IPA may be better in some very rigorous sense of the word.  It is like the Platonic IPA -- all others mere reflections, or maybe mixed with a touch of lager.  But this isn't intimidating and over the psychotic top like the ruination.  It's drinkable any time, requiring no mental steeling, no palate flexing.  Deep, slightly cloudy orange.  Looks rather like the beer on the cover of Michael Jackson's Ultimate Beer.  Beautiful.  Piney aroma, modest bitterness, basically, just incredible.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2003 Bottled: Orange golden coloured. Has a medium lasting head. Aroma has notes of earth and flowers. Flvaour is hops, hops, hops, hops and ..... Boy oh boy. My palate was carpetbombed with hops. Quite pleasant, really, with this massive bitterness in the palate. If this is gonna be the standard of the 6 californian beers i've traded from herbjones, i'm gonna be a lucky man!

Once poured, you notice the mysterious dense head, slightly misty golden orange colour.  One of the first IPA's I have seriously sampled to date and yet still remains my favourite.  Starts with a strong crisp and complexed, hop to floral flavour with a pronounced finish.  It is a medley of liquid love in a bottle.  I am throwing my first wife out for this beer!

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2006 Ok, Better looking than I remember. Lightly hazed orange, with some decent lace. Still sweet but without the heavy cardboard,. More alcohol perceived. Flavors are better with some grapefruit and a touch of white grapes. Malt evident and welcome in the middle and finish to help balance out the hops. Quite smooth for the strength. Big yeast presents in both the aroma and the flavor at times. A full, strong IPA.  Original Rating (7,3,6,4,13 = 3.3)  Hazy golden orange color with a tight bubbled small beige head.  Sweet grapefruit with a hint of wet cardboard aroma.  Citrus and sweet (near cloying) flavors.  I would wager this is either old or heat struck.   Rats!

This is the 1st beer ive ever had from this brewery, and i will definitely be trying more after this. Yes its bitter, but in a very refreshing way, that makes me want to take another sip every time. Theres also some sweetness to balance it out. Absolutely delicious.

You know I tried the Ruination ale right before this one and I swear this one is more bitter.  I still had no problem swallowing this one down with ease.  Although after dropping 44 oz of ale down my into my belly I wasn't exactly all there.
These guys do like their hops.  But I still feel as though I am worthy of their beer.  Very hoppy but they don't skimp on the malts either.  This is a great beer before bedtime.
Orange in color. Bitter bitter bitter. Very complex, sweet, sour, fruty. An amazing aroma. My second brew from Stone.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2007 A splendid IPA. Big on the hops aroma and flavor, but the bitterness is not overdone. A little weak on malt character, but who said this was supposed to be a "balanced" beer? The dry hopping gives it that "fresh hops" smell that is simply not present in most IPAs; it smells like hops fresh out of the bag.

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2007 Hands down the best IPA Ive tried yet.  Fruity and amazingly complex aroma (IMO) for an IPA. Pears, honey, hops oil. Foamy white head on hazy dark amber beer with lacing down the whole side of the glass. Medium-heavy body with low-medium carb - great mouthfeel. The balance of sweet/tart malts/hops is incredible. Very fruity and huge hops finish with light bitter/fruit after. Clean and crisp - really perks you up.

This beer is awesome.  The aroma is lightly floral, with some citrus notes.  It pours a clear golden color, with a small cream head.  The palate is wonderful, It is soft, rich, somewhat buttery as well.  It is hopped just right.  It is fully bitter, and the finish is nice and dry.
Wonderful aroma and a big, thick puffy head to match.  Bitterness well balanced with malt and extreme citrus sweetness.  Really great to drink and deserves its high rating.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2015 Old rating: While IPAs are not my favorite, this one was pretty good. Stone seems to make some good beers. (2003)

New rating: on tap at Chickies and Petes in Northeast Phila - my IPA taste has thankfully changed in the past 12 years. Nice hoppy aroma and flavor. Cloudy golden color. A very good IPA. (2015)
Bronze with off white head and great lace.Lots of hops throughout with long finish

growler Hop flowers and carmel malts in the nose. Nice creamy head that thinned out but sustained. Balanced earthy citrus and creamy carmel malts. Resiny and smooth. Nutty bitter hoppy finish with biscuty malts.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2003 creamy, lasting head, good lacing.  Big, juicy, in your face hop aromas.  Impressive medium-full body and viscous mouthfeel.  Rich and sweetish malt flavors and a long bitter finish.  This is a big IPA and definitely an all-time favorite.  Thanks to urbnhautebourg!

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2003 re-rate: This is much better than I first thought.  It's drier than Stone Ruination, and slightly less bitter, but not a bad IPA by any means!  A wide variety of hoppiness fill the flowery/aromatic flavor.  Some citrus, like grapefruit, too.  The carbonation is just right.  There is not much head retention.  Very smooth and easy to drink.  It reminds me why I love IPA's.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2003 Re-rate - Expected more hops?  What was I thinking?  This is perfectly hopped.  Huge floral hop nose.  Intense flavor, with the perfect malt to hop balance.  A great IPA, though slightly inferior to the Ruination.  Original, 3.9 - Nice color and lacing.  Decent aroma of hops and sweetness.  I really expected more hops in the flavor, but it is creamy and mildly sweet, which I find enjoyable.  This is a prett good IPA, but 90 Minute and Hop Devil are better.  Thanks Racegoer!
Granted Im a hop fanatic, but wow. Strong hoppy and floral notes right up front. You know what you are getting yourself into. Ill just let you read the other reviews while I have another one.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2003 From the bottle. Great nose. Like smelling fresh hops.
Then balanced nicely with the malt.
A great overall expeience
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: I love this beer.  It has a big hop aroma which leads you into a crisp sharp hoppy elixir which is a feast for all your bitter taste buds.  However they wont be able to taste much afterwords :).

Huge hop nose - flowery and brightly fruity.  While the hops are brilliantly exploding from the glass, the taste actually grooves into a sweet sugary cereal flavor.  Nice balance and overall drinkability.

Pale golden color. Good white head. Aroma of hops, and then some. Brutally bitter and hoppy, but offset by a heavy, syrupy sweet body. Not as elegantly balanced as Ruination, but for being its kid brother, its mighty hefty. You would never guess its 6.9 ABV from the taste. Magnificent
fruity, hoppy, flowery, perfumy, Trix and Fruity Pebbles aroma with grassy hops and  alcohol. Tons of  carbonation.

Light straw-colored body with a rocky white head. Lacing by the ton as the head diminishes.
Huge amounts of hops in the nose. Smells like fresh hops! Very floral aromas.
A well-balanced IPA though. Just the right amount of bitter to balance the malt character.
Smooth on the palate and the whole way down.
I like this better than Ruination.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2012 3/3/12:  Draught at TJs:  Aroma of hops, citrus, resin.  Poured amber in color with a medium-sized, white head that diminished but lasted throughout as a film on top of the beer.  Clear.  Not sparkling.   Lightly sweet and medium bitter.  Tastes of hops, florals, 

12/22/02:  10/4/10/5/19=4.8

Great pour: head and lacing is great. Very clear bronze with light carbonation visible. The aroma is good but surprisingly light given the strength of flavor. Rich and complex flavor leading to a long and changing finish.

Wow. By far the best IPA I have ever had. Superbly hoppy and very crisp with a slight sweetness in the middle.  Not quite as knock you off your feet hoppy as I would have guessed - but thats a good thing.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2003 Light amber, slightly cloudy. Aroma entices, bitter semi-sweet flavor follows it well but requires commitment - which is rewarded as the glass depletes, to the point that I was sad after last drop. While I prefer Stone"s Pale Ale for drinkability, this is a fine IPA.

This beer is not yet available in my area.  So I was delighted to see it in a store in Bethlehem PA for me to try having both enjoyed Arrogant Bastard and seeing it rated so highly here.  Well...  I am sad to report that maybe I got a bad bottle.  It was fine but not all that it seems to be cracked up to be here.  What I tasted was a very well balanced, flavorful, well hopped IPA.  But I suppose I prefer something a little more off the beaten path... it was nice overall, but unremarkable.

lots of floral hops, a very deceiving brew at first I thought oh this isnt too bitter but then about five minutes later when my lips were still puckered I reconsidered, the finish may actually be TOO bitter

hoppy, hoppy, hoppy of course.  what else would I expect really?  beautiful, erratic lace hangs on well. well balanced for an ipa.  Long lasting finish alternating sweet and bitter.  truly refreshing!!!  Crystal  and cascade hops all over the place.  nothing but barley hops water and yeast makes for some serious magic here.  ohh, what a classic beer.  so many I.P.A.s out here, so little money.

Light amber pour, with a thick white head that laces very nicely.  First pour from the bomber had some large carb bubbles that trickled to the top pretty quickly.  Aroma had a strong pine smell to it, like sniffing a freshly fallen pine cone.  Taste followed the smell quite nicely, with lots of hops and a long trailing aftertaste.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2010 Truly a wonderful beer. Great hops from the first smell to the last sip. Full, bready body with a touch of malty sweetness that saves this IPA from tasting over-hopped. Distinctive grapefruit-juice-bitter finish. Clear, reddish-golden color. Leaves a complex latttice of lace down the side of the glass. About a thousand times better than the infamous Arrogant Bastard Ale. Stone should give this stuff the cool name.

Probably the best beer Ive ever had (as far as my preference goes).  This is truly the last IPA youll ever wat to drain.  Fragrant, beautiful rich mangoey shade of yellow.  The flavor is biiitttterrr!!!  As the great poet whose name Ive forgotten once said: It is bitter bitter.  But I love it because it is bitter, like my heart.  I sat down at my local pub last night and tried two twenty two ouncers.  The chalkboard advertising the specials of the evening had it labeled double bitter and it cost around 5 bucks but it was well worth it.  Great beer.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2004 Semi-sweet apple and grapefruit aroma. The hops bitterness doesn't really set in until after the first few sips. There is a big bitter edge to this along with a malty sweet back. A long aftertaste of the hops is present, and there seems to be nothing small about this beer. The color is a typical orange/brown, and it has a nice fluffy white head. I find this to be a very nice alternative to the big boy,  AKA "Ruination IPA." Stone brews are like a party. It's just fun drinking them!

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2010 Used to like it lots...when there wasnt any competition...now it really doesnt compete because theres no incentive for stone to care since retards buy up the shit like its crack.
A great American IPA.  Lots of American hoppiness.  Cloudy golden color.  Not as good as Victory Hop Devil or as Stones Ruination, which I remember as off the scale bitter and just about perfect.
A well-balanced, hoppy and bitter IPA.  Though excellent, I was slightly disappointed that, for all its hype, it was not quite as powerful an IPA as laConners or Diamond Knot.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2003 Update:  I actually drive to that god-foresaken .5 million acre office park known as Northern Virginia to get this amazing beer.  What I like most is the blend of citric and herbal hop flavor.  It's just brilliant.  

Old: Oh, these boys did a fine job, indeed.  A study in hops.  Whereas Alpha King offers a ton of hop flavor, but restrained bitterness, this beer widens its focus to embrace bitterness as a positive good.  I rather like this.
UPDATED: MAR 10, 2004 One of my favorite IPA's.  I like the hops and expect it in an IPA. I will go elsewhere for malt. That said, this beer is not ALL hops - in the end it measures out quite nicely.

First thing that hits you is the wonderfully powerful aroma, very citrusy and sweet.  Then, the flavor, hoppy and bitter but very well balanced with a nice buttery caramel front and the hops slowly exploding as it goes down.  My first Stone, after reading about it for a year on the site, and Im not disappointed; now if only we could get more than the couple currently available in New England?  Hmmm?  Greg??
Nice beer- nice aroma. its tasty, could have used more bitterness.
A nice IPA. About as bitter as you can get before imbalance sets in. Nice body, good head. Some caramel notes along with the requisite spicy, citrus, grapefruit.
Nice bite! Great for an IPA - maybe the best Ive had (Ill have to check the old records).  Great bitter biting hops.

Tasted at the Barrelhouse Brewing Company Microbrew Fest on November 9. I didnt think this stacked up to Ruination but it is still a contender. Dry, biting hops keep it interesting but it is still easy to drink. Keep em coming Stone!

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2003 Upon uncapping the bottle, the smell of Cascade hops fills the room.  It pours a medium golden color with a decent puffy head.  Lots of aromatics and sweet malt mix together with a generous amount of hops to give this brew tremendous flavor and drinkability.  Sweet malty body is well balanced with the perfect amount of citrusy hops.  I just wish I could get more of this stuff around here.  Thanks jcalabre.

This is a great IPA but its definitely for the experienced American IPA drinker. Brits wouldnt enjoy this beer because it is too far over the top for a Brits idea of an IPA. Here in the U.S. we love IPAs as hoppy as we can get them and among American IPAs, this one is damn good.
What a great ALE.  From the aroma to the texture, a classic.  One of the best mouth feels on a beer that Ive had in a long time.
Deep golden color with a a lemon citrus nose.   Bold hops, very nice.   Stone Rocks!
22oz bottle: A sweet hop flower has blossomed in my glass and its beauty and aroma have consumed me.  Mint leaves mix with semi-sweet grapefruit to bring a blissful IPA experience.

Um, I dont really know what to say.  Ive been looking at beers for about a year and a half.  Finally, finally, Ive been privaleged enough to be able to try something from Stone Brewing.  I know all of the hype about the over-the-top Stone brews, so Im sitting here thinking, "Wow, this is going to be big."  Well, I wasnt wrong, but I wasnt exactly right either.  Stick your nose in the glass, and out comes this incredible piney, citrusy, floral hop aroma.  Behind it lies a subtle, sweet malt backbone.  Im certainly happy.  So, Im smelling this beer and thinking about how ill prepared I am for this moment.  As long as Ive been waiting (and wanting, desperately wanting) some Stone beers, I get one and Im timid and unsure.  Finally I take the plunge and just drink.  Oh how wonderful.  The aroma (and the reputation)tricks you into thinking this IPA will be insanely bitter and glorious.  Tons of citrus and pine and bitter flavor.  Ha, how wrong I was.  Sure, there are all of the characteristics of a good IPA--citrus, pine, flowers, perfume.  However, the malt is there, in just the right proportion.  Glorious, sweet beer.  How I love thee.  What a tremendous experience this beer, this Stone beer, has been.  I want so much more, and yet...

Better than I remembered it. Spicey, malty, very, very hoppy. A terrific Left Coast IPA. HopHeads, gotta get you a bottle. Thanks to herbjones for the refresher.

This beer rocks.
The color of molten Gold. The aroma is very organic, very floral. The flavor is very spicy and floral with hops galore. This hophead delight has a dry, crisp, bitter finish. An excellent IPA. They should require a liscense in order to drink this beer. If youre not a hophead, you need not apply.
UPDATED: JAN 30, 2003 Had this on draft at Cooper's.  Very well balanced and very enjoyable.  One of the better IPA's out there.
An excellent IPA. Love it. Great color, aroma. Nice head.
Incredible beer!!! best IPA i have ever had. Cant believe i found an IPA better than victory hop devil.
My all-time favorite IPA (except for Sam Smiths).  Magnificent balance of hops and malt (the malt is rather strong).  Loved it.

DAMN thats a lot of hops. Golden copper color with a small head. Rich floral hop aroma that ranks right up there with the best smelling beers. Powerful hoppy flavor finishes bitter and somewhat chewy. Very very good IPA.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2003 Clean white head.  Golden hue.  Sruce, tons of pine aroma.  Damn this stuff is great.  All pine needles, tons of pine resin, spruce accents.  Long lingering citrused out finish.  I love this crap.  Very delicious, addictive and highly drinkable. Damn...
Very yummy and fruity for my tummy. Very refreshing and not dry like other IPAs
I got to drink this at LAX while me and my bros eat a pizza, anyway I give this brew an: A

The commercial description is very accurate.  The aroma of hop is very present.  It taste alot like the aroma.  Nice balance between malt/hops.  Not over the top.   Stones has one very good IPA here.

Im just "learning to love" IPAs.  Not quite as over-the-top-hoppy as I thought it would be.  Solidly bitter - but balanced by the malt - not as citrusy as other IPAs.  Medium to thick body, properly pale in apperance.  Nice floral nose.   Exceptional balance between the malt / hoppiness / alcohol.  Im really surprised how easy this is to drink - a great beer.

My kind of beer.  Slightly floral scent with a hint of spearmint.  Clear golden color with the perfect amount of carbonation. Hoppy but not too the extreme.  Crisp and consise.  Smooth and complex at the same time.  Excellently balanced and easy to drink.  Not overpowering but still providing some umph!  Slightly bitter overtone and aftertaste.  An excellent brew.  Thanks jcalambre for another great Stone brew!  I need to do a head-to-head taste off with the Victory Hop Devil.  Try with a crawfish etouffee and you will be in heaven!

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2003 This IPA pours a clear, deep amber color with a large, rocky, white head that is mostly lasting. The aroma is full of hops with some piney notes, but also contains some good fruitiness and a bit of maltiness as well. Medium to full bodied with a smooth palate and moderate carbonation, the flavor is hoppy at first, but is soon balanced some by the intense maltiness. The finish is all hops, however, with a good bitter bite to end it all. An excellent IPA, and one that grace the lips of every good beer drinker at least once.
GABF 2002: Fresh piney aroma.  Nice golden colour.  Thin, crisp, and bitter.  Not much matl balance unitl the end.

Not many bottled beers ever score all that highly for me in the aroma section....but this one is an exception.  Nice hoppy aroma, and a lovely amber color.  Excellent balance, crisp and refreshing hop flavors, slightly citrusy.   A bitter zing throughout.   Very good.

Light straw color, small head. A very hoppy beer, dry and crisp. Distinctive hop aroma. Beer is ‘dry hopped’ for 2 weeks. A 60 IBU beer. Finish is clean and crisp. A nice bitter IPA. Good beer, etched beer bottle.
Great nose to this beer.  The hop flavor really makes this beer, and gives it a lasting feel.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2011 10/3/02: Over the top HOP-HOP-HOP. My intro to IPAs.
8/16/03: Golden color, light white head. Flowery hop aroma. Flavor is malt, grapefruit and pine. This was once the benchmark for west coast IPAs, but AleSmith has raised the bar! 
5/10/06: Green Flash has raised the bar again.
10/26/06
But I still pick up a bomber every now and again. 10/21/11: My go-to-beer at Valley View Casino.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2004 A hop explosion of aroma and flavor with a bit of mint and vines without any any heavy tobacco or dust. It snaps crisp on the tongue and is very drinkable. A model West Coast IPA.

Amber color with a thick creamy white head. Flowery citrusy, junipery, Cascade hop aroma with a hint of maltyness. Strong citrus, tea, hop flavor bitterness and uncharacteristically but not unplesant subdued malt flavor for a Stone beer.  An outstanding beer.

Mmmmmmmmmmmm....this is really really good. The dryhopping is very apparent and adds a lot to this extraordinary IPA. This is the best IPA Ive had. Actually modestly bitter in my opinion (reguardless of its IBUs) but just incredibly flavorful. The hops are prominent here but very well balanced and presented. My first 4+ IPA.

Large olfactory presence. Rich, citrusy-fruity, & juicy malt characteristics. Well balanced and very tasty. Mouthwatering hop flavors complement the malty aroma. Malt flavors reminded me of some IPAs I had in Canada; had a round, "fruitiness" to it. Lingering sweetness plays in the mouth.

Sweet, floral, citrus aroma.  Sweet, hoppy flavor at the start, tastes and smells like unfermented wort.  Crisp, bitter, hoppy finish.  Not as good as the Ruination IPA, but still better than most others.

Very hoppy, although surprisingly not too much that it is overpowering. Citrus/floral aroma and citrus and hop flavor with a nice bitter finish. Malts were still somewhat detectable as not to make this too one dimensional.

Holy Hoppiness Batman! Sit down and hold on if your cracking open a beautiful bottle of Stones India Pale Ale because your palate is in order for a rude awakening. Definitely citrusy/flowery taste..defined best by my friend as "liquid weed." Im not much of the hop craver myself, but this was a nice treat for my taste buds. Wonderful aroma, striking taste, and long lasting aftertaste. A good IPA to pick up if you have the time!!!

A pure citrus and hop amalgamation wafts over a crystal clear golden amber lake. The foam scribes angry dragons and monsters down the glass. Encroaching malt sweetness harmonizes with a brazen bitter. This is a classic. I keep coming back to it, and never tire of the senses it spins.
Strong, citrusy.  Some sourness in the aftertaste.  Some pine thruogh the nose as well.  Could use a little more carbonation out of the bottle.
A hoppy little beer!  A beaut of a beer for all IPA lovers ... Well done!
verry hoppy. pours light orange and cloudy. even with the bitterness the malt undertones come through

Just like me in the midst of a wild and crazy round of drunken hopscotch, this beer is HOPPY.
Very crisp, bitter finish. I can understand how past raters have claimed its somewhat acidic, with an almost medicinal quality at times.. but still, a great beer.
Those 70 IBUs hit your palate like a fat girl crashing a tricycle.
UPDATED: MAR 22, 2005 This beer does a breakdance in your mouth.  The flavors are bold and bitter.  Seems well crafted.

Fantastic aroma, very hoppy, citrusy.  the taste does not dissapoint, there is no point in waiting for the malt because this beer is all about the hops.  and there is so much to experience.  they are wonderfully sharp and crisp in this brew.  the hops balance themselves quite well.  the only problem is that you wont be able to taste too much other than hops when you are finished with this one.
Definitely a top quality IPA.  Balanced flavor and strength.  Smooth and satisfying.

Being on the east coast this stuff is impossible for me to find. But lucky my friend brought back 4 22Oz. of Stone beers when he came to visit. Now to see if this IPA would live up to the hype. First i crack it open and take a whif. Ahhh a refreshing citrus/ fruity/ earthy hop oder hits me. I poured it into a pint glass to check the color and head, both of which are very enticing. Now for the moment of truth. Its up, its down, and damn is it good. clean crisp earthy citrusy hop flavor the keeps hittin yer taste buds even after its down the throat. Now i guess i have to wait to move before i can have em on a regular basis
Very good india pale ale... very hoppy, which is to be expected, and finishes off incredibly well.

Yessss !!! back to Quality, American IPAs, another Stone Brewing Co. winner. Strong hop and Citrus flavors, a Winner here. Hops on fire once again from Stone, If you like hoppy beers, you ought to LOVE Stone.Right there with Ruination, I would like to try them back to back, except the latter is impossible to find right now. Highly Recommended. tonight at my Local beer retailer  (800+) beers I saw two guys buying Heineken(cans) I told them to try a bottle of this, right now they are discovering what real beer is, I Love it, Wake up America !!
Hops, hops, hops.  Good copper color.  Nice citrusy aroma and flavor.  Perfect hop bitterness and dryness.  One awesome beer.
UPDATED: OCT 9, 2003 Very hoppy.  Great aftertaste, subtle for a beer with such a distinct aroma.  The color is amazing.

A real pretender. Pretty, silk-screened bottle, thats just about all. Case said bottled in July. However, had classic symptpoms of heat or light damage: caustic bitterness, uneven malt presence. I find this shocking -- We get bottle-conditoned Anchor Liberty out east, and its flat out superb up to 6 months after bottling.
over the top

as it pours into the glass, you are greeted by a beautiful golden beer, with cascading bubbles and a perfect hop aroma.  on the palate, the hoppiness is just right, setting of the nice malty flavors hidden beneath.  delicious, drinkable and perfect
Bottle.  Had this while camping in the Sierra Nevada Mountains at night by the camp fire.  Balanced hops, surprisingly fruity, creamy, dry, crisp.  A real treat.

This is Stone? I have to admit Im usually one of those who is not worthy.Opened the bottle and it didnt assault my senses. Very nice mellow hop/citrus aroma. Very pretty beer. Taste is a close to perfect balance for an IPA in my opinion. This is definately one of my favorite IPAs.

Nice fruity/hoppy aroma--relatively light for a big brew---an even better appearance---lovely orange/gold color with busy head--lots of lace...Flavors are full and nicely balanced: coming at you initially like an ocean wave...then settling-out into their separate and distinctive personalities...Plenty of body here, too...Finish is complex and covers full spectrum as well--fruity/hop top-end with light-tasting but substantial-feeling malt undertow...The real strength of this IPA is its balance--great mouthfeel and surprising restraint for a brew with this kind of power...most drinkable...

copper colored, foamy off-white head with incredibly beautiful lacing, highly carbonated, smells just like a ruby red grapefruit with a slight metallic hint. citrus in the flavor with the bitterness really coming out in the aftertaste. outstanding IPA...one interesting note, the metallic flavor REALLY comes through when you burp!
I find this to be one of the premier American IPAs.  The floral aroma and smooth hoppy finish is what all IPAs should want to achieve.  It is very crisp and clean. Kudos!

Hmmm.Rocky,white,long lasting head.Aroma.Do I need to even comment?Somewhat cold was probably the most bitter taste I have ever tasted.Hops were all over the place.Very little malt.As it warms the malts still seem very restrained. It also gains a spicy,hoppy,alcohol tinge to the finish. The aroma and taste dont seem to click for me.Ruination is suprisingly much more balnced IMO.In other words this tasted like hop juices to me. Right up my alley but quite a few better IPAs.Including Ruination.
Jesus!  the smell!  The hoppiest aroma of all time....pure hops and notes of fresh lawn clippings....cool! Color was orange.  Taste was benchmark IPA, all hops little malt.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2006 light amber/peach color. Clear with thin head and lace. Aroma of pine,toasted malt,hint of orange? Medium bodied, huge toasted and citric(orange) malt profile(reminicent of hop devil), piney hops take over leaving a long bitter finish. Very balanced leaving fantastic hop burps to boot! A world class IPA.
A strong, full-bodied IPA.  A strong flavor combines with a hoppy aftertaste.  Not as powerful as the Aniversary ales, but no less tasty.
The advert is right, this is a truly hoppy pint! Has a lovely aroma that comes out and bites you, and the flavor is strong as well. Lovely golden/amber color, with a strong head.

Nice golden color with a thick quite head and a good citrusy aroma.  The taste is almost nothing but hops, but controlled very nicely.  The malt temper it a bit to make for a very enjoyable IPA.  Actually, probably the best IPA Ive had yet.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2007 Stone India Pale Ale pours out an attractive, brilliant golden color with a hint of amber.  Famously citric and piney hop aroma.  Flavor is of course largely hop-oriented as well, but it has a decent sized malt backbone as well.  Finish is where the brilliantly clear, resiny hop flavors come into play the most, with a nice bitter aftertaste as well.  For the amount of hops and all-around bitterness this beer has, though, it is balanced quite effectively by the malt that is present enough here to give it a nice body and a hint of caramel and fruitiness.  Quite refreshing on this warm summer night.

Gusler calls this beer Quite sniffable, let me take it a step further, remember the show I dream of Genie? If I were to live in a bottle, this would be it! The hop aroma is incredible, I wouldnt care if this beer were purple, Id still love it A great flavor to match, just enough malts to smooth out this liquid ode to hop heads
wow this is a beer, nice hop aroma good finnishing malt good beer
This is a really hoppy, really good beer.  The initial flavor is good and finishes with a mouthful of hops.  I say its a winner.  Hopolicious.

I probably should have drank this first. It seems almost boring after the Ruination. Less floral than Ruination, with an intense smell of a christmas tree sap. Smell almost gives me a headache. Stone makes pretty beers and this is one of them. Good head with nice retention, good color. Flavor is surpisingly malty, nutty. Hops strong from the beginning and very short finish.

Re-Rate 07/11/02: Pours a clear amber, generous off white head and sheets of lace. Nose is floral, citrus, hints of malt and Quite Sniffable. Front is malt and lightly sweet, the top is light to medium, the finish is A Hop Heads Delight, dry, acidic and still a top 5 IPA on my Master List.

Orange beer, nice head.  Floral & citrus aroma slams you big time.  The cascade hops rock this beer, with initial sweetness giving way to big bold bitterness all the way down.  Good stuff, not for the faint of heart.

Nice fluffy head. Excellent lace on the glass. Full bodied and very hoppy in all aspects. The brew reeks of PNW hops and lots of it. The beer has enough malt to avoid being hop-water. The malt and hops create an orange vanilla flavor that is good. Nice stuff.
Very bitter IPA with excellent malt balance.  Citrusy and delicious.

Re-Rate: Clear hop nose with citrus tones and an orange-amber color. Bright hop taste yet a full malt body that really supports and complements the bitterness well. Great balance and a great American IPA - love it!
Nice red amber beer with a fruity and very hoppy taste and  fullmouth aroma. Very refreshing beer.

golden colored, fluffy white head, floral hoppy aroma
big bitter hoppy flavour but well balanced with a caramel malt sweetness.

indian corn golden orange color, clear as dappled light through a mountain stream. a big bubbled head was wet and evanescent, but did a winning song and dance before the curtain came up on the aroma. from an adequate malt foundation, the hops soar: cedar and lumber-mill piney; if hops bloomed big as roses theyd smell like this. through it emerges a subtle warm radiance of a cognac-like apertif.  but  @ 22 oz., plenty of time to savor and wax poetic, uttering unctious blandishments to the noble drink.
Never been an IPA fan, so I cant say I cared for the hoppy aroma much at all.  Nevertheless, I found it very fresh and drinkable.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2004 re-rate 6/28/2004. On draft at Goat Hill. This is still an excellent example of an IPA, but now that I've had a few hundred beers since then

6/19/2002
Excellent IPA. Great Aroma

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2003 This beer poured out a nice copperish gold color and formed a nice fairly white head, that when subsiding, left some nice lace. Aroma had elements of hops and some citrus. The taste had a substantial amount of hops and slightly bitter aspect to it, which is good in an IPA. Good beer

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2003 Rerate: Thinner than I orginally thought, more hops and less balance as well. Downgraded. Original: 6/17/02: Real Real good. More floral than 5th anniv. (I have yet to try DFH's or Victory's Hop Devil) and nearly as malty as this year's model (catch the ref, music fans?). Crisp and clean, not nearly as watery as even the same state wannabes. Very drinkable.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: Light color as far as IPAs go. Initial hop blast is big. Once the taste buds adjust to the hops this is a great brew. Lots of hops with enough malt to make it work. Had at the Seattle Brewfest. I will look for this next year for sure.
Strong hoppy aroma, very bitter like an IPA should be. Lasting aftertaste that isnt as acidic as you would expect.  Very well made. IPA fans shouldnt miss this one.
One of my all time favorite beers. Tastes wonderful almost like licorice!
Nice hop aroma with a hint of malt.  Body is balanced perfectly.  A great IPA.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2016 Bottle. Head is initially small, frothy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is dark yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (grain), moderately hoppy (resin, grapefruit), with a strong note of fabric softener. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly to moderately bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, moderately to heavily bitter, unclean. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, lightly to moderately astringent, lightly alcoholic. Horribly chemical-ish aroma, like Bounce dryer sheets were soaked in this. Dirty/chemical aftertaste as well. Wow, Stone has gone downhill since Lee Chase left, no question there, but they usually dont mess up beer THIS badly. Cringe-inducing.
A very fine IPA with loads of hops and a very light refreshing texture, maybe too light. The only thing this beer lacks is the malt depth, found in hopdevil, wich balances the great hop bitterness.

HOPPY - HOPPY - HOPPY. There is a time and place for hoppiness in a beer and certainly an IPA is one of them (no thanks in Stouts and Porters!!!). Im not a huge hop head, but this beer I did enjoy. Deep golden color. Medium head. Crisp, clean and refreshing. Had it on tap. Nice bitter and hoppy finish, sensing pine needles and such. Taste was not dry, but a pleasant bitter just as an IPA should be.
Quite complex, dry aroma.  Ridiculously bitter and hoppy, a bit too much for me but still a nice beer.  Try adding a splash of the smoked porter to this to make a smoked Indian.
One awesome IPA, this is what beer drinking is all about. Copper colored with a hoppy, hoppy nose and flavor, just damn good!
Hopheads heaven. Attractive aroma and appearance, rewarding taste and attitude adjustment.
wonderfully hoppy, great aroma.  Not too bitter either.  Long and smooth aftertaste.  Wish I could try it on draft.

This is a great IPA with a great hoppy aroma and the flavor to back it up.  The bitterness is strong but well balanced so as not to be harsh.  This is starting to get a wider distribution and if you see it, drink it.
This is my favortie IPA that Ive tried.You must get it on draft to do it justice.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2012 I have no idea what I was thinking when I wrote my first review of this beer.  Although, in my defense, my tastes must have changed in the almost ten years since that review.  I completely deleted those initial comments, because my current thoughts about Stone IPA are completely opposite!  This is one of the best IPAs in the land!  It pours a light gold color with a straw hue and a large, sticky white head.  The head leaves a ton of beautiful and cascading lacing around the glass.  The nose is full of dry and spicy hops, with a truck-load of citrus and a touch of bready malts.  The flavors are dry and spicy, as well, with the citrus dominating.  I taste some orange peel, grapefruit, hop resin and a touch of earth and bread.  The finish is almost the best part, with all the dry and spicy hops, along with the grapefruit and orange.  This is a just a tremendously awesome IPA!!

A very malty example of the style.  First aroma that hit me was Tang.  It smelled like coming home from the pool on a hot summer day and fixing a glass of Tang and watching TV.  Served cold, the bitterness hits your mouth like a brick, but is soon subdued by the rising maltiness.  A well balanced beer indeed. Damn good.

Had a bottle of this while working the grill.  This brew pours a clear golden honey amber.  The large fluffy almost white head is fully lasting with good lacing.  The bold perfumed nose is exclusively hops with grass, citrus, herbs, spruce, and flowers.  The flavor is very rich and complex while staying straightforward and exceptionally balanced.  The brew starts flowery with a sweet and fruity middle and a very long bitter bisquity finish.  The palate is stellar with  a medium smooth and soft body that is creamy and slightly oily.  The finish is very clean.  Stone is a MONSTER brewer.

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2003 12 oz bottle, light orange -copper color with a white frothy head, nice lacing. Clean citrus-pine aroma, medium body malty with a strong hop profile, nice balance, One hell of an IPA.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2003 My wife was about to kill me for ordering these.  Not available in Illinois, so I had six of them shipped from California and it was worth every penny.  If you like IPA's, this is excellent.  The aroma makes you want to stick your face into the glass until you run out of air.  The flavor is very hoppy but also easily drinkable.  Dogfish head 90 minute IPA is the only beer I've had with more hop flavor but not near the aroma or smoothness of this one.  This is near perfect.

Just picked up a keg of this stuff.  Not as hoppy as my first impression, but a great overall beer.
nice smooth hoppy aroma.  its got a solid green bitterness.  sweet malts poke through.  Ive had hoppier, but few that are this good.

Surprisingly pale in color; Head was thin and fleeting; Lots of citrus and pine in the nose. Surprisingly mild- this did not knock me on my ass with hops the way that I expected. Actually restrained. I am really surprised.
Definitely one of my alltime favorites.  Humungus hoppy aftertaste that just kills your palate for any other beer on the planet.  But why would you want to drink anything else?

Aroma is top notch extremely inviting hoppy aroma.  Malt flavor is quite well done, just the right amount of residual sweetness.  My main beef is that the hop flavor was quite different than the hop aroma.  I felt that it led to a bit of a disjointed drinking experience.

This beer is the definition of IPA.  No uncharecteristic flavors like the Maritime IPA, just liquid hops.  What is particularly lovely about this brew is the enourmous hop-nose: I spent 5 minutes just SMELLING the glass!  Obviously a lot of dry-hopping, but hops is the main ingrediant at every level of this beer.  The flavor backs up the hops with a strong enough bite and carbonation to distinguish it from Trees IPA, which has no body behind the hops.  I had the Full Sail IPA the night before, and almost poured the bottle out for lack of hops.  God bless Stone Brewing for this perfect beverage!

Pours with a clear,dark gold color. Less citrus, more honey sweetness. Higher alcohol (6.9%). Modest head of foam, doesnt exhibit the cloudiness or level of sedimentation that other craft IPAs show. Sweet, yet bitter... and for those who find this brew lacking... then you are ready to graduate to one of the best beers on this planet; Stones Arrogant Bastard. Cant say that it is my favorite IPA, but it is pretty darn good and reasonbly priced at $2.99 per 22 oz. bottle.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2007 Would it be excessive hubris to say that this embodies perfection in brewing?  Technically speaking, there is "nothing wrong" with, say, a Sierra Nevada Pale Ale.  Its got all the nice qualities that make for a good beer, and its not weak or bad in any way.  But it just doesnt make for hop-nirvana, now does it.  Quite literally, by contrast, there isnt anything wrong with this beer.  Remember, after all, that SNPA is a normal pale ale, something any beer lover could settle for absent something better.  This, on the other hand, is an IPA, so the bar gets raised, and this hits the spot for what an IPA could be and ought to be.  And when ones favorite style appears to be IPA, and this one just doesnt cut any corners, well, youre left with a beer that has nothing wrong with it.  It is Excellence in liquid form.  As IPAy an aroma as can be had.  Beautiful appearance, small bubbles and spectacular lacing.  No weakness in the taste; the palate is flawless.  It simply doesnt fall short anywhere.  I tried to find where I might possibly downgrade it, but I couldnt, because it satisfied completely in every respect.  For brewing "perfection" of a related sort, you can refer to this brewers Ruination IPA.  I think that the tastes of Stones brewers happened to coincide with mine; I dont know how else to explain this glorious synchronicity between taste and fulfillment.  If IPA is your thing, youve come to the right place.
UPDATED: APR 8, 2004 Wow wow.  Massive flowery, hoppy nose.  Lovely creamy texture.  Big, fruity hops, plenty of lemon and orange.  Love the massively hoppy aftertaste.  Glorious IPA.
Well, I didnt hate this beer, but it definitely wasnt my favorite IPA.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2004 22OZ bottle:  There is a super amount of cascade hops that is put against a strong malt backbone.  A new #1 IPA in my book.  Too bad I cant buy this where I live, but thank goodness for VintageCellar.com.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2006 Draft:  First beer from this keg.  dense and creamy head that is very sticky.  aroma is floral, citric, touch of caramel, sweet, kind nuggets, nutty, pine sap.  flavors of ripe oranges.  like biting into a ripe, juicy orange, hop burp...something i hadnt had in a beer before this.  palate is very round and soft, juicy, extremely fresh and refreshing, yet very complex.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: I had just decided earlier that IPAs available in 12 oz bottles were probably dominated by the great tasting Bridgeport and Big Daddy (Speakeasy). Then, I had Stones IPA.Great Stuff from the first to the last sip and a Hop saturation that I found very satisfying. I also liked not being able to single out the alcohol (like some other hopped-up Ipas and Double Ipas). Id actually give this a 20 but then Id probably never buy any other. Even the bottle looked cool. Congratulations Stone, on a terrific IPA.

Wow. Good stuff. Cloudy caramel color. Very hoppy, without any bitterness. I smelled and tasted sweet oranges and other citrus. Im a big fan of IPA, and this may be the best I have tasted. Bravo! I think Ill have another.
This is my favorite IPA so far.  Great hoppy flavor and aroma without the bitter aftertaste.  A must try if you are an IPA fan.

Modest orange in appearance with a frothy head topping this blissfully hop-aromed beer. A label on the beer states nothing but barley, hops, yeast, and water--what could be more simple?--Is this really all it takes to make a great beer--then why havent more brewers caught on?! Relatively smooth hoppiness that saturates all parts of the mouth, leaving a pleasant, but slightly metallic, hop aftertaste.  A wonderful all-around IPA with well balanced hopping.  One of the best.
Inconsistent, oxidized notes, lacks complexity and balance.

Excellent.  Best brew Ive tasted
since Harpoon IPA, maybe better.
Very hoppy.  No bitter aftertaste.
Highly recommended.
Pale, golden color. Slightly cloudy. Subtle maltiness but megga hoppy on the nose and palate.

Sweet, pleasant (not powerful) aroma with nice color and clarity.  Has a nice balance between bitter and sweet (fruit) flavor.  Personally, I would have toned down the maltiness of this IPA a bit , but that is  a personal opinion.  There is a definite orange/tangerine bent to the flavor of this beer.  Hoppiness is there, but not as overpowering as some reviewers would suggest.  For me, the sweetness of this beer was more prominent than its bitterness.  Its not my favorite IPA, but overall, a very good beer-- I  definitely understand why this is such a highly rated beer.

A darn good IPA.  Solid hop backbone, but this beer is set apart by the malt character.  Deep caramel and slightly roasted malt flavors really make this IPA worth drinking.  The relationship between the hops and the malt -where some other IPAs fall flat IMHO - make for solid mouthfeel.  Another fine West Coast IPA
Typical west coast IPA - more hop character and fruitiness.  A very special beer.
if you know what an IPA is, then youll love the hoppiness in this.
This is a truly fantastic IPA for those who love a strong, lasting hop presence, and at nearly 7% ABV it doesnt lose any drinkability.
The best IPA ive ever had. One of my favorites
I guess Ill be the only sissy reviewer.  There comes a point where less is more.  This beer is way past that point to my tastes.
UPDATED: JUN 12, 2003 Cloudy gold color, medium head and lots of lacing. Piney hop aroma. Very bitter hop flavor and finish.
Orange colored. Sweet & malty. Huge flowery cascade aroma. A relatively well balanced hop monster.

Cloudy yellow-gold color with a med head - fades quickly.  Heavy lacing.  Excellent complex hop nose: grapefruit, lemon rind, pine and grass (new mown hay).  Tingly grassy lemony flavor with med malt balance.  Malt is clean and straightforward (not even any caramelly notes).  Very nice beer, if more than a bit one-dimensional.  Followed by some seriously long hoppy belches.
A truly great IPA. Strong notes of citrus in the malt and a moderate orange/tangerine flavor in the finish. Very hoppy finish as well but remarkably smooth. Impressive.

One of the best IPAs around.  Huge hop aroma and flavor.  Theres a brief hint of maltiness up front (and you have to watch for it) and then the hops hit with a 1-2 punch to the palate.  A top IPA in my book.
Fantastic beer.  Leaves a wonderful dry aftertaste.  Pretty expensive for an IPA, but worth it.

Frist you smell it and it smells light... then you taste it. its smooth like the kind of beer you could drink all night long....... then you get it swallow and that when the hopps really hit........... a great lightly flavered beer with a great taste and even better finish....HIGHLY RECOMENED

I can honestly say this is one of the best beers on the planet.  The aroma is pure earthiness.  The taste is pure nirvana.  If I had to choose one beer to drink for the rest of my life, I would chose Stone IPA!
I was amazed at the maltiness of this IPA. The aroma was incredible and the hoppiness show up in a big way to balance the maltiness. Very good beer.
UPDATED: SEP 13, 2005 This should be the mark that all ipas are judged by. This beers got more hopps than a freakin rabbit. Good stuff.
possibly the best IPA on the market. Great hoppy aroma and crisp hop flavor. A tad sweet but Ill over look that. Great beer Stone!
I usually dont buy too many IPAs or American brews...but this is probably the best IPA I have had. Very good.
user_name: Almeter, The Aryan God of Beer

text: Id had this a few time before and been disappointed everytime...those must have been bad bottles, because this is just a fantastic IPA. Very, very hoppy both in bitterness and flavor, but its actually overmatched by a malty sweetness.  Caramely, toasty flavor complimented by a smooth hop flavor.  Extra dry-hopping really shows.  At 6.9%, its way too strong for a session beer, a bummer since I want to drink the whole six-pack tonight!  With this one added to the mix, Id say that the top 10 IPAs all come from the West Coast, and eight of those are from California!!

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2011 Distinctive tea like aroma and flavor. Great orangey sweetness in the flavor as well as a strong grapefruit bitterness in the finish. Its a shame its 7 % because this would be one of my everyday beers

Great brew for taking it easy and enjoying the sights. Clean from start to finish, without an off aftertaste.
Try this one and you will be glad you did!

Sorry to be giving another perfect score, but Im new here, and looking up the beers I love, and this is one.  Happy hoppy flavor with a kick.  Look for their Anniversary brews of this beer, and if you are in the SD area, look for Stones annual Anniversary party, its a blast every year.
woaahhh !! bronze colour, fine lace, very deep hop aroma and flavor, fantastic bitterness, very long aftertaste - please, give me more of this stuff !
